Job Level: Professional Location: Rotterdam, NL, 3012AG Area of Expertise: Actuarial Unit: Allianz Direct Employing Entity: Allianz Direct Versicherungs-AG Dutch br Job Type: Full Time or Part Time Remote Job: Hybrid working Employment Type: Permanent ID: 36655

title: Financial Analyst
description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology. We currently looking for a Finance Analyst to join our Controlling Department. Working at Abbott At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow and learn, care for yourself and your family, be your true self and live a full life. You will have access to: Working at the #1 Top Employer in the Netherlands (for three consecutive years); Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of; A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune; A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as the best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives and scientists; Excellent employment conditions that you can arrange yourself; A budget that you can use to follow non-work-related training and courses that contribute to your personal development; A sports allowance for work on your fitness; Personal financial planning advice to map out your current financial situation. Financial Analyst The Opportunity This position works out of our Weesp or Olst locations in the Controlling Department. As a Financial Analyst, you’ll be part of the One NL Finance team, assisting business to achieve targets, drive improvement and control/ understand variances in results. Main responsibilities - financial analysis, cost and process improvement, risk prevention and budgeting, ensuring the financial health and stability of the business. What You’ll Do You provide insight into the business to support operational and strategic decision making. You are responsible for preparing, developing and analyzing financial information and delivering high quality reports, review key business drivers Act as a point of contact in the field of (financial) process alignment and improvement Maintain cost improvement process to ensure ideation, confirmation and implementation of ideas related to Gross margin improvement Supporting budgeting process, month end close and audit processes Close contact with local team: Production, Supply Chain, Procurement, Quality and Engineering but also accounting department. Often interactions with Division Assist Finance Head on developing Plan/RLBE/divisional review presentation and packages Performing various business economic reviews and strategic scenario analyses Required Qualifications University degree in Business administration, Finance or Accounting; 5-7 years of work experience in a similar position Expert in Power BI, data analysis Persistent, analytical and technically minded Committed to delivering high standards, even under pressure Strong time management and problem-solving skills, strategic thinking High degree of initiative and self-organization, as well as communication and team competences Fluent in English Currently living in the Netherlands.

title: Business Analist
description: Bedrijfsvoorstelling Bleckmann is de expert in supply chain management en biedt end-to-end logistieke oplossingen voor mode-, lifestyle- en consumentenelektronicamerken. Wij maken de beloftes van onze klanten waar. We streven continue naar verbetering en innovatie in de praktijk is ons niet vreemd. Efficiënter en duurzamer werken zijn drijfveren in onze besluitvorming. Als multinationale organisatie hebben we teamleden met verschillende achtergronden in dienst die dezelfde waarden delen: Ondernemerschap, Deskundigheid, Betrokkenheid en Uitmuntendheid. Wij vinden dat deze waarden tot uiting moeten komen in alles wat we doen en hoe we samenwerken. Door je bij ons team aan te sluiten, draag je bij aan het bouwen aan een betere toekomst. Functie Doel van de afdeling De Afdeling Control Tower BI & Master Data is verantwoordelijk voor het integraal ontwikkelen van (afdeling brede) management-rapportages en analyses naar interne en externe klanten. Daarnaast borgt en bewaakt de afdeling de continuïteit en draagt zorg voor het verbeteren van de serviceverlening. Dit wordt uitgevoerd door middel van het sturen en rapporteren op de effectiviteit en efficiëntie van de (service management) processen, het produceren van management informatie en het doen van verbetervoorstellen. De afdeling heeft een ondersteunende en integrale ontwikkelende rol, waarbij ook ondersteuning van het management en de subafdelingen op gebied van managementinformatie wordt geleverd. Taken en verantwoordelijkheden: Medeverantwoordelijk voor planning en uitvoer managementrapportages voor Transport. Medeverantwoordelijk voor de Masterdata/onboarding in BlueRock (bijhouden en valideren van de masterdata) Zorgdragen voor Carrier (Contract) Management beheersing Communicatie/ delen van transport informatie en rapportage’s Voeren van overleg met betrokkenen over concept, inhoud of lay-out van rapportages en adviseren over evt. wijzigingen hierin. Verantwoordelijk voor beheer van de databases met daarin de gegevens en gemaakte rapportages. Verantwoordelijk voor tijdig doen uitgaan van rapportages. Ondersteuning van het management door het voorzien van data voor het maken van budgetten, budgetbewaking en forecast. Ondersteunen in de implementatie van nieuwe Carriers, Klanten en Services Contact met Carriers tbv van up tot date carrier data Bijdragen aan de verschillende continuous improving projecten en signaleren van eventuele verbetermogelijkheden Profiel Bij voorkeur Bachelor kwalificatie in combinatie met ICT ervaring. Engels vereist in woord en schrift. Kennis van rapportage systemen. Affiniteit met het werken binnen een internationale omgeving. Analytisch en conceptueel denkvermogen. Stressbestending en effectief kunnen werken onder tijdsdruk met daarbij oog voor detail, In staat kritisch naar eigen werkzaamheden te kijken en de eigen werkwijze bij te stellen door verkregen nieuwe inzichten/ informatie Een actieve houding ten aanzien van de samenwerking met de verschillende afdelingen Aanbod Wij bieden een afwisselende functie met een hoge mate van zelfstandigheid en een prettige werkomgeving. Bijkomende informatie Voor vragen en extra informatie kunt u contact opnemen met Marien Vaandrager (Project Manager): marien.vaandrager@bleckmann.com of 06-45800631.

title: Data Analist
company: Organisatie en Personeel Rijk (O&P Rijk, Ministerie van BZK)
description: Functieomschrijving Vind jij uitdaging en plezier in het analyseren van data binnen het contactcenter? Is het voor jou een uitdaging om verbindingen te leggen tussen verschillende datapunten? Visualiseer je graag wensen vanuit de klant in Excel of door middel van het bouwen van een dashboard? Draai je je hand niet om voor het opmaken van een Business Intelligence plan? Werk je graag scrum; binnen een agile omgeving? Dan ben jij misschien wel dé nieuwe data analist binnen het Datateam van dienstverlening P-Direkt. Samen met je collega’s ben je verantwoordelijk voor de data analyse en het voorzien in de informatievoorziening door middel van dashboards in Qlik Sense. Je geeft daarbij advies over de informatievoorziening ten behoeve van onder andere de operationele sturing. Een goed stuurmiddel is van essentieel belang voor de organisatie. Jij zorgt samen met je collega’s voor gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards waar de wensen van de klant goed in zijn verwerkt, ‘less is more’. De visualisatie van de weergegeven resultaten leidt tot inzichten die helpen bij de aansturing van de productieteams. Samen zorgen we dus doormiddel van de juiste sturingsinformatie dat de organisatie ‘in control’ is. Daarnaast ben je een sparringpartner voor WFM, de teamleiders van het contactcenter en het MT. Samen met je collega’s waarborg je de kwaliteit door uniform de data te bewerken en een gedegen administratie bij te houden. Als data analist binnen Team Data ben je zeer analytisch en adviesvaardig. Vanuit je functie creëer je overzicht en signaleer je knel- en verbeterpunten. Daarbij werk je nauw samen met de andere WFM-disciplines en ondersteun je deze disciplines door hen van de juiste informatie te voorzien en analyses uit te voeren. Jij bent op de hoogte van alle ontwikkelingen die impact hebben op het data gedreven werken binnen dienstverlening P-Direkt. Je werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit de volgende taken: Data analyse dienstverlening P-Direkt Advisering ten aanzien van informatievoorziening Ontwikkeling van datamodellen en dashboards in Qlik Sense Data extracties maken Doorvoeren wijzigingen naar aanleiding van procesverbeteringen Samenwerken met collega’s van de teams WFM, UX, communicatie en projecten Bijdragen aan het continu optimaliseren van het dataproces Functie-eisen Je bent vergevorderd in het werken met QS zowel front als de backend van de applicatie Je bent analytisch sterk Je hebt gevoel voor- & affiniteit met data Je bent adviesvaardig en daarmee ook een kritische gesprekspartner Je hebt ervaring en kennis van LEAN en beschikt over een verbeter-mindset Je hebt ervaring en kennis van de scrum methodiek of bent bereid deze eigen te maken Je hebt bij voorkeur gevorderde kennis van data analyse Je hebt energie en daadkracht. Dit maak je zichtbaar door initiatief te tonen en ondernemend te zijn in jouw vakgebied. Je bent leergierig, klantgericht Je bent communicatief vaardig en gericht op een zo goed mogelijke samenwerking Tot slot streef je naar kwaliteit en neem je de verantwoordelijkheid voor je werk. Kerncompetenties Analytisch Advisering Zelfontwikkeling Klantgericht Samenwerken Omgevingsbewustzijn Voortgangscontrole Arbeidsvoorwaarden Salarisniveau schaal 10 Maandsalaris Min €3.045 – Max. €4.848 (bruto) Dienstverband Arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd met uitzicht op onbepaalde tijd Contractduur Vast contract na jaarcontract (bij voldoende functioneren) Minimaal aantal uren per week 32 Maximaal aantal uren per week 36 Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden Naast het salaris ontvang je een Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB). Het IKB bestaat uit geld (16,37% van je bruto jaarsalaris) en tijd. Met het IKB maak jij de keuzes die bij jou passen en kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Je kunt er bijvoorbeeld voor kiezen om een deel van je maandinkomen te laten uitbetalen wanneer jij dat wenst. Ook kun je dit budget omzetten in verlof en andersom of besteden aan fiscaal vriendelijke doelen. De Rijksoverheid hecht sterk aan persoonlijke groei en loopbaanontwikkeling en biedt daarvoor tal van mogelijkheden. Tot de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden behoren onder meer verschillende studiefaciliteiten, bedrijfsfitness, volledige vergoeding van je OV-reiskosten woon-werkverkeer en gedeeltelijk betaald ouderschapsverlof. Bijzonderheden O&P Rijk vindt het belangrijk om een goede afspiegeling van de samenleving te zijn en werkt daarom actief aan een divers personeelsbestand binnen een inclusieve organisatie. Inclusief betekent dat iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt – niet ondanks maar dankzij de verschillen. Het is dan ook mogelijk om in je sollicitatie alleen die gegevens te noemen die je relevant vindt voor de functie. Want ook zonder bijvoorbeeld je naam, je leeftijd of je geboorteplaats kunnen wij een goede inschatting maken of je in aanmerking komt voor een sollicitatiegesprek. Meer over de functiegroep Adviseur Bedrijfsvoering Door het Functiegebouw Rijk worden medewerkers en leidinggevenden geholpen bij het maken van resultaat- en ontwikkelafspraken in functioneringsgesprekken en krijgt men inzicht in de loopbaanmogelijkheden binnen de Rijksoverheid. Meer over jouw toekomstige afdeling O&P Rijk | P-Direkt levert diensten op het snijvlak van HR en ICT voor 140.000 medewerkers, managers, beleidsmakers en HR-professionals die werken binnen de Rijksoverheid. Deze dienstverlening is modern, efficiënt, betrouwbaar en direct toegankelijk. Belangrijke eindproducten zijn salarisbetaling en informatievoorziening. Het contactcenter heeft als doel de rijksambtenaar telefonisch, per mail of via de app te ondersteunen met het moeiteloos regelen van personeels- en salariszaken. Daarnaast verwerken we aangeleverde opdrachten in het P-Direktportaal. Al deze werkzaamheden doet het contactcenter met ruim 450 enthousiaste medewerkers, verspreid over Den Haag, Zwolle en Bonaire. P-Direkt (O&P Rijk) Organisatie en Personeel Rijk (O&P Rijk, Ministerie van BZK) Organisatie en Personeel Rijk (O&P Rijk) is een nieuwe uitvoeringsorganisatie én de grootste HR-serviceverlener van de Rijksoverheid. O&P Rijk valt onder het Ministerie van Binnenlandse Zaken en Koninkrijksrelaties en komt voort uit de samenvoeging van UBR Personeel, P-Direkt en Binnenwerk. Voor alle medewerkers, managers, HR-directies en beleidsmakers van het Rijk bieden we basisdienstverlening en dienstverlening op maat. Met ruim 2000 medewerkers zet O&P Rijk zich in voor alle 140.000 rijksambtenaren. Vanuit 8 merken bieden we een breed palet aan diensten op het terrein van organisatie en personeel. Deze 8 merken vallen onder O&P Rijk: Binnenwerk, Advocaten en Adviseurs Arbeidsrecht, Organisatie-inrichting, Bedrijfszorg, Arbeidsmarkt, Inclusiviteit, Loopbaan- en Talentontwikkeling en P-Direkt. Als organisatie gaan wij multidisciplinair, eigentijds en betrouwbaar te werk. De efficiënte verwerking van grootschalige HR-processen én zorgvuldige begeleiding van individuele cases is bij ons in deskundige handen. Wij zijn een shared service organisatie met diepe wortels in de Rijksoverheid. Daarom bieden wij een expertblik op HR-processen en ontwikkelingen binnen het Rijk. Onze diensten zijn beschikbaar voor alle onderdelen binnen de Rijksoverheid. Contact Voor meer informatie over deze vacature: Irene Slotboom 06-50174273 Bas van Mourik Bas.Mourik@p-direkt.minbzk.nl 06-15178902

title: Digital Transformation Consultant
description: Internship the Netherlands Eindhoven Introduction Are you a passionate student and do you have an affinity for enterprise applications? Then this internship will suit you! We are looking for enthusiastic interns with data analysis, robotic process automation and machine learning as well as fluency in English. Don’t worry if you are not experienced, we value your personality and attitude, together with your eagerness to learn and grow. What will you do? For next year we are looking for 3 talented students to join our application teams. We are looking for students who have passion for: Data Analyst intern Are you a student with a passion for data analysis? Join our team as a Data Analyst Intern, where you'll be diving into the land of enterprise applications. We are seeking interns with preliminary knowledge of Power BI, relational databases and SQL statement . While prior experience is beneficial, we prioritize your enthusiasm to learn and grow. Proficiency in English is essential for effective communication within our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst Intern, you will play a crucial role in maintaining and analyzing web-based applications, contributing to the strategic decisions of our department. Robotics automation intern Are you fascinated by the world of robotics and automation? We invite you to explore this exciting field with our Robotics Automation Internship. We are looking for candidates with a background in Power Automate and basic programming . If you are a student eager to expand your knowledge and skills in these areas, we encourage you to apply. Your responsibilities will involve working on projects that leverage automation technologies to enhance our enterprise applications. Artificial Intelligence intern Do you like exploring into the fascinating field of artificial intelligence? As an Artificial Intelligence Intern, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects. We are searching for candidates with good knowledge in python and machine learning particularly Natural Language Processing (NLP). While experience in these areas is valued, we prioritize your passion for AI and your willingness to contribute to our innovative initiatives. Join us in shaping the future of enterprise applications through the lens of artificial intelligence! Why an internship in Advantech? You have a lot of positive energy and you bring fresh ideas to the table. Next to that: You are enrolled at an educational institution during the internship period You are 3rd or 4th year student. Preferably enrolled in a bachelor program in computer engineering, computer science or engineering You are fluent in English both verbal and written You have basic knowledge in web application development Available for at least 6 months What do we offer? Investment in your talent is our priority! As an intern, you will be involved in different projects and activities getting a clear view of the day-to-day activities of Application Support Intern, which will help you in your future career development. Joining our international environment with more than 35 nationalities Flexible working hours and the possibility for hybrid working model (office & home) Internship compensation of 500 EUR per month based on a full-time contract Travel allowance in case you are not eligible for a student OV-card Fun quarterly events and teambuilding activities Opportunities for future employment Guidance throughout your journey in the company What are the requirements? Are you ready to get on board with our mission of Enabling an intelligent planet while keeping sustainability in mind? Then you are on the right page! Advantech is a leader in providing trusted, innovative products such as life-saving medical equipment to movie projectors providing your Saturday entertainment, there are Advantech computers all around you. These products range from industrial computers with the processing power for artificial intelligence, to displays that meet the medical requirements for surgical rooms or communications products that connect devices across a factory floor

title: Corporal
description: Job Advert Details At HSBC, we’re a trusted international organisation with a global customer base of around 39 million customers worldwide through a network that covers 62 countries and territories. In Europe, our ambition is to become the leading international wholesale bank and we need talent like you to help us meet our ambition. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top or in an exciting new direction—we offer opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. We are looking for an enthusiastic Analyst for our Dutch Large Corporate team to support our growth trajectory. In this role you will support the (Global) Relationship manager, being responsible for a portfolio of large corporate clients through preparation of transaction related credit & capital applications, annual credit & KYC reviews, identifying cross sell opportunities, sustainability topics, and coordinating with cross-functional teams. You will do this together with a team of highly experienced and motivated colleagues, operating in an international high-performance setting, with short and informal communication lines. In this role you will: Support the Relationship Team (GRMs & RMs) with all operational and commercial activities Support with prospecting of new clients and identifying commercial cross sell opportunities on existing clients Assist with the preparation of credit risk (annual) reviews, including financial analysis/modeling, industry- and competitor analyses and identifying key financial- and other risks Coordination with cross-functional teams during due diligence and deal execution phase (product, capital, credit, legal and operations teams) Ensure that the business meets its internal and external regulatory requirements, including KYC requirements and making sure all client data is captured and up to date in relevant systems Work in partnership with other teams to deliver the services and products of the bank in a fair and transparent manner, including participating in internal- and external client calls and meetings Maintain close contact with the international network to ensure prompt and appropriate responses to client queries and capture additional business opportunities You should

title: Data Analist
description: Openstaande Vacature PARTTIME FUNCTIE NOORDWIJK 32-40 UUR Duur: Minimaal 5 maanden Over ons Wij zijn CreditDevice – een snelgroeiend softwarebedrijf dat bruisend is van energie. Met grote, gerenommeerde klanten én kleinere ondernemingen in ons portfolio, worden we steeds meer een begrip in de markt. Ons doel? Bedrijven niet alleen helpen, maar echt partner worden tijdens hun reis om creditmanagementprocessen te optimaliseren. Van MKB tot multinationals, wij zijn er voor iedereen. En met onze innovatieve software en diepe inzichten helpen we organisaties om financieel florerend te zijn. Wat zoeken wij in jou? Wij zijn op zoek naar een leergierige en gemotiveerde (afstudeer)stagiair Data Analist die ons team komt versterken voor een periode van minimaal 5 maanden. Deze rol biedt een unieke kans om praktische ervaring op te doen in een dynamische snelgroeiende omgeving. Het project: Tijdens de stage ontwikkel je met PowerBI dashboards die aansluiten bij de wensen van de klanten. Wat krijg je van ons? Je bent proactief en een echte doorzetter. Nieuwe dingen ontwikkelen is niet altijd meteen succesvol maar daar laat jij je niet door uit het veld slaan. Je bent analytisch sterk. Je volgt een HBO-/WO-opleiding in de richting van AI, Data Science, Wiskunde, Informatica. Je hebt ervaring met PowerBI Je bent bereid om op kantoor te werken in Noordwijk. Wat bieden wij? Een uitdagende en leerzame stage in een groeiend bedrijf. Een prettige werksfeer in een jong en dynamisch team. Veel vrijheid in hoe je het project aanpakt. Begeleiding door onze Data Science collega. Een stagevergoeding conform de marktstandaard. Wil jij ons team komen versterken? Stuur je CV en motivatiebrief naar s.zaal@creditdevice.nl met als onderwerp ‘stage Data Analist’. Wij kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!

title: Financial Analyst
description: Develop and maintain the cost accounting system, documents, and records. Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual reports, ensuring compliance with regulations and internal procedures. Initiate and drive continuous improvements in cost accounting processes and procedures for our manufacturing sites. Provide support for internal and external audits. Assist the Supply Chain Controller in preparing manufacturing variance reports. Conduct analyses on finished products in warehouse locations. Monitor accurate fixed assets reporting and conduct physical fixed asset counts. Analyze cost prices and assist in preparing cost price assessments. Act as a key user for IT systems. Prepare month- and year-end accruals related to manufacturing processes. Support and advise on VAT transactions. Participate in (ad hoc) projects. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in a business economics discipline. Minimum 2 years' experience in a similar role, preferably within a manufacturing organization. Extensive knowledge of automation systems like MS Office and ERP systems (experience with JDE is advantageous). Fluency in English C2, both written and verbal and Dutch is a big plus. You have valid working permit Working conditions A competitive salary based on the role's requirements and your experience. Generous time off including statutory vacation days and additional days as you progress in your career. Holiday pay, bonuses, and an excellent pension scheme. Travel allowance or full reimbursement of public transportation costs. A modern work environment that values work-life balance and supports hybrid work arrangements. Salary from: €2800,- Salary to: €3700,- Work location Scherpenzeel Company description As a Manufacturing Financial Analyst, you play a vital role in overseeing and controlling cost accounting for our manufacturing entities across EMEA. Your responsibilities encompass maintaining financial accounting aligned with fiscal, legal, and internal procedures, utilizing financial data analyses to advise on accounting practices and facilitate informed decision-making processes.

title: IT Business Consultant
description: Verrijk het team met jouw expertise Je bent een analist die IT-systemen van onze klanten implementeert en evalueert. Daarmee help je de organisatie groeien. Je maakt verschil door mensen en processen met elkaar te verbinden. Omschrijving van een dag Vanmorgen ben je op tijd begonnen, want vanmiddag ga je een uurtje eerder stoppen om bij het afzwemmen van je dochter te zijn. Vandaag werk je vanuit huis aan twee klussen. Een collega van je heeft met een Technische Dienst een werkproces uitgewerkt die nu in het onderhoudsbeheersysteem gebouwd moet worden. Voor het grootste deel kun je met de standaard uit de voeten, maar er zitten een paar ‘exotische’ aanpassingen in waar je even goed naar moet kijken. SQL ken je goed, maar moet je voor deze specifieke workflow nou een outer of inner join leggen? Het systeem is nog een beetje nieuw voor je, maar dat maakt het leuk. Lekker om dat even in alle vroegte te kunnen doen, voordat je collega’s zich tussen de bedrijven door komen melden om een beroep te doen op jouw expertise. Naast die workflows moet je vanmiddag nog een data import doen. In de afgelopen weken heb je jouw klant zelfstandig begeleid met het verzamelen van de data. Dat was nog een hele klus, maar vanmiddag is het zo ver. Je gaat een statement schrijven waarmee het Cloud Team de data set kan inlezen. Spannend want de klant heeft er hoge verwachtingen van. Jij hebt er alle vertrouwen in, want ook jij kan weer bij anderen terecht met jouw vragen. De data zit goed in elkaar en de insert verloopt soepel. Echt gaaf om je klant zo te kunnen helpen. En je bent op tijd klaar om je dochter te zien afzwemmen. Heerlijk als alles zo mooi in balans is. Waarom je bij ons wilt werken? Kies je voor Pontifexx dan kies je niet voor een baan maar voor een bestaan. Wij willen dat je wordt wie je bent. Je leert en ontwikkelt jezelf continu bij Pontifexx. Als je leuke dingen doet dan heb je er plezier in. Als je ergens plezier in hebt, dan word je er goed in. Mocht je nog twijfelen? ’Klinkt goed zo’n baan bij Pontifexx, maar ik zie mijzelf niet als consultant of adviseur.’ Ben je technisch goed, maar twijfel je over je adviesvaardigheden? Of andersom, dan is het handig om eerst eens met een van onze consultants te praten. Vraag een gesprek aan, dan bespreken we samen wat jouw sterke kanten zijn en wat je wensen zijn om je verder te ontwikkelen. De kleine lettertjes Er zijn een paar basiseisen die we stellen aan de functie: Afgeronde HBO-opleiding in een technisch bedrijfskundige en/of IT-richting Ervaring met software implementaties is een must Je hebt affiniteit met SQL en XML en je begrijpt hoe databases werken Gaat je hart al sneller kloppen? Wil je geen standaard kantoorbaan, maar juist veel onderweg zijn, met steeds nieuwe uitdagingen, dan wil je deze baan. Leuk! Ja, ik wil deze baan!

title: Data Analist
description: 's-Gravenhage 12 maanden (+ optie verlenging) 36u 08-12-2023 Voor één van onze klanten in omgeving Den Haag zoeken wij een Data Analist voor 36 uur per week. Interesse? Lees snel verder! Omgeving: Den Haag Startdatum: 08-12-2023 Duur: 06-12-2024 + optie tot verlenging Aantal uur: 36 uur Jij houdt er van data te analyseren en interpreteren. Zie jij jezelf als onze nieuwe ‘Sherlock Holmes’ van de digitale tijd? Ben je nieuwsgierig, leergierig en creatief in het bedenken van oplossingen om ons handhavings (toezichts) werk efficiënter uit te voeren? Werk mee aan het beschermen van de leefomgeving en solliciteer. Wat ga je doen Je ondersteunt en stimuleert de afdeling in het data gedreven en informatie gestuurde toezicht houden. Je verzamelt informatie bij toezichthouders, samenwerkingspartners en bij andere openbare bronnen met als doel risico’s beter te kunnen inschatten. Je werkt intensief samen met de I-afdeling bij het verder op orde brengen en verbeteren van de informatiebasis van de ODH. Je verzamelt, controleert, ordent, koppelt, verrijkt en interpreteert relevante data. Je initieert (kwalitatieve en kwantitatieve) onderzoeken, stelt rapportages op en geeft aanbevelingen. Je werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van de data-analyse binnen het team. Je helpt mee met het ontwikkelen van het GEO-georiënteerd werken binnen de dienst. Je neemt deel aan diverse in- en externe projecten, zoals spotten, mobiel toezicht en risicomethodiek. Wij bieden Deskundige en betrokken collega’s die op hun talent en interesses worden ingezet. Eisen De kandidaat heeft minimaal een afgeronde WO opleiding, waarin statische data-analyse, onderzoek en rapportage dominante onderdelen zijn. Wo-diploma in een studierichting waarin statistische data-analyse, onderzoek en rapportage dominante onderdelen zijn. Wensen De kandidaat heeft aantoonbare ervaring met GIS-enduser tools (GeoWeb, QGisc, ArcGis) De kandidaat heeft aantoonbare ervaring met data analyses en statistische methoden De kandidaat heeft aantoonbare ervaring met technieken om visualisaties in geografische context te plaatsen De kandidaat heeft aantoonbare ervaring met digitale systemen/programma zoals; excel, acces, statistische tooling, Power BI en SQL De volgende competenties zullen worden getoetst tijdens het gesprek; – communicatieve vaardigheden – neemt initiatief – analytisch Graag hoor ik of je interesse hebt in deze functie?

title: Devops Engineer
description: Jij maakt het net beter als Junior Cloud DevOps Engineer Als Junior Cloud DevOps Engineer heb jij de juiste energie en ben jij de persoon die proactief dingen uitzoekt. Je zult je o.a. bezig houden met het beheren, verbeteren en ondersteunen van producten en dienst op onze nieuwe Data Cloud Platformen. Je speelt een belangrijke rol binnen Alliander omdat je een platform ontwikkelt wat andere IT teams gebruiken om data veilig en betrouwbaar op te kunnen gebruiken en op te slaan. Het energienet van de toekomst maken we voor iedereen, mét iedereen. En als Junior Cloud DevOps Engineer werk jij hieraan mee. Zo ben jij bezig met het: integreren van Cloud diensten als Snowflake (datawarehouse) en Matillion (data transformatie) in de Alliander omgeving; automatiseren van alles; we hebben een hekel aan dingen handmatig te onderhouden. Dit kan zijn in b.v. AWS code languages of Python. maken van koppelingen van en naar AWS (Amazon Web Services); opzetten van CI/CD workflows in GitHub (actions). beheren van diverse componenten in de Alliander DataCloud als Snowflake, Matillion en diverse andere AWS componenten. Jij maakt het net completer bij Alliander Wist je dat we bij Alliander uit verschillende bedrijven bestaan? Samen met Liander, Qirion, Qterra, Dep en Entrnce ontwikkelen én beheren we het energienet voor miljoenen inwoners van Nederland. En met de huidige energietransitie is dat hard werken. Dat doen we met de hulp van ruim 8.000 vakmensen. Dankzij deze talenten hebben wij het volste vertrouwen in de energietoekomst van Nederland. Samen met jou maken wij dat mogelijk. De nieuwste trends en ontwikkelingen volgen kan alleen als jij genoeg energie hebt. En de juiste werkomgeving geeft jou dat. Het moet dus wat opleveren. De afdeling Data & Analytics bestaat uit slimme en betrokken specialisten. Jij maakt het net energieker Werken met de nieuwste technieken en innovaties. Dat doe je vanuit je eigen kracht en talent. En dat doe je bij ons. Draag jij daaraan bij met jouw fijne manier van samenwerken? Tof. Doen we! Zeker als je dit aanvult met: (bijna)een afgeronde opleiding richting IT/ Cloud en/of Infrastructure (hbo of wo). sterke affiniteit met de IT. leergierigheid en assertiviteit. Last but not least: excellent knowledge of the Dutch language is required. If you don’t read, write and speak Dutch fluently we cannot include you in the process for this vacancy. Voor jou net beter geregeld Daarvoor krijg jij op basis van een 38-urige werkweek: een salaris van € 2.927,- tot € 4.712,- bruto per maand. op basis van een fulltime werkweek een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB) van 18% van je bruto jaarsalaris, dit is inclusief ADV. Werk je niet fulltime, dan heb je geen recht op ADV en krijg jij 12,8%. Jij bepaalt of je die voor onder andere opleidingen, extra vrije dagen of extra salaris gebruikt. een eindejaarsuitkering in december van 5,94% van de uitbetaalde maandsalarissen in het huidige kalenderjaar. de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken. vergoedingen voor studies en trainingen. Alliander vergoed in de meeste gevallen jouw gehele opleiding. Natuurlijk hebben we nog veel meer! Lees meer over al jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden. Voor jou net wat meer informatie Samen maken we het net beter. Voor iedereen, met iedereen. En daar hoor jij bij! Solliciteer op deze vacature voor 22 december. Binnen 5 werkdagen krijg je een reactie van ons. Een assessment of screening kan onderdeel uitmaken van jouw sollicitatieprocedure. In onze screeningsvoorwaarden vind je meer informatie. Meer weten over de functie-inhoud? Sandra Jokhan, Chapterlead Technical Platforms, vertelt je hier meer over via Sandra.Jokhan@Alliander.com. En heb je nog vragen over de selectieprocedure of screening? Dan helpt Serdal Guclu, Senior Corporate Recruiter IT, jou graag verder via 0638197975 of Serdal.Guclu@Alliander.com. Recruiter Serdal Guclu Telefoonnummer: +31 (6) 38197975

title: Data Scientist
description: How do you make our customers happy? Bol. is changing retail to make daily life simpler for 13 million Dutch and Belgian customers. We are joined on this mission by 52,000 partner sellers that do business on our retail tech platform. This represents a combined assortment of approximately 42 million products. And each of these products needs to be onboarded quickly, efficiently and flawlessly into the product catalog. A complex endeavor because product information comes in many shapes and sizes. So how do we rationalize and automate that process? What do you do as a Data Scientist? Are you a passionate explorer of the data universe, driven by the thrill of uncovering hidden insights and patterns? Do you have a keen eye for turning raw data into actionable information? If so, we invite you to embark on a data-driven adventure with us as a Data Scientist. Team SmartAds is looking for a Data Scientist to help us unlock valuable insights for various projects. Team SmartAds is the Engineering/Data Science team currently owning the attribution process and several attribution models built on the data coming from that pipeline. The output of those models is used for Marketing performance reporting, affiliates payout and marketing performance forecasting. Currently we are working on an exciting new project, where we can tell you everything about in the interview. For this project we are currently in an exploration phase, where we are leveraging our internal bol. data, together with data that we receive from a third party, to measure and drastically improve our performance. The new Data Scientist in the team would continue on these explorations to create insights/rules/models that we can use in production, with a huge potential impact on the efficiency of our marketing budget. Why can you make a difference? To be successful as a Data Scientist in the Traffic Product, you obviously need the right credentials, such as a background in Data Science (AI or equivalent) and at least 3 years of relevant work experience. This ideally comprises a mix of Machine Learning / Deep Learning, and NLP / Information Retrieval techniques. We also expect a proven ability to program in Python and write queries in SQL and BigQuery If you are also versed in sklearn, keras and/or tensorflow, we will fast-track the onboarding process for your CV. Bonus points are awarded for Java/Kotlin, Cloud solutions and Google’s AI platform experience. On a more personal level, we highly value a strong drive to help people with wildly diverging backgrounds and skill sets to understand your models, as well as strong social skills. Moreover, the team loves to share, both ‘internally’ and with the broader Data Science community. If you share that mentality, great! 3 reasons why this is (not) for you Show me why it's not for me Show me why it's for me - No, if your attention span plummets after the POC phase - No, if neural nets are your answer to anything and everything - No, if you like flying solo #allthatairspaceismiiiiiiiiiiine! + Yes, if you are keen to collaborate with the engineers in your team: they build what you envision, so the closer the bonds, the better + Yes, if mixing and mingling with the Product Catalogue crowd is your thing: you are eager to spread the Data Science word + Yes, if you feel responsible for turning ideas into realities Where you’ll work At the premier online retail tech platform in the Netherlands and Belgium. A platform where 13 million Dutch and Belgian customers can choose from over 35 million articles. A platform that helps roughly 52,000 commercial partners run their business. And a platform that will never be ‘finished’, because bol. has been reinventing retail since 1999 and we always will be. If there’s a better way to do something, we’re working on it! Together with our customers, partners, and about 3000 colleagues. And hopefully together with you! In this role, you work closely with our Product Manager, and 3 Software Engineers with a focus on ML solutions. Perks of having a blue heart Discover all perks Bonus The bonus is calculated at the end of the year and we always end the year with a fun party! The extra's This includes a telephone, training sessions, a nice lunch and possibly a lease car, if this is necessary for the performance of your job. The new flexible working We bring the best of both worlds together by working 50% at the office and 50% at home. This way, we find a balance between organisational and individual needs. Your application process Your application Carefully, we take a look at your application. You will hear from us soon to let you know if we invite you for an interview. First contact We’ll contact you to walk you through the process and take the first step to set up an interview. And since we’re already talking: feel free to ask any questions you may have. First date During the first interview we’ll get to know each other. We want to find out more about you, your work experience and skills. Your next interview Before this interview will take please we will ask you to take an online HR assessment and a technical assessment. We’ll also discuss the position and the team in depth. Is this love? Two interviews are usually enough to see if it’s a match. And if you agree… well, it’s the beautiful beginning of your career at bol.com. Any questions? Monika Myslinska, Recruiter Job experience mmyslinska@bol.com Apply right away Are you contributing to bol. online marketing and budget optimization? First name Last name Email address Phone number LinkedIn Anything you want to share CV/ resume (Word or PDF only, max. 10 MB)) Upload Upload another file + Cover letter (Word or PDF only, max. 10 MB)) Upload I approve bol.com to retain my details for 1 year for future, relevant job opportunities Send application Kraak jij de code voor onze tech uitdagingen? All jobs Lead Product Analyst - Logistics Help us deliver on millions of promises locatie Utrecht Education level Bachelor / Master Job experience 7-10 years Check this job Medior/Senior Logistics Process Engineer - Reverse Flow Will you join this team? locatie Utrecht Education level Bachelor / Master Job experience 4-7 years Check this job Platform Interaction Data Engineer Enable bol. to understand our customers locatie Utrecht Education level Bachelor / Master Job experience 4-7 years Check this job Get to work on Discover Building the very best data teams Data & Analytics From Brazil to bol | The power of diversity Tech

title: Development Operations Engineer
description: Our team is responsible for 3 main trade and communications data analysis systems with a broad underlying infrastructure (Large international financial markets organization trading different asset classes, across the globe from 6 main locations), making use of the newest technology standards to find market abuse. Those are ING’s global systems for high tech smart investigations, meaning that the users and stakeholders are found all over the world in Asia, Pacific, Americas, Europe, Middle-east. If you want to be part of a team whose impact extends to ensuring the safety of trading of a global international financial institution, if you are interested in maintaining machine learning models and being part of a growing organization, please read on. The team We ingest all corporate communication channels like email, chat, voice data, data from trading terminals with many more to come, with terabytes of data flowing through its data streams daily. You will be part of the team that ensures system stability and provides for the further growth of the application. In addition, you are expected to contribute to continuous delivery and continuous integration practices and strive to further integrate our machine learning models into our daily operations. We operate according to a BizDevOps development process and strongly believe in the Agile approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical target oriented development with regular milestones. We are an open minded squad that values trust and transparency above all. Roles and responsibilities Excellent social and communication skills. We are a very international team and main language is English. Scrum rituals desire proper communication and social skillset. Great analytical skills and problem solving skills. The mindset of openness and willingness to try new ways of working and technologies You love technology and naturally stay up-to-date on relevant new developments. End-to-end ownership mindset Active team player who takes responsibility Independent and autonomous in completing tasks The mentality of continuous improvement of the service and way of working Reflects upon behaviors and performance to proactively identify improvement areas Coaches others to help their individual development Experience in direct communication with and/or support of end users How to succeed We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself. Master of Science in Software engineering or an equivalent field. 5+ years of experience in relevant field Good knowledge of RHEL and Windows 2016 servers. Experience with PowerShell, Bash and Python. Good knowledge of at least one modern relational database. This combined with either knowledge of or interest in learning the MS-SQL database, which we rely on. DevOps/scrum or Agile experience. Experience with continuous delivery and deployment tools (knowledge of one of the following three is required Azure DevOps/Jenkins/TFS) Automating maintenance and support activities. Nice to have: Experience with OpenShift / Kubernetes. Basic knowledge on S3 buckets , Elastic search or OpenSearch Understanding of big data analytics and data science. Financial Markets domain knowledge. Experience with the implementation of Machine Learning/AI on the CI/CD/CT pipeline with ML OPS IT Risk management. PowerBi expertise Rewards and benefits We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm The benefits of working with us at ING include: A salary tailored to your qualities and experience 24-27 vacation days depending on contract Pension scheme 13th month salary Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary 8% Holiday payment Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities An informal working environment with innovative colleagues If you are designated by your lead for stand-by shifts to be available for incidents outside of your regular working hours, a Stand-by compensation is awarded. About us With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today. Questions? Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button. Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, and lines of code. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place, the excitement of the next morning, the friends you make, the journeys you take, the sights you see, and the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. The Data and Machine Learning department (DMLP) is on a mission to radically accelerate innovation across all data, analytics & machine learning teams by providing a self-service, end-to-end data platform. We’re on a way to roll out a company wide Data Governance, Data Stewardship program, and a Data Catalog using Collibra products. The Data Management Tools team will provide a Collibra-based service, which would enable management of Data Stewards organisation, global Data Domain structure, Data Glossary and Data Asset library. Integrated with internal DMLP services, it needs to become a part of the holistic ecosystem by implementing Collibra workflows and configuration to provide seamless user journeys for all kinds of the data platform users. Key Job Responsibilities and Duties: Become a source of knowledge around user flows in Data Stewardship and Data Working on consolidating physical source meta-data via tools like Collibra EDGE Catalogue: both business and technical side Create and maintain producer / consumer / data steward workflows Create and maintain data domain and data asset workflows Configure new functionalities in Collibra Develop new Data Catalog capabilities Develop Collibra dashboards and reports Develop 3rd party integrations with Collibra, OKTA, Terraform Administration of the service Customer support and operations Represent Booking.com values, both within the company and in the external community. Role Qualifications and Requirements: 6+ years in Software / Data Engineering 2+ years of successful experience with Collibra products or alternate catalogue (Alation,Informatica), doing integrations is a huge plus Self-driven learner, capable to proactively connect with many other teams to understand the user flows and technical integrations High level of ownership and responsibility Attention to detail Preferably a university degree in Mathematics or Software Engineering. Excellent communication: written and spoken (with English as the main language across the organisation). Tech stack: Java/Groovy Gitlab/Github CI/CD K8S Vault, Secret Management AWS / GCP / Azure What we offer: Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. Our Total Rewards strive to make it easier for you to experience all that life has to offer on your terms so that you can focus on what really matters. We offer competitive compensation as well as thoughtful, valuable, and even fun benefits which include: Headquarters located in one of the most dynamic and cosmopolitan cities in Europe: Amsterdam. Contribute to a high scale, sophisticated, world-class product and see the real time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide. Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture. Full relocation support for you and your family to move to Amsterdam. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating over 300 Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone! Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits. Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture. Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world. Health, life, and disability insurance* Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave. Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country). Industry leading product discounts for yourself, friends, and family, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and quarterly Booking.com wallet credit. Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs, and a complimentary Headspace membership On-site meals, coffee, and snacks, including healthy and vegan options, daily* #ThinkInclusion: Wellbeing & Inclusion at Booking.com: Inclusion, Diversity, Belonging, Wellbeing and Volunteering (IDBWV) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations. Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.” We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustment to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive. Pre- Employment Screening: If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

title: Data Scientist
description: : CareerStart@SAS Internship Program 2024 EMEA & APAC Data Scientist intern -Technical Consultant Team Huizen Hybrid Nice to meet you! We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence – and questions into answers. We’re also a debt-free multi-billion-dollar organization on our path to IPO-readiness. If you’re looking for a dynamic, fulfilling internship coupled with flexibility and world-class employee experience, you’ll find it here. Opportunity Within our EMEA/ APAC-wide Internship Program CareerStart@sas we’re offering a 6-month full-time internship in the Professional Services Department as Data Scientist Intern. in this role you'll develop statistical and analytical applications including SAS solution implementations for consulting sessions using knowledge of analytical methods and related SAS procedures and products Required qualifications: You’re curious, passionate, authentic, and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do. Strong communication skills – both written and verbal. We’re a global company, English is key. Dutch is preferred You’re interested in the future of Analytics and embrace technology. You’re a college student enrolled in an accredited program at the end of course. Or, you are a fresh graduate ready to start your internship. Target majors include Health Data Science, Data Science, Statistic, Mathematical Engineer degree and all the STEM faculties Preferred qualifications Basic knowledge of Lua, Python, R, SQL, SAS is preferred. Advanced knowledge of statistics and algorithm What you can expect? We’re not about coffee runs or boring busywork. Our internship program is focused on development, culture and community. We’ll help you grow professionally, thrive in an award-winning work environment and make memorable connections with your co-workers and fellow interns. We provide you with a unique business project and great opportunity to work on the most innovative analytics solutions during your internship. Besides that, you will have a SAS mentor, a personalized training program, and a tutor who always supports and enables you. Perks of the job Work with (and learn from) the best. As a SAS intern, you’ll get face time with our top executives! Free SAS programming training and certification for technical consulting roles. At SAS, flexible work is the norm. Want to work remotely? That’s cool. Prefer a hybrid mix of sweatpants and in-person collaboration? That’s great, too. Enjoy hackathons, social events and other opportunities to connect + engage. Your well-being matters, and that’s why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you stay healthy and productive. Diverse and inclusive At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here. Additional Information Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com . SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

title: Senior Auditor
description: Company Description Work with Us. Change the World. At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us. Job Description Job Description The Audit Services Senior Manager is a key leadership role responsible for planning, executing, and overseeing internal audit activities across the Europe & India, Middle East and Africa regions. This role is vital for ensuring AECOM’s financial integrity, operational efficiency, and compliance with international regulations. The incumbent will play a key role in safeguarding the organization's assets and reputation while providing valuable insights to support strategic decision-making. This role is a member of the Audit Services Leadership Team. The Audit Services Senior Manager will have 5 direct reports and will work closely with the Audit Services Senior Director, International to coordinate all Audit Services project within the Europe & India; Middle East and Africa regions, this includes collaborating with our Audit Services Cyber Security, Data Analytics, and Information Technology teams. Role Responsibilities Participate in the development of the annual audit plan for the Europe & India; Middle East and Africa regions, aligning with AECOM's overall strategic and objectives, following a risk-based approach to prioritize audit activities. Evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls, policies, and procedures, ensuring compliance with regulations and AECOM policies and procedures. Lead and execute complex audits across various locations, including financial, operational, compliance, and special audits. Manage staffing, workload distribution, and resource allocation to meet audit objectives. Review and analyse audit findings and work with audit teams as well as collaborating with stakeholders to develop action plans for improvement. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify emerging risks and assess their potential impact on AECOM. Prepare and present clear and concise audit reports to senior management. Communicate audit findings, recommendations, and potential risks to key stakeholders, fostering a culture of transparency and accountability. Promote adherence to ethical and governance principles within AECOM. Drive continuous improvement initiatives within ASG, streamlining processes, and enhancing efficiency. Stay current with evolving best practices and regulatory changes in internal auditing. Leadership: Set an example of integrity, trust, and performance. Acts ethically and models the AECOM Purpose and Core Values. Perseveres and demonstrates strategic thinking and influence skills. Is an inclusive leader, considering the diversity of the team and adapting leadership style when needed to ensure an inclusive environment. Create and maintain high performing engaged teams through effective communication, feedback, and support of all team members. Inspires the creative process of others, actively soliciting and using ideas from members of the team/group. Additional Information About AECOM AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM. Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Hardware Engineer
description: As a fast-growing company, we are looking for a hardware engineer to extend our development team. Your focus will be the complete electronics development lifecycle: from idea to production of custom-designed IoT sensor products that are the foundation of our predictive maintenance applications. Our company Sensorfy isn’t just a leading industry 4.0 innovator – we’re a family of talented, hard-working professionals dedicated to empowering change with technology. By producing the most accurate smart sensors and analytics, we help industrial companies to eliminate unplanned downtime and lengthen the lifetime of their assets. Together we make industrial operations more effective and sustainable. The vacancy As a Hardware Engineer, you are responsible for the development, qualification, and production of our products. Of course, you will not do this alone but together with other hardware engineers, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary Scrum development team. Our products consist of battery-powered IoT sensors and gateway devices for different markets and customers. It is the job of the senior hardware engineer to design robust, low-power products that provide maximum battery life without compromising functionality. For connectivity, we make frequent use of Bluetooth LE, 4G, and LTE-M networks which will require maximum RF performance, done by antenna tuning and good RF layout. Responsibilities Create quality hardware solutions that meet the customer requirements before moving into production. Clear, concise, and frequent communication is vital for a smooth operation. Support the business developer with new sales opportunities by designing the system architecture, identifying risk, estimating project size and hardware cost-price Continuously engage in the improvement of the hardware engineering process Continuously keep your knowledge up-to-date on new IoT technologies including (but not limited to) power management and energy harvesting, sensor technologies, and connectivity Strong collaboration with team members while empowering them through technical and soft skill coaching. Who are you? You are a hands-on person with a strong interest in technical things with the ability to work structurally and carefully. You are constantly looking for ways to improve the customer experience and you know how to explain complex situations in a clear and customer-oriented way. You know how to build trusty and long-term relationships with our customers. You are someone who prefers to work with new technologies, someone who has the ambition to be at the forefront of new developments. You like to share your knowledge with your colleagues and you work closely with your team. You identify problems within the projects and take action to solve them. To qualify The following list of experience is not required, but could be an indicator of success (reaching goals) in this role: HBO / WO Electrical Engineering 3+ years of experience in similar roles Experience in startup / scale-up environment Preferably experience with Altium Designer To get us extra excited PCBA Layout knowledge Connectivity & RF knowledge Low-power design knowledge Get to know the team Learn more Apply below or contact us to learn more about this job. You can send an email to kyra.hendrix@sensorfy.ai or call +31 6 14 96 88 77

title: Lead Engineer
description: Discipline R&D Engineer Education Medior Area EINDHOVEN Introduction As a Lead Engineer specializing in engine diagnostic robustness within the Engine Development division, you'll be pivotal in shaping heavy-duty diesel engines with a strong emphasis on diagnostic reliability. Your role encompasses a wide array of responsibilities, ensuring robust diagnostic performance, exploring avenues for improvement, and contributing to the resolution of field issues. Job description Analyze diagnostic monitor performance using data analytics derived from vehicle fleet, connected vehicles, and test cell data to evaluate false failures and detectability. Explore and assess various options to enhance robustness, including calibrations, software functions, and hardware improvements. Create and implement plans for improvements across current and upcoming projects, focusing on calibration optimizations, enhanced diagnostic functions, and more. Participate in root cause analysis and resolution concerning field issues related to diagnostics. Identify crucial tests for test cell and vehicle testing, ensuring early assessment of diagnostic performance for future projects. Collaborate within multidisciplinary project teams, engaging with software development, calibration, validation, service, and hardware design teams. Drive proactive improvements in tools and processes, continuously seeking opportunities for enhancement. Provide insights into project requirements at different stages based on fleet experience and analysis, contributing to property definition, function development, and calibration. Analyze, summarize, review, and report on the diagnostic performance of current products to the (Project) Management team.Initiative-driven problem-solving approach. Strong collaboration skills to integrate diverse perspectives within teams. Result-oriented mindset emphasizing timely delivery of effective solutions. Proficient analytical capabilities to synthesize information from diverse sources. Clear and effective communication skills suitable for presentations at the (Project) Management level. Persistence and collaboration in unifying teams with differing insights. What do we expect from you? Hold a Master's degree in Automotive Technology, Mechanical Engineering, or Controls Engineering. Possess a minimum of 5 years of experience in engine and aftertreatment OBD development, covering diagnostic function development, calibration, validation, and data analytics. Experience in engine and aftertreatment systems diagnostics or controls (DOC, DPF, SCR). Proficiency in diagnostic-related aspects such as OBD monitors, regulations, and service tests. Solid knowledge in FMEA, Root Cause Analysis, P-diagrams, Statistics, and Boundary diagrams. Strong background in data analytics supported by robust analytical skills. Excellent English language skills are mandatory. What can you expect from us? The right candidate will be provided a challenging and varied position in a professional, high-tech environment. An appropriate salary based on your experience and education. Future prospects and excellent benefits are evident. After a period of secondment and functioning properly, you can be contracted by our client. Good secondary conditions such as a minimum of 25 holidays and 8,33% holiday allowance. Courses to develop yourself professionally and personally via Trinamics Academy. Discount on your healthcare and referral bonusses and fun activities. Certain pre-employment screening checks may be part of this vacancy procedure.

title: Field Engineer
description: Job Description Summary All resources, and logistics required to perform services and maintenance activities on customers' site/property. These activities contribute to, maintain, repair and refurbish sold or existing products. Includes all types of maintenance service (preventive and remedial), manage maintenance facilities and field services engineering. Impacts quality of own work and the work of others on the team. Executes standard operational/technical tasks typically subject to instructions and work routines. There is latitude to rearrange the sequence to complete task/duties based on changing work situations. Job Description GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator with over 100 years of healthcare industry experience and around 50,000 employees globally. We enable clinicians to make faster, more informed decisions through intelligent devices, data analytics, applications and services, supported by our Edison intelligence platform. We operate at the center of an ecosystem working toward precision health - digitizing healthcare, helping drive productivity and improving outcomes for patients, providers, health systems and researchers around the world. In this role you will: Take care of all on site life extensions, repair and provide inspection-related service activities for installed fleets and supervision for construction and commissioning of new and existing equipment, able to be performed at customer site; make Engineering decisions Develop conceptual knowledge of professional discipline. May include support roles with specialized expertise or technical knowledge in broad area. Apply general knowledge of business developed through education or past experience. Understand how work of own team contributes to the area Resolve issues using established procedures. Consults supervisor or more senior team members for issues outside of defined instructions/parameters Collaborate with others to solve issues. For customer facing roles, develop strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between customer and GE HealthCare. Exchange technical information asks questions and checks for understanding What you will bring with you: 2-4 years experience in the Services & Field Services, preferably in MI/CT Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree in biomedical engineering from an accredited university or college IT knowledge Fluent Dutch Good English skills with effective verbal, writing and reading abilities Strong customer service skills GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our purpose is to create a world where healthcare has no limits. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world. GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity. Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support. #LI-JR2 Additional Information Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Industrial Engineer
description: Apollo Tyres Ltd is an international tyre manufacturer and the leading tyre brand in India. The company has multiple manufacturing units in India and a unit each in The Netherlands and Hungary. The company markets its products under its two global brands – Apollo and Vredestein, and its products are available in over 100 countries through a vast network of branded, exclusive and multi-product outlets. Job Title : Industrial Engineer Enschede The Netherlands Location : Enschede Reports to (Position) : Department/Function : Industrial Engineer Who we are: Apollo Tyres is a dynamic and fast-growing Indian tyre manufacturer with a global footprint. Powered by its key brands — Apollo and Vredestein, the company offers a comprehensive product portfolio spread across passenger cars, light trucks, truck-bus, off-highway, and bicycle tyres. The company has a manufacturing presence in Asia and Europe with 8 modern tyre facilities and exports to over 118 countries. What is the position?: The position is part of the Industrial Engineering (IE) department, a full-time role in day shift, reporting to the Manager Operational Analytics & Planning. Your role involves contributing to making our factory "Futureproof" by optimizing production processes. We are looking for someone proactive who can implement improvements, make processes more efficient, and engage colleagues in the process. Additionally, you should be analytically strong, familiar with change management, and capable of successfully completing projects. Your strength lies in understanding the impact of changes on the overall production flow. Location: Enschede, The Netherlands The position will be based in Enschede as part of the Industrial Engineering team. What are the responsibilities? Participating in (and possibly leading) projects for new machines, including capacity calculations and efficiency. Determining FAT/SAT content regarding machine performance and supporting FAT/SAT. Conducting time studies, work method analyses, and translating them into standards. Calculating occupancy and determining shift systems. Overall productivity improvements, addressing acute output problems, analyzing multi-year plans for feasibility and necessary investments, time standard management, administrative storage management, and specification changes. IE is jointly responsible for: Defining the necessary performance requirements of new machines and documenting them in acceptance protocols. Ensuring that installations meet all requirements before being transferred to production. Overseeing the performance requirements of processes. Continuously seeking improvement opportunities in productivity. Designing and building digital reports. Specific activities within the department include: Plant layout design and material handling. Workplace design & ergonomics. Lean manufacturing, including 5S, SMED, Value-Stream mapping & Kaizen. Do you have what it takes? (requirements) 5+ years of experience. Bachelor+ or master level. Experience with Lean tools and improvement projects. Affinity with production technology. Creative problem-solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills (Dutch/English). Excellent advisory skills (stakeholders at various levels). Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint (knowledge of VBA or PowerBi is a plus).

title: Data Scientist
description: Brief info about Vinted Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life. Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year. The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital. Information about the position You'll become part of the Trust domain, Safety track, with a mission to protect the Vinted community from harmful activities and content. The Safety track of the Trust domain is engaged in detecting, understanding, and stopping fraud and other malicious activities within the Vinted Marketplace. As a product team Decision Scientist, you will become part of a cross-functional team and drive quality of decisions by bringing actionable insights from data. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA), we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department: Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms. In this position, you'll Be your team's primary point of contact to provide answers to data-related questions Ensure these questions are answered in optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis) Collaborate with your team and stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities) Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively
