flagging issues Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker) Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests Help to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analyses About you Strong proven experience in Data Analytics (typically 4+ years of working experience or similar activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency) A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills A degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis) Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.) Advantage: experience with Machine Learning techniques (especially NLP) Advantage: experience working in the Trust & Safety or Fraud-related area Work perks The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme 25 working days of holiday Newest MacBook models Free access to an office gym Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture Private health insurance On-site canteen serving delicious homemade food at discount prices Frequent team-building events A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation A dog-friendly office Working at Vinted Individual Learning Budget Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You'll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role. Hybrid Work We've adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It's up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you'll spend working together in person. Equal Opportunity The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic. The salary range for this position is € 56,400 - € 79,925 gross per year.

title: Engineer
location: Capelle aan den IJssel, ZH, Netherlands
description: Als digital consultant bij Radancy ga je aan de slag met het ontwikkelen van recruitmentstrategieën, -websites en -campagnes voor grote opdrachtgevers zoals ING, UPS en Nutreco. Daarbij zoek je continu naar kansen om nieuwe onderdelen van ons inhouse ontwikkelde Radancy Talent Acquisition Platform (RTAC) aan te bieden bij zowel nieuwe als bestaande klanten. Je werkt rechtstreeks samen met deze klanten om doelstellingen te definiëren, online marketingstrategieën te creëren en uiteindelijk samen successen te behalen. Binnen Radancy ben je hét aanspreekpunt als het gaat om de juiste inzet van onze Platform-producten: van EVP, employer branding en recruitment sites tot employee referrals, programmatic jobs, eventmodules en CRM-oplossingen. Je neemt hierbij de leiding in het gehele proces; van het vertalen van de doelstellingen naar een concrete briefing voor de uitvoerende teams tot het interpreteren en presenteren van data-analyses. In samenwerking met je mediacollega’s adviseer je klanten over de media-inzet en klantvragen vertaal je naar online oplossingen voor zowel de website, owned media als paid media. Op basis van websitereviews, (tussentijdse) metingen en data-analyses stel je verbeteradviezen voor, voer je aanpassingen en optimalisaties door en bouw je business cases. Je verlegt voortdurend de grenzen in de manier waarop werkgevers in contact kunnen komen met talent. Dankzij jouw creatieve oplossingen behaal je niet alleen de doelstellingen van de klant, maar weet je ook te innoveren. Of het nu gaat om onze software, media-inzet of data-analyse; als digital consultant ben je op alle niveaus betrokken in de ontwikkeling en uitvoering van digitale employer branding-strategieën. Dit zijn wij Radancy Nederland (voorheen Maximum) is een full-service arbeidsmarktcommunicatiebureau gespecialiseerd in employer branding en recruitment advertising. Maar op feestjes zeggen we gewoon: een reclamebureau gespecialiseerd in personeelswerving. We helpen toonaangevende bedrijven en overheidsorganisaties zich te onderscheiden als werkgever en zo de juiste talenten Radancy A TMP Worldwide Company 2022 2 aan zich te binden voor de toekomst. Dat doen we met alle mogelijke media en communicatiemiddelen, waarbij technologie vrijwel altijd een grote rol speelt: van outdoor media tot interactieve apps, en van applicant tracking systemen tot social advertising. Met zo’n 60 Nederlandse collega’s en nog eens 1.200 collega’s wereldwijd hebben we alle kennis en vakmanschap in huis. Dit betekent dat we ook marktonderzoek doen, media-advies geven en complete recruitmentsites ontwikkelen en beheren voor onze klanten. Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met het ontwikkelen en presenteren van complexe digitale oplossingen binnen een marketingbureau, reclamebureau of SaaS-organisatie. Je hebt veel kennis van en ervaring met digitale media, technologieën en trends. Specifieke ervaring in recruitment is geen vereiste, dat leren we je gaandeweg. Je hebt sterke analytische vaardigheden en (basis)kennis van Google Analytics of een ander Metricspakket om de performance van websites te beoordelen. Je hebt goede presentatievaardigheden en kunt complexe zaken eenvoudiguitleggen. Dit bieden we: Je krijgt een goed salaris en daarnaast hebben we uitgebreide secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een uitstekende pensioenregeling. Maar laat dat niet je motivatie zijn. We bieden je namelijk een unieke kans om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Je komt in een ervaren team terecht, en werkt samen met (internationale) specialisten op het gebied van creatie, design, front- en back-end development, media en research. Stuk voor stuk jonge, gedreven mensen van wie je ontzettend veel kunt leren. En dat allemaal in een omgeving waar het niet draait om waar of wanneer je werkt, maar om wat je bijdraagt aan het succes voor onze opdrachtgevers. O, en hadden we al verteld dat: Radancy is gevestigd in een prachtig pand aan de pittoreske Hollandsche IJssel? Je 25 vakantiedagen, 3 well-being dagen én verjaardagsvrij krijgt? We onderdeel zijn van een global organisatie, wat deuren opent tot mooie internationale kansen? We een eigen chef hebben die dagelijks een biologische lunch bereidt? Je gratis kunt meedoen aan onze wekelijke Office Bootcamp (no pressure!)? Onze prioriteit is het vinden van de beste kandidaat voor deze functie. Ben je geïnteresseerd maar twijfel je of je aan alle kwalificaties voldoet? Dan raden we je toch aan te solliciteren!

title: Sales Manager
description: Company Overview At Motorola Solutions, we're guided by a shared purpose - helping people be their best in the moments that matter - and we're living up to our purpose everyday by solving for safer. Because people can only be their best when they not only feel safe, but are safe. We're solving for safer - safer communities, safer schools, safer hospitals, safer businesses - safer everywhere. We're building integrated technologies that help protect people, property and places. We're connecting public safety agencies and enterprises - enabling the collaboration that's critical for a more proactive approach to safety and security. We're committed to solving for safer every day because the work we do here matters. Department Overview At Motorola Solutions we unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters. Job Description The Focus Account Manager Luxury Goods - Europe will report to the Senior Sales Director of Strategic Accounts International and work closely with the regional sales leaders of the assigned territory. The role encompasses promoting and selling multiple Video and Security Brands from Motorola Solutions, including Avigilon, Pelco, Indigovision, Openpath, Ava, Videotec and any further brands in the VS&A division in the future as appropriate. Motorola Solutions Video Security & Access Control division (VS&A) engages with key luxury goods accounts and stakeholders globally . The role in question is responsible for developing, supporting, advising, and managing these relationships, ensuring a unified engagement with the respective Motorola Solutions local sales teams, to further position the portfolio and solution offerings of Motorola Solutions VS&A., increasing the respective sales and market share. The role is a highly varied role and requires skills in several core functions including, general management tasks, business-to-business account management, and sales activities. The core objective of this position is to increase funnel growth and sales of our video security and access control solutions portfolio by creating and shaping demand while increasing relationships within the luxury goods market sector, working closely with Motorola Solutions’ regional account teams and channel partners. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following: Responsible for establishing strategic business development initiatives that drive corporate growth through product expansion, partnerships and alliances with a selected list of F.A.S.T Accounts. Analyze market data to identify trends/opportunities, develop strategic direction from market information, and create compelling market analysis presentations. Effectively present Motorola Solutions’ value proposition and demonstrate key attributes of our video security and access control portfolio. Sales functions include forecasting, project registration, pipeline management through CRM, proof of concepts, demonstration, and market positioning presentations. Business development and identification of new opportunities across the respective luxury goods accounts landscape. Business to Business functions including training as required, to best position Motorola Solutions VS&A products enabling them to confidently ensure compliance with respective corporate policies and expectations. Ensure delivery of respective revenue quota together with any MBO’s assigned. Attend team conference calls and meetings as prescribed. Work with and educate regional Sales Team members on how to engage with the luxury good market effectively and with maximum results. Help in identifying all prospective new business opportunities in the assigned luxury goods accounts to maximize the impact of regional Sales Team efforts within the assigned territories. Identify “product gaps” that need to be addressed by Product Management in order to gain greater exposure/standardization assigned sector. Prepare reports and provide to your reporting line and Product Management on gaps and fiscal impact of gaps to the organization. Interface and work with relevant 3rd party technology providers in the assigned account landscape to develop relationships for technology integrations. Attend trade shows and professionally participate in booth duty within the Motorola Solutions VS&A attendance at various marketing events as determined necessary. Conduct all required sales calls, schedule “local” promotional work and track sales activities with all channels using Motorola Solutions VS&A’s Salesforce.com lead and project tracking software database. Update regularly. Develop standardized vertical market presentations and sales tools outlining Motorola Solutions VS&A value proposition as appropriate. Work with applications engineers for proof of concept and relevant solution designs. Submit regular forecasts and activity reports to management. Basic Requirements Strong understanding of the video surveillance & access control market in mid to premium brand space, with an aptitude for selling solutions. A self-motivated and focused individual with a passion for technology and an aptitude for customer satisfaction. A minimum of five years experience with a proven successful Sales/Business Development Management track record at all levels. Luxury goods industry experience and established and relevant contacts/connections Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and at a minimum 1 additional European language, additional languages an advantage Strong negotiation skills, being comfortable with negotiation at all levels Excellent presentation skills verbal and written, able to communicate complex solutions in an informative way, and adapt to a varied audience Pleasant & friendly style of verbal and written communication Excellent knowledge of networking principles and IP communication, CCTV, and access control Excellent IT skills, in Office/Google and other essential platforms Territory The Focus Account Manager Luxury Goods (Europe), shall have the responsibility to cover the following territory: Europe Other Frequent international travel will be required during the execution of the duties of the Focus Account Manager Luxury Goods(Europe) expected to be in excess of 50%. It is expected and required that the Focus Account Manager Luxury Goods(Europe) has a valid driving license and has no individual or personal restrictions on travel and access to countries and jurisdictions within the defined territory. Motorola Solutions VS&A may allocate such additional or other duties of work as informed to the Focus Account Manager Luxury Goods(Europe), from time to time as necessary to meet the needs of the business of Motorola Solutions Video Security & Access Control. Travel Requirements Over 50% Relocation Provided None Position Type Experienced Referral Payment Plan No Company Motorola Solutions France SAS

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Working as a Full stack developer for AH technology means you build state-of-the-art web and applications, while creating an impact on millions of our customers. We create insights in regards to our inventory in every store with as ultimate goal: minimizing food waste. Your new job As a fullstack developer, you are technically co-responsible for the work of the ComGenius product team. The team develops and supports a state-of-the-art software product that integrates outcomes from data science and analytics teams into a user-friendly web application. This application is used by our commercial employees daily. Multiple users at the beating heart of Albert Heijn use this tool as the single source of truth for all their insights and receive proactive notifications to support their decisions regarding the assortment, price, promotions, and more of our products in stores. We support remote working in this team. On average we meet once every two weeks in the office for meetings or fun stuff. Although we are looking for candidates who are based in the Netherlands, we don’t mind if you’d be working remotely from a different location in the world a few weeks a year. This automatically means we have no mandatory days that you need to be at the office but you are always welcome at our office located in Zaandam (near train station). More specifically you: Our team is operating on every possible tier of the application development starting with A) fetching data from the data lakes, transforming it B) Move the data to the MS SQL database C) fetching data with NodeJS API and serving it to D) React frontend. For that we have data engineers, fullstack developers and frontend developers working in our team. We’re looking for a full-stack Javascript/Typescript developer to support us on the (c) and partially (d) level. You will be mostly responsible for maintaining NodeJS API, that serves the frontend, and create new endpoints to serve new data structures. The right ingredients for an impactful job: At Albert Heijn we aim to grow, and this is only possible if you grow along with us. As we work together to build our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week): An annual salary up to 78K including holiday allowance and a flexible bonus. Depending on your experience; 45 days of paid leave to enjoy your well-deserved holidays: 25,5 regular vacation days and 19,5 ADV days. Enjoy! Flexible working hours; Access to a challenging training curriculum – AH Tech Academy; An excellent pension plan where we as an employer contribute 4,5 more than you as an employee; A travel allowance or a NS-business card for traveling to and from Zaandam by train; Attractive discounts on various insurance policies; 10% staff discount on groceries in all Albert Heijn stores, to a maximum of €300 per year; A free Mijn Albert Heijn Premium membership with many benefits; A company laptop and telephone. The recipe for maximum impact: Passionate about tech and building products. Understanding “how computers work” and “what happens when you type google in a browser”. 5+ years of experience with JavaScript and/or related technologies. Experience with both front and backend of the project development. Proven hands-on experience with React. Understanding of modern React principles, like Context API. Proven solid knowledge of NodeJS and containerization. Understanding of databases, ability to understand and create SQL queries. Experience working with CI/CD pipelines, creating deployment scripts (GitHub Actions, GitLab, etc…). Experience creating API’s with NodeJS, frameworks like NestJS is a plus. Bonus points for: Experience with Azure, or any other cloud provider. Experience in the field of Retail Tech. Dutch is a big plus. Interview Process: The first step is reviewing your resume and plan a (video) call with our tech recruiter Carly DeSantis. The next step is a technical assignment to tackle at home, which we use to understand if your programming style matches what we look for in a team mate. If it does, we follow up with a relaxed 1-hour chat, where we talk about the assessment, your experiences, and some day-to-day technical stuff you don’t really need any preparation for. At last there’s a 1 hour chat with the Director and our PO to get to know each other and tell you more about the direction and ambitions of the team. Together we make eating better the easy choice. For everyone. The world around us has changed, and significantly at that. These changes have impact on the lives of our customers, colleagues and partners. And therefore, also on Albert Heijn. We’re moving towards a new world with new opportunities and challenges. Albert Heijn wants more people to eat fresher, healthier and more sustainable food. Eating brings us together, keeps us healthier and contributes positively to the world. Our mission is: Together we make eating better the easy choice. For everyone. Ready to contribute to our mission? Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Would you like to learn more first, before you apply to Albert Heijn? We’re happy to tell you everything about this vacancy! , . Solliciteren Stuur je sollicitatie in via deze website. Gesprek Als je aan het profiel voldoet nodigen we je snel uit voor een gesprek in de winkel. Mogelijkheden Samen bekijken we de mogelijkheden voor jou in de winkel zoals de verschillende werktijden en welke plek het beste bij je past. Welkom! Zijn we allebei enthousiast? Dan kun je snel beginnen! Welkom. We vragen An eye for detail Excellent analytical skills A drive to innovate High focus on quality A positive attitude

title: Application Developer
description: Location Eindhoven HTC, The Netherlands Hours 40 hours SMART Photonics is rapidly growing, and we are expanding our ICT team with an all-round Application Engineer MES. Someone who understands our semiconductor/photonics & production processes and who can support us by offering proposals, designs, development, and implementation of complex MES projects. Beside the technical knowhow, you are an adventurer like the rest of us, able to understand the needs of a scale-up organization and its changing environment. You prioritize, deal with all the challenges we are facing on a daily base and enjoy the hectical moments. Responsibilities: Manage, control, develop and validate MES solution using EZ-MES of Eazyworks; Assist and participate in all aspects of MES project implementation (recipe design, interface development, documentation, testing, requirement gathering); Configure work-flows in MES with collaboration of engineering team; Troubleshoot and assist Smart Photonics with resolving application problems including verifying/testing software hotfixes; Configure manufacturing execution systems, manufacturing intelligence tools, process control systems and interfaces between these systems and other enterprise systems; Presenting and reporting on projects & updates; Supervising documentation & configuration changes, including implementation preparation, with an interdisciplinary role; Create and optimize documents and procedures; Manage and monitor the traceability & consistency of MES configurations; Prepare work instructions & training material; Provide on-demand reports to stakeholders and support development of analytic capabilities; Support future enhancement of MES and integration to ISA-95 level-2 and 4 systems; Active thinking and improvement of processes and associated automation. (e.g. PLM). Our ideal candidate is / has: A bachelor’s degree in computer science, automation, bioengineering, chemical engineering or equivalent; +3 years of experience with MES in a complex production environment; Strong verbal and written skills to communicate effectively and create buy-in; Software development skills in programming, analysis, methodology, design and architecture; Business acumen in a technical environment; Actively participate in technical project team; Proactive mentality with self-driven approach; Ability to work independently based on task guidance as provided by others; Ability to contribute and support multiple projects simultaneously; Knowledge of SQL and Spotfire/Power BI is a plus. We offer : Investment in your career development by a tailor-made career plan (including courses, training, and personal coaching options); Up to 250 online courses, you can follow; Chair massage, fruit of the office, company fitness discount and Lunch Walks; We are located at the High Tech Campus a bustling location offering a supermarket, all kind of restaurants, a gym, and network events; For people who need a work permit, visa and/or relocation, we are acknowledged as high-tech company allow to apply for the highly skilled migrant visa. We also have a relocation package in place. Our employees valued teamwork with an 8.8 /10, freedom in their job with an 8.8/10 and collaboration with other colleagues an 8.6/10. Interested? Then join us in the Photonics revolution and apply!

title: Control Room Operator
description: CEVA Logistics provides global supply chain solutions to connect people, products and providers all around the world. Present in 170 countries and with more than 110,000 employees spread over 1,300 sites, we are well on our way to achieving our vision: to be a Top 5 global 3PL. We believe that our employees are the key to our success. We want to engage and empower our diverse, global team to co-create value with our customers through our solutions in contract logistics and air, ocean, ground, and finished vehicle transport. That is why CEVA Logistics offers a dynamic and exceptional work environment that fosters personal growth, innovation, and continuous improvement. DARE TO GROW! Join CEVA Logistics, and you will be part of a team that values imagination, encourages boldness and exemplarity, and is committed to excellence in everything we do. Join us in our mission to shape the future of global logistics as we become a global leader in the logistics industry. As we continue growing at a fast pace, will you “Dare to Grow” with us? YOUR ROLE In Bleiswijk, Zalando has built a warehouse of 140,000 m2, equivalent to 19 football fields. This high-tech and sustainable logistics centre has a capacity of 16 million items and is crucial to Zalando's growth objectives. You can play a significant role! In the role of Manager Controlroom, you are responsible for the direct supervision of the Control Room, the heartbeat of our logistical operation. Working together with your team and Zalando's teams, you ensure that the operational departments can maximize the production environment through process balance and timely action on daily challenges. In addition to daily supervision, you are expected to show initiative and propose measures to control operations and optimize systems and mechanization. You will closely collaborate with your direct colleagues from the control room, the Operational Controlroom Specialists, Process Controlroom Specialists, IT Controlroom Specialists and Equipment Controlroom Specialists. Additionally, you will work closely with on-site colleagues such as Operations Managers, Business Analysts and Engineers. You will work in day shifts from Bleiswijk and report directly to the Senior Manager Analytics & Control. WHAT WILL YOU DO? Achieve optimal performance for both your department and the operation; Analyze logistics indicators and take appropriate actions with your team; Coach, motivate, assess, and develop the direct members of your team, consisting of 18 employees; Manage and control work agreements, conduct regular work meetings, and promote communication between departments; Internal and external stakeholder management to ensure process continuity; Manage all qualitative and quantitative aspects of the operation (KPI and Performance Management); Monitor the output, reliability, and quality of the mentioned departments; Focus on continuous improvement and integrating new technologies and functionalities. WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR? A bachelor's or master's degree in (technical) business administration or logistics; At least 2 years of leadership experience with professionals at an HBO (higher professional education) level; Analytical, results-oriented, customer-focuse, and decisive; Ability to quickly switch tasks and communicate easily with colleagues within different levels of the organization; Full-time availability; Proficient in the Dutch and English language. WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU? A leadership position where you, together with the entire operation, exceed customer expectations every day. You will have significant responsibility and plenty of room for own initiative, with the opportunity to make a significant contribution to our further growth and ambitions. Additionally, we offer: Excellent primary and secondary employment conditions, including a travel allowance; A one-year contract with the possibility of a permanent contract hereafter; 25 vacation days and 4 additional days if you do not miss work; An attractive pension scheme and discounts in the employee benefit shop and on various insurances. YOUR FUTURE At CEVA eCommerce Logistics, our people are the heartbeat of the organization, our strength. Within our international organization we work for our favourite brands such as bol.com, Zalando and de Bijenkorf. We continuously innovate and give you the space to get everything out of yourself. Together we grow! We offer a working environment to work with integrity and trust you to be resourceful, work with an entrepreneurial spirit and pioneer creative ideas. Cooperation and respect for each other are important in our organization, a good atmosphere is the starting point. Become part of The Heartbeat Of Logistic Services. Challenge yourself and determine your future at CEVA eCommerce Logistics! APPLY NOW! If you are enthusiastic about the position of Manager Controlroom, we invite you to apply. You can apply through the 'Apply now' button on this page. Still have questions? Feel free to ask! Please contact Ruud Roelen, Corporate Recruiter, 06-21280770 or ruud.roelen@cevalogistics.com. A Certificate of Good Conduct (VOG) request and a personality questionnaire are part of the application process. Recruitment agencies; we prefer to find our own employees. If we need your assistance in the future, we know where to find you. As a global organization, and as part of the CMA CGM Group, diversity is critical to our business success; only when we can reflect the cultures, languages, behaviors and local knowledge of our customers, we can succeed. By employing people with different experiences and abilities, we expand our knowledge and increase our creativity and innovation. Please note: Legitimate CEVA Logistics recruitment processes include communication with candidates through recognized professional networks, such as LinkedIn or via an official company email address: firstname.lastname@cevalogistics.com. We recommend that you do not respond to unsolicited business propositions and/or offers from people with whom you are unfamiliar.

title: Data Scientist
description: De functie Waternet zoekt een ambitieuze Azure Data Platform Engineer die wil meebouwen aan de data gedreven dienstverlening van Waternet. Je hebt een ‘drive’ om slimme data gedreven oplossingen in de cloud te realiseren. Als dataspecialist begrijp je de betekenis en gebruikswaarde van data en informatie. Je bent van nature initiatiefrijk, analytisch, proactief en communicatief vaardig. Je hebt affiniteit met (publieke) dienstverlening aan verschillende stakeholders in een samenwerkingsketen. Vanzelfsprekend werk je graag samen in teamverband (agile) en ben je daarin een teamspeler met oog voor kansen die veranderende behoeften van de business bieden. Je bent goed in staat om te opereren in een dynamische omgeving met verschillende stakeholders en expertises. Belangrijkste aspect van deze opdracht is om deze kennis bij de interne medewerker(s) te laten landen. Als Azure Data Platform Engineer werk je samen met andere specialisten in een Azure DevOps omgeving om het datalandschap verder op te bouwen en te professionaliseren. Jouw aandachtsgebied is het Data & Analytics platform van Waternet t.b.v. Business Intelligence, Data Analytics en Data Science. Wij zijn op zoek naar een professional die: Brede kennis heeft van de mogelijkheden en nieuwste ontwikkelingen van de Azure omgevingen en tooling en de ambitie heeft om zichzelf verder te ontwikkelen tot data- en integratiespecialist; Een resultaatgerichte, oplossingsgerichte en integere houding heeft; Samenwerkingsgericht is door een verbindende en constructief-kritische stijl van werken heeft; Ambitieus is om data gedreven oplossingen en standaarden bij Waternet op de kaart te zetten; Helder en zakelijk is in het maken en nakomen van afspraken. 3 maanden - 36 uur - 1,00fte. Functie-eisen Relevant HBO diploma; Certificeringen Azure Data Engineering; Certificeringen Solution Architect; Minstens 3 jaar praktische werkervaring met het ontwikkelen van D&A platformen; Minstens 2 jaar ervaring met Azure Cloud architecturen; Minstens 2 jaar hands-on ervaring met de volgende producten: Azure Pipelines; Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2; Azure Data Factory; DWH Automation Account runbooks; Keyvaults. Ervaring met dimensioneel modeleren; Ervaring met het opzetten van een modern data lake house van end-to-end; Ervaring met Agile werken; Ervaring met de implementatie van TimeXtender op een Azure platform. Bedrijfsprofiel Bij Waternet werken we met een uniek product: water. Samen met 1.800 collega’s zorgen we voor veilig drinkwater, schone grachten, rivieren en droge voeten. We werken aan unieke innovatieve projecten op het gebied van digitalisering, data en waterbeheer. Aandacht voor duurzaamheid zit in ons DNA.

title: Data Scientist
description: Wat ga je doen als Azure Dataplatform Engineer? Voor onze eindklant, Waternet, zoeken wij een Azure Dataplatform Engineer. Binnen het team Data Inzicht is de kennis van het Azure Platform voornamelijk bij externe consultants belegd. We willen deze kennis graag bij de interne medewerkers laten landen, zodat zij op termijn zelf de werkzaamheden op het Azure Platform kunnen uitvoeren. De opdracht Start opdracht 02-01-2024 (of eventueel eerder in overleg) Duur opdracht 31-03-2024 Uren per week 36 Locatie Amsterdam / Thuis Tarief € 85 - € 97 Jouw rol als Azure Dataplatform Engineer Waternet zoekt een ambitieuze Azure Data Platform Engineer die wil meebouwen aan de data gedreven dienst verlening van Waternet. Je hebt een ‘drive’ om slimme data gedreven oplossingen in de cloud te realiseren. Als dataspecialist begrijp je de betekenis en gebruikswaarde van data en informatie. Je bent van nature initiatiefrijk, analytisch, proactief en communicatief vaardig. Je hebt affiniteit met (publieke) dienstverlening aan verschillende stakeholders in een samenwerkingsketen. Vanzelfsprekend werk je graag samen in teamverband (agile) en ben je daarin een teamspeler met oog voor kansen die veranderende behoeften van de business bieden. Je bent goed in staat om te opereren in een dynamische omgeving met verschillende stakeholders en expertises. Belangrijkste aspect van deze opdracht is om deze kennis bij de interne medewerker(s) te laten landen. Als Azure Data Platform Engineer werk je samen met andere specialisten in een Azure DevOps omgeving om het datalandschap verder op te bouwen en te professionaliseren. Jouw aandachts-gebied is het Data & Analytics platform van Waternet t.b.v. Business Intelligence, Data Analytics en Data Science. Afdeling/team Data Inzicht is verantwoordelijk voor het bouwen en onderhouden van het Waternet Data en Informatie Platform. Via dit platform ontsluiten we data uit diverse bedrijfsprocessen en stellen we deze data beschikbaar aan verschillende gebruikers binnen de organisatie. Dit kan de directie zijn, managementteams, maar ook analisten van de verschillende afdelingen. We ondersteunen en adviseren de key-users in de organisatie met het gebruik van data en het visualisatietool Power BI. Het team werkt samen met diverse afdelingen en biedt mogelijkheden om te werken met moderne technologieën en om te experimenteren. Het team maakt deel uit van de snelle digitale transformatie van Waternet, waarin Agile principes centraal staan. Onze organisatie bestaat uit 17 Agile teams die werken aan het verbeteren van de werkomgeving. We werken momenteel twee dagen per week op kantoor en bieden een uitdagende en innovatieve omgeving voor nieuwe ideeën. Wat breng je mee als Azure Dataplatform Engineer? Eisen Je hebt een relevant HBO diploma Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar praktische werkervaring met het ontwikkelen van D&A platformen Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met Azure Cloud architecturen Je hebt ervaring met dimensioneel modelleren Je hebt ervaring met het opzetten van een modern data lake house van end-to-end Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar hands-on ervaring met de volgende producten Azure Pipelines of; Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 of; Azure Data Factory of; DWH Automation Account runbooks of; Keyvaults Wensen Je hebt ervaring met Agile werken (10 punten) Je hebt ervaring met de implementatie van TimeXtender op een Azure platform (30 punten) Je hebt ervaring in het overdragen van kennis (30 punten) Je hebt certificeringen aangaande Azure Data Engineering (20 punten) Je hebt certificeringen aangaande Solution Architect (10 punten) Algemeen Wij zijn op zoek naar een professional die brede kennis heeft van de mogelijkheden en nieuwste ontwikkelingen van de Azure omgevingen en tooling en de ambitie heeft om zichzelf verder te ontwikkelen tot data- en integratiespecialist; een resultaatgerichte, oplossingsgerichte en integere houding heeft; samenwerkingsgericht is door een verbindende en constructief-kritische stijl van werken heeft; ambitieus is om datagedreven oplossingen en standaarden bij Waternet op de kaart te zetten; helder en zakelijk is in het maken en nakomen van afspraken; Toelichting op de eisen en wensen Bij niet voldoen aan 1 van de eisen, kan er geen definitieve offerte worden ingestuurd, er is sprake van een digitale en geautomatiseerde selectie bij de eindklant. De wensen worden beoordeeld met een puntensysteem. Hoe meer punten hoe groter de kans op een interview. CV's en offertes indienen langs geautomatiseerde aankoopsystemen kost veel tijd, kan lastig zijn en vergt enige skills om de selectiecriteria te doorgronden. Wij helpen je met een scorende offerte! Details selectieprocedure Sluiting aanvraag dinsdag 12 december om 10.00 uur Geselecteerde CV's/reacties worden benaderd door OptimaData uiterlijk 12 december voor 12.00 uur Gezamenlijk offerte samenstellen uiterlijk op maandagmiddag 12 december (online) Deadline indienen offerte bij Waternet donderdag 14 december om 09.00 uur Interview met Waternet op 18 december tussen 09.00 en 16.00 op locatie of via MS Teams Reageren Heb je interesse in deze rol als Azure Dataplatform Engineer bij Waternet en deze opdracht samen met Multi-platform (open source) Database dienstverlener OptimaData aan te vliegen? Reageer dan met je CV in Word, uurtarief in euro's en een korte gerichte motivatie in het Nederlands, kortom een onderbouwd en niet te ontwijken voorstel! Let goed op de eisen in de vraag, wij kunnen zonder voldoen aan alle eisen NIET indienen, wees daarvan bewust. Als wij je hebben geselecteerd gaan we je benaderen en samen de definitieve aanbieding voorbereiden. Zo zullen we ook samen het eindtarief bepalen in volledige transparantie. Heb je vragen over deze opdracht of over OptimaData, aarzel niet en stuur een reactie via deze site.

description: Binnen het team Data Inzicht is de kennis van het Azure Platform voornamelijk bij externe consultants belegd. Eisen bij de opdracht: Je hebt minstens 3 jaar praktische werkervaring met het ontwikkelen van D&A platformen. Je hebt minstens 2 jaar ervaring met Azure Cloud architecturen. Je hebt minstens 2 jaar hands-on ervaring met de volgende producten: Azure Pipelines of; Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 of; Azure Data Factory of; DWH Automation Account runbooks of; Keyvaults. Opdrachtspecificaties Referentienummer: 2023-06934 Omgeving: Hoofdkantoor Amsterdam Startdatum: z.s.m. na gunning Einddatum: 3 maanden na start Gesprekken: 18 december 2023 9.00 uur – 16.00 uur Optie op verlenging: Ja Aantal uur per week: 36 Sluitingsdatum: woensdag 13 december om 09.00 uur En? Ben je enthousiast? Stuur dan je CV met een korte opdrachtgerichte motivatie. Ons proces Wij geloven in intensief persoonlijk contact en streven naar een nauwe samenwerking waarin wij met kennis van de opdrachtgever zorgen voor de beste match. Wij behandelen binnen 24 uur je reactie en nemen vervolgens contact op om dit samen te bespreken. Bij een match worden de eisen en wensen van de opdracht smart uitgeschreven en adviseren we over de inhoud van je CV. Wij staan voor een heldere en transparante communicatie en trachten jou als professional volledig te ontzorgen tijdens het volledige proces. Follow the BlueTrail - Always on track to the perfect match Opdrachtspecificaties Vacature id: 2023-06934 Omgeving: Amsterdam Branche: Publieke sector Startdatum: 28/12/2023 Einddatum: 28/03/2024 Optie op verlenging: Ja Uren per week: 36 Intakegesprek: 18/12/2023 Sluitingsdatum: 13/12/2023 Reacties na deze tijd zullen in principe niet worden meegenomen in het selectieproces.

title: Intern
description: Location Veldhoven, Netherlands Team Interns and Trainees Work experience 0-1 year, N/A Educational background Data Science, Other technical backgrounds, Other non-technical backgrounds Travel No Remote work Hybrid Fulltime/parttime Full time New Job ID: J-00288784 Introduction Are you an HBO/bachelor or master student in Human Resources, Work and Organizational Psychology or something related? Are you willing to take that extra mile to improve employee engagement? If yes, this is the internship for you! Background information ASML’s success is founded on the innovation power and competences of its employees. As our CEO once said: “ASML can only grow as fast as its employees grow”. Engaged and fulfilled people build our future through their willingness to go the extra mile and demonstrate resilience when faced with challenges. This results in more satisfied customers and a better performance – both critical to ASML’s success and future growth. In other words, engaged employees help make us grow. A comprehensive Employee Engagement Program is essential, and the first step in this program is the yearly strategic employee engagement survey, we@ASML. It will enable a more impactful process, with the agility to provide real insights at any time, empowering managers and their teams to further develop and grow together. Your assignment During this internship you will provide all-round support to our employee engagement manager within HR. You will gain project- and change management skills, experience with People Analytics to some extend and will learn all about senior stakeholder engagement. You will be assisting in organizing of activities, events and meetings, update webpages, create presentations, handling questions of employees and managers, etc. Your profile To be the perfect match for this internship, you: Are an HBO/bachelor or master student in HR, Work and Organizational Psychology or something related; Have a great passion for organizational change management and communication; Feel comfortable in a high-tech, dynamic environment and communicating in English; Are pro-active, have a hands-on mentality and are able to work independently. This is an apprentice internship for minimum of 4 months, with the number of working days per week to be discussed. The start date of this assignment is as soon as possible. Please note that we can only consider students who are enrolled at a school for the entire duration of the internship. Diversity and inclusion ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company. Change the world – one nanometer at a time Become an intern at a Dutch company that’s a global industry leader. You’ll gain valuable experience in a highly innovative environment – one that sparks your imagination and creativity. In addition to a monthly internship allowance of maximum €600 (plus a possible housing and free public transport), you’ll get practical guidance from experts in the field and the chance to work in and experience a dynamic team environment. ASML: be part of progress ASML is a high-tech company headquartered in the Netherlands. We manufacture the complex lithography machines that chipmakers use to produce integrated circuits, or computer chips. What we do is at the heart of all the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected. Every day, you use electronics that simply wouldn’t exist without our machines. Behind ASML’s innovations are engineers who think ahead. The people who work at our company include some of the most creative minds in physics, electrical engineering, mathematics, chemistry, mechatronics, optics, mechanical engineering, computer science and fields which are not technical oriented. We believe we can always do better. We believe the winning idea can come from anyone. We love what we do – not because it’s easy, but because it’s hard. Students: getting ready for real-world R&D We’re a global team of about 42,000 people of 140 different nationalities and counting. Headquartered in Europe’s top tech hub, the Brainport Eindhoven region in the Netherlands, our operations are spread across Europe, Asia and the US. In such an environment, your colleagues may be sitting next door, or they could be thousands of kilometers away in a different country – or even working for a different company. How will you be part of progress?

title: Engineer
description: Does this sound like you? Your passion is data and analytics. You want to create value at our clients by uncovering, organizing, and making sense of data. You understand that it is important to build robust solutions. You feel comfortable to operate in the sweet spot between business and engineering. How you will help to create value with Data & AI At Xebia, we help build data & AI practices that deliver value to both our clients and their customers. In the past, our team of data professionals has predicted the daily demand for millions of loaves of bread, advanced energy-saving algorithms to nationwide scale, and set up data innovation labs at large multinationals. We have already enjoyed great success in making the top companies AI-driven – just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team! What you will do to make organizations AI-driven The Analytics Engineer is the bridge between business and engineering, and you understand what data can bring to the organization. With your strong communication skills, you help uncover business needs and how to support that with data, reporting and visualization. You use software engineering best practices to write production-grade ETL pipelines, making high-quality data available for creating business value with analytics. You take a pragmatic approach to rapidly building visualizations and dashboards, allowing everyone to get actionable insights from the data. THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF… You’re trained as a data analyst or scientist but have a deeper interest in software engineering than most. You’re a jack-of-all-trades that loves learning new skills, always trying out the latest in data crunching tools. You’ve excellent visualization chops, can write efficient SQL queries and know basic programming in Python. THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF… You always take the academic approach to data and analytics and find it hard to be pragmatic. You solely want to work as either analytics translator, data scientist or data engineer. You dislike giving training, organizing workshops and getting to know the needs of the business.

title: Technical Writer
description: Since founding Coalesce, our mission has remained the same: to improve the lives of data professionals by helping them transform data as efficiently as possible. We aim to bring an end to the days of arduous manual coding and inflexible GUIs by providing a best of both worlds solution. We're looking for a Technical Writer who excels in creating clear, user-oriented documentation and enjoys working in a collaborative environment. This role requires translating complex technical features into simple terms for our users through close coordination with our engineers and support staff, ensuring excellence in our documentation. Responsibilities Write and maintain technical documentation including user guides, release notes, and in-app copy. Develop voice and tone and ensure all technical literature is accurate and consistent with our brand voice. Identify gaps and pain points in the existing technical documentation and propose improvements. Collaborate with engineering and support teams to gather insights and translate technical concepts into user-friendly language. Adapt content for various user personas, ensuring accessibility and ease of use. Manage the lifecycle of documentation from creation to updates and archiving. Act as a user advocate, ensuring user feedback is incorporated into documentation improvements. Qualifications You have a proven track record as a Technical Writer for 3+ years, specifically within the software or tech industry, with a portfolio that showcases your expertise in creating comprehensive documentation. Ability to work independently is paramount. You are self-motivated, can manage your tasks effectively without constant oversight, and have a self-starter mindset. Experience in a growing startup environment is crucial as it means you're comfortable with the rapid pace and fluid nature of our work, and can adapt to the evolving needs of our business. Exceptional ability to understand and document technical concepts and processes. Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex information clearly. Adept at technical writing tools and platforms. Detail-oriented with a keen eye for consistency and accuracy. Proactive in collaborating with multidisciplinary teams. Experience with Markdown language. Fluency in written English. Experience working with SaaS and data analytics is highly desirable. Equity and benefits included. All final pay rates will be determined by the candidate's specific education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data. Remote, work-from-anywhere policy 401(k) retirement plan with up to 3% match Affordable healthcare plans Employee stock option plan Flexible, take-what-you-need PTO policy (with minimums enforced) Annual company leave from December 26-30 Bi-annual company meet-ups (Maui, Portugal, and Sedona were our most recent trips) Reimbursed home office internet & WiFi Upward mobility Ongoing learning opportunities By joining Coalesce, you become part of our exciting journey as we continue to expand and redefine data transformation. We are a dynamic, future-focused company that values its employees and the contributions they make. We look forward to welcoming you to the team!

title: Brand Strategy Consultant
description: Does this sound like you? You are passionate about helping organizations drive their success with Data & AI. You feel comfortable operating at the sweet spot between Leadership, Business, and Tech. And, after co-creating a vision and strategy on Data & AI, you’re not afraid to kick-start and drive the execution with a top-notch team that will turn your ideas into reality. How you will help to create value with Data & AI Xebia Data is on a mission to help organizations win with Data & AI. We do this by helping clients to build, train and organize their data and AI capabilities. You will be part of the GDD Strategy team that is specifically focused on guiding our clients through their AI maturity journey. In the past, our team has successfully set up Centers of Excellence, organized and led experienced data science and engineering teams, and trained thousands of business stakeholders at large corporations. We have already enjoyed great success in making the top companies AI-driven – just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team! What you will do to make organizations AI-driven As an AI Strategy Consultant, you will work closely together with our clients in shaping their Data & AI strategy. You liaise with leadership and other stakeholders from all business domains to make sure that your plans find enough platform and sponsorship within the organization. However, it does not stop there! We believe that the proof of the pudding is in the eating; you will also get the chance to turn your strategy into practice. By working closely together with our team of top-notch translators, scientists, and engineers you will be able to execute on solutions that you devised! Allowing you to truly see the fruits of your labor. This is your dream job if... You are passionate about making an impact with machine learning and data. You have proven experience with designing and executing Data or AI Strategy. You like to contribute to and shape the GDD Strategy proposition. You are comfortable in the board room because consultancy is your second nature. This is not your dream job if... You want to become a data scientist or engineering and want to code. You have no experience with advanced analytics and machine learning. You want someone to tell you where to go, what to do and how to do it.

title: Platform Engineer
description: Does This Sound Like You? You're an experienced Data Platform Engineer with a passion for Microsoft Azure cloud solutions and a strong background in Azure Data Engineering. Your expertise in various Azure services, data pipelines, and data modeling methodologies sets you apart from the rest. How will you help Create Value with Azure Data Engineering expertise Xebia | Xpirit is a renowned technology consulting company that excels in delivering Microsoft Azure cloud solutions. Our commitment to excellence has led us to receive the prestigious Microsoft Global DevOps Partner of the Year award two years in a row and employ the largest number of Microsoft MVPs in a single company worldwide. As a Data Platform Engineer, your expertise in Azure Data Engineering will be pivotal in enhancing our data platforms, AI, and cloud technologies, further solidifying our position as industry leaders and maintaining our award-winning reputation. What Will You Do as a Data Platform Engineer Consultant You'll collaborate with our team to design and implement data platform solutions using Microsoft Azure services, focusing on Azure Data Engineering. You'll develop and maintain data pipelines, data integration processes, and data workflows using Azure technologies like Azure Cognitive Services, Azure OpenAI services, and Azure Machine Learning. Additionally, you'll support and optimize Azure SQL databases, Azure Databricks, and Azure Data Factory for efficient data processing and analysis. Your expertise in data modeling methodologies like Data Vault and Kimball will help design and implement effective data models. THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF... You love working with cutting-edge Azure cloud technologies and collaborating with a team of experts. You have strong knowledge of The Microsoft Azure data stack beyond Azure SQL: Azure Synapse Analytics, Databricks, Data Lake, Azure Data Explorer ("Kusto"), Cosmos DB, Event Hubs, Stream Analytics, and IoT Hub. You have strong knowledge of Azure provisioning – experience with Terraform and Bicep. You have strong knowledge of ETL best practices and data automation techniques. You have proficiency in production deployments and working in an Azure DevOps environment. You have experience with version control systems like Git. You have knowledge of REST API integrations and working with pipeline-based deployments using ARM/BICEP templates. You have experience with CI/CD pipelines using YAML. THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF... You prefer working with outdated technologies and avoiding new challenges. You're not interested in collaborating with a team of Microsoft MVPs and award-winning professionals. You don't see the value in investing time and resources in personal growth and development.

title: Technical Project Manager
description: Deliverect As a rapidly scaling global SaaS unicorn, Deliverect stands at the forefront of revolutionising technological solutions for the dynamic hospitality and Q-commerce sectors. Our mission is clear: to empower ambitious individuals with the skills and knowledge to make a positive impact on business. Developing in their professional careers, all the while being a part of something larger than themselves. Omnichannel Innovation Our omnichannel solution serves as the driving force behind order management for fast-paced operations, providing seamless experiences for businesses and their customers. With real-time insights and analytics, our versatile and adaptable solution caters to businesses of all sizes in the hospitality and Q-commerce industry, spanning restaurants, delivery services, grocery stores, and more. With Deliverect, businesses don't just survive; they thrive in an ever-changing global landscape. Unlocking Benefits Our meticulously crafted solutions provide a multitude of benefits: Growing Sales: Acting as a catalyst, we propel businesses to expand their customer base, accelerating order processing and improving order delivery times. Optimised Operations: As specialists in fine-tuning business operations, we elevate overall efficiency while concurrently reducing operational costs. Elevated Customer Satisfaction: Deliverect supports businesses in offering customers faster delivery times and a seamless ordering experience, ensuring unparalleled customer satisfaction. Dynamic Team and Values Embarking on our global expansion journey across strategic hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Oceania, Asia, and the Middle East, Deliverect is fuelled by ambition and mutual respect. Our tight-knit team thrives on continuous enhancements and personal growth. Guided by unwavering values of ownership, collaboration, and learning, we provide individuals with an environment to conquer challenges and build determination. Our culture is deeply rooted in our growth story, originating from our Belgian startup roots. From our humble beginnings, we defied all odds in unity, transforming into a global force in the tech industry. We leave a positive impact on our customers and the individuals we serve, creating a lasting legacy in our collective journey. Department Focus Welcome to the epicentre of the digital ordering revolution—Deliverect. Within our Product Department, we stand unwavering in our dedication to consistently and efficiently deliver groundbreaking solutions to the global marketplace. Our mission is more than a goal; it's a commitment to bridging the gap between customers and the businesses they hold dear. Whether streamlining digital ordering for delivery or on-premise service, we are the architects of tools that empower businesses to flourish in our swiftly evolving digital landscape. Behind the scenes, our engineers, designers, and product managers are fueled by boundless passion and innovation, perpetually pushing the boundaries of what's possible. In our world, the word "impossible" finds no home. We're not just thinkers; we're doers on a grand scale, acting on ideas that create fresh and improved ways to serve our customers. Our products, relied upon by businesses across the globe, represent our integral role in their success—a role we take immense pride in. Our commitment goes beyond crafting products; it's about creating experiences. User-friendly, dependable, and scalable, we design and build technology that empowers without overwhelming, always keeping simplicity and user-friendliness at the forefront. Join us in the Product Department, where innovation is not just a buzzword—it's our way of life. Your Impact We are looking for an experienced technical project manager with an understanding of API / web services to manage all integration projects from start to finish between Deliverect and all the various platforms we want to integrate with. During the project, you will manage and set the expectations for all internal and external stakeholders. You will be custodian to timelines, making sure details of the integrations are properly specified and engaging with all key stakeholders (internal and external). You will need the appetite to develop a strong product knowledge (training is provided) alongside an understanding of the food tech industry ecosystem including Point of Sales (POS), Delivery Service Providers (DSPs), Online Ordering, Dispatch, etc… You will work closely with a development team that is building integrations and managing the scope, timeline, and budget of the integrations. A Typical Day Align with stakeholders (both internal and external, sales, and product teams) to gather integration requirements, manage expectations and define the finished integration Manage in parallel 5-10 integration projects at the same time Collaborate with the management team to define integration priorities Outreach to prospective partners in the hospitality tech industry together with our regional partner managers Define the engagement model with technology partners, identifying the different steps of engagement, touchpoints and pace Turn requirements into user stories and work with the development team to execute stories Provide 'hands-on' 1st level of support towards customers when launching an integration Your Expertise Organizational skills and time management skills to keep projects on track to the finish Project managing skills to start projects and finish projects successfully. Having a project management certification is a plus. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to coordinate with team members, partners, customers and management Fluent in English, other languages are beneficial Technology experience, preferably partner programs (we work with APIs and software development kits (SDK) and solutions ecosystems) Able to operate in a Global company environment Demonstrated operational excellence in analytical thinking, process development and improvement, problem-solving, communication, delegation and planning Able to be flexible with evolving business priorities; dealing with ambiguity Willing and able to address escalated client issues with speed and urgency Experience in Agile development methodologies and SaaS products/cloud technologies are beneficial Join Deliverect: Where You Shape Tomorrow's Success At Deliverect, we're not just seeking team members; we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who thrive in a fast-paced SaaS environment. We are fuelled by perceptive, ambitious, and determined professionals who embrace challenges and turn them into opportunities for innovation. What We Bring to the Table: Unicorn Status : Join a fast-growing SaaS unicorn at the forefront of the order management industry. Learning Opportunities : We invest in your growth with a dedicated learning budget and clear learning pathways. Inclusive Policies : Our paternity/maternity policies, enhanced vacation entitlement, and working arrangements reflect our commitment to your success. Diverse Team: Become part of an international team that values diversity, fostering a culture of transparency and visibility. A Peek into Life at Deliverect: Performance-Driven Freedom : Your contributions speak louder than the clock. Achieve flexibility by focusing on what matters—delivering impactful results. Your autonomy in choosing how you achieve success is recognised and celebrated. Innovation Hub : Immerse yourself in a culture of constant innovation, where weekly releases and new features keep our products at the forefront. Big Challenges, Bigger Solutions: Be part of a mission to solve some of the global tech industry's most significant challenges. Equal Opportunities at Deliverect: We're committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace. We actively encourage applications from underrepresented individuals, fostering a workplace where everyone is treated with respect and provided equal opportunities to thrive. Rights to Work: While we welcome diverse backgrounds, it's crucial to note that applicants must have the legal right to work in the country of the role. Though we value contributions from various backgrounds, we currently can't offer financial support for relocation or travel assistance. Supporting Your Journey: If you need assistance or support during our recruitment process or require accommodations due to a disability, reach out to us at talent@deliverect.com. Join Deliverect, a workplace where culture meets career advancement.

title: Software Engineer Industriële Automatisering
description: In het kort Data intelligence, business intelligence en data science & analytics zijn niet meer weg te denken uit onze huidige samenleving. Door voortschrijdende technologie neemt de stroom van waardevolle data – en daarmee de mogelijkheden voor slim gebruik van data binnen organisaties – in hoog tempo toe. Als BI Engineer Industrial Automation zie je het als een uitdaging om stapsgewijs de datastroom te structureren en de behoefte van onze klanten te vertalen naar intelligente oplossingen. In deze functie ben je primair verantwoordelijk voor het opbouwen van rapportage mogelijkheden met behulp van data visualisatietools en dataplatformen (Bijv. Power BI, Tableau, Inmation, AVEVA Datahub), en de resultaten weergeven in gemakkelijk te begrijpen, interactieve dashboards. Je ontwikkelt ad-hoc query’s,rapportages en dashboards op basis van requirements. Met de resultaten ga je data-analyse gebruiken om samen met de key-users van de klant prestaties te meten, hypothesen te testen, inzichten te ontwikkelen en aanbevelingen te doen Dit vind je leuk om te doen Ophalen, uitwerken en ontwikkelen van vereisten voor KPI-rapportage en -analyse; Schrijven en onderhouden van ETL-processen voor het extraheren en voorbereiden van data; Creatieve en praktische oplossingen toepassen om rapportageactiviteiten te automatiseren; Effectief communiceren met alle niveaus van interne en externe stakeholders; Verzamel de benodigde data, koppel ze en visualiseer ze. Hier herken je jezelf in Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie; Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van query’s en nieuwe rapportages; Bekend met Power BI, Tableau of Plantweb Optics, AVEVA Datahub; Kennis van datamodellering & -transformatie; Sterke communicatievaardigheden; Kennis van Asset Administration Shell, AutomationML is een pre; Ervaring binnen het industriële werkveld is een pre; Certificering als Certified Data Professional (iccp) is een pre. Wie zijn wij? Als ervaren leverancier van oplossingen voor industriële technologie wil ICT Netherlands de wereld elke dag een stap slimmer maken. Onze toegewijde technische professionals voorzien klanten van diensten op het gebied van consultancy, softwareontwikkeling, projectmatige oplossingen en managed services. Wat bieden wij? 13e maand: elk jaar een extra maandsalaris; 29 vakantiedagen: met de vrijheid om dagen toe te voegen of te verkopen; Hybride werkwijze : een goede balans tussen thuis en kantoor; Pensioenregeling: een goede regeling voor uw oude dag; Leaseauto: of een vergoeding voor uw eigen auto; Onkostenvergoeding: een netto bijdrage in de werkkosten; Training: houd je kennis op peil in onze ICT Academy; Boekbudget: koop een boek of hard- of software voor jezelf. Heb je interesse in deze vacature, neem dan contact met op met Esther Blok via esther.blok@ict.nl of 088-9082000. Wij maken alvast een bureau voor je vrij!

title: Data Scientist
description: As a Data Scientist Finance Analytics you are responsible for the development of complex Data Science solutions adding value to the core processes of the Rabobank. You and your job As a Data Scientist, you will leverage your expertise to drive business decisions through the development and implementation of Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions. Working with complex, large and rich data sources, you will utilize data science technologies to build robust products using the MLOps framework. In this role, you will be part of a collaborative team of experienced Data Scientists and Data Engineers, with end-to-end responsibility for the products. Practical Examples Using ML and client clustering techniques to help front office employees identify the next best product to buy for corporate clients Develop and implement a retention model for mortgage clients to increase customer loyalty and reduce churn rate Facts & Figures You work with ~150 other data scientists, data engineers and ML Ops engineers from various backgrounds and 15+ nationalities Monthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge The department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutions Together we achieve more than alone Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can. “Working with multidisciplinary teams, building end-to-end solutions for our stakeholders. I work closely together with other data sciences colleagues, but also with data engineers and the business consultants on a project-basis. Add to that a mix of smart and fun colleagues from whom I can learn a lot plus many learning opportunities, I couldn`t imagine a better place for a data scientist.” - Tim, Data Scientist You will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members. Within Finance Analytics we create value using advanced analytics solutions to enable data-driven decision making on core banking areas and act as a bridge between multiple departments/data sources. Working together is the way we work; as 1 results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business. You and your talent Master or PhD degree in a quantitative field >3 years of relevant working experience in data science Experience with Python/Pyspark, Git and Databricks Experience in operationalisation of ML solutions in collaboration with engineers Experience with Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps practices (CI/CD, Clean Code) Wants to get better every day Hands-on mentality This is what we offer you A 36-hour workweek with a salary in Scale 8 (between € 3.518 - €5.024) or Scale 9 (between € 4.068-€5.811) depending on experience An extra budget of 10% (scale 8) or 11% (scale 9) of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance Hybrid working: we work 1 or 2 days a week from the office This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Scientist based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment. You and the job application process Apply to the vacancy for Data Scientist Finance Analytics Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lisa Bosma, Senior Recruiter via lisa.bosma@rabobank.nl #LI-LB We will hold the interviews through a video call. You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank A security check is part of the process. We respect your privacy.

title: Data Engineer
description: We love to see people grow. We empower our product teams, farmers, dealers & suppliers to move forward. Driving the digital future of Kramp Group by discovering and building great products, making life easy for our customers. Kramp Group discovers and builds e-commerce, supply chain & data science solutions that are aimed at giving the ag-tech industry a push forward. We’re building a digital platform, serving thousands of customers, and generating a turnover of over one billion euros per year. Our Data vision is to provide a centralized entry point for data to be used on self-service platforms that unlock the full potential of Data for Kramp Group, ensuring data accessibility, quality, and value generation across all departments in a unified way. The mission of a Data Engineer role is to accelerate the rollout of our Cloud Data Warehouse and make an impact on how data and technology are used to provide next-generation tools to an organization. You will be part of Data Office which is an international cross-functional team, combining: Data Governance; BI Development; Software Development; Data Science. The team is in the transformation from an on-premise data warehouse to a Google Cloud Platform-based data warehouse (DWH). This DWH builds the foundation of Kramp's self-service analytics platform feeding different targets as: Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau); Data-driven e-commerce applications; Kramp's Machine Learning platform. What we offer: The Data Office is international, and cross-functional team, combining Business Intelligence, Pricing Management, Data Science, and Software Development; Working within Agile SCRUM Methodologies and the Atlassian toolchain (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git); To build our state-of-the-art cloud data warehouse, we use Python, Java, BigQuery SQL, other Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Build, Data transfers, Workflows, Schedulers and Functions; Making use of Dataform, Terraform & CDKTF and Data Modelling Tools; You will get deep insights into the work at an international wholesaler being in the middle of the digital transformation, you can contribute and make a real impact; And a lot of freedom to initiate new ideas and develop these further. Some facts about us: We follow the philosophy of "You build it, you own it, you love it." We believe in empowering individuals to take control of their own growth, with guidance provided. Our colleagues come from 66 different countries, creating an inclusive and open-minded environment. Transparent environment, mature management team with clear vision and specific goals, and open to feedback. Kramp Group is a healthy and financially stable company. What else we bring to the table: 25 vacation days and 12 ATV days (based on a full time contract). Flexible working policy in hours and location (with offices in Utrecht and Varsseveld). Travel and working from home allowance. Profit sharing bonus. Learning budget for training and courses to support your growth ambitions. Generous pension plan. Who are you? Openness to engage in continuous learning and agility in addressing business challenges; Experience in designing, developing, documenting, and maintaining software written in Python and/or Java as well as dataflows written in SQL; Knowledge of different Data Modelling principles and selecting the right one depending on the needs of a consumer; Feeling comfortable working with Linux, git, and Docker to extend and maintain our CI/CD workflows and pipelines or are you eager to dive into this topic; Experience in working in cloud environments (preferably GCP or AWS); Experience or knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code applications like Terraform and data transformation tools as dbt and Dataform; Cultural awareness, sensitivity, and adaptability in building connections with people from diverse backgrounds; Excel conceptual thinking and a proactive approach to decision-making, taking ownership to ensure project success. Who are we? Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and supply chain innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA. Working at Kramp means … you belong here! Being part of our open business community … your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters … you will develop and realize! Learn and realize your potential More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl Procedure and contact Do you see yourself in this role but don't hit every requirement? That's okay! Apply anyway. This is a great chance for you to grow and learn. Don't hesitate to reach out to Julia Bodun julia@kramphub.com if you have any questions. N.B. External recruiters/agencies we'd appreciate it if you'd let us reach out to you if we need help. At the moment, this is not the case. Utrecht (NL) Varsseveld (NL)

title: Data Scientist
description: How do you make our customers happy? Bol. is changing retail to make daily life simpler for 13 million Dutch and Belgian customers. We are joined on this mission by 52,000 partner sellers that do business on our retail tech platform. This represents a combined assortment of approximately 42 million products. And each of these products needs to be onboarded quickly, efficiently and flawlessly into the product catalog. A complex endeavor because product information comes in many shapes and sizes. So how do we rationalize and automate that process? What do you do as a Data Scientist? Are you a passionate explorer of the data universe, driven by the thrill of uncovering hidden insights and patterns? Do you have a keen eye for turning raw data into actionable information? If so, we invite you to embark on a data-driven adventure with us as a Data Scientist. Team SmartAds is looking for a Data Scientist to help us unlock valuable insights for various projects. Team SmartAds is the Engineering/Data Science team currently owning the attribution process and several attribution models built on the data coming from that pipeline. The output of those models is used for Marketing performance reporting, affiliates payout and marketing performance forecasting. Currently we are working on an exciting new project, where we can tell you everything about in the interview. For this project we are currently in an exploration phase, where we are leveraging our internal bol. data, together with data that we receive from a third party, to measure and drastically improve our performance. The new Data Scientist in the team would continue on these explorations to create insights/rules/models that we can use in production, with a huge potential impact on the efficiency of our marketing budget. Why can you make a difference? To be successful as a Data Scientist in the Traffic Product, you obviously need the right credentials, such as a background in Data Science (AI or equivalent) and at least 3 years of relevant work experience. This ideally comprises a mix of Machine Learning / Deep Learning, and NLP / Information Retrieval techniques. We also expect a proven ability to program in Python and write queries in SQL and BigQuery If you are also versed in sklearn, keras and/or tensorflow, we will fast-track the onboarding process for your CV. Bonus points are awarded for Java/Kotlin, Cloud solutions and Google’s AI platform experience. On a more personal level, we highly value a strong drive to help people with wildly diverging backgrounds and skill sets to understand your models, as well as strong social skills. Moreover, the team loves to share, both ‘internally’ and with the broader Data Science community. If you share that mentality, great! 3 reasons why this is (not) for you Show me why it's not for me Show me why it's for me - No, if your attention span plummets after the POC phase - No, if neural nets are your answer to anything and everything - No, if you like flying solo #allthatairspaceismiiiiiiiiiiine! + Yes, if you are keen to collaborate with the engineers in your team: they build what you envision, so the closer the bonds, the better + Yes, if mixing and mingling with the Product Catalogue crowd is your thing: you are eager to spread the Data Science word + Yes, if you feel responsible for turning ideas into realities Where you’ll work At the premier online retail tech platform in the Netherlands and Belgium. A platform where 13 million Dutch and Belgian customers can choose from over 35 million articles. A platform that helps roughly 52,000 commercial partners run their business.
