title: Woordvoerder
description: Over deze vacature Onze reputatie wordt bepaald door hoe onze klanten, consumenten, belangrijke stakeholders en journalisten aankijken tegen onze organisatie. De reputatiestrateeg heeft als belangrijkste taak het positief bevorderen van de reputatie van Interpolis. Door slimme en impactvolle strategieën te bedenken, creëren en uit te voeren, zodat media erover willen berichten, relevante en diverse partijen met Interpolis willen samenwerken en alle stakeholders positief worden beïnvloed in hun mening over Interpolis. In de kern gaat het om: Het pro-actief uitbouwen en versterken van de reputatie van Interpolis (en daarmee indirect die van Rabobank en Achmea); Het bewaken en beschermen van de reputatie van Interpolis (en daarmee indirect die van Rabobank en Achmea); Pro-actieve en reactieve woordvoering aan on- en offline media. Op basis van grondige data-verzameling en data-analyse ontwikkel je een duurzaam reputatiebeleid en je voert dat ook uit, in nauwe afstemming met tal van stakeholders. Resultaten van dit beleid rapporteer je helder en duidelijk aan stakeholders. De gekozen strategie wordt ook continu verbeterd en bijgesteld, op basis van feitelijke ontwikkelingen. Je adviseert en begeleidt de directie, senior management en diverse agile-teams bij issues, imago, identiteit en positionering van Interpolis, Interpolis-Rabobank en Interpolis-Achmea. In deze functie ga je om met zeer vertrouwelijke dossiers, met een hoog afbreukrisico. Jouw werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit: Je stelt en voert een actief issue- en crisismanagement uit; In samenwerking met vakgenoten binnen Achmea en Rabobank geef je invulling en vorm aan public affairs op de terreinen waar Interpolis een belang heeft/risico’s loopt; Je stelt een duurzaam reputatiebeleid op dat continu wordt verbeterd en afgestemd met Achmea en Rabobank en voert deze vervolgens ook uit; Je stelt een strategisch persbeleid op ten behoeve van het proactief uitdragen van de visie van Interpolis. Stand alone, en als onderdeel van commerciële acties van Interpolis. Steeds afgestemd met Achmea en Rabobank; Je draagt zorg voor de pro-actieve en adequate externe profilering van directieleden en senior managers managers; Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de woordvoering. De afdeling Mensen verschillen, gelukkig maar. Wij geloven erin dat diversiteit ons helpt om tot de beste oplossingen te komen. Elke dag werken we daarom aan een nog meer diverse en inclusieve omgeving, waarin iedereen de ruimte krijgt om zichzelf te zijn. Samen werken we aan een gezonde, veilige en duurzame samenleving. De afdeling Merkmanagement is verantwoordelijk voor het waarmaken van de strategische doelstelling “Interpolis en Rabobank, 2 ijzersterke merken”. Merkmanagent heeft binnen de marketingmix de verantwoordelijkheid voor onder andere positionering, reputatie en –in nauwe samenwerking met Marktmanagement Particulieren en Marktmanagement Bedrijven – voor campagne-management en -uitvoering. Daarnaast moet de afdeling zorgen dat de publishing strategie wordt waargemaakt waardoor we vanuit Interpolis zorgen voor relevante content voor alle Rabobank- en Interpolis-klanten en media. De afdeling is zoals gezegd verantwoordelijk voor reputatiemanagement en zorgt voor een goede interne doorvertaling van de merkstrategie naar alle medewerkers, ook binnen Rabobank en Achmea, die voor Interpolis werken. Jouw achtergrond Wat jou uniek maakt als PR-/Reputatiestrateeg: Je beschikt over wo werk- en denkniveau (bedrijfs)communicatie / journalistiek / reputatiemanagement); Je hebt kennis van en ervaring met data-gedreven merk- en reputatiemanagement; Je beschikt over strategische en tactische kennis van en ervaring met geïntegreerde communicatie (reputatie als onderdeel van de totale communicatiemix van Interpolis); Je hebt ruime ervaring met het leveren en waarmaken van advies op hoog niveau in complexe organisaties; Je bent expert op reputatiemanagement en woordvoering, zowel vanuit analyse als visie en realisatie. In staat lange termijn en korte termijn aan elkaar te verbinden. Kan de visie duidelijk, helder en visueel over het voetlicht brengen; Je beschikt over een uitstekend en relevant extern (vakinhoudelijk) netwerk; Je bent een resultaatgerichte verbinder en je bent in staat om je te verplaatsen in andere partijen en disciplines; Je hebt het vermogen om efficiënt samen te werken met diverse disciplines binnen (Interpolis, Rabobank, Achmea) en buiten de organisatie op basis van helder wederzijds verwachtingsmanagement. Wat krijg je van ons Als medewerker bij Achmea zet jij je elke dag in voor een gezonde, veilige én duurzame toekomst. En daar belonen we je graag voor! Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons een goed salaris, een mooie pensioenregeling mét lage eigen bijdrage (3,25%), 136 verlofuren (op basis van 34 uur per week) én korting op onze verzekeringen. Maar er is meer! 34-urige werkweek Een 34-urige werkweek is bij Achmea de standaard! Je werkt dan bijvoorbeeld 4 dagen van 8,5 uur. Zo heb je nóg meer tijd voor vrijwilligerswerk, een goed boek, mantelzorg óf jouw favoriete sport! All You Can Learn Onder de noemer All You Can Learn volg je opleidingen, cursussen en trainingen. De wereld van leren en ontwikkelen ligt bij ons aan je voeten! Healthy initiatieven Gezond werken vinden we belangrijk, dus zorgen we ook dat dit kan met een berg healthy initiatieven! Persoonlijk keuzebudget Je ontvangt maandelijks een persoonlijk keuzebudget, opgebouwd uit 8% vakantietoeslag, 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering en 3,85% bovenwettelijk verlof. Je kiest zelf op welk moment je dit budget laat uitbetalen, je het gebruikt voor verlofsparen of dat je er vakantie-uren van koopt. Over Interpolis Interpolis behoort als maatschappelijke, coöperatieve organisatie tot een van de meest toonaangevende financiële dienstverleners van Nederland. Begin jaren 90 introduceerden we ‘Glashelder’, onze belofte om verzekeren minder complex te maken. Voortaan was er maar één polisblad, geen kleine lettertjes en met één telefoontje is schade afgehandeld. 2017 gingen we daarin een stapje verder. We maakten de stap van het minder complex maken van verzekeren naar het minder complex maken van de levens van mensen. Dit doen we door mensen bewust te maken van waar het echt om gaat in het leven. En door oplossingen te bieden voor wat er echt toe doet. We helpen mensen en bedrijven te focussen op wat echt belangrijk is. Sollicitatieprocedure Binnen 5 werkdagen reactie Of er een volgende stap wordt gezet (en zo ja, welke), weet jij al binnen 5 werkdagen. Het 1e gesprek Tijdens onze 1e ontmoeting maken we kennis en bespreken we wat wij voor elkaar kunnen betekenen. Een assessment Nieuwsgierig als we zijn, willen wij meteen van alles van je weten. Via je device thuis vul je een online assessment in. Het 2e gesprek In een 2e gesprek zetten we de puntjes op de i en beantwoorden we de laatste vragen. Zo weten we beiden waar we aan beginnen. Arbeidsovereenkomst Allebei even enthousiast!? Samen met jouw toekomstige manager zet je alle afspraken over het werken bij Achmea op een rij.

title: Marketeer
description: Ben jij data gedreven en neem jij data altijd als vertrekpunt? Staat de ideale customer journey bij jou altijd op nummer één? Ben jij performance gedreven en draag je bij aan de groei van de organisatie? Lees dan snel verder! Data Driven Marketeer: De stip aan de horizon is dat er meer geconverteerd word op de website. Aan jou de taak om dit stap voor stap in kaart te brengen en volledig in te richten naar eigen smaak. Jij kijkt naar de huidige propositie en hoe jij de jaaromzet van meer dan 7,5 miljoen een flinke boost gaat geven. Je ondersteund de afdelingen Content, Redactie, Category en Online Marketing bij het opzetten van campagnes, je creëert nieuwe leads, zorgt voor up-selling en implementeert instrumenten om er voor te zorgen dat er meer verkeerd naar de website word geleidt. Er wordt verwacht dat jij zowel hands-on ervaring hebt in het opzetten van campagnes, dat jij in staat bent om het grotere plaatje te zien en dit op een heldere manier kunt verwoorden naar waar je mee samenwerkt. Technology driven: Jouw nieuwe werkgever is het grootste “technology driven” mediabedrijf van Nederland. Zij hebben zich gespecialiseerd in het leveren van uitdagende campagnes en authentieke content die geoptimaliseerd is voor mobiel, online, video, prints en events met een bereik van meer dan acht miljoen mensen per maand. Op deze manier hebben zij een sterke bijdrage in merkbekendheid, beleving en rendement. Op de locatie zijn meer dan 100 experts aanwezig met allemaal een eigen discipline waaronder developers, redacteuren, journalisten en digital marketeers die de handen in één knijpen om zo tot het beste resultaat te komen. Zodra je binnen stapt kom je terecht in een dynamische werkomgeving met een informele werksfeer. Zo zijn er flexwerkplekken wat de mogelijkheid biedt om bij de afdeling aan te sluiten waar je die dag voor aan de slag gaat. In het hart van het bedrijf staan meerdere koffiezet apparaten die in de weide omgeving bekend staan voor de lekkerste koffie! De vereisten: HBO werk- en denkniveau Analytisch sterk en data gedreven Zelf startende en ondernemende persoonlijkheid Minimaal 2 jaar relevante ervaring met SEO, SEA en CRO Sterk analytisch vermogen en creatief in het oplossen van problemen Wat wordt er geboden: Bezig zijn met meerdere online facetten Dynamische werkomgeving met meer 100 collega’s Zelfstandige rol met veel vrijheid Vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit Een salaris rond tussen €2.800,- en €3.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van ervaring)

title: Campaign Developer
description: Krijg jij energie van het werken in een multidisciplinair specialisten team ? Vind jij het belangrijk om vanuit de data te werk te gaan om de ultieme mailings op te zetten? Ook wel eens met een miljoenen bereik je campagnes willen testen? Dan is dit wellicht de uitdaging voor jou! Je nieuwe werkgever: Internationaal Mediagigant in Amsterdam Met een rijke cultuur en achtergrond binnen verschillende mediakanalen en platformen, is dit een van de meest bekende en toonaangevende spelers in de wereld van media . En dat niet alleen in Nederland. Zelf zal je onderdeel worden van de afdeling B2C Data – een team van 6 data analisten en nog een Campaign Developer . Samen vormen jullie een specialisten team, die zich inzet voor de optimale experience en retentie voor alle B2C merken en platformen. Met een dagelijks bereik in de miljoenen, zal je geen tekort hebben aan afwisseling in campagnes en labels. Je nieuwe uitdaging: Campaign Developer | Selligent Vanuit het B2C Data team ben jij, samen met een directe Campaign Development collega, verantwoordelijk voor het bedenken, opzetten en implementeren van data gedreven E-mail campagnes en gehele journeys . Om voor de beste klant experience te zorgen, schakel jij vaak met je analisten collega’s, om net dat stukje persoonlijker aan de slag te kunnen gaan. Waar haakt iemand af? Waarom? Wat kan jij hieraan doen? Waar staat deze lezer op te wachten? Vanuit jouw specialisatie ben jij een belangrijke sparringpartner binnen je eigen team, maar ook voor marketing collega’s op andere afdelingen maar ook journalisten en project managers. Ook is het aan jouw om de technische kant van Selligent te beheren en optimaliseren waar jij mogelijkheden hiervoor ziet. Hiervoor heb jij ook de ondersteuning van een externe specialisten bureau ter beschikking. Wat wordt er gevraagd: Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met het ontwikkelen van E-mail Campagnes en journeys Een analytische mindset – Data is je grootste vriend Interne motivatie om altijd te blijven optimaliseren Je vindt het belangrijk om de consument zo goed mogelijk te begrijpen en daarop in te spelen Ervaring met A/B testen Hands-on sterk in ESP’s – bij voorkeur Selligent Ruime HTML skills Ervaring binnen de media is een zeer grote pre! Wat bieden zij? Een goed salaris gebaseerd op je ervaring en kennis Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals pensioen, opleidingsmogelijkheden en meer Persoonlijk ontwikkelingsbudget Gym op kantoor Uitstekende locatie, bereikbaar met zowel OV als auto

title: Program Manager
description: Is het jouw droom om een eigen onderneming op te zetten binnen een bestaand bedrijf? Is het geven van pitches en presentaties voor jou een tweede natuur? Ben jij vakinhoudelijk sterk op SEA? Deel jij graag je kennis en ben jij in je element als coach voor medior en junior SEA specialisten? Loop jij al enige tijd rond met het idee om een eigen onderneming te starten maar heb jij de stap nog niet gemaakt? Dan is dit een uitgelezen kans voor je! Performance Marketing Manager met een sterke focus op SEA: Deze opdrachtgever heeft inmiddels al meer dan vier succesvolle merken opgezet en uitgebouwd. Jouw sparringpartners hebben samen +40 jaar ervaring in het opzetten van ondernemingen. Dit betekend dat er veel kennis in huis is waar jij gebruik van kunt maken. Daarnaast krijg je alle ruimte en vrijheid om nieuwe paden te bewandelen. Eén van deze succesvolle merken is een bekende vergelijkingssite die een top 5 speler op gebied van SEA is. Omdat zij al veel kennis in huis hebben op gebied van online marketing en resultaat-awareness willen zij nu de stap maken om dit ook voor externe partijen te doen. Het idee is om klanten te voorzien van opleiding en detachering met een sterke focus op SEA. Daarnaast ligt het voor de hand dat jij straks ook kansen aangrijpt op gebied van SEO of data-analyse wanneer je deze tegenkomt. Je krijgt volledige verantwoordelijkheid in het opzetten van deze onderneming. Naast veel vrijheid komt hier ook een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel bij kijken. Zo ga je zelf je businessplannen schrijven, bereidt je pitches voor en ga je langs bestaande of nieuwe klanten langs om presentaties te geven. De organisatie | Een bereik van meer dan 8 miljoen mensen per maand! De opdrachtgever heeft zich gespecialiseerd in het leveren van uitdagende campagnes en authentieke content die geoptimaliseerd is voor mobiel, online, video, prints en events met een bereik van meer dan acht miljoen mensen per maand. Op deze manier hebben zij een sterke bijdrage in merkbekendheid, beleving en rendement. Wat een groot voordeel is van deze organisatie, is het feit dat zij alle kennis en expertise in huis hebben. Zo werken er meer dan 100 medewerkers, waaronder developers, redacteuren, journalisten en digital marketeers, samen aan verschillende labels. Vanaf het moment dat je binnenkomt merk je dat er een informele maar professionele sfeer hangt. De organisatie is technology driven en organiseert grote events waarbij 5000+ bezoekers zich als een community binden aan brands en labels die het bedrijf vertegenwoordigd. De vereisten: HBO werk- en denkniveau Affiniteit met data Sterke drive naar zelfstandigheid Relevante ervaring met het opzetten van een businessplan Sterk analytisch vermogen en creatief in het oplossen van problemen Ervaren projectmanager en zelfverzekerdheid in een leidinggevende rol Hands-on ervaring met SEA (dit moet geen geheimen meer voor je hebben) Vertrouwd zijn met het werven van eigen klanten Uitstekende mondelinge en schriftelijke vaardigheden in de Nederlandse en Engelse taal Wat wordt er geboden: Kans om je eigen business op te zetten onder de vleugels van een bestaande organisatie Vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit Een salaris rond €5.500,- bruto per maand afhankelijk van ervaring Een internationaal georiënteerde werkomgeving (internationale collega’s) Mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder te worden

title: Junior Researcher Biobased Applications
description: As Junior Researcher at MNEXT, you work in the development of biobased applications in collaboration with industry partners.Great JobMNEXT is a Centre of Expertise and a collaboration between Avans University of Applied Sciences and HZ University of Applied Sciences. Seven research groups are part of MNEXT: Biobased Construction (both at HZ and Avans), Biobased Resources & Energy, Biobased Building Blocks & Products, Smart Energy, New energy carriers, Biobased Transitions and Marine Biobased Chemistry.MNEXT forms the bridge between innovation and society together with companies by carrying out applied research with them. In this way, MNEXT provides excellently trained professionals who can support and shape the transition to a sustainable society.In the research group Biobased Building Blocks & Products, we investigate the synthesis, processing and application of biobased polymers and high-grade additives materials made from biomass. By collecting knowledge about, for example, the insulating properties, modification and source of building blocks, we can develop materials with specific chemical and physical properties, such as easy degradability and recyclability.In your role as a Junior Researcher, you will be responsible for:Active literature survey, keeping up to date with relevant articles/patents in the field.Preparation of work protocols after discussion with the experts involved.Execution of laboratory work to the highest level of safety and quality standards. This includes, among others, extractions, chemical modifications, formulation development, compounding, characterization techniques such as HPLC, FTIR, NMR, DSC, TGA, or tensile testing.Accurate recording of test data and interpretation.Planning follow up experiments in consultation with experts.Preparation of presentations for meetings and reports.Provide help with the guidance of internship students.Your place as Junior Researcher within AvansYou will work together with lecturers, researchers, other junior researchers and interns and you will be part of the Biobased Building Blocks & Products research group. You will do this in collaboration with industry partners. The research group is situated within the Center of Expertise MNEXT. By conducting practice-oriented research with students, teachers, researchers and outside stakeholders, we set the materials and energy transition in motion towards a more sustainable future.At MNEXT there is a pleasant and friendly working atmosphere, where respect, humor and flexibility are central. We encourage everyone's own input, creating a dynamic environment where we work together as a team towards a sustainable future.We offer youAn environment where you are given the freedom to discover and improve things; That's how we get the best out of you. We continuously facilitate your development, which results in your contribution to our technical and content professionalization. We also offer:A monthly salary of at least € 3,370.- to a maximum of € 5,019.- gross for a full-time appointment (scale 10 collective labor agreement for higher professional education).An end-of-year bonus, which is approximately equal to a thirteenth month.A contract for 1 year. If you function well and we have sufficient room for staff, an extension is possible.A good work/life balance and pleasant workplaces.About 50 days off if you work full-time.You fit right inAvans' vision on practice-oriented research appeals to you. You can put things into perspective, are stress-resistant and 'fit' in with the informal and professional atmosphere of Avans University of Applied Sciences. You are excellent at working both independently and as part of a team. Also, you have an analytical mindset; you approach problems or situations by breaking them down into smaller parts, examining them closely, and drawing logical conclusions. You are a critical thinker with the ability to think rationally and independently, evaluating information objectively and assessing its validity and significance. On top of this you have:A bachelor's degree in Organic Chemistry/ Polymer Chemistry/ Chemical Engineering/ Material Science.Basic knowledge about biobased polymers/additives.Excellent command of the English language, both spoken and written.A proactive attitude; you don’t wait for issues to arise but rather take actions to prevent them or address them before they become significant.Ideally, previous laboratory experience.Innovative AvansLarge, but small-scale. Involved. Personal. That is what Avans is. Here you can be yourself. Your unique ideas and insights are given plenty of space with Avans. This goes well with our learning and enterprising way of thinking. We offer flexible education and research in co-creation with the work field. And we continuously adapt to the world around us. Discover Avans as employer via these stories.Contribute to our researchDo you see yourself in a position with Avans and would you like to contribute to further professionalize our research and (the link to) education? Then apply no later than 11th December via the application button. Tell us in your motivation why you are looking forward to this challenge. If you have any questions about the content of the position, please contact Sandra Corderí Gándara, Project Leader at Biobased Building Blocks and Products via s.corderigandara@avans.nl / 088-5250336. We will give you an update on your application within 2 weeks after the closing of the vacancy.We find our candidates ourselves, therefore we do not deal with acquisition.

title: Management Assistent Parttime
description: Dit ga je doenHeb jij al enige ervaring als management assistent (of soortgelijke rol) en ben je klaar om de volgende stap in je carrière te zetten? Weet je alleen nog niet precies welke richting je op wilt? Wij gaan graag met je in gesprek om jouw kansen in kaart te brengen én heel bewust voor de volgende stap te kiezen, zonder het risico dat het niet helemaal uitpakt zoals je had gehoopt.Aan Welke Werkzaamheden Kan Je Zoal DenkenOrganiseren van bijeenkomsten;Complex agendabeheer;Inplannen, notuleren en uitwerken van vergaderingen;E-mails verwerken en correspondentie;Plannen en organiseren.Dit ben jijEn dat is nog maar het begin! Maar er is meer.. Herken jij jezelf in het volgende?Je hebt minimaal twee jaar werkervaring in een secretariële rol;Proactief en uitstekende organisatie skills;Je werkt veel met het office pakket van Microsoft;Je gaat discreet om met vertrouwelijke informatie;Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, Engels is een pré;Goede communicatieve vaardigheden.Over het bedrijfSecretary Plus is marktleider in het bemiddelen van support gerelateerde functies. Een gigantisch netwerk aan mooie bedrijven en fijne samenwerkingsverbanden met belangrijke opleiders zoals Schoevers zorgen ervoor dat de personen die wij bemiddelen altijd op een passende baan terecht komen. Zo ook voor jou als parttime Managementassistent.Wij hebben functies in bijvoorbeeld Eindhoven, Valkenswaard, Helmond, Deurne en Best.Wat bieden wij jou?Is voor jou de checklist compleet? Dan gaan wij graag het gesprek met je aan. We streven ernaar om jouw droombaan te realiseren. We hebben voornamelijk vaste functies, maar zit jouw droombaan er nog niet tussen dan zou je ook via ons tijdelijke functies kunnen uitvoeren terwijl je verzekerd bent van een vast inkomen. Daarnaast heb je de mogelijkheid om jezelf bij ons verder te ontwikkelen door een cursus of opleiding via Schoevers te volgen en zullen wij jouw adviseur zijn in je zoektocht.Tot slot een aantal zaken die wij belangrijk vinden voor deze rol als parttime Managementassistent:Je bent beschikbaar voor een vaste of tijdelijke baan tussen de 32-40 uur beschikbaar;Je wordt blij van een salaris tussen de €3000,- en €3700,-;Je wordt enthousiast van direct een contract én opleidingsmogelijkheden;Thuiswerken behoort tot de mogelijkheden, evenals hybride werken;Je bent per direct beschikbaar of op korte termijn beschikbaar.Wij kunnen ons voorstellen dat je nog veel vragen hebt voor, bel of mail ons gerust. Direct solliciteren mag uiteraard ook.

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Digital Data Analyst (Entry Level)
description: We are seeking a motivated and analytic individual to join our team as a Remote Digital Data Analyst. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting and analysing large data sets, making data-driven decisions, and presenting findings to management.Responsibilities Collect and analyse large data sets from various sources Interpret data and identify trends and patterns Create reports and visualisations to communicate findings Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights Continuously monitor data for accuracy and completeness Identify areas for improvement and make recommendationsRequirements Proficient in SQL, Excel, and data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI Strong analytic skills with the ability to interpret complex data Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Attention to detail and accuracyIf you are a self-starter who is passionate about data and enjoys problem-solving, we encourage you to apply. This is an entry-level position with room for growth within the company.To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter highlighting your qualifications and why you would be a great fit for this position. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Remote Market Research Analyst - Trend Spotter (Remote)
description: Position OverviewAs a Remote Market Research Analyst - Trend Spotter, you'll play a pivotal role in our growth by staying ahead of market trends and identifying opportunities for innovation. You'll work from the comfort of your own space, collaborating with our dynamic team of market researchers and strategists.Key ResponsibilitiesDive deep into market data, conduct consumer surveys, and analyse industry reports.Identify emerging trends, consumer preferences, and market opportunities.Create comprehensive trend reports and present findings to cross-functional teams.Collaborate with product development and marketing teams to implement trend-driven strategies.Monitor and evaluate the success of trend-based initiatives.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Market Research, Business, or a related field.Proven experience as a market researcher or trend spotter.Strong analytically skills and proficiency in data analysis tools.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Ability to work independently and remotely.

title: Machine operator, Den Haag
description: Al ruim 60 jaar maakt dit bedrijf draadproducten in allerlei vormen en maten. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan satépennen, lampenkapframes en ventilatieroosters. Met hun machinepark kunnen zijn van draad wel duizenden producten maken. En jij krijgt de kans om aan deze productie mee te helpen!Zo ziet jouw werkdag eruitAls machine operator ben jij op meerdere afdelingen inzetbaar. Denk aan de buigerij, de lasserij en de spuiterij.Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opnieuw in productie nemen van bestaande producten.Het gehele proces neem jij voor rekening. Denk aan het ombouwen, instellen, bedienen, nameten en bijstellen.Heb je het werk onder de knie? Top! Dan kan je doorgroeien naar programmeur!Uiteindelijk kan jij zelfstandig machines instellen op basis van technische tekeningen en nieuwe modellen.Jij werkt van maandag tot en met donderdag van 8.00 tot 17.00 uur en op vrijdag van 8.00 tot 15.30 uur.Wat valt ‘r te halen?Een bruto uurloon tussen de €13,85 en €18,46 afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.Werken in een informeel, familiair bedrijf.Collegialiteit staat bovenaan.Inzet wordt beloond en in overleg kan je je door ontwikkelen.Sporten bij een gratis sportschool naar keuze.Extra toeslagen en reiskostenvergoeding.25 vakantiedagen en 8,3% vakantiegeld.Een goede pensioensregeling.Dit ben jijAls machine operator heb je een achtergrond in de techniek. Jij bent serieus en wilt graag aan het werk gaan. Zorgvuldigheid en kwaliteit staan bij jou erg hoog. Schakelen tussen verschillende werkzaamheden is voor jou een makkie. Je bent een echte teamplayer, maar kan ook zelfstandig te werk gaan. Solliciteer directBen jij iemand met technisch inzicht en lijkt het jou leuk om jouw steentje bij te dragen aan dit bedrijf? Stuur dan nu jouw cv via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina. of bel naar 0174 - 628 008 en vraag naar Max.5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer

title: Research Consultant - Modeling and Meta-Analysis
description: Research Consultant – Modeling and Meta-Analysis Reports to Associate Director Modeling and Meta-AnalysisJob SummaryAs a Research Consultant at OPEN Health, you are an essential contributor to our team, working across various projects with responsibility for delivering high-quality outputs. You will support project leads in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary, international organization.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesConducting and/or guiding and mentoring junior consultants on trial data analysis and evidence synthesis projects and performing quality control of project deliverables Developing project reports and other deliverables Adhering to project budgets and timelines Supporting client interactions and outreach to ensure client satisfaction Assisting with requests for proposals and supporting growth of the business through the development of strong client relationships Effectively managing relationships within OPEN Health and with external stakeholders Supporting the development of, implementation, and maintenance of internal processes and quality standards Keeping abreast with the latest developments in the field Disseminating and integrating new methods into the business Contributing to thought leadership and publications Experience, Skills, And QualificationsMaster’s Degree or PhD in any relevant science, such as health economics, econometrics, economics, pharmacy, epidemiology, statistics or medical sciences Experienced within the field of HEOR, with hands-on experience in trial data analysis and/or evidence synthesis, and familiarity with analysis positioning in the context of health economic modelling, reimbursement dossiers, and health technology assessment submissions Experience with contributing to data analysis and/or evidence synthesis projects, including: Bayesian network meta-analysis, including non-proportional hazard methods and meta-regression Population-adjusted indirect treatment comparisons, including matching-adjusted indirect comparison, simulated treatment comparison, and multi-level network meta-regression Survival analysis, including flexible and innovative methods not limited to landmark survival analysis and methods for incorporating external data Utility analysis to inform health economic models Bespoke statistical modelling of clinical trial patient level data to inform health economic models Analysis of surrogate endpoints Intellectual curiosity and independence, to include the ability to self-start and self-teach Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) along with the ability to question the status quo Ability to clearly communicate complex (statistical) methods to other team members and external stakeholders Proactive, responsive and able to balance shifting priorities Team player, but also able to work independently Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Full proficiency in MS Office programs: Excel, Word, PowerPoint Experience with statistical software: R (version control, RMarkdown and Shiny would be an advantage), STAN (or equivalent MCMC simulation software) Travel RequirementsInternational and domestic as required for team and client meetings/conferences as required by business needs About OPEN HealthOPEN Health unites deep scientific knowledge with wide-ranging specialist expertise to unlock possibilities that improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing. Working in partnership with our clients, we embrace our different perspectives and strengths to deliver fresh thinking and solutions that make a difference. OPEN Health is a flexible global organization that solves complex healthcare challenges across consulting, HEOR and market access, scientific communications, patient engagement, and creative omnichannel communications.What we offer:As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits programCompetitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locations Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility program The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work If we sound like the sort of business environment in which you would thrive, then we would love to hear from you.

title: Sensory Science Internship
description: Do you want to gain experience in sensory panel leading and sensory project management? Are you looking for the best place to hone your skills and learn how a sensory lab functions?Apply now to join the team at MMR!MMR is a global leader in guiding innovation for clients within the food, drink and personal care sectors. We advise many iconic global brands, as well as up-and-coming innovators. Our culture is vibrant, fast paced, yet friendly and supportive. Our work practices embody both scientific rigor and creative drive, leading to innovation in research methods and techniques to facilitate our clients’ creative business thinking.We are looking for Sensory Interns to join MMR’s passionate and vibrant team and work on site with our teams and client based in Utrecht, Netherlands.This is an exciting role where the Sensory Intern will lead research project(s) and get integrated in the day to day life of the panel, including panel session preparation, sensory moderation, panel performance analysis and monitoring to fulfil our clients’ needs and fit their KPIs. You will also be part of our MMR global sensory team, with constant opportunities for training and mentoring, and learn from our 60+ experienced sensory scientists. As Sensory Intern your main responsibilities are: To support the team in place in preparing the sensory panel sessions, to ensure smooth delivery of sensory research and consistently deliver high quality descriptive analysis dataHandle tasks in the lab such as:Sample labelling and preparation for sessionsLab equipment / consumables managementScheduling of the sessions and communication to sensory panelistsTo prepare panel sessions on the provided sensory software as neededTo regularly recruit and train new panelists to keep panel numbers at a required levelYou will shadow the MMR Panel Leader and learn to analyse panel performance in order to guarantee the quality of the data as well as spotting needs for improvement and putting in place appropriate training plans To ensure that clients are kept up to date with project progress, and receive and understand draft lexicons and topline results whenever appropriate To work together with our on-site team and client teams to advice and develop new sensory methodologies to address our business and consumer challengesTo lead specific research project(s), in order to improve ways of working and approach to leading sensory panels efficientlyRequirementsRequirements / Profile:Currently following a Master’s level cursus with a component of Sensory / Consumer ScienceKnowledge of Sensory / Statistical Analysis -QDA, Similarity/Thurstonian testing, Post hoc, PCA, MFAFluent written and spoken Dutch and English Experience with sensory software and data analysis (Eye Question, R and XL Stat…) is a plusExcellent organizational skills and the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced environmentStrong collaboration and communication skills Ability to work well within a teamAble to work independentlyA plus: being a foodie who is passionate with food and cookingWe’ve placed passion, honesty, curiosity, positivity and commercial orientation at the center of our corporate values – do they fit what you’re looking for in your next career move? If so, you will flourish in MMR’s environment, with the autonomy to express yourself and the tools to really connect with clients.If you are looking to expand your experience and skills and have a great attitude then we have a unique opportunity for you to learn and grow at an exciting time within our team.BenefitsMMR is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

title: Renewables International Graduate Programme - Europe
description: Initial Placement in Germany, UK, Italy, Poland, Sweden, Netherlands or DenmarkTo start on 1st September 2024, Full time, Fixed Term Opportunity for 18 MonthsHow does the energy of the future look like? At RWE we have one clear goal: Reaching carbon neutrality by 2040 by extensive investment in innovative technologies, constantly expanding capacities and future talents. Therefore, we are looking for the next generation of qualified and committed graduates like you!Let’s shape tomorrow’s energy together as you become an essential part of the energy revolution and of #TeamRWE! What we offer: Your Career Entry Point Our 18-months Renewables International Graduate Programme is designed for you to get in-depth business insights, build up your own international network and bring your knowledge into diverse projects. We have a clear focus on providing you with a general overview on the whole value chain of RWE . Finally, there will be the chance to become a full team member after successfully finishing the programme.You will take part in three rotations in various functions of the organisation.Besides , you will have the opportunity to stay max. 6 months abroad – outside of your start country. Please apply only to one of the two job postings (Europe or US) according to your desired initial placement.Moreover, you will be supported by a Mentor during the whole time of the programme and your development will be further accelerated via trainings, Peer-Coaching, etc. Who we are looking for: Talents shaping the energy transition You have successfully completed your Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in the field of engineering or science (physics, geoscience, geoinformatics, environmental science, biological oceanography etc.) Moreover, you score points with first working experience ideally in the field of renewable energy Everyone can feel your enthusiasm for renewable energy and your desire to be an engaged part of the energy revolution You convince us with your advanced reasoning skills for complex problem solving, combined with a strategic and forward-thinking mindset Curiosity, openness towards change and the self-believe to question the status quo are the right words to describe you You are motivated to take initiative and to promote your own ideas as well as concepts. Your degree of self-reliance is high You are able to interact and connect in cross-cultural teams, with a sense for diversity and inclusion You have fluent oral and written business English skills, other European languages are a welcome plus rwe.com/career rwe.com/graduates From here, you benefit from many further advantages – Curious? Then click here!Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code 83903, application deadline 15th December 2023Any questions? Contact in recruiting: renewables_graduates@rwe.comWe look forward to receiving your application!We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications, irrespective of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity. #inclusionmattersOf course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Xing, too.RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: About UsDyson is growing fast, and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Pioneering technology takes more than just inventive engineers. At Dyson, we take a problem-solving approach to everything we do. And across our support teams, we’re proud to be different supporting change to maintain our rapid growth. We push the boundaries of what others have defined as possible. Our approach starts with an engineering mindset and different thinking. Then we continuously refine our ideas – unwilling to compromise and driven by an obsession for finding a better way.The EMEA Business Intelligence & Analytics team supports our commercial operations to develop insightful dashboards that supports data driven decision making. The team reaches across the value chain from supply operations to customer retention delivering actionable reporting, supporting measurement of initiatives and operationalising our data. Our responsibility is delivering scalable insights and tools through close market partnership.About The RoleAs a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the advancement of the Analytics team by automating and transforming solutions for our partners in the EMEA Region. We are a project-based team where you will own 2-3 projects concurrently capturing requirements, defining and delivering insights. You will leverage structured and unstructured data sets to produce recommendations that enhance our financial performance.Every day will be different, and you will have the opportunity to engage with stakeholders across the business. This role requires a consultative approach to provide support & guidance in delivering Business Intelligence needs in a variety of ways, be it data acquisition, visualization or analysis depending on the project.About You3-5 years of Tableau Development experience (or equivalent tool)Self-motivated with the ability to work independentlyAbility to understand, analyse, report on and present/visualise data in an engaging wayCommercially astute and financially savvy in contextualising business valueInquisitive mind-set and can collaborate with individuals and teams both cross-functionality and geographicallyConfident and credible when working with a wide range of people across the business.Benefits Discount on Dyson products Company Pension scheme 29 days annual holiday plan Company Fitness plan EAP (Employee Assistant Programme) Life Assurance Plan Transportation allowance (0,21€/km regardless of the means of transport) Health Insurance – Medical Contribution Eye Examination & Computer Glasses Reimbursement Please noteWe do not offer remote working for this position Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

title: International Graduate (m/f/d)
description: Join TUI's International Graduate Programme and Launch Your Career! Are you a recent graduate eager to kick-start your career in the world of travel, tourism and aviation? Are you looking for an opportunity to gain international exposure and experience in various roles within a global industry leader? If so, the TUI International Graduate Programme is your passport to success!About TUI: TUI is one of the world's leading travel and tourism companies, providing unforgettable experiences to millions of travellers across the globe. With a rich history and a commitment to sustainable tourism, TUI is your gateway to a vibrant and dynamic industry.The Programme: Our International Graduate Programme is a two-year journey that offers unparalleled opportunities for professional growth, personal development, and international exposure. Designed to mould future leaders in the travel and tourism industry, the programme is structured around four six-month rotations (e.g. Marketing, Engineering & Maintenance, Commercial, Crew Planning, Strategy, Procurement, Airline Operations, Innovation & Digitalisation etc.). This structure allows you to experience different facets of our business, helping you to discover your strengths, passions, and aspirations within TUI.Why TUI's International Graduate Programme? Global Experience: You'll have the chance to work in different TUI locations, allowing you to gain a unique global perspective on the travel and tourism industry. Mentorship: Throughout your journey, you'll receive guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals who are committed to helping you succeed. Career Acceleration: Each rotation offers the opportunity to make a tangible impact on our business, accelerating your career progression. Continuous Learning: TUI's commitment to learning and development means you'll have access to a wide range of training opportunities, including our Learning Lounge. Networking: Build a network of like-minded individuals and industry professionals, expanding your connections and opportunities. About YouPlease note that to be eligible we would welcome applications from our main employing locations (Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, UK) Recent graduate with a bachelor's or master's degree. Passion for travel and tourism. Strong leadership potential and a desire to drive positive change. International mobility between our office locations (Hanover, London, Dublin, Rijswijk, Oostende, Stockholm, Vienna, Palma) English language skills to business standard, additional European language skills will be advantageous. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. If you're ready to embark on a thrilling journey with TUI, apply to our International Graduate Programme today!Application Deadline: 3rd December, 2023.Don't miss this opportunity to shape your future and make a meaningful impact on the global travel and tourism industry. Join TUI's International Graduate Programme, where your dreams take flight!About Our OfferWe offer a competitive salary for the role depending on the country you are living and working in. This is a 24-month graduate programme working in a hybrid environment enabling you to work from home and also to get to know TUI colleagues in the office. Please note that if you are applying to work from one of our locations in the Nordics you will have to visit the office weekly due to legal provisions. Currently TUI is unable to provide visa sponsorship, you must have permanent right to live and work in one of the countries listed above without sponsorship to be eligible to apply. This includes applicants in possession of a Tier 4 Student visa. Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams. Mobile working and flexible working hours: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: newWork@TUI (hybrid working) & TUI Workwide (Working from abroad) Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities. Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration with exciting travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more depending on your location. We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA. We encourage people with disabilities to apply.

title: Sustainability Data Scientist
description: About OlamOlam Agri supplies food, feed and fibre to meet rising demand and a shift to protein-based diets, particularly in Asian and African countries. Headquartered in Singapore and present on all continents, our value chains include farming, processing and distribution operations, as well as a sourcing network of an estimated 2.5 million farmers. Our teams have built leadership positions in many Olam Agri businesses, including rice, flour, animal feed, sesame, cotton, wood, and more. As a purpose-driven company, we aim to contribute positively to the prosperity and well-being of people along our supply chains, the protection and regeneration of our natural resource base, and the fight against climate change.Role OverviewThe global climate crisis requires us to reduce global GHG to net-zero emissions by 2050 in line with the Paris 1.5 agreement; to do so whilst feeding 10 billion people sustainably and ensuring inclusive growth, is the greatest challenge of our lifetime. With some 2.5 million farmers and 10 million hectares in our supply chains, and our on-the-ground ground presence -- throughout grower programmers, our farms and processing units, and our supply and distribution networks -- OGA businesses can make a tangible, positive impact for people, nature and the climate. As part of the Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability department, you will ensure that the company accurately and transparently reports on its environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance. You will also play a key role in helping Olam Agri measure its impact and integrate sustainability considerations across its businesses and operations. The responsibilities of the Sustainability Data Scientist / Researcher will includeDesigning studies to support sustainability programming and risk management.Identifying and building alignment around the key questions to answer and metrics to measure, to help the company achieve its sustainability goals and drive decision-making.Developing metrics, methodologies, surveys and tools for measuring sustainability baseline, outputs and impactsTopics may include, inter alia, farmer incomes, food security, drivers of farm yields, women’s empowerment, child labor, post-harvest loss, deforestation, carbon emissions. Collecting and analyzing dataCollating and analyzing data related to Olam Agri’s ESG performance and impact.Generating insights from large amounts of data and developing practical systems for relevant business users to access and visualize data insights. Guidance, training and quality control Training and guiding workstream leads and survey enumerators.Ensuring quality study design and analysis conducted within team’s workstream. Communication & disclosuresCollect, Analyse and prepare data for sustainability reporting, considering reporting standards such as GRI, TCFD, SASB/ISSB, and CDP.Keep up to date with the latest developments and best practices in sustainability impact measurement, reporting and disclosures.Supporting responses to inquiries from banks and investors Continually improving data processesIdentifying opportunities to automate data collection and management and improving online systems.Advancing supply chain traceability, in collaboration with finance, IT and commercial departmentsMaintaining documentation of processes and methodologies around data collection, ESG metrics/indicators and calculation methodologies The candidate will collaborate with a wide range of internal stakeholders for the execution of the above, including the CSO, CR&S unit leads) environment, social, governance and partnerships), business managers, IT, Internal Audit, Risk, Finance and Human Resources.QualificationsA personal passion for sustainable agriculture and food systemsExcellent data sourcing and analysis capabilitiesA good eye for designing clear and impactful graphical visualizations of data insights.Strong & clear communication and presentation skillsFamiliarity with in ESG reporting frameworks, social impact measurement, carbon footprint accounting, and survey design.University degree related to data analytics, statistics, internal audit or another relevant domain.10+ years of relevant experience, such as in ESG reporting, monitoring & evaluation, sustainability audits or ESG risk analysis

title: Data Scientist
description: Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.Role Overview:Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.Skills and Qualifications:Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great assetOffered:Competitive salary: up to €55,000Pension scheme for financial security€30 net gym budget for well-beingSwappfiets subscription for convenient commuting25 days of holiday leave for work-life balanceHybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

title: Quantitative Risk Analyst
description: As a senior quantitative risk analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that the bank makes informed, data driven decisions. You will work with the business to understand the data they generate in their day-to-day activities. The aim is to unlock the intelligence contained within this data using the best quantitative methods and techniques. You will coach team members while developing new credit risk models, and will evaluate and improve the performance of existing credit risk models. Here, you can apply your leadership and quantitative skills and experience on various datasets and business challenges, and make a positive impact for the bank and its customers. You will be responsible for delivering important project goals, working together with junior and experienced risk analysts.RequirementsRequirementsYour profileDo you have leadership skills and the ability to motivate team members in order to successfully complete projects?Are you thoroughly knowledgeable in credit risk or other financial risk modelling areas?Do you have a strong quantitative education in an area such as mathematics, econometrics, actuarial studies, or physics?Are you experienced in programming languages suited for doing statistical and data analysis, such as Python, SAS, R, and/or MATLAB?Do you have at least 6 years of work experience in quantitative analysis, preferably within risk modelling in banking and finance?And! Do you want to further develop your skills in quantitative risk modelling? Can you apply your skills to derive meaningful, robust, data driven models to guide business decisions? Do you work well within a team? Can you take the lead to ensure the successful delivery of projects while coaching team members?Credit Risk QuantRWA Calculation ExperienceExperience with SAS RWA Calculator

title: Internship – Plastic Ingestion Research
description: MISSION TO METRICSIn our mission to rid the world’s oceans of plastic, we rely on a thorough understanding of the global plastic pollution problem and its impact on marine life. The Environmental and Social Affairs team at The Ocean Cleanup aims to ensure the net positive environmental and social impact of The Ocean Cleanup's operations by investigating the risks and benefits of cleaning up plastic pollution in rivers and on the high seas. An important research aspect is to investigate how marine life in the Great Pacific Garbage Patch (GPGP) is affected by plastic accumulating in these offshore waters. To this end, the team is researching plastic ingestion by fish and other marine life in the GPGP. You will be responsible for analyzing the plastic ingestion by fish collected from the GPGP in our laboratory in Rotterdam. Taking on the responsibility for the sample analysis and working independently in the laboratory is an important part of this internship. The success of the project relies on delivering high-quality data to achieve the objective of determining the extent, impact, and sources of plastic ingestion in the GPGP."Come join our diverse team and help us better understand the impacts of plastic pollution on marine life in the Great Pacific Garbage Patch. Your findings are crucial to quantify the net environmental benefit of our offshore cleanup operations.”, Matthias Egger, Head of Environmental and Social Affairs.ResponsibilitiesResponsible for analysis of plastic ingestion in fish in our laboratory in Rotterdam and delivering high-quality data on the amount and type of plastics present in these samples.Other Responsibilities IncludeCollecting quantitative data on the fish characteristics (morphometrics) Fish dissections to extract the complete gastrointestinal tractFamiliarizing yourself with the different techniques used to extract and analyze plastics from fish and other marine speciesUsing Raman and FTIR spectroscopy to identify the polymer types of the extracted plasticsConducting data analysis, interpretation, presentation, and documenting everything in a report Professional QualificationsBachelor's degree in (marine) biology or a related field, with preferably post-graduate science education Successful completion of marine science courses is a plusExperience with laboratory protocols, procedures, and safety measures Experience with biological research in the laboratory Ability to clearly present and explain the results of complex research to scientists is a plus Fluent in English PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONSAble to quickly get the essence of a technical challenge and investigate the most relevant/important aspects to get to a solution. Able to perform well in a fast-paced and challenging environmentComfortable with the demands of laboratory work Ability to work independentlyCurious, creative, and determined to deliverStrong organizational skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsIntrinsic motivation to work on our ambitious and meaningful goalADDITIONAL DETAILS Starting from January/February 2024Duration: 6 monthsNote that the candidate needs to be enrolled at a University (MSc program) during the internship. If applicable, the internship can be combined with a MSc thesis project.

title: Junior Data Scientist
