title: Data Scientist
description: Data ScientistLocation: UtrechtHybrid modelDuration: 1+ year rolling contractPreventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing is crucial in our society, and as a leading organisation in the banking industry, we play a vital role. We seek a talented individual like yourself who thrives on analysing data, identifying patterns, and uncovering illegal activities to join our team.As a Data Scientist, you will optimise our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) system and ensure its future-proof by incorporating advanced analytics methodologies like Machine Learning.Position Overview:Our TM system evaluates millions of transactions daily and needs to perform within specified computing time and resource constraints. It is an ongoing development, with new computationally intensive functionality being added. Your role will be to optimise the performance of model components. However, this task is more than just technical; you will also need to thoroughly understand the functionality of the model and its elements within the context of transaction monitoring.Requirements:Academic degree (MSc/PhD) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (required)Strong software development skills, including Git, bash scripting, release management, and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)Minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics, modelling, or artificial intelligence activities with large data sets (required)Highly skilled in Python, PySpark, and Spark (required), with experience in Azure Databricks (preferred)Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Ideal Candidate:Motivated by the opportunity to make a measurable impact, such as catching criminals, rather than solely focusing on building complex analytics modelsStructured, precise, and communicative, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse individuals and rolesThrives in a high-impact, dynamic, and fast-paced environmentProactive, results-oriented, and has a business-focused mindset to fight financial crime effectivelyResponsibilities:The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering the following results:Enhancing functionality within our data model (TDM) while efficiently integrating all required data sources (30+) for Transaction Monitoring. These sources include transaction data, logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS, as well as enrichment data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM.Ensuring the TDM design enables Rabobank to comply with regulatory, audit, and internal requirements, including building versions on both account and customer levels.Establishing the TDM as a solid building block that can function independently and be leveraged by other KYC/TM projects.Optimising the computational performance of the TDM for daily batch scoring and one-off runs on multiple years of data using (Py)Spark.Assignment Description:The assignment aims to add functionality to our data model (TDM) to meet regulatory deadlines related to Transaction Monitoring model changes, lookbacks, and tuning & back testing.The added functionality should be computationally optimised. Once set up and running, it will become a business-as-usual task that requires no external support.Regular alignment with technical and non-technical stakeholders, such as product owners, to ensure progress and results are on track.The Model Developer will review and accept proposed solutions that align with technical and functional requirements.

title: Sustainability Data Scientist
description: About OlamOlam Agri supplies food, feed and fibre to meet rising demand and a shift to protein-based diets, particularly in Asian and African countries. Headquartered in Singapore and present on all continents, our value chains include farming, processing and distribution operations, as well as a sourcing network of an estimated 2.5 million farmers. Our teams have built leadership positions in many Olam Agri businesses, including rice, flour, animal feed, sesame, cotton, wood, and more. As a purpose-driven company, we aim to contribute positively to the prosperity and well-being of people along our supply chains, the protection and regeneration of our natural resource base, and the fight against climate change.Role OverviewThe global climate crisis requires us to reduce global GHG to net-zero emissions by 2050 in line with the Paris 1.5 agreement; to do so whilst feeding 10 billion people sustainably and ensuring inclusive growth, is the greatest challenge of our lifetime. With some 2.5 million farmers and 10 million hectares in our supply chains, and our on-the-ground ground presence -- throughout grower programmers, our farms and processing units, and our supply and distribution networks -- OGA businesses can make a tangible, positive impact for people, nature and the climate. As part of the Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability department, you will ensure that the company accurately and transparently reports on its environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance. You will also play a key role in helping Olam Agri measure its impact and integrate sustainability considerations across its businesses and operations. The responsibilities of the Sustainability Data Scientist / Researcher will includeDesigning studies to support sustainability programming and risk management.Identifying and building alignment around the key questions to answer and metrics to measure, to help the company achieve its sustainability goals and drive decision-making.Developing metrics, methodologies, surveys and tools for measuring sustainability baseline, outputs and impactsTopics may include, inter alia, farmer incomes, food security, drivers of farm yields, women’s empowerment, child labor, post-harvest loss, deforestation, carbon emissions. Collecting and analyzing dataCollating and analyzing data related to Olam Agri’s ESG performance and impact.Generating insights from large amounts of data and developing practical systems for relevant business users to access and visualize data insights. Guidance, training and quality control Training and guiding workstream leads and survey enumerators.Ensuring quality study design and analysis conducted within team’s workstream. Communication & disclosuresCollect, Analyse and prepare data for sustainability reporting, considering reporting standards such as GRI, TCFD, SASB/ISSB, and CDP.Keep up to date with the latest developments and best practices in sustainability impact measurement, reporting and disclosures.Supporting responses to inquiries from banks and investors Continually improving data processesIdentifying opportunities to automate data collection and management and improving online systems.Advancing supply chain traceability, in collaboration with finance, IT and commercial departmentsMaintaining documentation of processes and methodologies around data collection, ESG metrics/indicators and calculation methodologies The candidate will collaborate with a wide range of internal stakeholders for the execution of the above, including the CSO, CR&S unit leads) environment, social, governance and partnerships), business managers, IT, Internal Audit, Risk, Finance and Human Resources.QualificationsA personal passion for sustainable agriculture and food systemsExcellent data sourcing and analysis capabilitiesA good eye for designing clear and impactful graphical visualizations of data insights.Strong & clear communication and presentation skillsFamiliarity with in ESG reporting frameworks, social impact measurement, carbon footprint accounting, and survey design.University degree related to data analytics, statistics, internal audit or another relevant domain.10+ years of relevant experience, such as in ESG reporting, monitoring & evaluation, sustainability audits or ESG risk analysis

title: Data Scientist
description: Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.Role Overview:Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.Skills and Qualifications:Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great assetOffered:Competitive salary: up to €55,000Pension scheme for financial security€30 net gym budget for well-beingSwappfiets subscription for convenient commuting25 days of holiday leave for work-life balanceHybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

title: Data Scientist AI
description: CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.Wat breng jij mee?Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;Een geldig rijbewijs B.Wat bieden wij?Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;€ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: TL;DR: fast-growing healthtech company (stroke workflow), Amsterdam, 55-70k euros, Machine Learning EngineerDescription:Nicolab is a healthcare company that seeks to connect human & artificial intelligence to revolutionize emergency care. We are looking for a talented and passionate Software/ML Engineer who brings a customer-centric approach to creating healthcare products with a highly positive impact on people’s health. You will be a crucial engineering team member and develop algorithms for medical imaging applications. You will work closely with other machine learning engineers to develop biomarkers for Computed Tomography images, with software engineers to deploy the models on the cloud infrastructure, and with clinical specialists to validate the algorithms.We are looking for someone inquisitive and eager to learn and build AI-powered medical devices that will bring positive change to the world.What you’ll do:Work with other Machine Learning Engineers to develop and maintain algorithms for stroke diagnosis, primarily on Computed Tomography imagesResearch the literature, implement and modify deep learning and computer vision algorithms based on product requirementsCollaborate with backend/cloud engineers to bring ML models into production on GCP/AWSUnit test developmentDesign, implement, and test complex data pipelines to support training and validation of algorithmsCreate technical documentation about the algorithms and design intuitionsAnalyze and collect insights from the complex medical dataRequired Skills:Good Python development skills, including scientific Python stack, i.e. Numpy and Scipy1 - 3 years experience with deep learning for computer visionHands-on experience with machine learning frameworks, like PyTorchGreat to have:Experience with building deep learning products and deploying themExperience with DockerKnowledge of DICOM protocolExperience with SimpleITKExperience with public cloud, i.e. GCP and AWSWhat we offer:Salary € 55.000 - € 70.000, including 8% holiday pay and pension contributionReimbursement of commute and travel expenses Equipment for work. LaptopThe best place to learn new things. We discuss new publications in the field, try new technologies, visit meetups together, and give you 4 hours per week to let you learn new technologies.Learning budget. We allocate a budget for every engineer to spend on learning & professional development - attending conferences, engaging in courses or relevant booksGreat working environment. We are proud of our strong company culture where we strive to live and breathe by our core values - Be bold, Collaborate to achieve success, Commit to our promises, Build impactful and intuitive solutions and Center the customerSo, if you’re ready to make a real difference in patients' lives and work with a highly motivated, talented, multi-disciplinary, and diverse team, apply now!

title: Data Scientist at Chapter Data
description: Data Scientist at Chapter DataRequirements2–4 years of experienceA Master’s degree, preferably in a field like Econometrics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Data Science, or MathematicIntermediate programming skills in Matlab, Python, R, Julia, or SQL (“Hello world” won’t cut it)Familiarity with technologies like Pyspark, Scikit-learn, Pytorch, Tensorflow, or TidyverseAmbition, curiosity and a willingness to dig deep and ask the right questionsAs a Data Scientist at Chapter Data, you’ll Fast-Track your career while working with our diverse clients, of different sizes, and at various levels of data maturity. You’ll help them navigate the future and uncover insights that were previously hidden by answering questions ‘What is going to happen next?’ and subsequently, ‘How do we make that happen?’Chapter Data: Supercharge your professional Growth As a Data Science professional, what you want more than anything is to learn and to grow. At Chapter Data we strongly believe that one-on-one coaching, tailored to your personality and growth goals, works better than any cookie-cutter trainee program — in getting you to that next step as fast as possible.Our clients and their challenges Our clients and their work can range from the Dutch market leader in online shopping Bol.com, exciting fintech companies building innovative solutions in the financial industry, to one of the world’s most famous, socially and environmentally responsible FMGC brands at Ben & Jerry’s. What they all have in common, is that they need help with identifying and tapping into the true value of the data available in their company. And to do so in the most innovative, ethical, and sustainable way.We help them create a company-wide Data Strategy, build their engineering and Data Analytics capacity, and to implement a truly Data-driven culture and ditto leadership. And that’s where you come in.The challenge and environment for you As a Data Scientist at Chapter Data, your findings will help our diverse clients develop insights and recommendations that solve complex business problems. On a practical level, you’ll develop your capability to collect, clean, enrich, and analyze data.You will create state-of-the-art machine learning models, often using large and complex data sets, and you’ll sharpen and leverage your programming skills to take these models into production yourself.On the consultancy and strategy side, you’ll learn how to present insights and recommendations to various stakeholders, at all different levels. You’ll help clients navigate the future by answering questions such as ‘What’s going to happen next?’ and ‘How do we make it happen?’ — and you’ll help uncover insights that were previously hidden. With your input, our clients can stay on top of their game.You’ll do all of this with one-on-one coaching and on-the-job learning, from a very experienced senior Data Scientist; our co-founder Sander Klinkenberg.Fast-Track your Data Science CareerTaking up the role of Data Scientist at Chapter Data really means pushing your career forward. Especially if you have or are currently developing both the technical knowledge and the business acumen that a great Data Scientist needs. If you’re a junior or medior Data Scientist who really wants to take the next step and wants to put in the effort to get it — this can be a great opportunity to put your career trajectory on the Fast Track. Apply now?Sounds like the next step for you? Contact Daan Bouman to express your interest – and let’s set up an introductory call to get acquainted.

title: AI Developer
description: As an AI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing artificial intelligence solutions to improve business processes, enhance decision-making capabilities, and drive innovation. You will work collaboratively with a team of experts to create cutting-edge AI solutions that meet the needs and requirements of our organization. Your expertise and knowledge in AI will play a key role in building internal and external capabilities.Essential Duties:Design and develop machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems and improve decision-making processes.Develop robust data engineering solutions to ingest, preprocess, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data for AI applications.Train AI models using various techniques such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning, and deploy them to production environments.Continuously refine and optimize AI solutions to improve accuracy, performance, and scalability, and minimize resource usage.Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to translate business requirements into AI models and solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.Keep abreast of advancements in the field of AI, including new algorithms, frameworks, and tools, and evaluate their potential for enhancing existing systems or developing new solutions.Requirements:Proficiency in programming (e.g., Python) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).Strong mathematical foundation (linear algebra, calculus, statistics).Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.Data preprocessing and feature engineering skills.Experience with cloud platforms and model deployment.Full fluency in Dutch is preferred.Minimum Bachelor degree education.What DevOn Offers: Unlimited holidaysChallenging assignments with several market leadersCar allowance, laptop and mobile phoneWeekly knowledge sessions with colleaguesTraining budget of €3.000 per year to become even more knowledgeable.Open work culture, lean hierarchy, work-life balance, no micromanagement, new-niche technology.Growth opportunities in a fast-moving, innovative organization.Learning by expert training, meet up sessions & in-house certified trainer-certifications. About DevOn:DevOn is a global technology company at the forefront of leading DevOps transformations and setting up High Performance Distributed DevOps teams with leading companies worldwide. DevOn helps market leaders to take the next step in software delivery. We consist of dynamic teams, in which personal growth is central to our organizations success.Within DevOn you get the chance to realize your ambition, in any direction. Do you really want to develop your knowledge and be known as a guru in the market? Or do you want to be more entrepreneurial and start your own team? You choose!To learn more, visit - https://devon.global

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: ML Engineer Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your ML engineering career with our advanced training program. We fully pay this program as well as your salary. Your job? Working as a ML(ops) engineer at one of our clients like Lely, ING, ASML or KLM on challenging projects. What kind of projects?✅ Help data-driven teams to build production-ready, scalable machine learning systems✅ Productionizing machine learning models✅ Maintain and improve automated ML pipelines and ML experimentation infrastructure focusing on scalability, usability, and performance The role itself· 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you’ll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, ML(ops) engineering and cloud fundamentals· Work 4 days a week as a ML(ops) Engineer at one of our clients like Heineken, Rabobank, ASML, Lely, FedEx, Vattenfall· Join us every Thursday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam/ on remote. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads· At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly As a ML(ops) Engineer you will work together with other medior- and senior team members on challenging projects for our clients. In these projects you will work on data science & ML related topics, such as predictive software solutions, fraud detection or data engineering challenges such as building data pipelines, developing on cloud architectures and productionizing machine learning models.Besides this, you like big data tools and programming frameworks to ensure that the raw data gathered from data pipelines are used to build production-ready scalable applications driven by data and AI. About XcceleratedXccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career. Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same. Or as Nikki, our ML engineer says: “The skills I learned at Xccelerated are incredibly valuable – I use them every day at work. After the bootcamp, I had the feeling that I wanted to rewrite all my previous projects”. This is youFrom a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality. You focus on results, have a desire to complete challenging tasks and learn while doing. Next to this, you have: ✅ A technical bachelor’s or master’s degree (e.g. Data Science, Econometrics, Artificial Intelligence)✅ 2-4 years of work experience as a ML Engineer or Data scientist✅ Statistical knowledge but are mainly experienced with end to end systems and able to run, deploy and monitor them✅ Knowledge of open-source technologies like Spark, Kafka, Airflow or Kubernetes What Xccelerated offers 💰 Good salary🛫 25 vacation days📙 Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training📊 Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)✅ Challenging assignments💻 Macbook and Iphone🍎 Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar🎒Flexibility in working from home & at the office Interested? We’d love to meet you! Please get in touch! Contact Samantha Alves Goncalves at sgoncalves@xccelerated.io or by phone at 0613889770. Application Process · First interview with one of our recruitment consultants (Samantha or Jessie)· Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote) **We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

title: Data Science Specialist
description: Our client is a top player in the Dutch finance market, providing their clients with data models and predictive analyses on investments, risk mitigation, security/fraud and environmental impact. They work with most big banks and financial institutions in the Netherlands, where they have their teams build the necessary models (usually of the complexity the clients cannot solve themselves). Sometimes the complexity is translating of business problems to the actual data solutions, sometimes the complexity is in the solution itself, the mass of the data, the regulations, etc.We are looking for Seniors and Managers, experienced Data Scientists / Consultants that can bring something extra. Of course, your bread and butter will be in the projects and working on Data Science challenges as described above, but next to this there is a variety of roles/domains where you can contribute within the organization. Think about managing a small team, taking on project management tasks, helping to scale the organization, inspire/mentor juniors, etc.The sky is the limit, and the company can create roles accustomed to the interests you have as a senior in the field!We are looking for experienced people who bring:At least 5+ years’ experience within the Data Science field.Strong Python and SQL skills as a bare minimum on the technical side.Education background in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Astronomy,Computer Science, etc.Strong communication and commercial skills, you are client facing after all.Go getter, pragmatic, analytical and positive.So, are you pragmatic and analytically strong? Do you like client facing work, creating out of the box data models for clients? Do you like to do something extra in your work on a variety of topics (leadership, PM, growth, etc.)? Please apply!Location: Amsterdam, client side and remote (hybrid, unpredictable)Salary: up to 120kRelocation: possible

title: Data Scientist (L5) - Promotional Media - EMEA
description: Our mission at Netflix is to connect global stories with global audiences. When a Netflix member opens our app, we have a few precious moments to help them choose a story that is right for them at that instance. Presenting them evidence – Artwork, Trailers, Synopses – that authentically represents each title and resonates with the member is essential to this effort.Getting this evidence just right for each title is a tall order but our creative strategists, art designers, and video editors are masters of this. Perhaps a more unique aspect of Netflix is that these teams leverage data to inform their decision-making. This is made possible because Netflix UI is a thriving learning machine, personalized via reinforcement learning.Europe is a significant center for our broader Studio and Creative Production teams. We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist based in our Amsterdam office to join our growing European team. In this role, you would serve as a trusted partner for regional Creative Production leadership. Given this data & insights-rich landscape, we are looking for a highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to partner with teams and product managers. This is an opportunity for you to have direct influence on strategic decisions through technical and thought partnership that will ultimately shape promotional content.As a Senior Data Scientist in this space, you will…As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be partnering with a diverse range of cross-functional partners to uncover new opportunities, design, execute, and analyze experiments, and deliver solutions that have a significant impact and implications for our usersYou will help drive innovations through effective identification and application of analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learningThis is a high-impact role in which you will have a direct influence on how product decisions are madeEffectively identify and apply analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learning techniques for given problemsLead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments Proactively perform data exploration on engagement behaviors to discover future opportunitiesIdentify, compute and validate the appropriate metrics to measure success in a product areaCultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etcYou are…Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field5+ years relevant experience with large scale dataStrong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation or other product analytics settingsStrong product knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in consumer/ or user interface settings or internally serving technical audiences such as engineersDemonstrated ability to communicate and drive product changeStrong SQL skillsStrong Quantitative Programming skills in Python or RAbility to work independently and drive your own projectsAbility to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at many different levelsPlus: Experience in building real-world machine learning models with demonstrated impactPlus: Experience creating data products and dashboards such as TableauPlus: Experience in building causal inference solutionsPlus: Familiarity with software engineering practice and working with APIsNetflix culture resonates with youCultureYou will have the opportunity to impact in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence decision-making in a fast paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about the Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that an inclusive work environment builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Scientist
description: Wij zoeken jou als Data Scientist bij Transavia Voor ons Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team bij Transavia zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Als Data Scientist ontwikkel je een brede range aan advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen: van recommenders tot forecasting modellen en decision support tools. Heb jij een passie voor slimme modellen en optimalisatie strategieën? Ben jij gedreven om de business nog slimmer te laten werken en klanten beter te servicen met advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen? Dan ben jij mogelijk de Data Scientist naar wie wij op zoek zijn!Wat ga je doen?Je werkt aan AI, Machine Learning en Optimization oplossingen voor de verschillende domeinen binnen Transavia. Denk aan marketing & sales, revenue management, planning & scheduling, technische dienst, het operations control center, etc. Samen met een Data Analyst en/of Engineer vertaal je de doelstellingen van het AI/ML product door in data (kwaliteits)vereisten en een opzet voor het experiment/prototype of nieuwe release. Samen met de Data Engineers werk je aan de data en machine learning pipelines om het model in productie te kunnen zetten in onze Microsoft Azure cloud omgeving. De resultaten deel je (tussentijds) middels visuals en dashboards. Met andere woorden, je werkt aan de AI/ML oplossingen van begin tot eind: van concept, ontwikkeling en implementatie tot beheer en monitoring van de tools in productie; van MVP/prototype tot verschillende opvolgende releases. Zo optimaliseren we flight schedules, automatiseren we real time aanbevelingen voor klanten, forecasten we de benodigde crew standby en call center bezetting of bedenken we hoe we ons netwerk en vluchtschema kunnen optimaliseren.Je zal onderdeel uitmaken van Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI). Dit team is opgericht om Transavia naar een hoger niveau te brengen in Data & Analytics. SDI leidt de transformatie naar het data-gedreven werken, adviseert afdelingen aan de hand van informatie en inzichten, en bouwt aan data- en AI-oplossingen voor klanten en medewerkers van Transavia. Naast Data Scientists bestaat het team uit de Lead SDI, Lead Data Scientist, Analytics Translators, Data Engineers, Data Analysts en Business Consultants. Je zal veel samenwerken met jouw SDI collega’s, de business en onze (data) collega’s bij Transavia Frankrijk.Wie ben jij? Je herkent je in onze waarden: daadkrachtig, bevlogen, verantwoordelijk en vriendelijk, én je hebt dat “tikkeltje lef”;Je hebt een WO-diploma in een business analytics, econometrie, (toegepaste) wiskunde of een andere data science gerelateerde studie en minimaal 5 jaar relevante ervaring in een data science positie;Je bent beschikbaar voor minimaal 32 uur per week;Je spreekt en schrijft Nederlands en Engels.Als Data Scientistheb je data science kennis (vanuit zowel de theorie als praktijk) op het gebied van advanced analytics, machine learning, , statistics, data visualization, software engineering, model interpretation, etc;heb je kennis van verschillende AI/ML best practices en ben je continu op zoek hoe je de kwaliteit van onze producten kan verbeteren (en hoe dit breed in het team toegepast kan worden);ben je in staat om deze kennis op anderen (mede Data Scientists) over te brengen;heb je uitgebreide ervaring met Python en veelgebruikte packages (bijv. Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark, etc.) of soortgelijke programmeertalen;heb je ervaring met het in productie brengen van data science modellen (MLOps);kun je goed overweg met SQL, Git en CLI en (Azure) Cloud; gebruik je deze kennis om een probleem uit de business te vertalen naar een wiskundige en technische oplossing;kun je problemen, maar ook kansen identificeren en begrijpen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om je data om te zetten in een concreet advies waar jij zelf, of het team, mee aan de slag kan;werk je agile. Wat je ontdekt, pas je gelijk toe.Wat kun je van ons verwachten?Werken voor dé nummer 1 budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij;Vrijheid om je functie naar eigen inzicht vorm te geven;Veel ruimte en initiatieven voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling;22 verlof- en 4 adv dagen o.b.v. een fulltime dienstverband;Vriendelijke en bevlogen collega’s; Persoonlijk budget voor jouw duurzame inzetbaarheid en vitaliteit;Last but not least; ben je reislustig, dan is onze IPB regeling (tegen mooie tarieven vliegen indien plaats beschikbaar) zeker de moeite waard!Afhankelijk van ervaring wordt deze vacature geschaald in functiegroep 10 of 11. Dit betekent dat wij op basis van kennis en ervaring een aanbieding doen tussen de €3.680,- en €6.222,- bruto per maand.Over TransaviaWe zetten graag een stap extra voor onze passagiers en voor elkaar. De sfeer in de organisatie kenmerkt zich door bevlogen medewerkers met een groen hart! Iedere dag werken we met elkaar samen om een gemeenschappelijk doel te behalen; een memorabele klantbeleving.Als zelfstandige airline binnen de AIR FRANCE-KLM Groep verzorgen wij al 55 jaar lijndiensten en chartervluchten naar meer dan 150 bestemmingen in Europa en Noord-Afrika. Transavia, onderdeel van de AIR FRANCE KLM Group, is de nummer één budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij en qua grootte de tweede airline van Nederland. Bij Transavia werken gemiddeld 2500 collega’s: 230 bij de Technische Dienst, 600 vliegers, 1300 cabin attendants en 370 kantoormedewerkers.Transavia is een dynamische organisatie (never a dull moment) die continu probeert bij te blijven in een veranderende luchtvaartwereld. Wil jij graag werken in een omgeving met enthousiaste daadkrachtig collega’s die oog hebben voor elkaar? Krijg je energie van verandering en vernieuwing en voel jij je het prettigst in een omgeving waar je regisseur bent van je eigen werk? Dan komen we graag met jou in contact.Is deze functie jou op het lijf geschreven en wil je solliciteren?Ben jij de Data Scientist die wij zoeken en kom je ons team versterken? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button. Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact met ons op via recruitment@transavia.com.Jouw sollicitatieprocedureJe solliciteert op de vacature! Binnen twee weken bekijken wij je sollicitatie en hoor je of wij je uitnodigen voor een gesprek;Eerste contact: Wij bellen je om kennis te maken en een afspraak in te plannen;Het eerste gesprek: Er volgt een eerste (online) gesprek met potentiële collega’s;Is er een match? Dan volgt een technisch (online) assessment;Indien succesvol, plannen wij graag nog een laatste gesprek met andere collega’s;Is de match compleet? Dan doen we je met veel plezier een voorstel en begint jouw reis bij Transavia! Wel moet je wegens (luchtvaart)veiligheidseisen eerst een screening doorlopen en maakt een antecedentenonderzoek deel uit van de procedure.Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen voor deze vacature als Data Scientist bij Transavia? Bedankt, maar hier gaan we niet op in. We werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf.

title: Data Scientist
description: Wij zijn op zoek naar een data scientist (junior/medior), kom jij ons team versterken? Wil je een impact maken door het inzetten van state-of-the-art AI/ML technieken voor het oplossen van betekenisvolle bedrijfs- en organisatievraagstukken? En wil je werken in een inspirerende omgeving waarin je toegang hebt tot de laatste wetenschappelijke ontwikkelingen in het data science vakgebied (en andere relevante vakgebieden)? Als data scientist bij Erasmus Q-Intelligence werk je mee aan diverse consulting- en softwareontwikkelingsprojecten. Zo help je bijvoorbeeld onze demand forecasting en inventory management software FCastTM verder te ontwikkelen om daarmee organisaties in staat te stellen hun waste verminderen en hun leverbetrouwbaarheid te vergroten. Daarbij schakel je regelmatig met de klant om te zorgen voor een optimale aansluiting op hun werkwijze en behoeften. Of je draagt bij aan onze loonkloofonderzoeken waarmee je bijdraagt aan gelijkwaardige beloning ongeacht geslacht of afkomst. Daarnaast kun je een rol spelen in onze onderwijsprogramma’s voor professionals. Erasmus Q-Intelligence Erasmus Q-Intelligence (EQI) helpt organisaties en individuen positieve impact te maken met de inzet van advanced analytics en kunstmatige intelligentie. EQI is onderdeel van de Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam (EUR) en verbonden met het Econometrisch Instituut van de Erasmus School of Economics. EQI richt zich in het bijzonder op het aanbieden van analytics software, consulting en post-initieel onderwijs. Voorbeelden van projecten die we gerealiseerd hebben zijn het voorspellen van bezoekersaantallen en het verminderen van wachtrijen voor het Van Gogh museum, het matchen van nierpatiënten en -donoren voor het Erasmus MC, en het onderzoek doen naar gelijkwaardig beloningsbeleid voor mannen en vrouwen bij APG. Wat kun je verwachten Werken in een unieke en inspirerende werkomgeving op het snijvlak van het bedrijfsleven en de wetenschap.Uitdagende projecten waarmee je echt impact kunt maken. Toegang tot state-of-the-art kennis en technieken en deze direct toepassen.Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van onze advanced analytics software. De mogelijkheid om snel verantwoordelijkheid te krijgen binnen je eigen project.Je werkt in een hecht en professioneel team dat elkaar ondersteunt om de beste oplossing voor de klant te creëren. Brainstormen met collega’s, klanten en onderzoekers van het Econometrisch Instituut. Wie we zoeken MSc of PhD in Data Science, Econometrie, Operations Research, Artificial Intelligence, Statistiek, Toegepaste wiskunde of een soortgelijk veld. Je bent communicatief sterk, klantgericht en goed in staat de vertaalslag te maken van de behoefte van de klant naar een oplossing.Goede programmeervaardigheden (met name R / Python).Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal. Je wilt je graag verder ontwikkelen en vertoont eigenaarschap. Je kunt goed samenwerken in een multidisciplinair team. Je bent minimaal 32 uur per week beschikbaar. Wat we biedenEen marktconform salaris, tussen € 3.226,- en € 5.090 per maand en uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder 44 verlofdagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband), goede pensioenopbouw (via ABP) en betaald ouderschapsverlof. Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken. Veel mogelijkheden om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen, hetzij on-the-job of door educatie en training bij programma’s binnen de universiteit en daarbuiten. SolliciterenZou je ons team willen komen versterken? Stuur dan je sollicitatiebrief en cv naar sollicitaties-eqi@ese.eur.nl.

title: Data Scientist
description: Hungry for a challenge?That’s good, because at Just Eat Takeaway.com (JET) we have abundant opportunity or as we say, everything is on the table. We are a leading global online food delivery marketplace. Our tech ecosystem connects millions of active customers with hundreds of thousands of connected partners in countries across the globe.Our mission? To empower every food moment around the world, whether it’s through customer service, coding or couriers.All About The RoleAs Data Scientist you will be focussing on delivering new and improving existing machine learning applications for a variety of sales operations at Just Eat Takeaway.com. You will help drive better restaurant recommendations, more accurate delivery estimates, operational improvements, and better experiences for our customers, restaurants and drivers.Our Functional Sales analytics team operates as a center of excellence, and as such you will be collaborating with departments and functions across the whole company. You are an expert in Machine Learning and will share and develop your expertise together with the wider data science community where best practices are adopted. You'll work on projects side by side with Data Scientists from other departments, other times you will collaborate directly with our business stakeholders - depending on what is needed to make a business impact. In this role you will also work with our ML engineering team to shape our Machine Learning platform, which enables us to perform advanced analytics in a streamlined manner across the company.You will be part of the Functional Sales team which is part of the Sales Strategy and Operations organisation, and you will report directly to our Manager of Sales Analytics.In this role, you will also have the opportunity to:Lead and deliver data science projects from start to finish, working closely with stakeholders to ensure a measurable business impactGuide and coach junior team members to help them develop their data science skillsIdentify improvement opportunities across the data science landscape, proactively advising the team on this and taking action as needed to prevent and fix critical problems across our ML solutions with the wider team.Consult with stakeholders on data and technical issues, providing guidance on technical implementation feasibilityDevelop guidelines, best practices and drive adoption throughout the data science communityBe an active participant in the community for all data scientists and data engineersCan you deliver…Here are the skills we need from our Data Scientist:3+ years’ experience working in data scienceProven record of applying statistical and machine learning methods to solve real-world problems in a scalable way, ideally in a production-grade environment. Example methods include forecasting, anomaly detection, classification, personalization, ranking, recommender systems, and dynamic pricingDelivering data-driven insights and outcomes clearly and communicating effectively with people of varying levels of data literacy and technical knowledgeAbility to collaborate with stakeholders across different organizations and geographies to define the work and deliver initiativesConfident in extracting and manipulating data from various SQL and NoSQL data stores (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, Cassandra) and platforms (Airflow, Spark, Kafka) in a cloud environmentAbility to develop confidently in Python. This doesn't mean hacking in Jupyter, we need people with a passion for software, who can read and understand complicated codebasesExperience working in agile teams with code reviews and source control is preferredAt JET, This Is On The MenuOur teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.Fun, fast-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.Inclusion, Diversity & BelongingNo matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.What else is cooking?Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!

title: Machine Learning Developer
description: We are looking for Machine Learning DeveloperJob ResponsibilitiesWorking on machine learning projects Analyzing and processing data to create machine learning models Implementing and optimizing machine learning algorithms Testing and evaluating models Collaborating with the programming team and other departments within the company to develop innovative solutions RequirementsMinimum 2 years of experience in the field of machine learning Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques Ability to analyze and process data Familiarity with machine learning tools and technologies Proficient in English communication Education in computer science We OfferB2B contract type Full-time employment Remote and flexible working hours

title: Data scientist
description: Functie­omschrijvingHet datateam (HDCV Data) van BZ valt onder de hoofddirectie Consulaire Zaken en Visumbeleid (HDCV) en heeft als doel om de consulaire informatiepositie te versterken. Om dat doel te bereiken verwerken we data uit verschillende bronnen in het consulaire data warehouse. Vanuit de verschillende afdelingen en posten komen allerlei informatieverzoeken, analyseverzoeken en wensen ten aanzien van rapportages. Binnen HDCV Data werken we vanuit verschillende datadisciplines (analisten, engineers en stewards) samen om deze vragen vanuit het consulaire domein te helpen beantwoorden.Als data scientist ben je relevante data voor het consulaire domein aan het verzamelen, opschonen, bewerken, analyseren en visualiseren. Je werkt met een veelvoud van datasets, gestructureerd en ongestructureerd, en vertaalt deze data naar bruikbare informatie. Je voelt je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit, actualiteit en rechtmatigheid van de informatieproducten die je ontwikkelt. Je werk begint bij een probleem en eindigt bij monitoring van de zelfgemaakte oplossing. Verder zijn we nadrukkelijk op zoek naar iemand die zich in meerdere datadisciplines comfortabel voelt.Binnen het team maken we gebruik van Azure Cloud Services Databricks en Azure SQL. In jouw analyses maak je gebruik van Tableau, SQL en Python. Tevens treed je ook op als vraagbaak voor zowel andere leden in jouw team als voor de business. Je houdt rekening met het feit dat deze vaak niet dezelfde technische kennis hebben als jij en jouw mede-dataspecialisten. Je bent op de hoogte van nieuwste technologieën en de inzetbaarheid daarvan voor het team.Omdat veel consulaire processen verdergaand aan het digitaliseren zijn, komen er steeds meer mogelijkheden. Eén van je taken is om creatief na te denken over hoe deze mogelijkheden het informatiegestuurd werken kunnen verrijken. Je zoekt de grenzen op van wat technologisch haalbaar is en hebt een natuurlijke nieuwsgierigheid. Je bent je bewust van de juridische kaders en je werkt zorgvuldig en altijd met respect voor privacy. Je ziet problemen eerder als een uitdaging dan een belemmering en je bent flexibel genoeg om je aan te passen aan een snel veranderende technologische wereld.Onderwerpen waaraan je mogelijk kunt bijdragen zijn:Beheren en ontwikkelen van pipelines.Monitoren van pipelines en datakwaliteit.Doorontwikkelen van Informatie Ondersteund Beslissen.‘Speech to tekst’-analyse van telefoongesprekken met het klantcontactcenter.Het verbeteren van het prognosemodel voor het inzetten van medewerkers op het klantcontactcenter.De totstandkoming van reisadviezen.Functie-eisenEen academisch werk- en denkniveau. Bij voorkeur heb je een universitaire studie afgerond met een kwantitatief of statistisch component of relevante werkervaring in het data engineering/analyse/science vakgebied.Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.Leergierig, creatief en het vermogen om zelfstandig problemen op te lossen.Goede communicatieve en analytische vaardigheden.Abstract kunnen denken en problemen op conceptueel niveau kunnen oplossen/uitwerken.Comfortabel met het toepassen van technieken in programmeertalen zoals Python en SQL.Ontwerpen en gebruiken van algoritmes is een pre.Ervaring met cloud-omgeving (bijv. Microsoft Azure) is een pre.Data engineering skills/ETL-ervaring is een pre.Ervaring met machine learning en data mining is een pre.Arbeids­voorwaardenSalaris­niveauschaal 12Maand­salaris: Min €4214 - Max €6227

title: Data Scientist
description: Data ScientistDo you want to contribute to predicting conversion probabilities for a million households as a Data Scientist? If this speaks to you, you'll feel at home at the International Analytics Hub. And every day at work, you’ll be doing your part for all the charities we support. So it won’t be just your job that’ll inspire you – so will the impact you’ll be helping to make. Maurits van den Brand, Data Scientist: “Every day we aim to identify, discover and implement new possibilities based on data intelligence in order to keep on raising ever more funds for social organisations and causes across the world.” As a Data Scientist, you’ll:Build, maintain and automate statistical models while also developing machine learning solutions.Use data-driven reasoning to provide informed advice and make optimal decisions.Conduct comprehensive research to better understand current and potential customers.Collaborate with marketers, product owners and other stakeholders to design and assess research and experiments.Advise management and stakeholders on analysis results and strategic recommendations.You’d describe yourself as follows:Holder of a master's degree in econometrics, mathematics, business analytics or a related field with 3+ years working as a Data Scientist.Extensively experienced in building and maintaining statistical models and machine learning algorithms using SQL and Python.Knowledgeable about AWS and tools like SageMaker and Docker, and familiar with or eager to learn about MLOps processes.A skilled communicator and collaborator, adept at working in cross-functional teams.Proactive, with a penchant for innovation and strategic, creative thinking.About us: The Postcode Lottery Group is a marketing-driven international non-profit organisation. We operate lotteries to raise funds for a fairer, greener and healthier world. Our players win with their neighbours and generate money for charities together – it’s a win-win!We’ve raised more than €12.6 billion for thousands of good causes since 1989. We’re the third-largest private charitable donor in the world. Working alongside more than 1,500 fellow team members in Great Britain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany and Norway, you’ll be helping to build a better world every day!About the department: The Postcode Lottery Group is building an International Analytics Hub to provide our lotteries with the right models, tools, tech and best practices to help realise our growth ambitions. In the hub you’ll work with the business to identify value-adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You’ll work on exciting and challenging BI, data and AI projects that will create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organisations.This will make you happy:A monthly salary between €4,800 and €6,500, a variable year-end bonus, an excellent pension scheme, and 28 days’ holiday a year based on a 40-hour week and flexible working hours.We believe it’s important that you’re able to keep developing professionally and personally, so we support ongoing training. The Lottery Academy offers a wide range of courses. And there are plenty of opportunities to grow within the organisation.You’ll work in our sustainable building within walking distance of Amsterdam Zuid station, and you'll get an NS Business Card, which lets you travel for free all over the Netherlands, even outside working hours!We like to celebrate our successes with our colleagues and charity partners at well-attended monthly drinks and parties.We know exercising and relaxing are good for you. So we offer free boot camp, Pilates and kickboxing classes, and some of our employees are training together for a half-marathon. And you’ll enjoy free entry to more than 145 museums, plus theatre and cinema discounts.You’ll receive your full salary (100%) during childbirth and parental leave.To help you get involved in our charity partners’ work, we offer project visits and talks in our on-site auditorium. You can also volunteer three days a year during working hours, potentially with colleagues.Join us:We believe an inclusive organisation is the ideal breeding ground for creativity, collaboration and innovation. Employee solidarity is important to us, too. Each of us has a part to play in that – we are the organisation, after all. We strive to make everyone feel at home. That means keeping an open mind and paying attention to each other’s welfare.Can you see yourself as part of the team? We encourage you to apply – whatever your roots, religion, age, ability to work or life philosophy.Send your CV and covering letter to our Recruitment Business Partner Maria-Christina Kool through werkendoejebij.nl. Do you want more information? She’ll be happy to help at +31 (0)6 57307901.Please note that this is a direct search led by the Recruitment team. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

title: Applied Scientist
description: The Impact You Will Make:As an Applied Scientist within our ADAS/ADS unit, you will be at the forefront of translating recent scientific advancements and cutting-edge technologies into real-world applications and products. Your impact will encompass: Collaborating closely with a multidisciplinary team of Engineers, Data Scientists, and Applied Scientists to transform scientific breakthroughs into Advanced AI software solutions. Utilizing your analytical skills to develop automated approaches that harness the full potential of data streams, optimizing the quality and efficiency of our mapping processes. Taking a leading role in designing and implementing advanced (AI-enabled) systems that leverage multisensory data and multimodality models, with a specialized focus on autonomous driving and real-time map generation. Applying deep learning methodologies and machine learning algorithms to develop pioneering systems that empower the capabilities of our real-time map creation. Adapting and fine-tuning deep learning and machine learning models for seamless deployment on low-power embedded devices, ensuring enhanced performance and operational efficiency. Driving transformative changes by taking ownership of your responsibilities, contributing to the elevation of team performance and successful project outcomes. Demonstrating adaptability through embracing iterative development methodologies and addressing evolving technical challenges head-on. Leading the initiation of new projects, positioning yourself as a key technical influencer within the unit and departments, and guiding strategic technology decisions. Balancing intricate technical decisions with their broader business and operational impacts, making well-informed trade-offs to effectively meet the company's overarching objectives. Crafting code and designing structures that promote collaborative teamwork and facilitate enhanced productivity and engagement among team members. Facilitating the resolution of contentious technical discussions by building consensus and showcasing your adeptness at leading through influence. What You Will Need:A PhD or MS degree in computer vision, machine learning, or a related field, complemented by multiple research publications in top AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR etc.) or journals, or equivalent industry experience solving intricate AD and Mapping challenges. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and/or C++, enabling the seamless development and implementation of your solutions. An in-depth understanding of sensor data processing and multimodal sensor fusion, especially in working with Cameras and LiDAR. Prior experience with GIS and RADAR is a plus. Extensive expertise in various computer vision approaches and deep learning methodologies including image / point cloud registration and structure from motion, 2D / 3D object detection and segmentation, self-supervised learning, active learning, uni-/multi-modal foundation models etc., allowing you to continually innovate and adapt in response to evolving ADAS technologies. Keep abreast of related literature and a documented history of successfully steering ML research projects from inception to completion, covering problem formulation, experimentation, iteration, and eventual publication or product integration. Effective communication skills, encompassing both written and verbal proficiency, to clearly articulate complex technical concepts and collaborate harmoniously within a diverse team. Familiarity with programming tools and deep learning frameworks, including Git, OpenCV, PyTorch/TensorFlow etc. Nice to have:Proficiency in map-related technologies such as SLAM, HD mapping, and geospatial data processing. Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning tools: Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, NumPy, Databricks, Spark, MLFlow, Hyperoptetc. General software tools: Docker, Azure/AWS, GIS softwares like QGIS etc. What we offerA competitive compensation package, of course.Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.Meet your teamWe're Product Unit Automation. We develop and operate map production systems for high-quality map data. This data goes on to power ADAS speed control, localization for L2+ robotics driving and more, helping TomTom on its mission to create the smartest, most useful map on the planet. In our team, you'll build data-oriented systems that leverage the freshest data through various sources, utilize machine learning techniques and improve themselves with quantitative and qualitative feedback.At TomTom...You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.Work with a team of 3,800+ unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.After you applyOur recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.TomTom is an equal opportunity employerTomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Scientist
description: Voor een van de grootste bedrijven van Nederland, met een jaaromzet van meer dan € 8,1 miljard en meer dan 16.000 medewerkers wereldwijd, zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Met enkele honderden vestigingen in 65 landen staat de organisatie midden in de samenleving en spelen in op trends als verstedelijking, elektrificatie, duurzaamheid en digitalisering. Daarnaast ondersteunen zij verschillende maatschappelijke initiatieven en nemen we actief deel aan maatschappelijke sponsoring. Een werkgever die werkt met topmerken, duurzaamheid actief omarmt en in jou investeert en mooie kansen biedt.Onlangs is de organisatie de trotse mede-eigenaar geworden van Europcar Mobility Group. Nu zijn zij op het moment aangekomen om deze overname verder uit te bouwen. Hiermee zet men een belangrijke stap voorwaarts om marktleider te worden in duurzame mobiliteit. Onze ambitie is om tev groeien tot een toonaangevend mobiliteitsplatform. Hierbij moet je denken aan een hoogwaardige, duurzame en innovatieve aanbieding van mobiliteit voor 1 minuut tot 24 maanden. Met dit initiatief kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat we centraal staan in de wereld van ‘’nieuwe mobiliteit”. Denk hierbij aan rental, car subscription en (car) sharing. Voor de vormgeving van de organisatie die hier aan bij moet gaan dragen, zijn wij het team aan het samenstellen.Data ScientistWij zoeken een Data Scientist die het als uitdaging ziet om het proces te ontwerpen en te realiseren waarmee we komen tot het optimaal verzamelen, integreren en analyseren van waardevolle data en informatie voor de rental business. Dit moet de nieuwe organisatie in staat stellen om optimale besluitvorming en digitalisering van processen te realiseren met behulp van Advanced Analytics. Dit doe je door jouw deskundige kennis en ervaring in te zetten en daarmee bij te dragen in het team van de Business Information Manager. Dit team is in ontwikkeling en zal zich vormen tot een team met een Data Scientist een Business Information Analyst en een Application manager.In dit team zorg je voor betrouwbare en bruikbare analyses die worden voorgelegd als waardevolle inzichten aan de gebruikers. Door het ontwikkelen van analytics tools voor eindgebruikers in de business maak je de informatie bruikbaar en verzorg je Data Science oplossingen (op basis van statistische modellen en/of algoritmes). Je levert een proactieve bijdrage in projecten om continue meer data driven te worden. Tevens ben je onderdeel van het netwerk bestaande uit verschillende data science functies binnen de organisatie.De Data Scientist bezit:Een afgeronde HBO/WO Business Analytics, Data Science, Econometrie en/of elk ander exacte wetenschap / STEM opleiding; Ruime ervaring (5+ jaar) als Data Science specialist; Uitstekende kennis van relevante software; Een visie op het gebruik van data science en ervaring met van fleet/yield management; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse- en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Een initiatiefrijk karakter en zoekt naar nieuwe invalshoeken en andere mogelijkheden voor verbeteringen/oplossingen.

title: Data Scientist
description: Als Data Scientist bij Hire.nl help jij met het analyseren en optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen vanuit een data gedreven insteek. Dit zou je kunnen doen bij interessante klanten zoals Ministerie van Buitenlandse Zaken, NPO, TUE, Waterschap Rivierenland, RIVM, KNMI, Ministerie van VWS maar bij Hire.nl heb je als Data Scientist ook de mogelijkheid om een uitdagende externe opdracht te combineren met interessante interne projecten. Denk hierbij aan het verschil maken, impact hebben en werken aan mooie, uitdagende data projecten voor onder andere de grootste legal IT-club van Nederland of academische ziekenhuizen? The best of both worlds; In- en externe opdrachten met elkaar combineren, en veel brede & diverse ervaring opdoen!Wie zijn wij?Wij zijn Hire.nl, één van de labels die vallen onder de Leadoo Groep. Wij zijn expert in (inter)nationaal recruitment en bestaan al sinds 2009. Een tweede label is Documentaal. Documentaal ontwikkelt C#/.NET softwareoplossingen en zorgt ervoor dat klanten effectief en eenvoudig aan documenten (samen) kunnen werken zonder dat opmaak en huisstijl in het gedrang komt. De software zorgt daarnaast voor structuur in de digitale opslagruimte.Wie ben jij?Een analytische Data Scientist, met een relevante afgeronde BSc of MSc met goede communicatieve skills. Je hebt ervaring met programmeertalen zoals bijvoorbeeld Python, R, SQL en bent bekend met datavisualisatie-tools.Wat bieden wij jou?Een zeer passend salaris;De vrijheid om remote te werken, maar past hybride jou beter; meer dan welkom op één van onze kantoren in Arnhem of Huizen;Direct een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd;25 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om vakantiedagen bij te kopen;Mogelijkheid om 32 of 36 uur te werken i.p.v. 40 uur. Jouw werk-privé balans vinden wij namelijk heel belangrijk;Volop gelegenheid om aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling te werken met opleidingen, cursussen, training en kennisdeling (zowel intern als extern);Een fitnessapparaat in bruikleen bij je thuis ;-);Veel social events met het team en/of het hele bedrijf!Meer weten over deze vacature Data Scientist?Klik op de button, en we laten heel snel van ons horen!

title: Data scientist | Valcon NL
description: Wat ga jij doen?As a Data Scientist, you are able to understand specific questions from our customers and answer them with data-driven analyses. In this role, you are responsible for gathering the right information, formulating working hypotheses and testing these in order to solve problems step by step. In addition, you are able to communicate the analysical steps, outcomes and impact in a clear way to both team members and (external) stakeholders. Similarly, you will be responsible for implementing and possibly automating these steps and their integration into our clients’ data systems.Waar kom je te werken?Valcon is a north-western European consulting, technology and data company based in the Netherlands, Denmark, UK, Sweden, Germany and Croatia. Our mission is to combine premium consulting with deep technology and data knowledge to add value to our clients. With our capabilities, we help clients to create value in transformations, from operational strategy to implementation, supported by a wide array of IT tools.Wat wij vragen?A completed technical university degree or PhD.Minimum of 2 years work experience as a Data Scientist, or as a Business Consultant with experience in data related issuesStrong team player with good communication skills.Curious and self-critical with strong analytical skills.Experience with analysis and programming of business issues and solutions (in e.g. Python, R, C/C++, SQL).You are fluent in Dutch and EnglishWat wij bieden?An energetic, ambitious and international environment with a great working atmosphere.An environment with significant autonomy and responsibility.A steep learning curve and structured coaching from your own mentor.A thriving community, active in both business and social events.Market relevant employment package (salary, benefits fund, bonus, lease car or mobility allowance and laptop).

title: Data Scientist
description: Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.Who We Are SupportingThe NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.The program Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.In order to provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorises: NATO International Civilians (NIC)s, Military (Mil) and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.Role Duties And ResponsibilitiesUnder the direction of the Section Head, they will perform duties such as:Applies existing data science techniques to new problems and datasets using specialised programming techniques to meet needs of the Agency and its customers;Selects from existing data sources and prepares data to be used by data science models;Evaluates the outcomes and performance of data science models. Identifies and implements opportunities to train and improve models and the data they use;Publishes and reports on machine learning model outputs to meet customer needs and conforming to agreed standards;Supports review of data science and AI activities, processes, products or services;Support development and maintenance of data pipelines for structured and unstructured data;Support maintenance of the Agency's data lakes, implementing updates and working with system owners to ensure data is available for analysis;Contribute to machine learning initiative across the Business Area with suggestions for ML approaches and implementation, including the processing of training data and performance assessment of machine learning techniques on datasets;Contribute to new/modifications to data science toolsets and metrics;Remain up-to-date with new developments in data science and AI to bring innovative ideas into implementation;Deputize for higher grade staff, if required;Perform other duties as may be required.Professional Contacts:They are responsible for:Active engagement with colleagues across the Agency;Supporting engagement with stakeholders, including industry and academia.Essential Skills And ExperienceUse of data science tools to support data analytics and data visualisation;Experience involving supporting data focused operations in a technical organisation. Such experience should encompass at least 2 skills listed below:Experience of working within a Big Data ecosystem, with tools such as DataBricks, Spark etc;Planning, executing and maintaining data pipelines;Knowledge of Machine Learning, statistical and mathematical models and ability to effectively explain them to both technical and non-technical colleagues;Proven ability to effectively communicate orally and in writingEducationA minimum requirement of a Bachelor's degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (such as; Data Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering) with 3 years of post-related experience;Desirable Experience and Education:A Master's degree or higher at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (Data Science, AI engineering);Experience in data presentation tools e.g. Microsoft Power BI,Spotfire, Tableau; Kibana; Dash; Streamlit;Knowledge of DevOps best practices (git, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery pipelines etc)Experience with Cloud ComputingCompetencies or Personal Attributes:Creating and Innovating –Produces new ideas, approaches, or insights; creates innovative products or designs; produces a range of solutions to problems.Achieving Personal Work Goals and Objectives –Accepts and tackles demanding goals with enthusiasm; works hard and puts in longer hours when it is necessary; seeks progression to roles of increased responsibility and influence; identifies own development needs and makes use of developmental or training opportunities.Delivering Results and Meeting Customer Expectations –Focuses on customer needs and satisfaction; sets high standards for quality and quantity; monitors and maintains quality and productivity;works in a systematic, methodical and orderly way; consistently achieves project goals.Language ProficiencyA thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.Working LocationThe Hague, NetherlandsWorking PolicyOn-SiteTravelBusiness travel to NATO and national facilities as well as frequent travel between the NCIA offices;Contract DurationJan 2024 – Dec 2024Security ClearanceValid National or NATO Secret personal security clearanceWe never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.
