Jij analyseert de registraties van telers en coffeeshops om mogelijke ‘lekken’ in de geslotenheid van de keten te ontdekken. Dit doe je door data uit de (graaf)database te ontsluiten en te analyseren met behulp van Python of R. Naast het zelf gebruiken van data, doet de Inspectie Justitie en Veiligheid onderzoek naar hoe JenV organisaties algoritmen inzetten bij hun taakuitvoering. Jij kan met je kennis en ervaring in het toepassen van (machine learning) algoritmes een bijdrage leveren in dit toezicht. Dit doe je onder andere door te kunnen doorgronden hoe toegepaste algoritmes werken, en door risico’s en beperkingen van toegepaste algoritmen te (her)kennen. Binnen ons team krijg je veel eigen verantwoordelijkheid en ga je zelfstandig met vraagstukken aan de slag. Jij bent hierin assertief en betrekt zelf collega’s om je projecten tot een succes te maken. Functie-eisen Kennis en ervaring WO-opleiding met statistische achtergrond; Ervaring met programmeren in R en Python; Ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyses in R en Python; Ervaring met het visualiseren van data in dashboards (in bijvoorbeeld Power BI of R Shiny); Ervaring met het werken met API’s; Kennis van databases en het uitvoeren van query’s hierop is een pré. Competenties Kan zelfstandig werken aan analysevragen; Pakt assertief nieuwe kansen aan om datascience-technieken toe te passen binnen de organisatie; Kan uitleg geven over zijn/haar werk aan niet-technische collega’s; Is leergierig op het gebied van statistische analyse en machine learning; Kan goed analyseren; Heeft overtuigingskracht; Beschikt over organisatiesensitiviteit; Is flexibel; Kan goed netwerken en beschikt over relevante contacten; Kan goed plannen-en-organiseren; Beschikt over creativiteit. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Salarisniveau schaal 11 Maandsalaris Min €3.608 – Max. €5.503 (bruto) Dienstverband Arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd met uitzicht op onbepaalde tijd Contractduur Voor de duur van één jaar met uitzicht op vast Minimaal aantal uren per week 32 Maximaal aantal uren per week 36 Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden Naast het salaris ontvang je een Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB). Het IKB bestaat uit geld (16,37% van je bruto jaarsalaris) en tijd. Met het IKB maak jij de keuzes die bij jou passen en kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Je kunt er bijvoorbeeld voor kiezen om een deel van je maandinkomen te laten uitbetalen wanneer jij dat wenst. Ook kun je dit budget omzetten in verlof en andersom of besteden aan fiscaal vriendelijke doelen. De Rijksoverheid hecht sterk aan persoonlijke groei en loopbaanontwikkeling en biedt daarvoor tal van mogelijkheden. Tot de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden behoren onder meer verschillende studiefaciliteiten, bedrijfsfitness, volledige vergoeding van je OV-reiskosten woon-werkverkeer en gedeeltelijk betaald ouderschapsverlof. Bijzonderheden De Inspectie Justitie en Veiligheid heeft diversiteit en inclusie hoog in het vaandel staan. Verschillende perspectieven, achtergronden en inzichten vergroten de denkkracht en handelingsperspectieven waardoor we optimaal aansluiten bij de behoeften uit de samenleving. Het maakt niet uit waar je bent geboren, waar je in gelooft, hoe oud je bent en van wie je houdt. We zijn vooral nieuwsgierig naar jouw talenten en kwaliteiten. Kandidaten niet in dienst van de Rijksoverheid, krijgen eerst een contract van een jaar aangeboden. Bij goed en volledig functioneren wordt het tijdelijke contract omgezet naar een vast contract. Het selectietraject bestaat uit twee gesprekken met een commissie, een selectiegesprek en een draagvlakgesprek. Het opvragen van referenties kan deel uitmaken van de procedure. Een vaardigheidstest en/of assessment kunnen deel uit maken van de procedure. Het toetsen van de integriteit van onze nieuwe collega’s is voor het ministerie van groot belang. Daarom vragen we nieuwe medewerkers om een verklaring omtrent gedrag (vog) te overleggen en een geheimhoudingsverklaring te ondertekenen. Meer over de functiegroep (Senior) Adviseur Door het Functiegebouw Rijk worden medewerkers en leidinggevenden geholpen bij het maken van resultaat- en ontwikkelafspraken in functioneringsgesprekken en krijgt men inzicht in de loopbaanmogelijkheden binnen de Rijksoverheid. Meer over jouw toekomstige afdeling Onder het motto: ‘Toezicht, omdat rechtvaardigheid en veiligheid niet vanzelfsprekend zijn’ houdt de Inspectie toezicht op verschillende onderdelen van JenV. De kerntaak van de Inspectie van Justitie en Veiligheid is erop toezien dat organisaties die werkzaam zijn in het domein van justitie en veiligheid met hun taakuitvoering individueel én gezamenlijk bijdragen aan een rechtvaardige en veilige samenleving. Met haar toezicht onderzoekt de Inspectie waar zich risico’s voordoen, waar het goed gaat en waar het beter kan. Door te informeren, te rapporteren en zo nodig te interveniëren en/of te handhaven, wil de Inspectie bijdragen aan de kwaliteit van de taakuitvoering en aan het publiek vertrouwen in de organisaties die actief zijn in het JenV-domein. De Inspectie doet dit binnen de driehoek uitvoering, beleid en toezicht. Deskundig en onafhankelijk toezicht draagt ook bij aan het functioneren van het sturingsmodel eigenaar, opdrachtgever en opdrachtnemer. Daarnaast biedt toezicht de samenleving en de politiek inzicht in het functioneren van overheidsorganisaties. Het taakveld van de Inspectie is in beweging, zo worden nieuwe taken voorbereid en verkend, zoals toezicht op het experiment gesloten coffeeshopketen en op incassobureaus. De organisatie zit daarnaast in een fase van doorontwikkeling naar een gevarieerder instrumentarium waar regulier toezicht ook nadrukkelijker een onderdeel van is. De Inspectie heeft sociale veiligheid en inclusie hoog in het vaandel staan en werkt er continue aan. Kennis- en Kwaliteitscentrum Het Kennis- en Kwaliteitscentrum (KKC) ondersteunt (de inspecteurs van) de Inspectie Veiligheid en Justitie in het dagelijkse werk. Dit gebeurt onder meer door medewerkers te voorzien van informatie, het faciliteren van kennisuitwisseling, door het maken van analyses, het adviseren over methoden en technieken en door kwaliteitsbewaking op rapporten en plannen van aanpak. Daarnaast speelt het KKC een rol bij het maken van gewogen keuzes over de inrichting en invulling van het toezicht door de inspectie (risicogestuurd toezicht). Voor haar activiteiten heeft het KKC onder andere informatiespecialisten, methodologen en (informatie)analisten in huis. Inspectie Justitie en Veiligheid Wij werken aan een veilige en rechtvaardige samenleving voor iedereen. Mensen moeten in vrijheid kunnen samenleven. Met de juiste balans tussen hoofd en hart kijken wij naar waar de vrijheid van de één ophoudt en die van de ander begint. Recht en veiligheid raken mensen. Door te luisteren zijn we zorgvuldig, daadkrachtig en open over onze afwegingen. Want iedereen moet kunnen vertrouwen op rechtvaardigheid. Samen met honderdduizend collega’s bij tal van organisaties staan we midden in de maatschappij. Helpen we allerlei vormen van onrecht en criminaliteit te voorkomen. Zetten we ons in voor de bescherming van de samenleving en het individu. Handhaven we met de menselijke maat. Zorgen we voor toegankelijke rechtspraak. Wij zijn het ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid. Met recht voor iedereen. Contact Voor meer informatie over deze vacature: Constant Hijzen 06-25374543 Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure: Hümeyra Akalin 06-50079682

title: Data Scientist
description: As a Data Scientist Finance Analytics you are responsible for the development of complex Data Science solutions adding value to the core processes of the Rabobank. You and your job As a Data Scientist, you will leverage your expertise to drive business decisions through the development and implementation of Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions. Working with complex, large and rich data sources, you will utilize data science technologies to build robust products using the MLOps framework. In this role, you will be part of a collaborative team of experienced Data Scientists and Data Engineers, with end-to-end responsibility for the products. Practical Examples Using ML and client clustering techniques to help front office employees identify the next best product to buy for corporate clients Develop and implement a retention model for mortgage clients to increase customer loyalty and reduce churn rate Facts & Figures You work with ~150 other data scientists, data engineers and ML Ops engineers from various backgrounds and 15+ nationalities Monthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge The department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutions Together we achieve more than alone Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can. “Working with multidisciplinary teams, building end-to-end solutions for our stakeholders. I work closely together with other data sciences colleagues, but also with data engineers and the business consultants on a project-basis. Add to that a mix of smart and fun colleagues from whom I can learn a lot plus many learning opportunities, I couldn`t imagine a better place for a data scientist.” - Tim, Data Scientist You will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members. Within Finance Analytics we create value using advanced analytics solutions to enable data-driven decision making on core banking areas and act as a bridge between multiple departments/data sources. Working together is the way we work; as 1 results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business. You and your talent Master or PhD degree in a quantitative field >3 years of relevant working experience in data science Experience with Python/Pyspark, Git and Databricks Experience in operationalisation of ML solutions in collaboration with engineers Experience with Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps practices (CI/CD, Clean Code) Wants to get better every day Hands-on mentality This is what we offer you A 36-hour workweek with a salary in Scale 8 (between € 3.518 - €5.024) or Scale 9 (between € 4.068-€5.811) depending on experience An extra budget of 10% (scale 8) or 11% (scale 9) of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance Hybrid working: we work 1 or 2 days a week from the office This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Scientist based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment. You and the job application process Apply to the vacancy for Data Scientist Finance Analytics Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lisa Bosma, Senior Recruiter via lisa.bosma@rabobank.nl #LI-LB We will hold the interviews through a video call. You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank A security check is part of the process. We respect your privacy.

title: Data Scientist
description: Eneco - Regio Rotterdam 32 - 40 uur 0-1 jaar/year €500 - €675 Je krijgt een kijkje in de keuken van ons Credit Management team Onderdeel uitmaken van een enthousiast team Bijdragen aan de energietransitie Waarom kiezen voor Eneco? Wij willen dat iedereen kan meedoen aan de energietransitie. Dat kan alleen als we klanten nog beter gaan helpen en drempels voor ze wegnemen om te verduurzamen. Een groep klanten die onze speciale aandacht verdient, zijn mensen die op de een of andere manier in de geldproblemen zijn gekomen. Bij Credit Management zoeken we naar creatieve manieren om financiële barrières te slechten zodat iedereen mee kan in de energietransitie. En daar hebben we jou bij nodig! Dit ga je doen Word jij blij van het ontwikkelen van modellen die gedrag kunnen voorspellen? Dan is deze stage perfect voor jou. Als Data Scientist ga je aan de slag bij de afdeling Credit Management. Deze afdeling is verantwoordelijk voor klanten die in de financiële problemen zijn gekomen. Gaat dit over jou? Je werkt samen met een team data specialisten met een missie: ervoor zorgen dat iedereen mee kan doen aan de energietransitie. Je hebt al eerder een voorspellend model ontwikkeld en je volgende uitdaging is om dit ook echt in praktijk toe te gaan passen. Je schrikt niet van grote hoeveelheden data en kunt daarin snel onderscheid maken tussen wat relevant is en wat niet. Daarnaast is het volgende belangrijk: Je volgt een HBO/WO opleiding Je gaat beginnen aan je scriptie Je het ervaring met SQL en kunt verschillende tabellen aan elkaar knopen Je kunt data ‘cleanen’, je weet hoe je om moet gaan met missende waarden of uitschieters Je hebt kennis/ervaring met de meest voorkomende machine learning algoritmes (regressie, clustering, tree analysis etc.) Je hebt ervaring met Python (of een andere taal/tool om voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen) Je vindt het leuk om resultaten begrijpelijk te maken en te presenteren aan mensen die minder gevoel bij ‘data’ hebben Je maakt data graag ‘menselijk’. Je hebt het niet over records maar over klanten. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor Samen met de andere data analisten en data scientists ga je aan slag met het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen die als doel hebben om klanten ‘op maat’ te helpen hun financiën weer op orde te krijgen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het identificeren van klanten die geholpen zouden zijn met een betalingsregeling. Of uitstellen van een betaling. Maar ook via welk kanaal (e-mail, telefoon, brief) we klanten het beste kunnen bereiken. Want daar begint het mee. Dit worden je collega's Bij Eneco Credit Management werken we met twee teams, jouw Resultaat team en een Operationeel team. Je gaat werken in een multidisciplinair team, zodat je snel kan schakelen bij marktontwikkelingen, feedback van klanten en het doorvoeren van verbeterinitiatieven. Alle disciplines die nodig zijn om een betekenisvolle verandering op te starten, zijn onderdeel van het team. Jouw collega’s in het resultaatteam hebben onder andere expertise op het gebied van Partner Management, Processen, Automatisering en Intelligence. Op ons hoofdkantoor werk je in modern en licht gebouw, op een locatie die uitstekend bereikbaar is: op 2 minuten loopafstand van metro en treinstation Rotterdam-Alexander. We werken hybride: je werkt 40% van je werkweek op kantoor en 40% thuis. De andere dag (overige 20%) bepaal je zelf waar je het beste kunt werken. Stagevergoeding tussen €500 en €675 bruto per maand Op basis van een fulltime stage krijg je maandelijks een stagevergoeding. Kickstart van je carrière Je krijgt veel vrijheid, tijd en ruimte om te leren én je mag meewerken binnen een grote organisatie. Alle kans jezelf te ontwikkelen Eneco zet vol in op persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling Hybride werken, thuis of op kantoor Je werkt 40% op kantoor en 40% thuis. De andere 20% bepaal je zelf waar je het beste kunt werken. Werken bij Eneco is voor iedereen Onze klanten zijn divers, en wijzelf ook. Ruim 4.000 Eneco-talenten zorgen voor een open, fijne cultuur waarin iedereen kan groeien en bloeien. Zo creëren we de ideale voedingsbodem voor creatieve inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En die kunnen we goed gebruiken om onze ambitieuze missie waar te maken: klimaatneutraal zijn in 2035. Weet je wat het leuke is? Van talent hebben we bij Eneco nooit genoeg. Dus laat van je horen en solliciteer. Samen met jou gaan we voor duurzaam. Werk dat werkt voor jou en het klimaat Kies je voor een carrière bij Eneco, dan kies je voor ambitie, groei en kansen. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en het werk te doen zoals het bij jou past. Daar hoort ook een goede werk-privébalans bij. Je kunt je tijden flexibel indelen en deels thuiswerken als je functie dat toelaat. Zo werk je aan je eigen toekomst, maar óók aan die van de wereld. Want samen met je 4.000 collega’s ga je voor die ene grote missie: klimaatneutraal in 2035. We helpen klanten sneller verduurzamen, bedenken innovatieve oplossingen en pakken kansen met beide handen aan. Doe je mee? Zo gaat het verder Stap 1 Je solliciteert Stap 2 Wij bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig Stap 3 Wij nodigen je uit voor een 1e (online) gesprek Stap 4 Soms willen we je nog beter leren kennen en volgt er een online assessment en een 2e gesprek Stap 5 Is er een match? Dan bellen we je met een passend aanbod. En dan... gefeliciteerd met je nieuwe baan! Meer weten over deze functie?

title: Senior Scientist
description: We are seeking a dedicated (Senior) Scientist Physics-Based Modeling, positioned within the Innovation and Technology Deployment (ITD) organization of Manufacturing Science and Technology (MSAT), to support global teams in the modeling of real manufacturing processes. We support both internal and external sites all over the globe and all platforms and modalities. Our mission is to make Johnson & Johnson's manufacturing processes faster and cost-efficient while improving product quality! As a member of the global process science modeling and data (PSMD) group, you will act as modeling ambassador everywhere they go. In a team stocked with brilliant specialists in many different aspects of mathematical modeling, you will function as lead for computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and support further, physics-based approaches related to the manufacturing of pharmaceutical products. You will set up a capability vital to achieve maximum impact at our manufacturing sites, supporting – among other things – technology transfers, root cause investigations, and new product introductions (NPIs). In this role, you will strengthen our physics-based modeling proficiency and be responsible for the CFD capability in the team, including dealing with vendors and the budget. You will be a key partner for projects involving the description and simulation of fluid- and/or particle flow. Working together with our strategy and deployment partners, you will assess the feasibility and value of proposals and drive the execution of chosen projects. You will work closely with other members of the modeling and site teams to upskill them in the domain of CFD and physics-based modeling. There are many things to do! Supporting the introduction of new products as well as the lifecycle of our marketed products. From process capability/quality improvements to breakthrough enhancements in Cost of Goods, our team strive to support all internal & external manufacturing sites with scientific know-how backed up by science. Key Responsibilities: Apply CFD software and tools to build accurate and efficient models for fluid behavior analysis and multiphysics simulations. Collaborate with multi-functional teams to define project requirements and provide technical expertise in CFD modeling. Conduct numerical simulations to predict and analyze fluid flow patterns, heat and mass transfer, as well as other relevant physical phenomena. Evaluate and interpret simulation results to uncover insights and recommend design improvements or solution optimization. Perform validation of models by comparing simulation results with experimental or theoretical data. Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings, recommendations, and outcomes of CFD simulations to internal customers or technical review committees. Proactive style, ready to seek out and engage with partners and customers both globally and on-site. Be the face of PSMD in every project they support. Entrepreneurial and brokering skills, setting up a new CFD competency in an existing group and driving the technology roadmap. Connect with our partners in R&D to improve the transfer of knowledge between early development and manufacturing. Qualifications Education: Minimum of a Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in a Scientific or related field is required. Advanced degree or equivalent experience such as MS or a PhD in Chemical Engineering, Bioengineering, Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Applied Mathematics, or similar quantitative scientific field is preferred. Experience and Skills: Required: A minimum 6 years of meaningful work experience, including hands-on experience in CFD modeling and analysis. Consistent track record in successfully completing CFD projects and delivering quality simulations. Strong understanding of fluid mechanics, heat transfer principles, and numerical methods applied to fluid dynamics problems. Proficiency in applying CFD software such as ANSYS Fluent or OpenFOAM. Experience with CAD software (e.g., ANSYS Meshing) for generating fluid domains and meshing. Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, or C++ for data analysis and scripting. Significant experience with any of the following: technology transfers, scale-ups/-downs, NPIs. Basic understanding of bioreactors, pharmaceutical manufacturing operating models, and good manufacturing principles (GMP) Preferred: Experience in developing and implementing new CFD algorithms or techniques. Knowledge of optimization methods and tools for improving fluid flow efficiency. Familiarity with high-performance computing (HPC) and parallel computing for accelerating CFD simulations. Proven ability to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously. Strong attention to detail and ability to interpret complex data accurately. Other: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve CFD model-related issues. Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate and present findings to technical and non-technical customers. Able to build positive relationships and use your influencing skills to drive outcomes. Motivated, self-starter that has proven problem-solving skills. Requires up to 15% domestic & international travel. At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through innovative programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work. Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.]

title: Associate Professor
description: As an assistant or associate professor, you will play a pivotal role in advancing both research and education within the Bioinformatics Group at Wageningen University. You will set up and maintain a research line on machine-learning-based method development in bioinformatics, with applications in the green life sciences. You will also help organize and deliver teaching in bioinformatics and data science. Your duties and responsibilities will include: performing and supervising research on machine learning/deep learning methodology to solve bioinformatics challenges, preferably in an area adjacent but complementary to current work in the Bioinformatics Group; setting up collaborations and attracting funding for PhD candidates and postdocs to support this research line; teaching a number of existing courses, and supervising BSc/MSc thesis projects that fit your expertise, innovating courses when needed and setting up new courses, when possible, in collaboration with other group staff members; academic service in the organization of the group, in Wageningen University & Research as a whole and in the broader scientific community. This position offers the opportunity to develop an academic career in bioinformatics and machine learning/deep learning. You will work on the Wageningen Campus in a group highly engaged in bioinformatics education and research, with an open, relaxed atmosphere. If you do not yet have a university teaching qualification (UTQ), you will be supported in obtaining one and be encouraged to seize other opportunities to develop yourself further. Are you interested in joining our team? We look forward to your application. Wageningen University & Research offers excellent terms of employment. A few highlights from our Collective Labour Agreement include: sabbatical leave, study leave, and partially paid parental leave; working hours that can be discussed and arranged so that they allow for the best possible work-life balance; the option to accrue additional compensation / holiday hours by working more, up to 40 hours per week; there is a strong focus on vitality and you can make use of the sports facilities available on campus for a small fee; a fixed December bonus of 8.3%; excellent pension scheme. In addition to these first-rate employee benefits, you will be offered a fixed-term, 7-year contract which, upon positive evaluation based on criteria elaborated in the University's Tenure Track policy, can lead to a permanent employment contract as assistant, associate or personal professor. Depending on your experience, we offer a competitive gross salary of between € 4,332.- and € 8,025.- for a full-time working week of 38 hours in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreements for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU) (scales 11-14). Wageningen University & Research encourages internal advancement opportunities and mobility with an internal recruitment policy. There are plenty of options for personal initiative in a learning environment, and we provide excellent training opportunities. We are offering a unique position in an international environment with a pleasant and open working atmosphere. You are going to work at the greenest and most innovative campus in Holland, and at a university that has been chosen as the “Best University” in the Netherlands for the 18th consecutive time. Coming from abroad Wageningen University & Research is the university and research centre for life sciences. The themes we deal with are relevant to everyone around the world and Wageningen, therefore, has a large international community and a lot to offer to international employees. Our team of advisors on Dutch immigration procedures will help you with the visa application procedures for yourself and, if applicable, for your family. Feeling welcome also has everything to do with being well informed. Wageningen University & Research's International Community page contains practical information about what we can do to support international employees and students coming to Wageningen. Furthermore, we can assist you with any additional advice and information about helping your partner to find a job, housing, schooling. For instance under the "30% rule", certain categories of international staff can receive tax exemption on approximately 30% of their gross salary. You are going to work at the greenest and most innovative campus in Holland, and at a university that has been chosen as the “Best University” in the Netherlands for the 18th consecutive time. Wageningen University & Research The mission of Wageningen University & Research is “To explore the potential of nature to improve the quality of life”. Under the banner Wageningen University & Research, Wageningen University and the specialised research institutes of the Wageningen Research Foundation have joined forces in contributing to finding solutions to important questions in the domain of healthy food and living environment. With its roughly 30 branches, 7,600 employees (6,700 fte) and 13,100 students and over 150,000 participants to WUR’s Life Long Learning, Wageningen University & Research is one of the leading organisations in its domain. The unique Wageningen approach lies in its integrated approach to issues and the collaboration between different disciplines. Read the 5 reasons why your future colleagues enjoy working at WUR and watch this video to get an idea of our green campus! You will work here You will be embedded in the Wageningen University Bioinformatics Group led by prof. Dick de Ridder, which is part of the Genome Biology research unit and located in the Department of Plant Sciences. The mission of the group is to develop and apply methods to obtain biological insights from -omics measurements – (meta)genomics, transcriptomics, metabolomics – in the green life sciences. Current research lines focus on transcriptomics, pangenomics, evolutionary genomics, metagenomics, genome mining for specialized metabolism and computational metabolomics. The group organizes and teaches courses in several study programmes, including a successful MSc programme in Bioinformatics & Systems Biology, and in various graduate school programmes. Currently, the group consists of 5 tenure track researchers, a lecturer, a software engineer, ~5 postdocs, ~25 PhD students and ~20 MSc students. In this challenging career trajectory: you acquire, lead and implement innovative and creative (inter)national research projects on the development and application of machine learning/deep learning methodology in bioinformatics; you collaborate with colleagues and supervise PhD students, BSc and MSc theses and you develop and teach courses; you contribute to the further development of the Bioinformatics Group. Wageningen University offers career paths for scientists who pursue to excel in education and research. Currently this is the Tenure Track, but a new Academic Career Framework that allows for more diversity and recognizes group work and leadership will be adopted mid-2024. We seek to attract scientific talent and to stimulate and support their development. We will recruit for the vacancy ourselves, so no employment agencies please. However, sharing in your network is appreciated. You are an academic with an interest in developing or further extending a career in research and education, with a focus on bioinformatics and machine learning/deep learning method development in the green life sciences. You possess: a PhD degree and preferably some years of (international) postdoc experience in bioinformatics, computational biology or a closely related field; proven expertise in machine learning method development in bioinformatics; affinity with applications of your work in -omics data analysis in the green life sciences; an interest in teaching algorithm/method development in bioinformatics and data science; strong collaboration, communication (English at least C1 level) and organization skills; curiosity, a critical but open attitude, and an interdisciplinary mindset. For more information about this position, please contact prof. Dick de Ridder, by telephone (+31 317 484074) or by e-mail: dick.deridder@wur.nl. For more information about the procedure, please contact Noorien Abbas, corporate recruiter, by email: vacaturemeldingen.psg@wur.nl Do you want to apply? You can apply directly using the apply button on the vacancy page on our website which will let us to process your personal information with your approval. This vacancy will be listed up to and including Monday January 8, 2024. We hope to schedule the first job interviews soon after the closing date. Equal opportunities Wageningen University & Research (WUR) employs a large number of people with very different backgrounds and qualities, who inspire and motivate each other. We want every talent to feel at home in our organisation and be offered the same career opportunities. We therefore especially welcome applications from people who are underrepresented at WUR. A good example of how WUR deals with inclusiveness can be read on the page working at WUR with a functional impairment.

title: PhD Student On Development of Neural Multimodal Speech Processing
description: Tilburg University is looking for A PhD student on development of neural multimodal speech processing Position in brief School: Tilburg School of Social and Behavioral Sciences Department: Cognitive Neuropsychology Location: Tilburg Monthly full-time gross salary: €2.770 (first year) - €3.539 (fourth year) Duration of employment contract: 4 years (12 + 36 months) Weekly hours: 40 hours Your position Are you interested in the development of electrophysiological signals in the brain and would you like to study how this relates to (multimodal) speech processing and language development? Then come join the Department of Cognitive Neuropsychology at Tilburg University as a PhD student. You will be part of the NWO-funded Vidi project “Tracking visual speech in the maturing brain”, in which we will study how infants’ and children’s brains process speech in the noisy multimodal world (using both auditory and visual speech cues), while their brain is still rapidly developing. There is a specific focus on individual differences, assessing both neurotypical and neurodivergent children. Your responsibilities This is what you will be doing: Perform and analyse several sub-studies on infants and/or children using electro-encephalography (EEG). You will set up experiments, recruit participants, and collect EEG and behavioral data. You will perform advanced data analysis on neural oscillations and neural speech processing. You will prepare scientific articles to be published in international journals, present key findings at national and international scientific conferences, and write a dissertation. You will contribute to Open Science and Team Science. Additionally, you will contribute to education and supervision (e.g. supervising bachelor’s theses and research skills groups; not more than 20% of your time will be devoted What you contribute Tilburg University seeks a scientist with knowledge, skills, and character. We are curious about your contribution. We think you should have the following qualities for this position: A Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g. cognitive neuroscience, neurolinguistics, experimental psychology, developmental psychology Strong enthusiasm for the topics of study: brain and language development, electrophysiology, multimodality, individual differences Experience with (quantitative) experimental design and statistical analyses Interest to learn advanced quantitative analysis of EEG Experience and/or affinity with various age groups from early childhood to young adulthood Excellent communication and writing skills (ENG), team player Excellent project management and organization skills, problem-solver Furthermore it is a recommendation if you are : Proficient in Dutch Experienced with EEG measures Comfortable with programming (e.g. E-Prime, Praat, Matlab, R) Increasing your value With us, you will find everything you need to maximize your potential and development. We offer excellent facilities and support for research, education, and making societal impact. In all three of these areas, we “recognize and reward” you in line with national university aspirations. With great opportunities such as collaborating in an academic collaborative center, or participating in our Connected Leading program. We attach great importance to team spirit and have a clear, shared vision of (personal) leadership (Connected Leading). Read more about careers at Tilburg University and personal development here. Your terms of employment Your valuable contribution will be rewarded with attractive benefits and sufficient attention to work-life balance. Our offer includes: A position based on 1.0 FTE (40 hours per week) This is a vacancy for a temporary position in accordance with Article 2.3, paragraph 5 of the CLA for Dutch Universities. You will be given a temporary employment contract for the duration of 12 months. After this period, in case of proven suitability and continuation in the same position, you will receive a subsequent employment contract that can be extended to a maximum duration of 48 months. A salary ranging from a minimum of € 2.770 to a maximum of € 3.539 gross per month for full time employment, based on UFO profile PhD and salary scale PR of the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. In addition to your monthly salary, you will receive 41 vacation days (for a 40-hour work week), a holiday allowance (8%), and a year-end bonus (8.3%). We reimburse the full cost of sustainable commuting: walking, cycling, or public transportation. We have a moving expenses scheme that makes it attractive to live close to the university. You will be enrolled in the ABP pension fund through us. Our Options Model allows you to choose from a variety of facilities at a tax advantage. You can work in a hybrid manner: on campus and, for a reimbursement, from home. Researchers from outside the Netherlands may qualify for a tax-free allowance of 30% of their taxable salary if they meet the relevant conditions. The university applies for this allowance on their behalf. Your work environment You will work in a pleasant working environment; a green campus with plenty of facilities. At a leading, entrepreneurial, and innovative university in the humanities and social sciences. The university employs 2,400 staff members and hosts 20,000 students of some 100 different nationalities. For nearly a century, this organization has worked together with a tradition aimed at contributing to society. We strive to be a community where differences in age, gender, orientation, and cultural and religious backgrounds are valued, with equal opportunities for colleagues and students and where, moreover, all decisions take into account the importance of preserving the Earth for future generations. Read more about the university here. How can you apply? Would you like to join us with your valuable input? Then apply online by January 4th, 2024 . Address your cover letter to dr Tineke Snijders. Your application should include: 1. Letter of motivation, including research area/topics of interest 2. Curriculum vitae 3. List of grades (transcripts) 4. A sample of your academic writing (e.g. bachelor/master thesis, paper). If you are currently working on your master thesis, feel free to submit your thesis draft. 5. Contact details of at least two referees For more information about this position, please email dr. Tineke Snijders t.m.snijders@tilburguniversity.edu. The first round of interviews is expected to take place in the week starting January 15th, 2024 . The PhD project will preferably start in March or April, 2024. The exact starting date is negotiable (between March and September 2024). Tilburg School of Social and Behavioral Sciences Tilburg University is een moderne gespecialiseerde universiteit. Het onderwijs en onderzoek van de Tilburg School of Social and Behavorial Sciences (TSB) zijn georganiseerd rond de thema’s Health, Care & Well-Being, en People, Work, & Organizations. Met een inspirerende werkomgeving daagt de school haar medewerkers uit om hun ambities te verwezenlijken. Betrokkenheid en samenwerking zijn daarbij belangrijke uitgangspunten. Tilburg School of Social and Behavioral Sciences Sollicitatiecode Tilburg University hanteert de NVP-sollicitatiecode van de Nederlandse Vereniging voor Personeelsmanagement & Organisatieontwikkeling. Disclaimer De tekst in deze vacatureadvertentie is auteursrechtelijk beschermd eigendom van Tilburg University. Gebruik, verspreiding en verdere openbaarmaking van de advertentie zonder uitdrukkelijke toestemming van Tilburg University is niet toegestaan en dat geldt expliciet voor gebruik door werving- en selectiebureaus welke niet rechtstreeks handelen in opdracht van de Tilburg University. Reacties naar aanleiding van werving door niet-opdrachtnemers van Tilburg University worden niet in behandeling genomen.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: As a Senior Data Scientist you analyse, enrich and build machine learning solutions on top of the richest data sources of the bank. Together, the people in our data science area create solutions that are of value to our customers and help to fight financial and economic crime. You and your job Your experience of building data science solutions and working with billions and billions of records of data will be your main guide during your day-to-day job while you provide valuable insights for more than 7 million customers. As a Senior Data Scientist you will work with a state-of-the-art data science toolkit and collaborate closely with a team of experienced data scientists and data engineers in an agile environment. You and your team are working on categorization of transactions. By doing so for all payments in the Rabobank app, you provide spending insights for millions of customers. Facts & Figures You work with ~150 other data scientists, data engineers and ML Ops engineers from various backgrounds and 15+ nationalities Monthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge with data scientists, engineers and product managers The department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutions Top 3 responsibilities Bring value to the business by designing, developing and deploying models in a responsible way to ensure a smooth validation process and tangible business impact; Make impact with new data science use cases by practicing your communication skills and effectively sharing your observations with stakeholders; Prove the added value of MLOps by identifying flaws at the earliest possible moment and implement the best MLOps practices accordingly. After all, you and your team are end-to-end responsible for the ML solutions you develop together! Together we achieve more than alone Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can. As a Data Scientist, I absolutely enjoy working on the challenging business problems that are presented to us. You go from diving into exploratory analyses to developing full products - together with hugely motivated and ambitious colleagues. There is a lot of room for your development, own initiatives and there are many opportunities to contribute to the area and make a difference for Rabobank! Wouter Smit, Data Scientist You will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members. Working together is the way we work as we are one results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a better world together, a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business. You and your talent Master or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Data science, Computer Science or related field >5 years of relevant working experience in data science, with a strong statistical component Experience with leading development of data science products Experience with production models and clear understanding of MLOps is a must Experience with Python, Git, PySpark and Databricks Experience with Azure DevOps and software engineering is a plus Wants to get better every day Hands-on mentality Strong communication skills Be the driver, take initiative and be proactive This is what we offer you € 4.848,64 to € 6.926,62 gross per month based on 36-hour work week (scale 10) and depending on experience An extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance Hybrid working: we work 1 or 2 days a week from the office This is a selection of the terms of employment based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment. You and the job application process Apply to this vacancy Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lisa Boschma, recruiter via lisa.boschma@rabobank.nl #LI-LB We will conduct the interviews through a video call. You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank A security check is part of the process. We respect your privacy.

title: Data Engineer
description: We are looking for a (DUTCH SPEAKING) Data Engineer to join one of our clients in Den Haag soon. You will be responsible for building and automating the data infrastructure and functional data components. You enable and actively collaborate with our platform teams within the business units to deliver high-quality software components, which are used within the BUs to compile data systems. Requirements: 7+ years of relevant experience in software, data and/or platform engineering, where you have built modular, testable, scalable and easily consumable platforms 3+ years of hands-on experience with one or more cloud services (Azure) such as ADF, Data-lake, Delta-lake, Databricks, KeyVaults, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Datapipeline, etc. Experience with Data as Code ; version control, small and frequent commits, unit tests, CI/CD, packaging, branching, containerization, etc. Proven programming and debugging experience with Python/PySpark, SQL, Go Is this you? Do you have a deep understanding in Data Engineering? Hit "APPLY" nowor send your CV directly to (see below) Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: Data Scientist
description: As a Data Scientist Finance Analytics you are responsible for the development of complex Data Science solutions adding value to the core processes of the Rabobank. You and your job As a Data Scientist, you will leverage your expertise to drive business decisions through the development and implementation of Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions. Working with complex, large and rich data sources, you will utilize data science technologies to build robust products using the MLOps framework. In this role, you will be part of a collaborative team of experienced Data Scientists and Data Engineers, with end-to-end responsibility for the products. Practical Examples Using ML and client clustering techniques to help front office employees identify the next best product to buy for corporate clients Develop and implement a retention model for mortgage clients to increase customer loyalty and reduce churn rate Facts & Figures You work with ~150 other data scientists, data engineers and ML Ops engineers from various backgrounds and 15+ nationalities Monthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge The department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutions Together we achieve more than alone Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can. “Working with multidisciplinary teams, building end-to-end solutions for our stakeholders. I work closely together with other data sciences colleagues, but also with data engineers and the business consultants on a project-basis. Add to that a mix of smart and fun colleagues from whom I can learn a lot plus many learning opportunities, I couldn`t imagine a better place for a data scientist.” - Tim, Data Scientist You will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members. Within Finance Analytics we create value using advanced analytics solutions to enable data-driven decision making on core banking areas and act as a bridge between multiple departments/data sources. Working together is the way we work; as 1 results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business. You and your talent Master or PhD degree in a quantitative field >3 years of relevant working experience in data science Experience with Python/Pyspark, Git and Databricks Experience in operationalisation of ML solutions in collaboration with engineers Experience with Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps practices (CI/CD, Clean Code) Wants to get better every day Hands-on mentality This is what we offer you A 36-hour workweek with a salary in Scale 8 (between € 3.518 - €5.024) or Scale 9 (between € 4.068-€5.811) depending on experience An extra budget of 10% (scale 8) or 11% (scale 9) of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance Hybrid working: we work 1 or 2 days a week from the office This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Scientist based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment. You and the job application process Apply to the vacancy for Data Scientist Finance Analytics Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lisa Bosma, Senior Recruiter via lisa.bosma@rabobank.nl #LI-LB We will hold the interviews through a video call. You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank A security check is part of the process. We respect your privacy.

title: Data Scientist
description: Data Engineer In het kort Wij zijn de digitale motor van Hypotheken! Dit team werkt aan de inrichting van een volledig functionerend data ecosysteem. Zowel binnen als buiten hypotheken wordt data makkelijk gedeeld vanuit Ã©Ã©n platform, data users kunnen terecht op deze ene plek. Buiten hypotheken zorgen we voor synergie door alle relevante data te delen zodat onze klanten en partners ons ervaren als een persoonlijke bank in een digitale tijd. Als Data Engineer ga je samen met een enthousiast en gedreven team van Engineers aan de slag om nog meer waarde te halen uit deze data. De sfeer op onze afdeling is gezellig en ontspannen â€“ wij kennen geen pakkencultuur. Maak werk van je doelen en ontwikkel je zowel professioneel als persoonlijk. Passie voor je vak, ondernemerschap en vakmanschap vinden wij belangrijk op de afdeling. De cultuur is informeel, wij zijn open naar elkaar, vieren successen en organiseren regelmatig afdelingsuitjes. Je werk Met ons selfservice data platform stellen we onze stakeholders in staat om data te gebruiken als leidraad bij het nemen van strategische en zakelijke beslissingen. Met het steeds groeiende belang van data voor onze innovaties en bedrijfsvoering willen we de overstap maken naar een gedistribueerde Data-Mesh architectuur geÃ¯mplementeerd op een nieuwe Azure based technology stack. Hiermee willen we nog beter voorbereid zijn op de toekomst. De Data Engineer die wij zoeken gaat deel uit maken van het Enabling team. We gaan bouwen aan generieke componenten in Python/PySpark voor data teams. Specifiek zijn we op zoek naar een Data Engineer die ons kan helpen bij de volgende activiteiten: Realiseren van de hiervoor genoemde architectuur met een op Microsoft Azure gebaseerde technology stack en op basis van Cloud Native concepten. Integreren en realiseren van koppelingen met meer traditionele dataleveranciers en afnemers. Dit kunnen services zijn, streaming data, maar in enkele gevallen misschien ook nog wel een legacy systeem met een batch koppeling met CSV-bestanden. Concreet: integreren van systemen tot een totaaloplossing. Migreren van bestaande data-oplossingen naar de nieuwe Azure-oplossingen. Je profiel We zijn op zoek naar een fijne collega met een sterke affiniteit voor data, die het leuk vindt om problemen op te lossen, uitdagingen aan te gaan, durft te experimenteren met oog voor de business aspecten, en samenwerken staat hoog in je vaandel. Daarnaast heb je oog voor de data engineering life-cycle en je zorgt voor duurzame oplossingen. Binnen de organisatie is Nederlands de voertaal. We vinden het fijn als je tussen de 32 en 40 uur bij ons wilt werken. Kennis en ervaring Ervaren Cloud Data engineer met tenminste 3 jaar werkervaring, bij voorkeur in de Azure Cloud; Python, SQL, PySpark, en test driven development met Pytest; Ervaring met git, CI/CD-pipelines bij voorkeur in Azure DevOps; Ervaring met het opzetten en beheren van data pipelines, zowel voor batch als streaming toepassingen; Ervaring met de realisatie van een Data architectuur is een prÃ©, bij voorkeur met de Data-Mesh. Wij bieden De vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen, flexibel te werken en veel ruimte om te groeien en ontwikkelen; Veel verantwoordelijkheid en een grote mate van autonomie; Een informele en ambitieuze werksfeer met veel ruimte voor initiatief en fun; Een uitstekend salaris afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring; Een OV-jaarabonnement, afhankelijk van de functie; Een uitstekende pensioenregeling. Interesse? We maken graag kennis met je! Reageer nu op deze vacature. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Marianne Pot (marianne.pot@nl.abnamro.com). Gelijke kansen voor iedereen Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt. Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om CV's te mogen indienen. Daarbij mag alleen een CV worden ingediend wanneer het bureau is uitgenodigd door een Talent Acquisition Specialist om mee te zoeken naar geschikte kandidaten. Alle ongevraagde CV's die buiten deze voorwaarden worden aangeboden zullen als eigendom van ABN AMRO BANK N.V. worden beschouwd. ABN AMRO BANK N.V. is hierbij geen plaatsingskosten verschuldigd. Wij vragen Goede communicatie vaardigheden Passie voor je vakgebied

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: What do we offer? To be courageous To live wholeheartedly To keep growing What do you bring? A customer centric focus A positive attitude A healthy dose of energy Why Ahold Delhaize Huge Impact Work with fun and smart colleagues (Inter)national growth opportunities How you can make a difference . Are you the experienced ML Ops Engineer and are you looking for your next challenge and make impact on whole international communities while being challenged? Then read the vacancy and don’t hesitate to apply! Hi, we are Ahold Delhaize, a global family of caring brands helping people eat well, save time, and live better. That is what Ahold Delhaize (60m weekly customers, 413k colleagues) stands for. As one of the world’s largest and most forward-thinking food retail groups, our global family of local brands creates inspiring shopping experiences. Whether people shop at brick-and-mortars, prefer quick pick-ups, or opt for the convenience of ordering online, Ahold Delhaize delivers! We are growing our business quickly but responsibly. We advocate and accelerate sustainable retailing, responsible sourcing, supporting local communities, and helping customers make healthier choices in a world in transition. That requires the courage and wholeheartedness to have convictions and stand up for what we believe in. It also takes a growth-hacking mindset: tomorrow’s opportunities call for tomorrow’s skills. But most of all, it requires us to be there for the people and communities we serve. #daretocare Job Objective As a ML Ops Engineer your job is twofold: Improving MLOps frameworks/boilerplate that are used by data scientists and ML engineers and allows to speed up the deployment across the projects Improving the deployment of existing ML projects (such as cross-sell, demand forecast, personalised offers) bridging gap between data scientists, data- and software engineers, improving data scientists code into production ready state. Work on designing and developing new- generation machine learning tooling and technologies to offer AD data science community products that enable more efficient and stable coding environments Day-to-day responsibilities include: Collaborate with data scientists to build ML-enhanced software products Define and implement retraining strategies for ML systems Convert data science prototypes to production-ready systems Ensure team’s code is modularized, reusable, tested, and properly versioned Defining governance around ML, post-deployment monitoring Handle model and data versioning Along with unit and integration test, build and maintain model validation framework Work with scrum teams to implement predictive models Our ideal candidate would look like this: >4 years experience in Machine Learning role Hands-on experience in building ML models and deploying them to production solid understanding of MLOps principles and ML concepts experience with cloud service provider ML ecosystem such as AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, Databricks. experience working with orchestration tools such as Airflow, Mage. experience working with machine learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc. strong Python experience, pySpark is a plus experience with API design, DevOps and CI/CD experience with creating architectural designs for machine learning projects using cloud frameworks like AWS, Azure or GCP hands on experience with Docker and Kubernetes experience with both SQL and NoSQL collaborative mindset and “can do” attitude This is how you keep growing Ahold Delhaize is growing enthusiastically, but sustainably. If we can grow while having a more positive impact on people or our planet, we’re going for it. We encourage all of our 413,000 colleagues to share this attitude on a personal level, so opportunities to master new skills and expand your capabilities are a given. And because we’re a global family of brands, finding your next challenge comes (almost) as naturally as calling an actual relative. We #daretocare for our people at all levels. What that translates to in this role? a gross annual salary up to €90k / year incl. holiday allowance and excl. bonus an excellent pension plan with an employee contribution of 4.7% twenty vacation days and a personal budget for you to decide whether to spend it on twelve and a half extra vacation days, discounts or a payout Flexible working hours: We foster a vibrant culture by balancing in-person connections and cross-functional collaboration reimbursement for travel expenses to and from Zaandam attractive discounts on various insurance policies a laptop and a phone a 10%-discount on your groceries at our Albert Heijn stores up to €300 per year Membership in a diverse community that wholeheartedly embraces courage, inspires growth, and dares to care Dare to care and grow with us? We look forward to teaming up! Virtually and at your home away from home: our vibrant HQ, right next to Zaandam station. At Ahold Delhaize and our local brands we define diversity broadly, seeing it as inclusive of thoughts and skills, generational differences, LGBTQ+, gender, race and ethnicity, disabilities, nationalities and more, and we accept all people for who they are. Apply Want to know more before you hit the Apply button? For questions you can contact Peter Dirks via peter.dirks@ah.nl . What matters to us? Ahold Delhaize is one of the world’s largest food retail groups and a leader in both supermarkets and e-commerce. Together, we help people eat well, save time and live better – it’s how we make a difference. And we do it because we care: for our customers, our people and the world around us. Be courageous "I realized how much impact you can truly have as an individual, working for such a huge international company.” Live wholeheartedly “The support this company has always offered means the world to me." Keep growing “I feel the freedom to show initiative, propose changes and try new things. Having that freedom gave me wings to fly.”

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Senior Data Scientist At a glance ABN is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to improve our customers experience providing a more personalized touch in their day-to-day banking. Your job The candidate is expected to fulfil the following responsibilities fully independent and with great ownership. Design the analysis: explicitly plan the analysis, anticipate and address competing explanation, determine the best way to evaluate the intended results. Conduct analysis: wrangle and explore the data appropriately, visualize and present the exploration results; develop/apply and devise appropriate algorithms; work as a thought data and algorithms lead; identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through the product capabilities; work closely with the data engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products; help solve various problems and make a true impact across various business units and domains. Business implementation: Discover the needs of the business/user; package technical work for diverse audiences; navigate the business organization structure; build a business network ; communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems. Engineering integration: Develop data pipelines from and to different (cloud and no-cloud) locations; make work compatible with the operationalisation stack; apply hands-on knowledge of the MLOps practices; co-create solution architectures; bring analytical models into production by collaborating with the engineers, co-create solution architectures. Way of working (WoW): Shape and enforce the WoW of the team and align it with other teams; work independently; collaborate with others; continuous improvement mindset; Lead complex use case: Lead complex projects, particularly XFN (cross-functional) projects; helping and influencing the grids (tribes) in the business line and the business units to prioritize their roadmap for more data driven solutions. Build the profession: Present in internal meetings and knowledge sharing sessions, as well as external conferences, meetups, workshops, encourage the team and staff; able to mentor and lead other data scientists. Working environment The CoE is a comprehensive data & analytics team part of Customer and Digital Experience (CDE) in ABN AMRO. Within Customer & Digital Experience the online platforms are being created and built that offer all the digital products of ABN AMRO. All these developments and products are powered by the data & analytics of our CoE. We strongly believe that online banking should be easier, faster, more delightful, and more personal to create sustainable long-term relationships with our customers. To do so, we develop suitable solutions that give our customers greater financial control. With a vast amount of data at hand, together with our unique usability lab as test-station we build digital services in an agile way that surprise customers and help them move forward. At Customer & Digital Experience you get the freedom and responsibility to improve our products & services. In other words, we encourage you to release your creativity and put it into practice. The environment is similar to a start-up atmosphere - feel free to wear your sneakers. Your profile The ideal candidate is expected to: Have a master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics; econometrics or related field; 5+ years of relevant industry experience Be able to analyse problems and strategize for better solutions Be comfortable in both a leadership and team-player role Be a creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge Be goal-oriented, organized team player Good interpersonal skills and communication Expert in a wide arsenal of statistical, machine learning, deep learning and operation research techniques to help solve different classes of problems; having a deep knowledge of the models, their pitfall, knowing what types of transformations work best with them, being able to recommend, coach and convince other data scientists on the right technical approach, being able to balance between the model quality and the speed of delivery; Experience in network science and customer journey analysis; Comfort working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to prioritize, and manage time effectively Experience with coaching and mentoring junior data scientists Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potentials clearly and confidently Proficiency in using SQL, Python and PySpark. Knowledge of at least one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) Experience in Banking and/or e-Commerce is a plus. We are offering We offer you a challenging position in a professional environment in which you get the opportunity to be the best version of yourself. You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial field and further develop your data science skills. We also offer the possibility to follow general and (specific) data science trainings. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits: A good monthly salary based on a 40-hour working week A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development The ability to work flexibly We help you to stay fit & vital An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel A good pension scheme A great organization with a great work culture Interesting work and challenging projects A team that likes to help, supplement and strengthen each other Interested? Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy now. For more information about the role, please contact Valerio Ciotti, Team Lead Data Science (valerio.ciotti@nl.abnamro.com). For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Nicay Hertogs (nicay.hertogs@nl.abnamro.com). The interview process First interview (1 hour): we will get to know each other during the first interview. Aim of the interview is to assess the level of seniority and the fit with the team. We will also spend some time explaining what we are working on. Second interview (1 hour): There is a take home assignment. This is a modelling/data analysis, machine learning assignment designed to take a couple of hours to complete. Based on the outcome of the use case, we will invite you to present your results and test your technical knowledge on ML and statistics. Third interview (45 min): Cultural fit and your interest in working in ABN. Equal opportunities for all The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated. Disclaimer external recruitment agencies External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please. Wij vragen Goede communicatie vaardigheden Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Senior Data Scientist Location: Amsterdam, with a mix of office and home working Parttime/fulltime: 32 to 40 hours a week Closing date: Monday, 4 December. Please note, we may close vacancies early where we receive significant numbers of applications, so don’t delay! What will you do as a Senior Data Scientist We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Global Analytics team. The mission of Global Analytics is to lead HEINEKEN into becoming a data-driven company and the best-connected brewer. As a team, we radiate a data-driven entrepreneurial culture to the rest of the company. We act as an incubator for smart data products in all areas of business - from sales to logistics and from marketing to purchasing. This approach has allowed us to grow rapidly and launch many value-creating use cases from management of spare parts to allocation of media spending. Our focus for the upcoming year is to scale and deploy our analytics solutions across the globe. Our team consists of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Business Intelligence Specialists, and Analytics Product Managers. As a Data Scientist you might be: Creating an algorithm that optimizes our brewing process Forecasting timeseries Writing an Evolutionary Algorithm to optimize warehouses Training a classification model to predict customer churn Running an A/B-test to assess the effectiveness of a change Optimizing transport and delivery routes Daily work of our team is driven by the following qualities: Collaboration : Our global community consists of diverse cultures, roles, and challenges. We thrive together. Innovation : We strive to create an environment where you enjoy the problems you are solving, but also the people you are solving them with. We innovate to transform HEINEKEN from a traditional to a data-driven company. Reliability : We position ourselves as a business partner driving value creating decisions and building trust in our solutions. This Senior Data Scientist role is part of the Supply Chain, Finance and Procurement chapter within the Global Analytics team. Specifically, we are looking for someone that wants to be at the forefront of our machine learning models developed for our 150+ breweries across the world. Working with IoT (streaming) data to optimize our brewing and packaging efficiency. Furthermore, you can expect to be coaching other data scientists, liaising with business stakeholders, and drinking some (0.0%) beers! Are you the Senior Data Scientist who completes our team? If this sounds interesting and exciting, we hope you apply. We want to be collaborative, innovative, and reliable. We see collaboration as key in our global community with many different cultures, roles, and challenges. And strive to create an environment where you enjoy both the problems you are solving, but also the people you are solving them with. We innovate to transform HEINEKEN from a traditional to a data-driven company. We position ourselves as a business partner driving value creating decisions and building trust in our solutions. These are ambitious goals, and therefore we need your help. In addition you will have: 8+ years of experience as a Data Scientist in the business setting. Experience building and designing complex data science solutions. Experience in leading a project from conception to completion. MSc/MA/PhD in a technical discipline related to Data Science (Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Bioinformatics, etc.) Effective communication skills so that you can tailor your message to the audience, be it a fellow Data Scientist or a Master brewer. Value-driven and pragmatic mind-set: focus on getting a result in an Agile manner. Coaching and mentoring other data scientists in the earlier stages of their careers. Knowledge of Machine Learning, Statistics, optimization algorithms and related fields. Fluent Python programming skills and thorough knowledge of PySpark, pandas & scikit-learn. Experience with applying software engineering best practices, like code version systems, code structure and unit tests. Familiarity with both Azure and AWS is advantageous. We embrace learning and growth and we anticipate there is scope to develop in this role. You’re also likely to bring experiences to this role that are not listed above – as long as you have a thirst for learning and development, not every box needs to be ticked when it comes to skillsets. What we have offer HEINEKEN is an international company with all the related perks: (inter)national career opportunities, ability to go places and diverse projects. We focus on developing HEINEKEN and ourselves: knowledge sharing is key and there is dedicated time for professional development through workshops, community sessions, Microsoft/Databricks courses/certifications and learning days. Our group consist of driven and entrepreneurial professionals that care about their work - and everything besides work! HEINEKEN embraces a hybrid working environment moving forward, with flexibility to define how often you are in the office. A MacBook and a work phone. Covered commuting expenses. Competitive salary Excellent pension scheme. Awesome social events! :) Apply Are you excited to get started as our Senior Data Scientist? Then apply immediately by clicking the green application button and sending us an updated version of your resume. A cover letter is not required, but we would love to hear about your passion for our position, so a short note along with your resume would be great! For information about this vacancy or the application process, please contact Leonie Reuvers (Talent Acquisition Business Partner) via leonie.reuvers@heineken.com We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Test Engineer
description: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world. At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for Data Test Engineer to join our QE&A Team . About Cognizant Quality Engineering & Assurance: With more than 650 clients across industry verticals and a global footprint, Cognizant QE&A is a recognized thought leader in quality assurance. With 33.000 colleagues at QE&A, putting quality in the fast lane with relentless automation and intelligent QA is just the beginning. QE&A is reimagining quality with QA Hub™, an ecosystem approach that merges deep industry expertise with QA intellectual property and innovation, supported by compelling partnerships and vibrant communities. Indeed, there is so much opportunity when the quality is right. Job Summary: Cognizant will be involved in defining the way of working, test automation framework, implementation of the same. Responsibilities: As a data test consultant, you are responsible for test automation framework – define, design and implementation. You will be supporting the implementation of the data quality, data governance. Test the complete data flow across silver, bronze, gold layers. Ability to work across core team, Guild etc,. What you will bring to the team: Experience in Azure data bricks is a must. Experience of hands on working with python data frames, pyspark, pytest in function of either python dev or test automation Experience on test automation, shift left, data driven testing and behavior driven testing What we offer: A competitive salary based on your qualities and experience. Access Udemy, Cognizant Academy digital libraries for your continuous learning. NS business card to cover your commute expenses. 25 days of paid holiday per year. A laptop and a smartphone. A pension scheme. Open, ‘can do’ team spirit and international environment that encourages making your ideas reality! An option of 32-40 hour working week Diversity and Inclusion at Cognizant: At Cognizant, we believe diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our ability to execute successfully and consistently over the long term. We recognize that our people are our most important asset. We strive to create an environment where all associates feel comfortable to be themselves, feel accepted and can therefore thrive both personally and professionally. We continue to drive D&I throughout our organization to unlock the insights, imagination, and innovation of our associates, as well as reflect the diversity of our clients and communities. We are a Dutch and European Top Employer and continually drive employment recognition and engagement through employee friendly policies and affinity groups such as “Women Empowered”, “Embrace LGBTQ+” and “Race Equality Network”. For more information, see https://careers.cognizant.com/global/en/diversity-and-inclusion Description of the recruitment process : Step 1: Written application/CV will be reviewed by the recruitment team Step 2: Conversation with the recruiter Step 3: Technical Panel interview Step 4: Interview with Business Unit representative Step 5: Client Interview Step 6: Offer Recruiter’s Contact Details: Name: Ankita Chadha Email address: ankita.chadha@cognizant.com Contact Number: +31621911225 Employee Status : Full Time Employee Shift : Day Job Travel : No Job Posting : Nov 23 2023 About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

title: Platform Engineer
description: South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all continents across the globe, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions, we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities. Our Corporate Functions team is the “enablement engine” of South Pole. Behind the scenes, we provide the business with world-class solutions and best practices that sustain business growth and success. We cover key areas such as Finance, HR, Office Management, Legal, IT, Operations, etc. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you! Job summary: At South Pole, we are on a mission to drive sustainability through data-driven insights.
