You may apply for this position until 7 January 11:59pm / before 8 January 2024 Dutch local time (CET) by means of the application form (click on "Apply" below on the advertisement on the university website). Interviews of shortlisted candidates will be held in the week 22-26 January 2024. The University of Groningen strives to be a university in which students and staff are respected and feel at home, regardless of differences in background, experiences, perspectives, and identities. We believe that working on our core values of inclusion and equality are a joint responsibility and we are constructively working on creating a socially safe environment. Diversity among students and staff members enriches academic debate and contributes to the quality of our teaching and research. We therefore invite applicants from underrepresented groups in particular to apply. For more information, see also our diversity policy webpage: https://www.rug.nl/about-ug/policy-and-strategy/diversity-and-inclusion/ Our selection procedure follows the guidelines of the Recruitment code (NVP): https://www.nvp-hrnetwerk.nl/nl/sollicitatiecode and European Commission's European Code of Conduct for recruitment of researchers: https://euraxess.ec.europa.eu/jobs/charter/code We provide career services for partners of new faculty members moving to Groningen. Unsolicited marketing is not appreciated. Information For information you can contact: Dr. J.D. Schnepf, j.d.schnepf rug.nl Dr. Sean Desjardins, s.p.a.desjardins rug.nl Flip Kramer, for practical information, gia rug.nl Please do not use the e-mail address(es) above for applications.

title: Logistics Manager
description: The Global Logistics Manager (EU) will oversee global logistics partnerships.|Trek is an awesome place to work, with amazing benefits for all employees. About Our Client Trek is an awesome place to work, with amazing benefits for all employees. ''We build only products we love, provide incredible hospitality to our customers, and change the world by getting more people on bikes. When you're on our team, you're taken care of, encouraged to learn and grow, and given lots of opportunities to do so. Give us your best, and we'll give it right back. Sound pretty sweet? Then come join us!'' Their EU dictribution centre is located in Wijchen (near Nijmegen) and is responsible for the fulfilment of all their orders (B2C, B2B, Retail etc.). Job Description The Global Logistics Manager (EU) will oversee global logistics partnerships and initiatives for ocean and air modes to/from Europe. Responsibilities include managing global logistics partner's performance, leading a team, and identify areas of opportunity within global transportation network. The responsibilities include all areas of execution including inbound/outbound international logistics operations, freight payment, and analytics all while maintaining best in class service levels. This team member is responsible for the overall performance of the logistics strategy around ocean, air, and inbound haulage transportation in Europe. Core Responsibilities Lead, mentor, and develop a team of logistics professionals Develop strong carrier relationships to ensure high levels of service and communication Ensure contracts, execution and vision align with Trek best practices, driving efficiency and cost savings Align, leverage, and deploy logistics strategies improving the overall service, scale, and pricing within Trek Work with Global Logistics Leadership to create strategies for future programs leveraging best in class principles Mentor and collaborate with teams to understand opportunities in daily operations to create efficiency from the team and external partners Provide subject matter expertise on complex logistics challenges ensuring timely resolution of issues as identified Leverage change management, project management and similar disciplines to align stakeholder expectations Develop and deploy KPIs reflecting areas of improvement or success, as well as automate reporting to align with global teams Create presentations to be used for weekly/monthly meetings. The Successful Applicant Degree in international business, supply chain or logistics. 7-9+ years-experience in international transportation/logistics. Strong knowledge of global logistics, supply chain management, and/or international freight procurement Solid interpersonal skills with proven ability to collaborate with a broad range of teams to drive results Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills with strong critical thinking and business curiosity Demonstrated ability to juggle competing priorities and adapt to a changing environment Ability to sort through ambiguity and work on undefined projects Highly ambitious and directed with strong attention to detail Strong verbal, written and presentation skills including ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple way to all levels in the organization Transportation Systems experience preferred including working knowledge of Amber Road and JDE/Oracle. Fun and flexible; inspires and motivates team members. Self-motivated; demonstrates the ability to work independently and take initiative. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required. Preferred experience with Power BI or other data visualization software. Fluent in Dutch and English is an absolute must. What's on Offer If you are interested in working for a global company, in a great industry, with a great team, Trek wants you! Trek offers the Global Logistics Manager (EU) a competitave salary of €70.000 up to €85.000 depending on experience and seniority. 25 vacation days and one extra on your birthday Bonus Flexible working enviroment with the posibility to work from home for 2 days per week. Sufficient opportunities to develop yourself, including through our training tool TrekU and 24/7 access to the Goodhabitz e-learning platform A good pension scheme where you only contribute 2.75% and the rest is paid by Trek An average of 40% discount on our products And of course a great team consisting of enthusiastic colleagues with a great passion and pride for our products!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Is it in your DNA to make the world a little better, healthier and smarter every day? D oes working on technologies such as autonomous driving or object detection with smart sensors combined with (deep learning) algorithms appeal to you? Are you challenged by generating/rendering (medical) data from 2D to 3D images or d o you like to work on wireless communication solutions for Lidar, Bluetooth or Ultra-Wideband ? Would you like to work from edge to cloud, from driver to embedded application? Join us at TOPIC! "Working at TOPIC gives you a flexible environment where there are amazing and challenging projects to keep on improving yourself" Tom Verhees | Senior Software Engineer at TOPIC Your job as Senior Software Engineer As a Senior Software Engineer at TOPIC you will get to work on state-of-the-art R&D projects within different domains and technologies. From developing low level and middleware solutions for implantable devices, surgical robots or high-tech machine control, to developing applications for IoT and real time data visualization. You are part of one of our scrum teams and will work on the design and implementation of high quality software solutions. From proof of concept to the delivery of a market ready product. Programming languages and technologies in our stack are C++, C, Python, QT, Docker, AWS, GIT, Jenkins, RTOS, TDD and BDD. Memory management and performance optimization are essential in the embedded systems that we develop. Your tasks and responsibilities: Design, implementation and verification of subsystems, modules and components; Maintaining and debugging existing software solutions; Write high quality, robust, structured code; Participate in meetings (e.g. stand-up, sprintplanning, retrospective, design/architectural sessions) and share your thoughts and ideas to help move the project forward; Sparring partner for peers and stakeholders inside and outside the team; Code review & guidance of (junior) engineers; Depending on your ambitions and desires for personal growth, we will support you in shaping your future and enable you to take on more responsibilities as you grow in seniority. You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in (applied) Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Embedded Systems, Physics and/or Mathematics; You have at least 8 years of experience in O.O. software development in the high-tech domain. You have excellent skills in C++ and C and are familiar with other programming languages such as Python and/or C#; You are used to delivering high quality code and are familiar with methodologies and techniques as Unit Testing, UML, Design Patterns, TDD/BDD and Agile; You have an excellent command of English (both oral and written); knowledge of the Dutch language is a big plus; Our Offer TOPIC is committed to make the world a little better healthier and smarter every day. Not only for our customers but also for the members of our TOPIC family for whom passion for Technical innovation is key! This will make you smarter : challenging and interesting projects in different domains; benefit from the expertise of your technical buddy and more than 100 smart colleagues; focus on guiding and coaching on personal development to achieve your ambitions; annual study budget and customized training program within our TOPIC Academy; tech events and knowledge sessions. This will make you better : contract for indefinite period of time; an all-in employee benefit package (€50.000 – €68.000 annually): incl. competitive gross salary, net cost allowance, mobility package, 13th month payment, holiday allowance; good secondary employment conditions: i.a. 26 vacation days (opportunity to buy extra days), pension scheme and relocation budget. This will keep you healthy : a good work-life balance, flexible working hours and hybrid way of working; an inspiring office environment with daily fresh fruit and a gym; the home office support package will turn your “home office” into an inspiring environment; lots of fun during events like celebrations, sport activities and the weekly Friday afternoon drinks. Our organization Since 1996 we have been developing (embedded) systems that are essential for products manufactured by renowned high-tech companies around the world. Our projects involve edge to cloud solutions; from PCB design and FPGA to low level embedded software and application software for UI, Web, Mobile and cloud. We are well known for our high level of knowledge and expertise and are proud to be a Premier Adaptive Computing Partner of AMD; technology leader in the field of System-on-Chips and FPGAs.

title: Senior Reporting Analyst
description: Company Description Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission. Job Description You might expect an energy company to only do electricity and heat. To live fossil free, we need to think beyond convention today. At Vattenfall, this is the mindset that drives us every day and everything we do. Our IT unit supports this journey by driving digitalization, new ways of (digital) working and customer focused deliveries for the whole Vattenfall group. Gathering data on customer experience, analyze them and derive better services from it, is our part of the IT value creation. We are looking for a Senior Reporting Analyst IT Customer Satisfaction which supports our great team as Reporting Analyst in IT Service Management in Berlin, Hamburg, Amsterdam, Stockholm or Katowice. Your role To support our delivery organization and enable an efficient international cooperation, IT Service Management sets the scene and maintains the commercial prerequisites. You will contribute actively by providing all needed data and assure the correctness of delivered information. You will work with modern analytical and reporting tools and be end-to-end responsible for the master data connected to Customer Experience. Your tasks and responsibilities: Create and maintain data models for customer satisfaction measurement Prepare master data and update business services in order to run the surveys Connect service delivery qualities with customer satisfaction measurement, develop underlaying KPIs and structure the information delivery process end-to-end Ensure proper data analysis to support the surrounding IT processes and stakeholder Hands-on development of PowerBI reports, making data easily accessible for management users through dashboard and report automation Cooperate with Service Desk, Client Services, System Managers and SPOCs to drive process quality to the next level Location Berlin, Hamburg, Amsterdam, Stockholm or Katowice Qualifications Your profile As our Senior Reporting Analyst IT Customer Satisfaction you are dedicated to facts and figures. You will bring value to our IT organization by providing reliable information and reporting. You are open minded and communicative with a strong customer orientation. You want to go the extra mile to satisfy our business stakeholders – the mission of IT Service Management. Next to this you bring: IT or business administration graduate with first work experience OR Reporting analyst with 5 year professional experience in the field of data analysis, business intelligence, visualizations or the creation of reports and dashboards project management basics, preferable lead own assignments and projects Strong analytical thinking, you successfully worked with data, statistics and simulations Work independently and with own initiative Experience with MSO products, development tools, automation and analytics, e.g., VBA, SQL, HTML, skills in PowerBI Fluency in written and spoken English; German or Swedish would be advantageous Additional Information Our offer Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development. More Information We welcome your application in English, no later than, 1st of January 2024 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Marius Gläßge via email: marius.glaessge@vattenfall.de At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Is it in your DNA to make the world a little better, healthier and smarter every day? Can we challenge you with the development of advanced (healthcare) systems? Does working on technologies such as autonomous driving or object detection with smart sensors combined with (deep learning) algorithms appeal to you? Do you like to work on wireless communication solutions for Lidar, Bluetooth or Ultra-Wideband or would you rather contribute to a new microprocessor platform for our next gen products? Join us at TOPIC! “My work challenges me and gives me the opportunity to learn something new every day. I like to dive into problems to find innovative solutions.” Mike van Zon | Senior Software Engineer at TOPIC Your job as senior embedded software engineer As a Senior Embedded Software Engineer at TOPIC you get to work on state-of-the-art R&D projects within different domains and technologies. From developing low level and middleware solutions for implantable devices, surgical robots or high-tech machine control, to developing applications for IOT and real time data visualization. You will work on the design and implementation of high quality software solutions. From proof of concept to the delivery of a market ready product. Memory management and performance optimization are essential in the embedded systems that we develop. Your tasks and responsibilities: design, implementation and verification of subsystems, modules and components; write high quality, structured code; maintaining and debugging existing software solutions; sparring partner for peers and stakeholders in- and outside of the team; participate in meetings (standup, sprint planning, retrospective, design/architectural sessions) and sharing your thoughts and ideas; code review and coaching of (junior) engineers; depending on your ambitions and desires for personal growth, we will support you in shaping your future and let you take on more responsibilities as you grow in seniority. you have a Masters or Bachelor's degree in Embedded Systems, (applied) Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics and/or Mathematics; you have at least 6 years of experience in (embedded) software development on platforms like Linux and Windows. you are an expert in using (modern) C++ and in addition you have experience in programming languages such as C, Python and/or Matlab. you are familiar with methodologies and techniques as O.O., UML, Design Patterns, Agile and TDD; you have excellent oral and written command of the English language. Command of the Dutch language is considered to be a bonus. Our Offer TOPIC is committed to make the world a little better healthier and smarter every day. Not only for our customers but also for the members of our TOPIC family for whom passion for technical innovation is key! This will make you smarter : challenging and interesting projects in different domains; benefit from the expertise of your technical buddy and more than 100 smart colleagues; focus on guiding and coaching on personal development to achieve your ambitions; annual study budget and customized training program within our TOPIC Academy; tech events and knowledge sessions. This will make you better : contract for indefinite period of time; an all-in employee benefit package (€50.000 – €68.000 annually): incl. competitive gross salary, net cost allowance, mobility package, 13th month payment, holiday allowance; good secondary employment conditions: i.a. 26 vacation days (opportunity to buy extra days), pension scheme and relocation budget. This will keep you healthy : a good work-life balance, flexible working hours and hybrid way of working; an inspiring office environment with daily fresh fruit and a gym; the home office support package will turn your “home office” into an inspiring environment; lots of fun during events like celebrations, sport activities and the weekly Friday afternoon drinks. Our organization Since 1996 we have been developing (embedded) systems that are essential for products manufactured by renowned high-tech companies around the world. Our projects involve edge to cloud solutions; from PCB design and FPGA to low level embedded software and application software for UI, Web, Mobile and cloud. We are well known for our high level of knowledge and expertise and are proud to be aPremier Adaptive Computing Partner of AMD; Technology leader in the field of System on Chips and FPGAs. #LI-Hybrid #LI-Hybrid

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: This role will not offer work permit/visa sponsorship and is only open to candidates with full working rights for The Netherlands and preferably already living here. Our client has been developing (embedded) systems for renowned high-tech companies around the world for almost 30 years. Projects involve edge to cloud solutions; from PCB design and FPGA to low level embedded software and application software for UI, Web, Mobile and cloud. They are well known for the high level of knowledge and expertise and proud to be a Premier Design Services Partner of AMD Xilinx; technology leader in the field of System-on-Chips and FPGAs. The role As Senior Software Engineer you are part of a scrum team and will work on various types of projects for different domains like industrial, medical or IOT. These are often edge-to-cloud projects where sensors are controlled to obtain data. You will be involved in data analysis, interpretation, storage (cloud) & optimization, predictability (AI) and visualization (front-end). Tasks and responsibilities Design, implementation and verification of subsystems, modules and components; Maintaining and debugging existing software solutions; Write high quality, robust, structured code; Participate in meetings (e.g. stand-up, sprintplanning, retrospective, design/architectural sessions) and share your thoughts and ideas to help move the project forward; Sparring partner for peers and stakeholders inside and outside the team; Code review & guidance of (junior) engineers; Depending on your ambitions and desires for personal growth, we will support you in shaping your future and enable you to take on more responsibilities as you grow in seniority. Requirements You have a Master or Bachelor's degree in (applied) Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Embedded Systems, Physics and/or Mathematics; You have 5+ years’ experience in O.O. programming within the high-tech domain. You have Excellent knowledge and command of C++. Preferably you are experienced in other technologies such as Python, C, C#, complex databases, front-end technologies like React and cloud technologies such as AWS or Azure; You are used to writing high quality code and are familiar with methodologies and techniques as UML, Design Patterns, Agile and TDD; You have excellent oral and written command of the English language, knowledge of the Dutch language would be a big plus; Offered Our client is committed to make the world a little better healthier and smarter every day. Not only for their customers but also for the all the team members for whom passion for Technical innovation is key! This will make you even smarter: challenging and interesting projects in different domains; benefit from the expertise of your technical buddy and more than 100 smart colleagues; focus on guiding and coaching on personal development to achieve your ambitions; annual study budget and customized training program within our TOPIC Academy; tech events and knowledge sessions. This will make you even better: contract for indefinite period of time; an all-in employee benefit package (€50.000 – €68.000 annually): incl. competitive gross salary, net cost allowance, mobility package, 13th month payment, holiday allowance; good secondary employment conditions: i.a. 26 vacation days (opportunity to buy extra days), pension scheme and relocation budget. This will keep you healthy: a good work-life balance, flexible working hours and hybrid way of working; an inspiring office environment with daily fresh fruit and a gym; the home office support package will turn your “home office” into an inspiring environment; lots of fun during events like celebrations, sport activities and the weekly Friday afternoon drinks.

title: Operational Excellence Specialist
description: The company Our client is a game-changer with a unique goal which is contributing to better care, such as the development of innovative therapies. Our client focuses mainly on patients with conditions for which few or no treatment options don’t exist, through the development of high-quality medicines. Role description As an Operational Excellence Specialist, your responsibilities encompass delivering key projects within agreed timelines, driving productivity initiatives within the Global Distribution Organization, implementing a culture of Continuous Improvement, anticipating change and initiating innovative Supply Chain concepts and services, and applying a data to analyze processes and realize improvements. Responsibilities -Overseeing and implementing established projects within the Operational Excellence strategy. -Conducting cross-functional problem-solving and process improvement workshops. -Defining, planning, and prioritizing tasks while ensuring thorough follow-up on outcomes in complex situations. -Providing support and guidance for project implementations. -Employing diverse data sources to blend, consolidate, and analyze data for streamlined delivery and reporting. Requirements -Master’s degree or equivalent in fields related to Supply Chain or Logistics, Business Administration, or Engineering. -2 years of directly relevant experience. -Skilled in visualization technologies like Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Smartsheet, or equivalent. -Demonstrated excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, coupled with a data-driven mindset. -Proven experience working in an international environment, showcasing the ability to effectively liaise and communicate with cross-functional teams. -Fluency in English, both in oral and written communication.

title: Operations Analyst
description: Why join Stryker? We are proud to be named one the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com Our total rewards package offering includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific. Know someone at Stryker? Be sure to have them submit you as a referrral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program The Job's Mission is: The Sales Operation Analyst is responsible for data stewardship and analysis - providing data insights and improving the sales process within Stryker. Part of the Business Enablement Solutions Department – COE Analytics team, this is a key sales operations support role to help Stryker deliver its growth strategy in Europe. The Sales Operation Analyst works closely with the sales team to identify areas for improvement, implement new processes and tools and enable standardized sales KPI reporting by geographies, products, customers, and sales reps. The Sales Operations Analyst will also work with other departments, such as marketing, finance, incentive compensation, and operations, to ensure that sales activities are aligned with overall business goals. The EU Sales Operational Analyst will act as single point of contact for the sales team of a geographical region when building innovative, analytical sales operations processes & tools across. Moreover, the Sales Analyst will strongly collaborate with sales management of EU markets and together with the Divisional commercial Analysts as to give data-based consultancy during the yearly process of new sales territories & sales targets setting, including regular updates and advice on how to best leverage the tools at their disposal. The jobholder will have the opportunity to work in important activities in a very dynamic environment. This position offers excellent opportunities for personal development (depending on candidate motivation and competencies) working together with both local and RHQ stakeholders. Key Activities & Accountabilities: Responsible for delivering information, KPIs, standardized set of reports for supporting the respective Region commercial senior leadership; Engage in initiatives to drive governance of the European standardized sales dashboards. Manage and maintain accurate information in sales-related systems and tools (Apps), such as DSA, IC systems; Analyze Stryker commercial data and interact closely with Commercial Analysts , BI and divisional leaders to disseminate customer insights; Collect, consolidate, analyze and maintain data on account sales potentials; Collaborate with IT to build /test necessary infrastructure as required; Coordinate, validate, reconcile sales data in collaboration with the various business functions (Customer Service, Finance, MdM etc..) when needed, following a framework; Support territory management, end year target setting, commissions; Create and execute training programs for sales/marketing users for existing capabilities and processes Participate in cross-functional projects to drive sales performance and growth Coach and mentor junior team members Technical skills Degree in Business, IT or equivalent Familiarity with the office365 environment (Power BI, Power Automate, Excel, SharePoint, Planner etc.) Strong Excel, PowerBI and data visualization skills Good knowledge of the BI solutions including data model and information flow Ability to comprehensively understand master data, transactional and analytical data, sources and relationships Good written and verbal English Any other European language is an advantage Soft skills With a growth mindset, adept at learning continuously Share knowledge and develop junior colleagues Who finds happiness in solving problem Responsible, who take ownership of their work Collaborative, who build cross-functional relationships, and share knowledge Who is disruptive, and questions the status-quo Who is detail-oriented Who is flexible and has a can-do attitude With strong communication skills with the ability to present complex insights to Sales management About Stryker Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com

title: Strategic Accounts Support
description: We Are Denim Heads. We love denim. Live and breathe it. It’s in our DNA. At G-Star, we see no limit to what denim can do. We believe it can be force of progress and innovation for both people and planet. How? By hiring the most creative, curious and caring minds. People who think beyond fashion. Bringing big ideas to big challenges. Driven by possibility. Those who work hard, make mistakes, but always continue to grow. Denim is in our DNA, our people are our stitching. Join the denim heads making raw denim. NOTE: You need to have work authorization/study permit in The Netherlands – no immigration support is available for internships. Here’s what we’ll do together: Is your passion for denim as high as ours? In this internship, you will learn all about the ins and outs of our strategic accounts at a leading denim brand. Just Imagine.. The G-Star RAW Strategic Accounts Department is looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic intern with a hands-on mentality, who feels at home in a dynamic and fast-moving environment. The Strategic Accounts Department is part of the global e-commerce department and it drives the strategic business development and marketing plans for the top 2 accounts of G-STAR RAW. These accounts are fast growing online pure players. We are looking for an ambitious intern who works in an organized and accurate manner. Someone who thrives in a fast-pace environment, and is eager to take responsibility for his/her tasks and projects. This is an excellent opportunity to learn all about the ins and outs of (digital) retail and marketing at a leading denim brand. You will be based at our global HQ in Amsterdam. Tasks & Responsibilities: As our new Intern Strategic Accounts Zalando, you will help with Coordinating seasonal/weekly product management execution, involving managing different internal and external stakeholders. Maintaining a data hub for our performance and starting looking into trends and improvement opportunities. Reporting weekly the trade performance across all business models, analysis and data insights. Building best practice cases from external and internal initiatives and bring learnings to improve way of working. Supporting team with execution of the partner program strategy and alignment across different channels and countries. Supporting team with execution of ad-hoc and cross-department projects. Maintaining the commercial calendar. What you bring to the table: You have strong numeracy and have skills in Excel (reporting and handling big data amounts, executing pivots and other analysis). You have strong analytical, data visualization and PowerPoint skills. Are digital and commercial minded with affinity for fashion and denim. Not scared of deadlines or working under pressure. You are able to handle multiple projects simultaneously. If you are a non-EU student you are in possession of a mandatory internship assignment from your university or college and you are enrolled at a Dutch university or college. You are already living in the Netherlands and (you are prepared to) have a Dutch health insurance. You are able and willing to sponsor your own daily travel costs. You are full-time available for 5-6 months starting February 2024. Fashion? You live and breathe it. You are enrolled in a Bachelor/Master in Business Administration or economics. Finally, do you have an autonomous and independent working attitude? Do you have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English? We’d love to meet you! What we bring to the table: Next to a compensation of €600 for your internship, working at G-Star brings so many perks and exciting opportunities, we don’t know where to begin… How about an awesome and diverse team that collaborates to inspire; a work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation and a clothing budget of €400 to buy the latest G-Star items! To keep up the greatness we also offer you a healthy, fresh, and delicious lunch in our HQ in Amsterdam! Here's what will happen next: Use the apply button below to submit your application. We will thoroughly review your application. We have an international community at G-Star, so please apply in English. When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will call you for a chat and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our first interview. When we’re ready to commit to each other, we will congratulate you on your brand new internship and discuss the next steps. We look forward to see you on the onboarding day

title: Data Analyst
description: To enhance the Data Analytics capabilities, we are currently looking for a Business Data Analyst to join the Commercial Finance Team of this organisation. Apply now. De functie To enhance the Data Analytics capabilities, we are currently looking for a Business Data Analyst to join the Commercial Finance Team of this organisation. In this role, you will help Sales, Sourcing, Product Development, Marketing and Finance teams to work on the most optimal pricing of the overall product portfolio, as well as become a key person to help us on the journey towards excellence in Data Intelligence. You will be working alongside Sr Pricing Manager, two Commercial Finance Controllers, Master Data Specialist and Pricing Data Analyst, reporting to Commercial Finance Director. What are you going to do? Your responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, the following: Business data analytics: Support Commercial Finance Director in implementation and maintenance of operational and strategic data analytics within the commercial area; Identify trends and patterns in complex datasets; Proactively identify improvements to internal processes, to improve revenue, margin, ROI, etc.; Independently initiate, shape and prepare investigations or projects, focusing on improving PF Concept's decisiveness and competitiveness; Data processing and visualization: Extract and join product and customer data from various systems (e.g. local ERP, SAP BO) and construct user-friendly summary tables, graphs and dashboards; Support the creation of presentation decks using PowerPoint (or similar); System infrastructure and data quality: Quality assurance and data cleansing, using MS Excel; Actively drive the implementation of Power BI software and, ultimately, become the main superuser of the tool; Proactively identify data improvement opportunities. Jouw profiel ﻿ BA or masters in Finance and/or Data Analytics, computer science, information systems, mathematics, machine learning, or similar (or a data analytics certification acquired through a specific program); Excellent command of written and spoken English. Minimum of 5 years of experience in the area of (Business) Data Analytics; Experience working with large datasets; Advanced knowledge of Excel - ability to use spreadsheets, graphing, tables, calculations, and automation efficiently to process large quantities of data relevant to business tasks; Familiarity with tools and languages such as Tableau or Power BI, SQL and Python, as well as data visualization, is a strong preference; You are commercially minded, energetic and passionate about achieving outstanding results. Ability to create databases from scratch and to develop existing frameworks; Strong head for math and statistics, a deep interest in problem-solving, and exceptional attention to detail; Excellent communication skills and ability to work both independently, as well as part of a team; You are methodical, accurate in your work and an excellent researcher, while consistently applying critical thinking and have ability and desire to collaborate with others. You already live in the Netherlands and hold a valid work permit. Bedrijfsprofiel Our client is the B2B Product Media expert and trusted partner for companies. And as the world is constantly changing, they keep thinking forward! They want to support you through the sustainable transition of the Product Media industry. They always select their products with care and guarantee a transparent supply chain. With many categories ranging from drink ware to technology, from clothing and bags to home and from stationery & writing to umbrellas and sports & leisure. It employs around 800 people across locations in Europe and Shanghai. The horizontal organisational structure helps ensure that any contacts with other departments are quickly established. It is also worth noting that this company was originally a trade organisation and has huge growth ambitions. You therefore feel comfortable in an international, dynamic and sales-oriented environment, where open communication and informal dealings are key. Commuting : best reached by private transport. There is a direct 40-minute bus connection from Leiden Central Station and from Schiphol Airport to this company's location. From Hoofddorp, there is a 30-minute direct bus connection. Het aanbod Besides a pleasant working atmosphere, a place to grow your talents, a flat organization with an open culture, where one’s own input and initiative is rewarded, we offer you: Good salary that matches with the knowledge and experience you bring; Annual bonus to celebrate our success, when we achieved our results; Laptop and the option to work partially from home fully equipped and with extra budget for a good working place; 25 (or more) holidays, a premium-free pension, money to celebrate your birthday, travel allowance for every kilometer you travel and more; Extensive learning and (personal) development possibilities, including a wide range of online courses via Goodhabitz; Allowances to keep you fit and healthy, free fruit and every day different lunch options available at rock bottom prices; A dynamic and inspiring world of product media products and gifts which you can buy in their own shop; Never a dull moment! If you want more information, call Ritsa Paraskevopoulou 06-27370489. She will be happy to speak with you. You already live in the Netherlands and hold a valid work permit. Exactpi refnr.: 4385.

title: Student Assistant
description: How brave are you? We are a high-tech company providing machine tools and laser technology, and are looking for people who can face new challenges with a fresh mind. As an independent family company, we offer you the freedom and trust to put your brave ideas into practice. With you on board, we would like to power ahead with the digital networking of the manufacturing industry. Our passion and creative drive ensure that we are an innovative force – across the globe at over 80 TRUMPF locations. At our site in Ulm in cooperation with the site in Eindhoven, a fast-growing and future-oriented high-tech company within the TRUMPF Group, we develop and produce photonic components (VCSEL, photodiodes) for our international customers on the basis of semiconductor processes. Our high-quality, future-oriented products from the fields of consumer electronics, industry and communications can be found in future fields such as smartphones, autonomous driving systems or digital data transmission. Your tasks: Verification and testing of the functionality of VCSEL and photodiodes as well as laser and sensor modules Participation in data evaluations and data analysis Operation of measuring instruments in the measurement laboratory Assistance with product inspection and product testing What we are looking for: Current studies (Bachelor's/Master's) in the field of communication technology, physics, electronics, microtechnology or comparable courses of study First hands-on experience in data analysis and data visualization Ideally, initial basic knowledge in the field of process automation Reliable, independent and meticulous way of working 8 - 16 hours per week / 6 months Working in a dynamic, young, high-tech company What we offer: State-of-the-art working environment with the latest technology Early assumption of responsibility and varied tasks Extensive range of training and further education opportunities Respectful and appreciative corporate culture Employee Discounts Complimentary coffee and water Flexible working hours Have we convinced you? Please send your online application to Nicole Bucher. If you have any questions, please contact us / our recruiting team at Tel.: +49(0)731 550 194 049. All of our advertised positions are currently still vacant.

title: Global Services Specialist
description: General Purpose: As an Assistant Manager Insights Global Consumer Services at adidas you are responsible for ensuring that we deliver a premium consumer service experience for our consumers who bought through eCom and in adidas retail stores and drive operating model which supports a membership first outlook. Your task is to support our global Insights process together with strong focus on driving improvements in our landscape. Consumer Services is the voice of the consumer and Consumer is at the heart of everything we do. Operational excellence, speed, accuracy, and consumer experience are the key topics in the Digital operations function and an integral part of our eCom strategy. Key focus of the role is managing the Consumer Services data foundation setup within adidas analytics ecosystem as well as analysing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights that will help improve the overall consumer experience. This role is part of COE (Community of Experts), where you are part of the community of Consumer Service experts from EU and other markets, share best practices and seek opportunities to build the best consumer experience for adidas consumers across the globe in the most efficient and sustainable way. In addition to other e-com markets, your key partners are our Consumer Services Vendors, who run day-to-day call center operations, as well as internal stakeholders such as Digital Product, Digital Analytics teams, SCM, and IT to ensure we continuously implement improvements through journey optimization. Key Responsibilities: Analytics - In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to dive deep into the Consumer Journey and Experiences across touchpoints to gather insights on the impact of our consumer facing activities on consumer engagement, loyalty, and sales. Tasks may include: Deliver standard analytics services by collecting, tracking, mining, and analyzing data and generating fact-based insights, with a focus (but not exclusively) on Consumer Services KPIs. Provide analytics services to stakeholders using various tools and data sources. Support key business stakeholders’ alignment to ensure and enable completion of projects. Support data analysis on unstructured data (Text analytics) which could be including sentiment analysis or other methodologies when appropriate Reporting & Visualization: Help to co-create the self-service analytics tools for our stakeholders. Support & maintain the existing reporting structure. Support implementing new reporting structures when appropriate Identify creative ways of automating and increasing efficiencies in recurring reporting needs across the team. Consulting: Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered insights. Translate gathered insights into engaging, actionable, and easy to digest insights presentations. Be the POC for the Digital Operations, Analytics teams, and local market teams for specific queries and oversee regular sessions for best practice sharing Support monitoring the use of delivered insights and measure the impact/benefit of those insights on business. Build and maintain a strong stakeholder network with high level of trust that facilitates action-ability of insights. Innovation: Explore newly available datasets to serve consumer insights use cases as we continue our data democratization journey as an organization. Support developing best practices and share insights, tooling, and analytical methodologies across COE Market teams worldwide – take the lead when there is an opportunity. Be a supporting member in a wide range of projects and topics such as insights extraction, analytics implementation, consumer journey and experience analytics, qualitative data, etc. Data Governance: Create and maintain data dictionaries and clean inventory of Consumer Service analytics assets. Support definitions and measurements alignment across teams and regions. Support in keeping the data quality top notch, clean and reliable in different data storages by owning and advocating your KPI’s and initiate new requests when needed to track new operations elements. Key Relationships: Digital Consumer Operations teams Consumer Excellence & Partnership Operations Scalability & Growth EU & Global Digital Analytics teams Advanced Analytics Product & IT Ops External vendors SCM Other eCom Teams Requirements, Education & Professional Experience: University degree in the field of Analytics, Marketing, Business or equivalent 2+ years of experience in Analytics Experience in eCommerce environment Experience with consumer centric work environment & operations Soft-Skills: Passion for delivering data-based recommendations for quantifiable improvements in business results and consumer experience. Ability to understand and analyze complex systems and transform them into simpler structures. Strong communication skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to stakeholders at various organizational levels both in person and remotely Good presentation skills and storytelling Consumer first mentality & mindset Self-motivated and able to work independently. Collaboration skills, critical thinker, logical and pragmatic team player Hard-Skills: Experience with quantitative analytical tools and methodologies. Advanced skills and previous experience in working with SQL. Experience with visualization techniques and data analysis tool(s) - Power BI Basic Experience with ETL tools and automation techniques is a plus. Previous experience with Python is a plus - e.g., statistical analysis & data manipulation. Basic Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud is a plus. Project Management skills, including the ability to work on several projects simultaneously. Proficient in MS Office - expert with MS Excel Fluent in English both verbally and written. Text and qualitative analytics experience is a plus AT ADIDAS WE HAVE A WINNING CULTURE. BUT TO WIN, PHYSICAL POWER IS NOT ENOUGH. JUST LIKE ATHLETES OUR EMPLOYEES NEED MENTAL STRENGTH IN THEIR GAME. WE FOSTER THE ATHLETE’S MINDSET THROUGH A SET OF BEHAVIORS THAT WE WANT TO ENABLE AND DEVELOP IN OUR PEOPLE AND THAT ARE AT THE CORE OF OUR UNIQUE COMPANY CULTURE: THIS IS HOW WE WIN WHILE PLAYING FAIR. COURAGE: Speak up when you see an opportunity; step up when you see a need.. OWNERSHIP: Pick up the ball. Be proactive, take responsibility and follow-through. INNOVATION: Elevate to win. Be curious, test and learn new and better ways of doing things. TEAMPLAY: Win together. Work collaboratively and cultivate a shared mindset. INTEGRITY: Play by the rules. Hold yourself and others accountable to our company’s standards. RESPECT: Value all players. Display empathy, be inclusive and show dignity to all. ADIDAS CELEBRATES DIVERSITY, SUPPORTS INCLUSIVENESS AND ENCOURAGES INDIVIDUAL EXPRESSION IN OUR WORKPLACE. WE DO NOT TOLERATE THE HARASSMENT OR DISCRIMINATION TOWARD ANY OF OUR APPLICANTS OR EMPLOYEES. WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. JOB TITLE: Assistant Manager - Insights Global Consumer Services - (Temp 12 Months) BRAND: adidas LOCATION: Amsterdam TEAM: Digital STATE: NH COUNTRY/REGION: NL CONTRACT TYPE: Limited Duration NUMBER: 505166 DATE: Dec 1, 2023

title: Product Manager
description: In samenwerking met DTACT zoeken wij een Product Manager in Utrecht en omgeving! Functieomschrijving Define product features and requirements on product roadmap. Drive productization process and work closely with Data Science, Dev Ops, Client Services, and Operations teams. Lead a team of technical writers, product designers, QA engineers, and product educators. Collect feedback from stakeholders to bridge the gap between market needs and product offering Perform in-depth analysis of products and use quantitative insight to drive improvements in both quality and design. Design and drive quarterly Key Results for your team that support Company objectives. Create dashboards, set team goals, track performance, and investigate unforeseen changes. Communicate effectively by preparing and presenting decks to various stakeholders. Hier gaan we vanuit 3+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in data products. Strong analytical skills and experience with data driven product design, decentralized data mesh, and virtual data warehouse. Strong database storage, querying, and data visualization skills (i.e. SQL, PostgreSQL). Strong collaboration skills with an Agile approach. Strong communication skills, ability to document requirements and work collaboratively. Proven leadership skills. Ability to effectively communicate technical feedback to a diverse group of stakeholders including customers. Certified Scrum Master is a plus Arbeidsvoorwaarden €7500 - €8333 bruto per maand Flexibele werktijden Laptop Pensioen Training Over DTACT: DTACT is a Dutch software company with four unique patent-pending software solutions that can be managed from a single platform as a service (or console if on-premise or air-gapped deployed). Integrate or connect disparate systems and data silos in a one-of-its-kind dynamic decentralized data mesh construct, avoiding costly data warehouse or system integration (ETL) and never ending maintenance projects. Our solution allows the application of data science and AI methodologies across systems or silos to generate cross-dimensional insights, unlocking the full potential of users’ systems and data instantly. Repeat this process as much as you like to look at the same (or more) data from new or different perspectives or with appliance or experimentation of new technology you currently don’t have... over and over... completely agnostic to anything. Opgericht in 2017 Werkzaam in de Computersoftware. Werkzaam in 4 kantoren.

title: Frontend Developer
description: Medior Front-End Specialist - 40 uur per week - Start: z.s.m. - Regio: Utrecht Functie Als Front-End Specialist werk je op het kruispunt van bedrijfsanalyse, gegevensmodellering en gegevensvisualisatie. Aanbod Een mooi salaris afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring; Onbeperkt educatiebudget; Een lease auto of reiskostenvergoeding; Een leuke en uitdagende functie in een energiek, ambitieus en internationaal team. title: Analytics Intern
description: Overview: Getting to Know PepsiCo: Pepsi Max, Lay’s, Quaker, Cheetos, 7Up, Doritos, sounds tasty and great fun right ?! That’s also what an internship at PepsiCo is! Joining a crispy team with salted opinion where going the extra mile and vibrant thinking are encouraged. Be bold, find your spark and taste one of our internships! First Gen Internship: Graduated or finishing up the last leads? Excited to finally make an impact and work with fantastic and tasty brands? Totally in the mood for the kick off of your career within the most dynamic and vibrant sector: FMCG?! What are you waiting for, you won’t get bored ! Every 6 months PepsiCo Northern Europe is looking for YOU – the greatest young talent. What is it exactly?! Well, in short, you will be full time occupied with projects, responsibilities and learnings we will offer you. Indeed, not only on-the-job learning but we will also develop you into a true professional. What that means? Mentoring sessions, a buddy program, skills training, consistent feedback, no kidding, you will rock . Whoever you are (sparkly, salty, spicy, the dip to our Doritos or the bubbles for our Sodastream), you are more than welcome within our international, diverse and inclusive culture ‍ ‍ ️ ️! And don’t worry, you will not be alone in this amazing story, you will be together with 30 other PepsiCo lovers to enjoy our FIRST GEN ride ! A Data & Analytics internship, sounds as your can of Pepsi?! Then free up your agenda from 29th January 2024 Job Perks That'll Rock Your World: You bet! This internship pays you €550 every month, and that's not all – you get travel reimbursement too! (only for NL internships) ✈️ Craving some extra time off? Well, guess what? Your holidays are sorted! Flex your hours – One of the best things about working for PepsiCo is our flexibility. Training for the next marathon ‍ ️ or just a night owl or early bird, you decide how you divide your day. Monthly office vibes: Don't miss out on our office events and activities! We cannot wait to welcome you within the team. Have you seen our offices yet, they are brand new! Prefer working from home? We will provide you of a ‘working-from-home toolkit’. Not to forget: Friends for life ‍ ️ & chips and snacks every day! Responsibilities: What you will learn as a Data & Analytics intern: Create high-quality analyses, presentations, and dashboards, mastering advanced visualization and storytelling Develop collaboration skills by working in global cross-functional teams and translating business requirements into analytical solutions Gain expertise in guiding the building of data & analytics models and explaining them to non-technical audiences Act as a product owner in an agile development framework, managing day-to-day work and ensuring project success Develop and continuously improve tools and solutions for commercial advanced analytics use cases Become a data & analytics evangelist, engaging in advanced analytics forums and initiatives to build a data-led culture at PepsiCo Qualifications: Job essentials: Master’s or Bachelor’s student, or a fresh graduate, preferably in a business and/or a quantitative field like Statistics or Data Science Fluent in English Proactive, with good communication and interpersonal skills Excellent analytical and data visualisation skills (e.g. PowerBI), with a natural ability to extract insights from data and make recommendations Intellectually curious, with an interest in how analytics, data science, machine learning and AI can be leveraged to derive business value Your recruitment journey: Phone screening by one of our fantastic recruiters Interview at our new office Offer: you are hired! ✍️ Welcome at PepsiCo! PepsiCo in a Nutshell: Our vision? We're all about being the global leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods, and we're doing it with the power of pep+. Pep+ is our game-changing strategy that's all about putting sustainability and our incredible team at the core of how we create value and drive growth. We're all about staying within our planet's boundaries and igniting positive transformations for the world and its people. Want more info? Check out www.pepsico.com.

title: Engineer
description: Does this sound like you? Your passion is data and analytics. You want to create value at our clients by uncovering, organizing, and making sense of data. You understand that it is important to build robust solutions. You feel comfortable to operate in the sweet spot between business and engineering. How you will help to create value with Data & AI At Xebia, we help build data & AI practices that deliver value to both our clients and their customers. In the past, our team of data professionals has predicted the daily demand for millions of loaves of bread, advanced energy-saving algorithms to nationwide scale, and set up data innovation labs at large multinationals. We have already enjoyed great success in making the top companies AI-driven – just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team! What you will do to make organizations AI-driven The Analytics Engineer is the bridge between business and engineering, and you understand what data can bring to the organization. With your strong communication skills, you help uncover business needs and how to support that with data, reporting and visualization. You use software engineering best practices to write production-grade ETL pipelines, making high-quality data available for creating business value with analytics. You take a pragmatic approach to rapidly building visualizations and dashboards, allowing everyone to get actionable insights from the data. THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF… You’re trained as a data analyst or scientist but have a deeper interest in software engineering than most. You’re a jack-of-all-trades that loves learning new skills, always trying out the latest in data crunching tools. You’ve excellent visualization chops, can write efficient SQL queries and know basic programming in Python. THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF… You always take the academic approach to data and analytics and find it hard to be pragmatic. You solely want to work as either analytics translator, data scientist or data engineer. You dislike giving training, organizing workshops and getting to know the needs of the business.

title: Market Analyst
description: What will you be doing? As Market intelligence analyst , you will work in our Insights and Strategic Services team with ~15 motivated colleagues from a wide variety of backgrounds and experience levels. In addition to direct team members, you work closely with our colleagues from the commercial teams to deliver the highest quality insights and services to our clients, and with colleagues from the product and tech teams to leverage the learnings you gained during projects into new features and value creators for our platform. At A-INSIGHTS, we help our clients in the agrifood industry make decisions data-driven, leveraging our industry expertise with a wide variety of data sources to provide a substantiated view on competitor and market developments. As a member of the Insights team, you work closely with internal and external stakeholders to maximize the value of the data by translating it into actionable insights and foresights. In short, you’ll be: Translating large volumes of data into actionable insights. Combining data with industry expertise to generate foresights. Pro-actively spotting opportunities to improve our solution and drive implementation Taking ownership of insights and foresights generation in customer projects ‍ Projects you’ll be working on For example, you might find yourself determining the addressable market for a business unit of a large agricultural company in support of an investment decision. Combining public sources such as agricultural statistics and trade flows with our internal industry expertise, you devise two methods to approximate the market size and projected growth in a selection of core countries. Core to the project is close collaboration with country managers from the client, who help validate findings and provide additional context to bring the project to the level needed for the presentation to the executive board. In another project, your consumer foods client is preparing for a 5-year strategy review and looking for an independent, outside-in perspective on their performance. After aligning on the scope, you draft a report, benchmarking the client company with direct peers on multiple axes such as financial performance and sustainability efforts, adding value with our data-driven view on the market outlook and the clients positioning for expected developments. To deliver the insights, you present your findings for the board of directors during the strategy review. ‍ We are looking for Someone: With a master’s degree, preferably in business administration, finance or data analytics With 1-3 years experience in a data or analytics environment. Experience in the agrifood sector is preferred That is passionate about data analysis Skilled in Excel, experience with visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) and data analytics tools (Python, SQL) is preferred That is fluent in English ‍ Who you will be working with Miriam Head of Operations Jurre Junior Analyst Celina Senior Analyst What we offer you ‍ A salary between €3086-3858 gross per month 8% holiday allowance Participation in our company bonus program Hybrid working: we work 2-4 days a week from the office Being part of successful data driven scale-up Swap-bike ‍ The application process Apply to this vacancy Any questions about working at A-INSIGHTS and the position? Contact Mathieu Geuskens via mathieu.geuskens@a-insights.eu First round: online skill-based assessment Second round: interview in our Amsterdam office Party time: your offer! Got energized? Is this vacancy really something for you and are you our new colleague? Then apply and we will contact you soon! ‍ About A-INSIGHTS A-Insights is the fastest growing company and market intelligence platform in the market. Trusted and loved by some of the world's largest companies (Bayer, McCain, Ahold, Royal Friesland Campina), we combine worldwide publicly available company and market data with the latest domain & tech expertise. Our goal is to set the international standard for objective company performance insights based on publicly available data, with a focus on the global Food&Agriculture Value Chain. Making impact on the world's total food supply by clearing unbiased decisions in rather conservative board rooms. And our journey is just getting started! We made a pivot in 2020 by transforming our consultancy business to a true Saas-product, attracted our first investors to get things going and are now growing @ 60% YoY. And that Determined to reach 10 Mio ARR before 2025. We are building a team of passionate and talented people who are eager to contribute to this growth and help us write our story. Ready? Thank you for considering this opportunity. We are excited to meet talented candidates who are passionate about our company and the role. We look forward to receiving your application and learning more about your experience and qualifications. Got questions about this job? If you have any questions, you can always contact Mathieu Geuskens at mathieu.geuskens@a-insights.eu

title: Data Engineer
description: We love to see people grow. We empower our product teams, farmers, dealers & suppliers to move forward. Driving the digital future of Kramp Group by discovering and building great products, making life easy for our customers. Kramp Group discovers and builds e-commerce, supply chain & data science solutions that are aimed at giving the ag-tech industry a push forward. We’re building a digital platform, serving thousands of customers, and generating a turnover of over one billion euros per year. Our Data vision is to provide a centralized entry point for data to be used on self-service platforms that unlock the full potential of Data for Kramp Group, ensuring data accessibility, quality, and value generation across all departments in a unified way. The mission of a Data Engineer role is to accelerate the rollout of our Cloud Data Warehouse and make an impact on how data and technology are used to provide next-generation tools to an organization. You will be part of Data Office which is an international cross-functional team, combining: Data Governance; BI Development; Software Development; Data Science. The team is in the transformation from an on-premise data warehouse to a Google Cloud Platform-based data warehouse (DWH). This DWH builds the foundation of Kramp's self-service analytics platform feeding different targets as: Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau); Data-driven e-commerce applications; Kramp's Machine Learning platform. What we offer: The Data Office is international, and cross-functional team, combining Business Intelligence, Pricing Management, Data Science, and Software Development; Working within Agile SCRUM Methodologies and the Atlassian toolchain (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git); To build our state-of-the-art cloud data warehouse, we use Python, Java, BigQuery SQL, other Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Build, Data transfers, Workflows, Schedulers and Functions; Making use of Dataform, Terraform & CDKTF and Data Modelling Tools; You will get deep insights into the work at an international wholesaler being in the middle of the digital transformation, you can contribute and make a real impact; And a lot of freedom to initiate new ideas and develop these further. Some facts about us: We follow the philosophy of "You build it, you own it, you love it." We believe in empowering individuals to take control of their own growth, with guidance provided. Our colleagues come from 66 different countries, creating an inclusive and open-minded environment. Transparent environment, mature management team with clear vision and specific goals, and open to feedback. Kramp Group is a healthy and financially stable company. What else we bring to the table: 25 vacation days and 12 ATV days (based on a full time contract). Flexible working policy in hours and location (with offices in Utrecht and Varsseveld). Travel and working from home allowance. Profit sharing bonus. Learning budget for training and courses to support your growth ambitions. Generous pension plan. Who are you? Openness to engage in continuous learning and agility in addressing business challenges; Experience in designing, developing, documenting, and maintaining software written in Python and/or Java as well as dataflows written in SQL; Knowledge of different Data Modelling principles and selecting the right one depending on the needs of a consumer; Feeling comfortable working with Linux, git, and Docker to extend and maintain our CI/CD workflows and pipelines or are you eager to dive into this topic; Experience in working in cloud environments (preferably GCP or AWS); Experience or knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code applications like Terraform and data transformation tools as dbt and Dataform; Cultural awareness, sensitivity, and adaptability in building connections with people from diverse backgrounds; Excel conceptual thinking and a proactive approach to decision-making, taking ownership to ensure project success. Who are we? Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and supply chain innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA. Working at Kramp means … you belong here! Being part of our open business community … your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters … you will develop and realize! Learn and realize your potential More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl Procedure and contact Do you see yourself in this role but don't hit every requirement? That's okay! Apply anyway. This is a great chance for you to grow and learn. Don't hesitate to reach out to Julia Bodun julia@kramphub.com if you have any questions. N.B. External recruiters/agencies we'd appreciate it if you'd let us reach out to you if we need help. At the moment, this is not the case. Utrecht (NL) Varsseveld (NL)

title: Product Owner
description: Position Title: Global Digital Product Owner Position Type: Regular - Full-Time Requisition ID: 26086 The Digital Product Owner is responsible for driving the creation, enhancement, and sustainment of digital technologies that drive automation, digitization and analytics in our agriculture business processes, across multiple regions and markets. The Digital Product Owner plays a crucial role in the development of the business process, aligning with the Business Transformation Office (BTO), and regional stakeholders and translating the business process into a supporting product vision, strategy, features and prioritization. This includes gathering business requirements, collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders, defining product features, and designing through the lens of enhancing end-user digital experience and ensuring timely delivery of high-quality products. The Product Owner is responsible for ensuring the successful launch of the product, the creation of business value, and the adoption of the product globally. This role will focus on digitalizing one or more agriculture business processes with a key focus on the Contracting and Seed Management business process. This includes end-to-end contract life cycle management from sourcing to payment to supplier digitally including an understanding of contract terms, pricing conditions, payment terms, and digital signature. The Product Owner will continue to identify opportunities for innovation and ensure the product remains competitive in the market with the latest tools, technology trends, and emerging practices. The Product Owner is also responsible for understanding the capabilities of the digital technologies selected for the build of the digital tools and works closely with the Digital Delivery Team from the Technology department. Academic Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Engineering/Science Ideal candidate will have Agriculture Business Experience Technical Experience Requirements: Digital Product Development Business Process Mapping Product Vision, Roadmap, Features, and Visualization Experience Data Analysis Salesforce.com Implementation Experience Working With Multiple Regions Ideal Candidate will also have experience in UX Design and Agriculture Product Development Related Work Experience: Minimum of four years of Business Consulting / Digital Product Development Strong background in developing business processes and translating them into product features Life cycle management/supplier management experience including pricing conditions, contract, and payment terms Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with key stakeholders Experience in creating and influencing change This is a hybrid role and will be based out of one of our European corporate office locations in either France, Belgium, Netherlands, United Kingdom, or Poland. With global product development, you will be working wtih remote teams in different locations and will also require occasional international travel. McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse, antiracist, inclusive, merit-based, and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger. McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Privacy Policy Job Family: Agriculture; Information Technology Location(s): NL - Netherlands : Flevoland : Lelystad || BE - Belgium : Antwerp : Berchem || BE - Belgium : Antwerp : Grobbendonk || BE - Belgium : Other : Reference job description || BE - Belgium : West Flanders : Kortrijk || BE - Belgium : West Flanders : Ostend || BE -
