title: Insights & Analytics Lead
description: By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. Job Description People First - At Takeda we are dedicated to improving the health and well-being of all people and bringing them the hope of a brighter future. It is our passion that transforms every job into meaningful action. Our people are the heart of Takeda . Within our Strategy & Operations department, we are looking for an experienced Insights & Analytics Lead at the location Hoofddorp, Netherlands. You will be working in a team of 3 Insights & Analytics ( I&A) leads and will directly report into the Head of Strategy & Operations. The I&A team works closely together with the other functions within Strategy & Operations as well as with the commercial Business Units in the Dutch LOC. Your tasks in detail: Identify, propose and evaluate business opportunities (e.g., product, service, tools) and potential partners, ensuring alignment with Takeda’s core therapeutic and complementary area’s Define policies, tools and systems to maximize commercial effectiveness of the organization as well as proper monitoring of their activities Drive data driven strategy and mindset to improve fact-based decision making and by doing so positively impact the business objectives Leveraging data and KPIs to generate actionable insights for the different BU’s Have data available in a structured, automated way in an easy to access environment for the different internal stakeholders Support the organization to enhance its I&A capabilities to form a solid foundation of data ownership and insights driven activities Support the omni-channel strategy by defining /creating metrics/dashboards to get insights of effectiveness of various channels Support the launch-readiness planning and preparations for pipeline products. Provision of market insights to the Business Units for the formulation of product strategies through desk research and supervising and overseeing gathering of market research results Business planning and forecasting of new products and provide support in business planning existing products. Use internal & external information sources to provide insights into business performance and suggests area and methods of improving operations or leading to actionable business opportunities Development of policies and value metrics to monitor commercial strategy/activity and tracking of Business Performance to optimize return of investment and to provide insights; Support the OCE team in development of KPI’s/ metrics and analyze channel effectiveness. Responsible for the development and enhancement of reports / dashboards using multiple tools with a focus on Microsoft Power BI Maintain and optimize the data infrastructure behind our reporting systems (databases, master data management) Drafting and negotiation of agreements with other partners, working with external and internal agents and counsel when appropriate; Support the principles of agile way of working Ensure all activities/communications are in line with the latest compliance policies, Takeda’s and local rules and regulations. Your profile: Master degree >5 years of experience in the life sciences industry on a strategic and /or operational business level Deep knowledge of the Dutch Pharmaceutical market Deep knowledge of data analysis & visualization tools, (i.e. PowerBI, Excel) Fluent in English and preferably fluent in Dutch Knowledge of standards, procedures, policies and codes of conduct of Pharmaceutical Market Preferable experience in omnichannel customer engagement principles Preferable working experience in an agile environment Outstanding communication skills and ability to influence and work effectively with various business partnerships Demonstrated ability to convert Dutch pharmaceutical market and data analysis knowledge into successful activities High level of strategic and analytical thinking and an entrepreneurial mind-set combined with solid business acumen and strong financial insights Strong problem solving quantitative and analytical abilities Experience/knowledge of statistical modeling techniques Daring to challenge the status quo Strong project management skills Empowering our people to shine At Takeda, we earn the trust of society and our customers through our values of Takeda-ism: Integrity, Fairness, Honesty, Perseverance. We incorporate these values in everything we do. They represent who we are and how we act. They help us make decisions that we can be proud of today and in the future. We enable our employees to develop their full potential. As a global top employer, we offer exciting career paths, promote innovation and strive for top performance in everything we do. Takeda fosters an inclusive, collaborative and international work environment where our teams are united by their relentless commitment to our goal of improving people's health and creating a better future for the world. Learn more at takedajobs.com. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Takeda is committed to foster diversity, equity and inclusion. Hiring decisions are based entirely on qualifications and are made regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability. If you are interested in this opportunity, we look forward to receiving your application in English via our online tool! For further questions, please contact: Jennifer Kriedemann / Talent Acquisition Partner Email: Jennifer.Kriedemann@takeda.com Locations Hoofddorp, Netherlands Worker Type Employee Worker Sub-Type Regular Time Type Full time

title: Optimization Manager
description: Do you wish to play an active part in building healthy, sustainable environments? At Wavin, we have a ‘calling’ … to service. A purpose. To build healthy, sustainable environments. And where is our help most needed? The very places we live in: our cities. Our cities’ drinking water is leaking away, greenery has been disappearing, streets are flooding after heavy rainfall and its sewer systems are outdated, polluting our groundwater. It’s time to join forces and build long-lasting cities. It’s time for you to join our team! At Wavin, we engage and collaborate with city leaders, engineers, planners and installers to help make cities future-proof and buildings comfortable and energy-efficient. As a pioneer in sustainable water infrastructure, we focus on creating positive change in the world, guided by our purpose of Building Healthy, Sustainable Environments. We want to build a team of champions. That’s why Wavin is currently looking for a Product Portfolio Optimization Manager to join our team at Amsterdam Schiphol, the Netherlands, Wavin Nederland B.V. If you want to make a difference and work for a purpose-led company, please read on. Main purpose As the Product Portfolio Optimization Manager, you will manage the analytics of Product Portfolio, provide strategic insights into product portfolio optimization opportunities, calculate the impact of actions derived from the rationalization exercise, model rationalization scenarios and support data-driven discussions in the context of business operations, market dynamics and industry trends, to provide recommendations to enhance the overall performance and profitability. Support the implementation resulting from portfolio analysis, as well as the follow up of the implementation. This role needs to interact with many areas in the organization and align differing information from different functional areas. This role will also be providing insights for opportunities that may have trade-offs between efficiency and meeting market needs. This role requires travelling and regular presence on the Orbia B&I sites in EMEA to work with the local teams and mgt on portfolio optimization proposals Main Responsibilities Providing input in the development of an approach for portfolio rationalization reviews Document the approach for product rationalization Preparing and conducting data analysis for the portfolio rationalization exercises Data gathering: identify the data required for the analysis and consolidate data from various sources Data cleaning: structure, clean and standardize data to ensure its accuracy and reliability for analysis Data aggregation: aggregate data to the desired level of granularity Data validation: conduct a thorough validation of the data to ensure its integrity and identify any missing or incomplete information Data visualization: generate visualizations to uncover insights, detect patterns, and communicate findings efficiently Data analysis: undertake the analysis of the portfolio according to the guidelines and thresholds established and generating preliminary insights/recommendation for the analysis Facilitating product rationalization discussions and contributing to the decision-making process. Managing relationships with stakeholders to ensure effective implementation of data-driven insights. Providing insights for guidelines to assess the commercial implications of eliminating assortments/SKUs. Collaborating with relevant parties to assess implications and coordinate activities Creating modelling tools to assess portfolio rationalization scenario with input from all relevant parties. Identifying and mitigating potential risks associated with data analysis and interpretation. Provide templates and coordinate the elaboration of implementations plans of plans and following up the execution of agreed-upon activities. Develop and implement a dashboard for implementation follow-up Follow-up implementation progress. Our requirements Bachelors degree in Engineering/Economics (preferably) with 8-10 years of experience in strategy / operations / finance. Expert-level proficiency and proven track record of undertaking complex data analysis, interpretation, presentation, with a strong understanding of analytical tools and methodologies to drive decision making (advanced Excel and Power BI). Fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills to present complex information in a concise manner for technical and non-technical audiences. Experience in project management. Experience working with multi-disciplinary teams with demonstrated ability to create trusted relationship and partnerships. Experienced in elaborating executive presentations. Desirable qualifications (nice to have) Knowledge of the Building and Infrastructure product portfolio Experience in portfolio rationalization Knowledge of Spanish language Wavin offers Do you want to make a difference by building healthy, sustainable environments? As an international company requiring many different professional skills, we understand and celebrate diversity, inclusion and belonging. At Wavin, we encourage all our employees to develop their talent with great innovative programs, and to become the best version of themselves. Together, as a strong team, we grow, and deliver on our purpose every day. Wavin is the place to be if you truly wish to make an impact. In addition to working with an enthusiastic, professional team in an international environment, we offer a competitive compensation and benefit package. Organization Wavin is active in the building and construction industry across multiple continents. Wavin is part of Orbia, a community of companies bound together by a shared purpose: to advance life around the world. Wavin is backed up by 65+ years of expertise and works with 10’500+ employees in 37 countries worldwide. Wavin is the largest business group in Orbia. Orbia has commercial activities in 100+ countries, 21’000+ employees and 120 production sites. Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated and unsolicited applications from third parties will not be accepted.

title: Data Scientist
description: Job description We have an exciting position for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Advanced Machine Learning Team which forms part of the GM-ship of Artificial Intelligence in the VP-ship of Computational Science and Digital Innovation in Shell’s Projects and Technology organization. Our team works on developing Advanced Machine Learning solutions for various business problems across Shell’s lines of business, in particular gas and power trading, new energies and windfarm optimization. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work across project teams providing high-level guidance and oversight, as well as stepping in hands-on when needed. As a senior member of the team, you will be responsible for ensuring that we apply best practices in research and development and deliver solutions that deliver value to the end-users. You will be working with the stakeholders and subject matter experts of the various businesses as well as external strategic partners, both commercial and academia. You will also contribute to further grow the capabilities and broaden the expertise in the team. On a day to day basis, you will work closely with the Principal AI Researcher of the team. This role provides an interface and liaises between the power trading business and the Advanced Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence team. You will: Translate complex business problems into projects with clearly defined scope Use innovative research to influence relevant products and partner teams across Shell, and to have company and societal impact Design, implement and deliver Advanced Machine Learning solutions to solve a wide variety of business problems Mentor junior Data Scientists and guide them in project delivery Provide subject matter expertise in Machine Learning Build relationships with internal project stakeholders and external partners, both commercial and academia Be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work and present the insights and findings Be articulate and compelling in describing your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences and back up your message with visualizations Stay current on state-of-the-art approaches and new Advanced Machine Learning techniques Requirements Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or Operations Research PhD in relevant domain is an advantage Candidates ideally have some prior work experience as a quant / energy trading analyst in the power markets, and / or experience with modeling and scheduling of batteries and renewables Experience across the project life-cycle from ideation to delivery Hands-on experience of building Machine Learning models in Python Experience working in AzureML and / or AWS SageMaker is an advantage Ability to work on complex problems and deliver business critical solutions Track record of delivering on and leading projects Excellent communications skills and experience working in agile teams Track record of conference / journal publications is an advantage Bedrijfsprofiel Sharing would be appricatied! Paylaşırsanız sevinirim! Do you want to work for our client in The Netherlands? Hollandada ICT alaninda calismak? Arbeidsvoorwaarden Do you want this too? Be the best version of yourself? We are happy to help you by focussing your development and investing in an environment in which you continue to learn. We give you the space to innovate and undertake. For example, we offer you plenty of growth opportunities and help you surpass your expectations and do the right things exceptionally well, so that you can grow as a professional. On top of that you can also count on us (based on a 36/40-hour working week): An Employee Benefit Budget (10% of your monthly income). How you bet this budget is up to you. Consider buying extra holiday days or an additional deposit in your pension; Relatively high flexibility in working hours and location independent work, depending on the planning in the team; 100% reimbursement of commuting if you travel with ov! Anyway with car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting fee; A pension scheme that you only contribute 5% to. Let's get acquainted. Are you him/her? The new colleague who wants to strengthen our clientas and to make the difference for yourself, our customers and society? We would like to receive your application on this vacancy. Useful to know: Even if you do not meet the profile of 100%, but you think the role can be perfectly fulfilled, we ask you to apply, we invest in your growth and development. Responses are handled in accordance with vacancy management. Felix de Bruin IT Recruiter is happy to answer questions about the application process via mail or applying to the according link. Screening is part of the application process. We test on the basis of the screening procedures that apply within our client or if new employees are sufficiently reliable to carry out work at our client. For this vacancy, an individual assessment and a test of your skills can be part of the application process. Everyone is different, and precisely the differences in people help us to be an even better bank. That's why we are curious about who you.

title: PhD in Foodshed Climate Services For Sustainable Development in Sub-saharan Africa
description: Are you passionate about improving the sustainability of food systems and combating the impacts of Climate Change in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA)? An exciting interdisciplinary PhD opportunity within the HORIZON project SAFE4ALL awaits you at Wageningen University's Water Systems and Global Change Group ! The project aims to support local and regional actors in decision making to safeguard African food security, disaster management and migration and to build resilience in communities across scales. The project will harness the EU climate services landscape and leverage it with local knowledge from African case studies. It will advance the uptake of user-centered climate services in three selected vulnerable regions in Africa (Ghana, Kenya and Zimbabwe). The emphasis is on tackling issues related to migration from secondary cities to the main cities within countries in Africa and beyond. Within SAFE4ALL, a PhD position is designed to deal with the following key objectives: 1) Assessing Food Policy Systems in SSA. You will: dive into the intricate landscape of food policy systems in SSA and perform a comprehensive assessment of food policy systems in the 3 case study areas in SSA. evaluate these systems by assessing their responsiveness to climate change, internal migration, urbanization, and other socio-economic developments. perform a review on how existing policies anticipate and adapt to these challenges and recognize risks to food security. 2) Identification of short and long term risks for key crops production in SSA. You will: focus on the short-term and long-term risks to the production of key crops in the study cases. address short-term risks related to climate variability and long-term risks related to climate change and socio-economic developments, including land use changes. make use of yield forecast maps and conceptualize a user-friendly portal to guide decision-making towards more sustainable food systems and resilience. 3) Using foodsheds and yield forecasting to visualize the effects of Climate Change, migration, urbanization, and socio-economic development on food systems in SSA. You will: follow a holistic approach, utilizing foodsheds and yield forecasting to visualize and analyze the integrated impacts of climate change, migration, urbanization, and socio-economic development on food systems in the case studies. research how foodsheds transform under the influence of climate change, evaluating shifts in production areas and consumption patterns. explore the profound effects of socio-economic changes, with a particular focus on migration, which can reshape the dynamics of foodsheds and ultimately inform more adaptive food system planning in the study cases and in general in SSA. 4) Evaluate the foodsheds concept as a climate service. You will: perform a comprehensive evaluation of the foodsheds concept as a climate service, supported by spatial data and stakeholder analysis. reflect on how the foodshed approach and visualization tools effectively demonstrate the impacts of climate change and socio-economic development. engage with stakeholders and co-develop adaptation options for short and long term scenarios, and connect with policy, seamlessly integrating with the key objectives to promote sustainable food system planning and development in SSA. Your responsibilities: conduct research and analysis within the project framework; contribute to development of new methods to support sustainable food systems in SSA; publish research results in peer-reviewed journals; write a doctoral thesis based on research findings. Wageningen University & Research offers excellent terms of employment. A few highlights from our Collective Labour Agreement include: partially paid parental leave; working hours that can be discussed and arranged so that they allow for the best possible work-life balance; the option to accrue additional compensation / holiday hours by working more; there is a strong focus on vitality and you can make use of the sports facilities available on campus for a small fee; a fixed December bonus of 8.3%; excellent pension scheme. In addition to these first-rate employee benefits, you will receive a fully funded PhD position and you will be offered a course program tailored to your needs and the research team. The gross salary for the first year is € 2.770 - per month rising to € 3.539,- in the fourth year in according to the Collective Labour Agreements for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU) (scale P). This is based on a full-time working week of 38 hours. We offer a temporary contract for 18 months which will be extended for the duration of the project if you perform well. There are plenty of options for personal initiative in a learning environment, and we provide excellent training opportunities. We are offering a unique position in an international environment with a pleasant and open working atmosphere. You are going to work at the greenest and most innovative campus in Holland, and at a university that has been chosen as the “ Best University ” in the Netherlands for the 18th consecutive time. Coming from abroad Wageningen University & Research is the university and research centre for life sciences. The themes we deal with are relevant to everyone around the world and Wageningen, therefore, has a large international community and a lot to offer to international employees. Our team of advisors on Dutch immigration procedures will help you with the visa application procedures for yourself and, if applicable, for your family. Feeling welcome also has everything to do with being well informed. Wageningen University & Research's International Community page contains practical information about what we can do to support international employees and students coming to Wageningen. Furthermore, we can assist you with any additional advice and information about helping your partner to find a job, housing, schooling. For instance under the "30% rule", certain categories of international staff can receive tax exemption on approximately 30% of their gross salary. Wageningen University & Research The mission of Wageningen University & Research is “To explore the potential of nature to improve the quality of life”. Under the banner Wageningen University & Research, Wageningen University and the specialised research institutes of the Wageningen Research Foundation have joined forces in contributing to finding solutions to important questions in the domain of healthy food and living environment. With its roughly 30 branches, 7,200 employees (6,400 fte) and 13,200 students and over 150.000 participants to WUR’s Life Long Learning, Wageningen University & Research is one of the leading organisations in its domain. The unique Wageningen approach lies in its integrated approach to issues and the collaboration between different disciplines.. An integrated approach to problems and the cooperation between various disciplines are at the heart of Wageningen’s unique approach. WUR has been named Best Employer in the Education category for 2019-2020. These are the points our employees list as good reasons to come work at WUR: read the 5 reasons to come work at WUR We will recruit for the vacancy ourselves, so no employment agencies please. However, sharing in your network is appreciated. The candidate must have the following qualities: strong analytical socio-technical skills; necessary programming experience using Python, C, C++; (We will not consider applications that do not showcase that); proven experience with large scale hydrological and/or crop modelling and spatial data analysis with GIS; (We will not consider applications that do not showcase that); familiarity with big data analysis; interest in stakeholder interaction; excellent scientific writing skills in English; experience with publishing peer-reviewed academic journals is highly desired; strong interest and desired experience with analyzing African food policy systems; good organizational and intercultural communication skills; willingness to travel to Africa. You must also possess: a successfully completed MSc degree in environmental sciences, earth system science, climate studies, agricultural studies, or similar with a strong quantitative background; enthusiasm for collaborating with an interdisciplinary team of researchers with diverse backgrounds and disciplines. For this position your command of the English language is expected to be at C1 level. Sometimes it is necessary to submit an internationally recognized Certificate of Proficiency in the English Language. More information can be found here. For more information about this position, please contact Spyros Paparrizos, by email: spyros.paparrizos@wur.nl, or Hester Biemans, by email: hester.biemans@wur.nl. For more information about the procedure, please contact Noorien Abbas, corporate recruiter, by email:noorien.abbas@wur.nl Do you want to apply? You can apply directly using the apply button on the vacancy page on our website which will allow us to process your personal information with your approval. To apply, please send the following documents: a complete and up-to-date curriculum vitae(max 2 pages); a motivation letter(max 1 page). The maximum length of the documents must not exceed the specified limit otherwise they may not be evaluated. Additional files such as grades and transcripts are not needed during this stage and will not be taken into account. This vacancy will be listed up to and including 20 December 2023. The first job interviews are scheduled for the 2nd week of January 2024. Equal opportunities Wageningen University & Research (WUR) employs a large number of people with very different backgrounds and qualities, who inspire and motivate each other. We want every talent to feel at home in our organisation and be offered the same career opportunities. We therefore especially welcome applications from people who are underrepresented at WUR. A good example of how WUR deals with inclusiveness can be read on the page working at WUR with a functional impairment.

title: Engineer
description: Nice to know (you) Join us at Enabling Technologies, where we're pioneering in a mission-critical environment, with a strong focus on quality and safety. Let's push technology boundaries together! 24/7 Connecting the Airport: Our Integration team powers seamless connections between the airport and partners round the clock. With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports. Connecting your world As a Splunk Engineer you will play a vital role in designing, implementing and maintaining our Splunk platform. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure the efficient and secure collection, analysis and visualization of operational data. And how you approach this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you want to get even better every day. You put your talents to work at: Design, implement, manage and improve Schiphol's Splunk platform. Develop and maintain data inputs, forwarders and custom scripts for data collection and forwarding. Collaborate with cross-functional teams across various airport departments to identify and implement data sources, data extraction and parsing requirements, supporting their specific needs. Create and optimize custom Splunk queries, dashboards and alerts for monitoring and troubleshooting, tailored to the unique requirements of different teams. Monitor the Splunk infrastructure, perform routine system maintenance, and troubleshoot issues as they arise. Ensure the security and compliance of the Splunk environment, including access controls, data protection, and retention policies, and assist other teams in adhering to these standards. Perform upgrades and updates to the Splunk platform, keeping it current with the latest features and security patches and assist in the integration of new technologies. Provide training and guidance to IT staff and end-users in other departments on best practices for using Splunk, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment. About Schiphol Group With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that: ... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport. ... Schiphol Airport had over 25.5 million passengers in 2021? ... you as a Splunk Engineer strengthen the business area IT & Data? About the team The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport. You've got this Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this by taking the initiative to make improvements. Also, you are the talent that is open to feedback and to new knowledge and information. In addition, for this position you have: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field. Proven experience (3+ years) working with Splunk, including design, implementation and maintenance. Splunk certification (e.g., Splunk Certified Administrator) is highly desirable. Strong knowledge of data collection, parsing and indexing strategies. Experience in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for automation and customization. Knowledge of IT security and compliance standards related to log management. You get this € 4262 to € 5934 gross per month (Scale 11). 8,33 % fixed bonus at the end of the year. An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work. An iPhone 14 or Samsung Galaxy S21. The choice is yours. Participation in the ABP pension fund. These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Arbeidsvoorwaarden van Schiphol | Schiphol (werkenbijschiphol.nl). Choose your destination What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below. Do you have any questions about the position? Get in touch with Lieke Kasper (People Lead) via lieke.kasper@schiphol.nl. Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Jesse Topelberg (Recruiter) via jesse.topelberg@schiphol.nl. An assessment may be part of the process. For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group. For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, an AIVD security screening (VGB B civil aviation) is always part of the recruitment process.

title: Engagement Specialist
description: Work Mode: Onsite Responsibilities: Roles and Responsibilities: Develop and drive regional engagement interventions with a focus on aligning, engaging and connecting our employees with the company’s mission and vision and core values. Arrange and manage internal culture events, including the organization activities/trainings and support of town halls, employee conferences and webcasts, firm-wide employee engagement events, as well as provide support on cascading such efforts across the EMEA region. Deliver valuable employee opportunities that promote Value for Users and Tech for Good through giving, volunteering (traditional and skills-based) and product development opportunities, enriching the employee experience and amplifying our social impact. Write, review, edit and publish communications, including feature stories, intranet articles and newsletters, publicity messages, multimedia materials, for an internal audience in support of Tencent’s strategy, people and culture, in collaboration with subject matter-experts across the firm. Design and drive benefits program delivery or cultural programs that employees care about such as wellness, benefits, volunteering, and review the effectiveness of events and programs and develop insights by utilizing metrics from internal data such as from employee surveys/feedback, employee data sources, and external data such as partner outcomes, to measure, propose and optimize interventions, on a regular basis. Closely collaborate with internal business partners as well as Learning and Development ,Global Communications, Marketing and Branding teams in EMEA and HQ to identify and generate content promoting our expertise, capabilities, stories and culture. Coordinate with HQ, regional HR representatives and business leaders to help develop and implement effective engagement activities and campaigns with the goal of helping to deliver on business objectives, conveying key messages and promoting the firm’s content to our internal audience. Manage content production, budgets, and timelines. Other adhoc HR projects. Requirements: Qualifications Bachelor degree or above At least 4-6 years of related HR experiences, MNC preferred Must demonstrate strong writing and editing skills, as well as a sharp eye for design, video and other visual storytelling forms. Content creation experience (social media, PR, interviews, testimonials, video production, internal comms experience a plus) Experienced in project management: planning budgets, executing online and offline campaigns Experienced communicator, working in either a corporate or agency environment. Experience in recruitment marketing or employer branding highly desirable Knowledge of regional market preferable, target audience behaviours Cultural Awareness Must be a team player who works collaboratively and can motivate teams. Must be detail oriented about understanding, measuring, and improving employee engagement on internal company-owned channels. Self-driven, conscientious, strong adaptability and fast learner; able to work in a fast-paced environment, deadline driven, and extremely well organized. Experience driving direction and alignment with cross-functional teams and operating in ambiguous environments. Data visualization and data-storytelling Exposure to video, blogging, infographics, mobile, canva or other similar tools

title: Junior Management Consultant
description: We invite highly motivated and dynamic starters to join our fast-growing Tax Management Consulting team, playing a critical role in the transformation of tax processes for global and local clients. Organisatie Meijburg & Co is the largest tax advisory firm in the Netherlands, and Meijburg Legal focuses on corporate law from the notarial and legal perspective. Both organizations are independent member firms within the (inter)national network of KPMG (active in 153 countries). Every day, over 800 motivated employees, spread across 5 locations, work towards providing excellent services for our clients. 'De Meijburger' is not a one-size-fits-all; that makes us unique as an advisory organization. What we all have in common, however, is entrepreneurship, creativity, and, of course, a passion for the profession. Afdeling The Tax Management Consulting (TMC) team within Meijburg & Co advises clients on the organization of the tax function with a specific focus on tax technology & data management, tax risk management and compliance (out)sourcing. Wat ga je doen? In the role of Junior Tax Technology & Data Management Consultant, you will work with clients to design, build and implement effective tax processes, supported through technology and data management solutions. Companies are facing day-to-day challenges in managing the rapidly changing tax (reporting) landscape where data is becoming an increasingly important asset. Therefore, you will be analyzing client’s tax processes, identifying tax technology and data needs and providing insights on how to improve processes and implement technologies. At the start of your career at Meijburg & Co, you will be linked to a colleague with experience, your buddy, who will also be your point of contact. From the first moment you will be part of our diverse, dynamic and experienced team. Jouw verantwoordelijkheden Together with your team, you will partner with client’s tax and finance teams to identify and clearly articulate (functional) business requirements; Help supporting with the implementation of fit-for-purpose solutions to meet client tax calculations, data analysis and reporting requirements; Work with implementation teams to implement tax requirements into ERP systems (such as SAP S/4HANA) and implementing supporting tools like tax engines and tax reporting solutions to assist with the automation of tax calculations and processes; Evaluate and document current and future state tax compliance and reporting processes; Assist with data analytics projects, including the understanding and manipulation of data across multiple data sources. Wie ben jij? Ideally, we are seeking a candidate with a background in taxation, complemented by a profound interest and/or experience in technology, or alternatively, someone with a strong foundation in technology who possesses a keen interest in taxes. Beyond tax and technical expertise, we are looking for an enthusiastic and energetic colleague with a strong personality, an innovative mindset and a fresh perspective. Additionally, you are communicatively skilled and service-oriented. Daarnaast beschik je over A Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in: Tax Technology; Tax Law; Tax Economics; Information Management; Data Management; Computer Science and/or Econometrics; You have completed your degree and are keen to start your career at a corporate organization; A proficient command of the Dutch and/or English language, both spoken and written; A strong numerical and analytical ability; Knowledge of and/or experience with programming (e.g. SQL, Python) is a plus; Knowledge of and/or experience with data management, analysis and visualization techniques and platforms (e.g. MS Power BI, Alteryx/KNIME, Snowflake) is a plus; Knowledge of and/or experience with tax technology projects, tax engines and/or ERP systems like SAP is a plus; Knowledge of or affinity with tax (compliance) processes (e.g. Direct Tax, Transfer Pricing or Indirect Tax); A representative appearance, you are communicatively skilled, and above all, a pleasant colleague! Wat bieden wij? The chance to kickstart your career with the largest tax advisory firm in the Netherlands; Excellent guidance from the best tax technology professionals; Own control over the progress of your tax technology career within our TMC team. Arbeidsvoorwaarden: 27 dagen vakantiedagen op basis van fulltime dienstverband Mogelijkheid tot het (ver)kopen van verlofdagen Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (in binnen- en buitenland) Sportschoolregeling (korting op jouw sportabonnement of gebruik van de in-company sportschool) Toegang tot het vitaliteitsprogramma (1-op-1 consults, jaarlijkse health checks, masterclasses etc.) Leaseauto / Bruto autotoelage Iphone Premievrij pensioen Collectieve zorgverzekering Een pre-employment screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure.

title: Supply Chain Specialist
description: C.H. Robinson’s Managed TMS® Services are provided through the TMC division. TMC provides customers with expertise and technology that drive both immediate and sustained cost savings throughout their transportation networks. In our Managed TMS customers often retain control of transportation service provider selection, transportation service provider contracts, and rate negotiations. As Supply Chain Engineer, you will design solutions and develop capabilities to support the strategic vision of TMC and the Customer. These solutions include continuous improvement and optimization of a customer’s supply chain including but not limited to sourcing, transportation, network layout, inventory, facility layout, order management, warehouse, material flow, etc. Key tasks include data gathering and cleansing, trend analysis, problem solving, solution design, process documentation, stakeholder communication and development of financial baselines and savings calculations. This role will also participate in the development of enterprise level or supply chain strategies for TMC and its customers. This role can be located in a centralized team, customer account team or onsite with the customer. Responsibilities: Analyze historic data to generate summaries, baselines, and cost improvement opportunities Develop moderately complex data models and connections between data from multiple systems Analyze mismatches between data sets and develop root cause analyses Self-guided and can work independently to implement customer solutions including documenting customer procedures, training, and resolving operational issues Manage projects including defining scope, developing project plan, tracking activities, reporting on progress and milestones, and measuring results Align and communicate with customer or internal stakeholders to gather information, voice of customer, scope, opportunities, deliverables, and project milestones Generate appropriate communications for delivering project updates and summaries to internal and external audiences Assist in the development and continuous improvement of department strategies for team skill and capability development or enhancement May lead small project teams within department or function Receive coaching, guidance, and feedback from others to support personal and technical skill development Provides coaching and guidance to less experienced team members for onboarding, training and skill development Other duties as assigned Qualifications: Required: 2 to 5 years of operations or related work experience including internships or advanced education/degree. Experience in the following tools: Advanced Excel, SQL, MS Access, Python, or other data handling tools Data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau Inventory or Warehouse Management systems knowledge preferred. Preferred: Comfortable using Microsoft Excel/Access/SQL/Python etc to analyze and summarize data, including graphs, charts, formulas, functions, solvers, and regression analysis Able to make complex data maneuvers which will include marrying multiple data sets together Knowledge in Inventory and Warehousing Management and systems preferred Knowledge in basic transportation principles Able to identify trends, patterns and outliers in supply chain data and form insights and recommendations. Comfortable using Microsoft Office tools to generate communications. Strong organization and task management skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple projects/priorities simultaneously. Understanding of end to end supply chain functions and relationships Knowledge of lean processes and tools for continuous improvement Must contribute to our culture focused on trust and respect for all team members, Customer-first strategies, and continuous improvement. Up to 10% travel may be required (domestic and/or international) Questioning if you meet the mark? Studies have shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply unless they match the job description exactly. Here at C.H. Robinson, we’re building a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel they belong. If this position excites you, we welcome you to apply whether you check all the preferred qualifications or just a few. You may just be our next great fit! Why Do You Belong at C.H. Robinson? Standing out among the world’s largest logistics platforms, C.H. Robinson solves logistics problems for companies across the globe and across industries, from the simple to the most complex. For 100+ years, our global suite of services has innovated trade to seamlessly deliver the products and goods that drive the world’s economy. With 20 million shipments annually for 100,000 customers, and millions of dollars contributed to support causes that matter to us, our people and technology literally move the world. As a FORTUNE 200 company, FORTUNE has also named C.H. Robinson one of the World’s Most Admired Companies 2022. Headquartered in Eden Prairie, Minnesota, we are proud to be recognized as one of LinkedIn’s Top Companies in Minneapolis-St. Paul 2021. And we’re not stopping there… Join us as we collaborate, innovate, and work as one global team to make life better and more sustainable for our customers, communities, and world.

Organisatie Meijburg & Co is the largest tax advisory firm in the Netherlands, and Meijburg Legal focuses on corporate law from the notarial and legal perspective. title: Data Engineer
description: We love to see people grow. We empower our product teams, farmers, dealers & suppliers to move forward. Driving the digital future of Kramp Group by discovering and building great products, making life easy for our customers. Kramp Group discovers and builds e-commerce, supply chain & data science solutions that are aiming at giving the ag-tech industry a push forward. We’re building a digital platform, serving thousands of customers and generating a turnover of over one billion euros per year. Our Data vision is to provide a centralized entry point for data to be used on self-service platforms that unlock the full potential of Data for Kramp Group, ensuring data accessibility, quality, and value generation across all departments in a unified way. The mission of a Data Engineer role is to accelerate the rollout of our Cloud Data Warehouse and make impact on how data and technology are used to provide the next-generation tools to an organization. You will be the part of Data Office which is an international cross-functional team, combining: Data Governance; BI Development; Software Development; Data Science. The team is in the transformation from an on-premise data warehouse to a Google Cloud Platform-based data warehouse (DWH). This DWH builds the foundation of Kramp's self-service analytics platform feeding different targets as: Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau); Data-driven e-commerce applications; Kramp's Machine Learning platform. What we offer: The Data Office is international, and cross-functional team, combining Business Intelligence, Pricing Management, Data Science, and Software Development; Working within Agile SCRUM Methodologies and the Atlassian toolchain (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git); To build our state-of-the-art cloud data warehouse, we use Python, Java, BigQuery SQL, other Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Build, Data transfers, Workflows, Schedulers and Functions; Making use of Dataform, Terraform & CDKTF and Data Modelling Tools; You will get deep insights into the work at an international wholesaler being in the middle of the digital transformation, you can contribute and make a real impact; And a lot of freedom to initiate new ideas and develop these further. Some facts about us: We follow the philosophy of "You build it, you own it, you love it." We believe in empowering individuals to take control of their own growth, with guidance provided. Our colleagues come from 66 different countries, creating an inclusive and open-minded environment. Transparent environment, mature management team with clear vision and specific goals, and open to feedback. Kramp Group is a healthy and financially stable company. What else we bring to the table: 25 vacation days and 12 ATV days (based on a full time contract). Flexible working policy in hours and location (with offices in Utrecht and Varsseveld). Travel and working from home allowance. Profit sharing bonus. Learning budget for training and courses to support your growth ambitions. Generous pension plan. Who you are: What will help you be successful in this role? Openness to engage in continuous learning and agility in addressing business challenges; Experience in designing, developing, documenting, and maintaining software written in Python and/or Java as well as dataflows written in SQL; Knowledge of different Data Modelling principles and selecting the right one depending on the needs of a consumer; Feeling comfortable working with Linux, git, and Docker to extend and maintain our CI/CD workflows and pipelines or are you eager to dive into this topic; Experience in working in cloud environments (preferably GCP or AWS); Experience or knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code applications like Terraform and data transformation tools as dbt and Dataform; Cultural awareness, sensitivity, and adaptability in building connections with people from diverse backgrounds; Excel conceptual thinking and a proactive approach to decision-making, taking ownership to ensure project success. Who Kramp Group is Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and supply chain innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA. Working at Kramp means: … you belong here! Being part of our open business community … your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters … you will develop and realize! Learn and realize your potential More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl Do you see yourself in this role but don't hit every requirement? That's okay! Apply anyway. This is a great chance for you to grow and learn. Don't hesitate to reach out to Julia Bodun julia@kramphub.com if you have any questions. N.B. External recruiters/agencies we'd appreciate it if you'd let us reach out to you if we need help. At the moment, this is not the case :)

title: Finance Intern
description: Company Description Dremel, part of the Bosch Group , is the global market leader in versatile tool systems, such as rotary tools and other home solutions. The Dremel EMEA headquarters are situated in Breda, the Netherlands and takes care of all marketing and sales activities together with the local offices across Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America and Asia Pacific. The international team works in various areas across the business, such as Sales, Marketing, Controlling and Business Development. The Dremel working environment is young, dynamic and a place where input and initiative of employees is highly valued. As an intern at Dremel, you will be working alongside highly motivated, experienced colleagues as well as a group of other interns in an environment which allows for students to develop on both a personal and professional level. Dremel’s supportive working culture is a key part to its success. For more information regarding please visit: https://www.dremel.com/gb/en For our Dremel department located in Breda, The Netherlands , we are currently offering an opportunity for a highly motivated and independent individual to join us as a Finance and Controlling intern. ( Note that we cannot guarantee a job after you have completed your internship) Job Description During the 12-month placement, you will familiarize yourself with the typical responsibilities of a Business Unit Controller and gain insights into the structure of a multinational organization. Throughout the internship, you will maintain regular communication with other departments, both in Breda and Germany, and in the United States. Your tasks will include daily support to the team, as well as monthly analyses. Here you can think of: Monthly Tasks: Compilation of the monthly reporting package focusing on business profitability. Analysis of sales, margin, and price development by country, product, and customer. Analysis of logistics cost development across Europe. Quarterly review meetings with Sales, Marketing, and Logistics management teams. Ad-hoc analysis to facilitate management decision-making. Planning Support: General assistance during the business planning period. Forecast creation for innovation share, pricing, costs, and sales. Participation in meetings addressing business strategy, future trends, and organizational development. Qualifications You are our perfect candidate if: You are currently in the 3rd or final year of a Business-related degree , with a focus on Finance and Controlling. You have excellent proficiency in written and spoken English, and potentially some experience with a second language. You are proficient in MS Office applications, and advanced knowledge of Excel. You have experience of dashboards and software skills (Power BI, Python, or others) for easy data visualization. Motivated individual who shows initiative and can independently manage challenges. Strong analytical and numerical skills. Additional Information We invite smart, independent-thinking applicants who are eager to learn to apply for an internship in our financial controlling department. You will work within a dynamic department which embraces an open culture. We offer a versatile internship within a challenging work environment of an international organization. We are open to new initiatives and ideas that you bring with you. In addition, there is plenty of opportunity to work independently on business research and ideas, while collaborating with the best colleagues! We offer: Versatile internship within a challenging working environment of an international organization. Internship allowance up to €550,- per month); Extra monthly allowance of €450,- for accommodation (in case you have to move to The Netherlands); Holiday days. Details: Duration: 1 July 2024 – July 31, 2025; Level: Final year Bachelor or a Master Student; Location: Breda - a cosy city in the province of North Brabant, within 1 hour to big and international cities, like Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Antwerp. What does the Bosch application process look like? Phone introduction to Corporate Recruiter; Interview with future manager; Offer and contract with Bosch. Interested? Apply via button! #ActlikeaBosch #Worklikeabosch

title: Senior Data Specialist
description: We are Leads.io — the world’s #1 tech-driven lead generation agency. Leads.io is on the search for a Martech Specialist to complement our dynamic work environment. Your expertise in advertising technology, web tracking, and 1st party data will be instrumental in creating high-impact lead-generation strategies. With a determination to become an ever-better growth catalyst for our clients, we are on the lookout for fresh faces to join our team! Do you have what it takes to join Leads.io? Key responsibilities Join the new and growing Business Intelligence team at Leads.io. You’ll lead the development of analytical models and solutions to a variety of business challenges, including optimizing marketing campaigns, identifying under utilized resources, and automating key workflows. Other responsibilities are: Lead analysis of structured and unstructured datasets to identify insights in areas such as conversion performance, demand forecasting, marketing optimization, customer segmentation, etc. Support departments with developing and tracking their KPIs, providing key analyses and recommendations Build predictive models leveraging statistical techniques and machine learning, including regression, decision trees, random forest, cluster analysis, etc. Translate data strategies and methodologies into actions, supporting and leading teams around data strategy, preparation, analysis, and modeling Prepare data sources using Python, R, and SQL for use in data analysis and visualization Mentor junior team members on coding and data analysis best practices Requirements Your qualifications 5+ years of data analytics experience Strong foundation in math and statistics Highly proficient in Python and/or R, primarily for building predictive models and data wrangling Experience with building optimized SQL queries Experience working with large relational databases Experience with marketing related analyses, such as: predictive modeling, conjoint analysis, time series forecasting, marketing optimization, and customer segmentation Ability to communicate analytical methodologies and findings to a business/non-technical audience Experience in a marketing or consulting environment a plus Benefits What’s in it for you? 25 holidays per year with 8% holiday pay Hybrid working/working from home allowance An open and inclusive culture that fosters personal growth and initiative Knowledge sessions hosted by internal and external experts Daily lunches at the office Flexible working hours Provided equipment (Macbook, mouse/keyboard) Access to mental health support through OpenUp is offered anonymously and without cost The opportunity to work fully remotely for up to a month per year from a location of your choice Excited? Wait until you see our cultural values! ✨ Trust – At Leads.io, we emphasize accountability and transparency, setting the foundation for genuine partnerships. ✨ Own it – Ownership entails having pride in both your work and yourself. We each aim to take a personal initiative in improving our business, so being the best version of yourself is the best-case scenario for us. ✨ Grow smart – Our vision is to become a global frontrunner in lead generation. We are committed to continually scaling our business whilst also growing as individuals in the process. ✨ Thrive as a team – We believe that teamwork is a key ingredient to obtaining outstanding results. While holding personal work ethics in high regard, we also encourage a working environment that is both social and more enjoyable through teamwork. Our recruitment process is designed to ensure the best fit. It comprises a phone meeting to discuss qualifications, followed by two interviews for cultural alignment, between the 2 interviews an assessment for technical skills will follow. If successful, we will extend a formal offer. Upon acceptance, you'll embark on your exciting journey with Leads.io. Ready for your new challenge? Apply now, and we will be in touch with you soon!

title: PhD On Ai-enhanced Strategic Decision-making
description: Job description Are you eager to work on uncovering the cognitive processes that drive strategic decision-making in inter-organizational relationships? Do you have what it takes to be our next PhD candidate in the exciting and evolving field of understanding strategic decision-making in inter-organizational relationship settings? Are you excited about pioneering innovative methodologies that leverage AI and experimental design to reshape our comprehension of human behavior and decision-making in the strategy and innovation field? If so, this PhD project opportunity awaits you, offering a chance to delve into the fascinating realm of strategic decision-making and push the boundaries of our understanding through cutting-edge research techniques. Job Description This PhD project will tackle the primary challenge of unraveling the complexities of decision-making behaviors in forming, maintaining, and dissolving inter-organizational relationships. You will be at the forefront of the research group’s efforts, contributing to understanding “the microfoundations of managing and organizing collaborative innovation”, where you will collaborate with like-minded experts in the field. The research project revolves around the pivotal role of inter-organizational relationships within the broader ecosystem of organizations. These relationships significantly influence the strategic decisions managers make, particularly concerning their choices to form or join ecosystems. As organizations operate in a data-rich environment, conventional analytical methods are increasingly challenged. To address this complexity, the study capitalizes on the advancements in computational capabilities, particularly utilizing large language models followed by experimental investigations, ensuring a holistic approach that combines advanced computational techniques with empirical studies. Consequently, candidates with expertise in programming and familiarity with advanced language models will play a vital role in harnessing the potential of big data resources and transforming them into actionable, experimental scenarios. This multifaceted research approach promises to contribute to a deeper understanding of managerial decision-making within inter-organizational relationships and its implications for the contemporary business landscape. You will be supervised by dr. Maral Mahdad, dr. Arjan Markus, and dr.ir. Bob Walrave, who are part of the ITEM group at Eindhoven University of Technology. The PhD candidate will benefit from the vibrant group of existing PhDs and professors. In addition, the candidate will have the opportunity to join the emerging Hub for Open Innovation, which is currently being established with a mission to foster a stronger synergy between scientific expertise and practitioners. Job requirements A master’s degree (or an equivalent university degree) in innovation management, business economics, behavioral economics, strategic management, business analytics, or any related disciplines. Strong expertise in programming, including proficiency in languages commonly used in data analysis and machine learning. Proficiency in data collection, preprocessing, and analysis, with the ability to handle large datasets efficiently. Affinity with experimental design and empirical research methods to investigate inter-organizational relationships and business ecosystems. Knowledge of statistical analysis and data visualization techniques to communicate research findings effectively. Excellent communication skills to collaborate with interdisciplinary teams and convey research findings to diverse stakeholders. Adaptability to address the challenges of working in a data-rich environment and evolving technology landscape. A fearless attitude towards experimentation and innovation to push the boundaries of traditional research methodologies. Fluent in spoken and written English (C1 level). Conditions of employment A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university, in an interdisciplinary setting and within an international network. You will work on a beautiful, green campus within walking distance of the central train station. In addition, we offer you: Full-time employment for four years, with an intermediate evaluation (go/no-go) after nine months. You will spend 10% of your employment on teaching tasks. Salary and benefits (such as a pension scheme, paid pregnancy and maternity leave, partially paid parental leave) in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, scale P (min. €2,770 max. €3,539). A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%. High-quality training programs and other support to grow into a self-aware, autonomous scientific researcher. At TU/e we challenge you to take charge of your own learning process. An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities. An allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs. A Staff Immigration Team and a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) for international candidates. Information and application About us Eindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow. You will be embedded in the Innovation, Technology Entrepreneurship & Marketing (ITEM) group. The ITEM group is responsible for the disciplinary areas of innovation, technology entrepreneurship, and marketing. The group teaches courses on, among others, strategy and technology management, new product development, open innovation, and system dynamics. Its research focuses on new product and business development processes for the high-tech industry. Information Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more? Please contact the hiring manager [Maral Mahdad, [Assistant Professor],m.mahdadat]tue.nl Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact our HR advisor, Najat Loiazizi (n.loiazizi[at]tue.nl or +31 402475152. Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page. Application We invite you to submit a complete application by using the apply button. The application should include a: Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position. Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references. One-page research proposal outlining the approach to investigate this research topic. We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: HubSpot Overview: HubSpot is an all-in-one marketing, sales, and service software platform that helps businesses grow and succeed. With a user-friendly interface and powerful tools, HubSpot enables businesses to attract, engage, and delight customers, ultimately driving growth and increasing revenue. From marketing automation to CRM, HubSpot offers a comprehensive solution that empowers businesses to succeed in the digital age. Job Summary: The Predictive Models team is part of the AI Product Line at HubSpot and partners closely with the Predictive AI Platform team to deliver the next generation of scoring, recommendation and personalisation models to HubSpot customers. In particular, we are looking to extend our predictive capabilities through the development of Graph Neural Networks to scale the adoption of Predictive AI across HubSpot's product suite. Responsibilities: Design and develop machine learning models for propensity scoring, recommendations and classification, using techniques such as deep learning and graph neural networks Implement and deploy machine learning algorithms in a scalable and efficient manner, working closely with software engineers Collaborate with product managers to define and refine requirements and use cases for conversation intelligence. Analyze and preprocess data from a variety of sources including numeric, text and other mediums Conduct experiments and evaluations of machine learning models, using statistical methods and visualization tools to assess performance and identify areas for improvement Keep up to date with the latest research and trends in Predictive AI, and contribute to the development of new algorithms and techniques Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation activities, ensuring high quality and maintainability of the codebase Experience or interest in mentoring other team members and proactively sharing knowledge Requirements: A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields, with a focus on machine learning, natural language processing, or speech analysis 3+ years of experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and algorithms, preferably in speech or text analysis domains Proficiency in Python programming and machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras Experience developing graph neural networks for a variety of predictive problems Familiarity with a variety of feature engineering techniques for both text and numerica data would be great Experience mentoring other team members and helping to define best practices for the group Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, interdisciplinary team environment. If you are passionate about leveraging machine learning to transform the way businesses interact with their customers in a collaborative work environment, come join us in HubSpot AI Group! We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply — we'd love to hear from you. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form . This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process. Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here . About HubSpot HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers' needs at any stage of growth. We're also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you. You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more. Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot. By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.

title: Analytics Consultant
description: Company Description Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service. Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus. Job Description Who will you be working with? The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together. What you are going to do As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia Partners Global, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights. Responsibilities include: Work closely with SIA consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites Who you are You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting. Qualifications What you need Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study. You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position. Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL) Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus. What we offer Training opportunities to develop yourself further Opportunities to work on international assignments Flexible working hours A meritocratic approach to promotion Performance related bonus An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme) Additional Information We are unable to provide a work permit for this position Non-Dutch speaker will no be accepted Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

title: Commentator Wielrennen Nos Sport
description: Commentator Wielrennen NOS Sport "Is geven van commentaar voor jou ook topsport?" Laat van je hóren en jij hoort van ons! (Hilversum | 36 uur | cao-contract | Startdatum: bij voorkeur 1 februari 2024) Leuk kennis te maken NOS Sport doet op alle mogelijke platforms verslag van alles wat er speelt in de sportwereld. Wij zijn er 24 uur per dag: online, op televisie, op de radio, op social en op Teletekst. Van Atletiek tot Zwemmen, en alles wat daar tussen zit. De agenda van NOS Sport staat bol van sportevenementen. Van klein tot groot tot supergroot. En of een evenement nu een wereldkampioenschap is of een ééndaagse wedstrijd: we hebben heel erg veel live sport. Wat je gaat doen Als commentator doe je verslag van sportwedstrijden in binnen- en buitenland. Vaak live, soms in samenvatting. De ene keer vanaf een locatie, de andere keer vanaf de redactie in Hilversum. Jouw focus ligt op becommentariëren van wielerwedstrijden. Buiten het wielerseizoen ben je ook inzetbaar voor andere sporten. Naast je werkzaamheden als commentator neem je deel aan redactievergaderingen en doe je suggesties voor onderwerpen. Je bent multimediaal inzetbaar, maakt interviews en neemt eventueel deel aan podcasts. Als commentator bij NOS Sport werk je op onregelmatige tijden met de focus op het weekeinde. Bekijk onderstaande video's voor een kijkje achter de schermen. Waarom teamleden hier graag werken Passie voor sport Als je de redactievloer opstapt voel je het meteen: de gezamenlijke passie voor sport. Voeg daar jouw portie passie gerust aan toe. Graag zelfs! Dat maakt het team bevlogen collega's nóg sterker. Ontwikkel jezelf hoe jij dat wilt Bij de NOS heb je alle ruimte om nieuwe dingen te leren én te doen. Ideeën? Deel ze en ga er mee aan de slag! Dat heet ook wel: volop mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Maar dan echt. Van alle kanten enthousiast Overal bij de NOS proef je de bevlogenheid. Koppel die van jou eraan en je merkt het meteen: meer dan interessante gesprekken waar je steeds van leert. En wij van jou. Teamwork uit overtuiging Bij de NOS werk je met wel héél enthousiaste collega's. Dat enthousiasme omvat ook intensief en gráág samenwerken. Sterker, waar nodig help je elkaar. Dat is gewoon omdat we dat gewoon zijn. Wat je meebrengt De commentator die we zoeken is in de eerste plaats een sterke journalist. Een allrounder met een grote kennis van sport (wielrennen in het bijzonder) die: over een scherp analytisch vermogen beschikt en daardoor een koers kan ‘lezen’; in staat is keuzes te maken uit de grote hoeveelheid data die beschikbaar is; in het moment zelfstandig journalistieke afwegingen kan maken vanuit verschillende perspectieven; op een verbaal aansprekende wijze bij gebeurtenissen betekenis en context geeft en weet over te brengen op het publiek; beschikt over een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal. Ook goede beheersing van de Engelse taal is onmisbaar en kennis van het Frans is een pré. minimaal 3 jaar commentaarervaring op lokaal, regionaal of nationaal niveau heeft; kan leunen op een grote kennis van sport, wielrennen in het bijzonder; een scherp oog heeft voor diversiteit in de breedste zin van het woord; in grote zelfstandigheid kan werken in binnen- en buitenland. Sport verbindt en is van en voor alle groepen in de samenleving. Daarom willen we ook een werkomgeving waar ruimte is voor verschillen, waar je het beste uit jezelf kunt halen en waarin iedereen zich thuis voelt. Een omgeving die even bont en gevarieerd is als de samenleving, onze volgers, kijkers en luisteraars waarvoor we werken. Met verschillen waardoor we vanuit verschillende perspectieven naar ons werk kunnen kijken. Meen jij hieraan te kunnen bijdragen, op welke manier dan ook?
