We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Renewables International Graduate Programme - Europe
description: Initial Placement in Germany, UK, Italy, Poland, Sweden, Netherlands or DenmarkTo start on 1st September 2024, Full time, Fixed Term Opportunity for 18 MonthsHow does the energy of the future look like? At RWE we have one clear goal: Reaching carbon neutrality by 2040 by extensive investment in innovative technologies, constantly expanding capacities and future talents. Therefore, we are looking for the next generation of qualified and committed graduates like you!Let’s shape tomorrow’s energy together as you become an essential part of the energy revolution and of #TeamRWE! What we offer: Your Career Entry Point Our 18-months Renewables International Graduate Programme is designed for you to get in-depth business insights, build up your own international network and bring your knowledge into diverse projects. We have a clear focus on providing you with a general overview on the whole value chain of RWE . Finally, there will be the chance to become a full team member after successfully finishing the programme.You will take part in three rotations in various functions of the organisation.Besides , you will have the opportunity to stay max. 6 months abroad – outside of your start country. Please apply only to one of the two job postings (Europe or US) according to your desired initial placement.Moreover, you will be supported by a Mentor during the whole time of the programme and your development will be further accelerated via trainings, Peer-Coaching, etc. Who we are looking for: Talents shaping the energy transition You have successfully completed your Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in the field of engineering or science (physics, geoscience, geoinformatics, environmental science, biological oceanography etc.) Moreover, you score points with first working experience ideally in the field of renewable energy Everyone can feel your enthusiasm for renewable energy and your desire to be an engaged part of the energy revolution You convince us with your advanced reasoning skills for complex problem solving, combined with a strategic and forward-thinking mindset Curiosity, openness towards change and the self-believe to question the status quo are the right words to describe you You are motivated to take initiative and to promote your own ideas as well as concepts. Your degree of self-reliance is high You are able to interact and connect in cross-cultural teams, with a sense for diversity and inclusion You have fluent oral and written business English skills, other European languages are a welcome plus rwe.com/career rwe.com/graduates From here, you benefit from many further advantages – Curious? Then click here!Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code 83903, application deadline 15th December 2023Any questions? Contact in recruiting: renewables_graduates@rwe.comWe look forward to receiving your application!We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications, irrespective of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity. #inclusionmattersOf course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Xing, too.RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.

title: Data Analyst/ Data Scientist
description: Job DescriptionMars Veterinary Health (MVH) is part of Mars Petcare, a global, family-owned business. At Mars Veterinary Health, our 70,000+ Associates are dedicated to creating A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS™. Mars Veterinary Health is a leading veterinary health provider with an international network of over 2,500 pet hospitals including BANFIELD™, BLUEPEARL™, VCA™, Linnaeus, AniCura, VSH, VES, Mount Pleasant and others across 20+ countries. We are committed to offering compassionate high-quality veterinary care, from wellness and prevention, through primary, emergency and specialty care. To learn more, visit our website or follow us on LinkedIn.AniCura is Europe’s leading provider of high-quality veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura offers a wide range of high-quality medical services covering preventive and basic health care as well as advanced diagnostics, internal medicine, intensive care, surgery, and orthopedics.Since 2018, AniCura is part of MARS Veterinary Health, a division of MARS Inc.Job Purpose/OverviewAt Mars Veterinary Health International, we are on a mission to redefine the future of veterinary care by leveraging data in unprecedented ways. We are seeking a dynamic, forward-thinking Data Analyst/Data Scientist (DA/DS) to join our vibrant team in AniCura. You will be at the forefront of all things data related, working with a team that is not just analyzing data but revolutionizing the way we operate and eventually change the lives of pets for the better. If you are passionate about data and eager to drive change, we want you on our team!The DA/DS will work to advance the data & analytics capabilities of MVHI and will be part of the D&A team at AniCura. This role will report into the Head of Data & Analytics, AniCura. This role is based in AniCura headquarters in Amsterdam, Netherlands.Key ResponsibilitiesUnlock Insights and Drive Innovation: Utilize your analytical prowess to dissect complex data sets and unveil insights that will propel our business forward.Collaborate and Influence: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop data-driven strategies that will add value.Visual Storytelling: Develop compelling data visualizations and dashboards that narrate the story behind the numbers, influencing key stakeholder decisions.Champion Data Quality: Be the guardian of data quality, ensuring accuracy and consistency, while identifying opportunities for process improvements.Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics/data science, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to our team.Job Specifications/Qualifications2-4 years of experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or consultingB.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in data analytics, statistics, economics, computer science or a similar fieldExperience with large and complex datasetsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a knack for translating data into actionable insightsIntermediate/advanced proficiency in Power BI/Query, Python and ExcelProficiency in data analysis and querying data through Python and SQL, data modelling and machine learningFluent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishExcellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise mannerExperience working with applications like Azure Suite, Power Automate, Databricks, Alteryx, PySpark as well as a good knowledge of ETL, dataflows of data warehouses would be a plus (but no requirement)What can you expect from AniCura? Work with over 12.000 like-minded and talented Associates at AniCura and over 130.000 at Mars, all guided by The Five Principles Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to shape the future of veterinary care, together An industry competitive salary and benefits package Flexible working hours, an international and digital work environment The opportunity to cuddle our beloved 4-legged friends in our officesAbout AniCuraAniCura is present at 500 European locations in 15 countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. Every year, AniCura’s 12,000 employees attend to more than 3.6 million companion animal patients. AniCura is a trusted training and referral body.Since 2018, AniCura is part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company with the sole objective of advancing the veterinary profession for the health and wellbeing of people, pets, and planet. Through our collective network of 2,500 veterinary clinics, hospitals, and diagnostic labs across 21 countries, we can provide the highest standards in pet care and achieve our collective Purpose: A better world for pets through Shaping the Future of Veterinary Care, together.Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Procurement Process Excellence Manager
description: General information All posting locations Amsterdam, , Netherlands Job Function 02 - Procurement Date Published 24-Jul-2023 Ref # R-71222 Remote, Hybrid or Onsite HybridRequirements Description & Requirements About the PositionWe have an excellent opportunity available for an experienced Procurement professional to make a difference at Kraft Heinz. The Procurement Process Excellence Manager lies within the Global Procurement Transformation team. You’ll be working in a high performing team- alongside peers always trying to reach the next level. You’ll be reporting into the Global Procurement Compliance Lead. Get ready for a lot of exposure to internal senior stakeholders. The delivery of various programs to enable Procurement’s evolution will be your primary responsibility. You’re constantly looking for improvement activities within Procurement.In brief- you will be responsible for the below items;Managing global projects to better develop or enhance the procurement processes- technology and people pillarsConnecting our Procurement department with other functions to improve overall supply chain processes and business knowledgeBeing connected externally to research procurement trends to enable you to proactively recommend and drive initiatives to advance procurement compliance program.Acting as a change agent by implementing best in class methodologies- improving use and capabilities of technology- and increasing engagement via communication strategiesProactively seek opportunities to simplify- standardize and automate procurement compliance processes.Implement internal controls and governance processes for our Global and Zone Procurement organizationImplement the Procurement collaboration model between Global and Zone Procurement including tracking and monitoring and continuous improvement initiativesOwn and develop the relationship between Procurement and Legal- Finance- Internal Control- Internal Audit- GBS and Tax to ensure our business process is aligned with relevant requirements; if any gaps between the business process and the requirements are noted- owning the action plan to efficiently minimize/absolve the associated riskEnsure that the Procurement policy is implemented in the day-to-day ways of working for the Global and Zone Procurement organization including the tracking of adoption and continuous tracking and monitoring of all key controlsQualificationsHard Skills Please kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position. Education in Bachelor/Master degree level in business- finance- supply chain or any related functionsAt least 5 years of working experience in an international company- project management- compliance- and/or supply chain experiences are a plusA proven track record in understanding procure-to-pay processes and its affiliate solutions (SAP- Coupa- Ariba- MicroStrategy- Tableau)Strong analytical- planning- and stakeholder management skillsAdvanced change management skills with an eager to learn and develop even furtherAdvanced user of MS Office and have technological understanding for source-to-pay toolsProfessional fluency in English with strong written- verbal and listening skills is a must; other languages is a plus. Professional Attributes Communication SkillsAt Kraft Heinz you’ll easily be exposed to senior management- no matter your level. Therefore- it’s important you have excellent communication skills- to deal with all kinds of different stakeholders.Ability to Simplify We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated- when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges. Result driven You don’t only focus on your own results- but always do what’s best for the company.Project management skillsTime management has no secrets for you. You’re organized- structured and always have an overview of all the deliverables. You know how to bring multiple projects to a successful ending within the given timeframe.High pressure You don’t get easily stressed by pressure- on the opposite- a demanding and dynamic environment is what keeps you energized.What We Offer YouAn ambitious employer; we only want to the best for you; A fast career track like only few other companies can match;A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);Permanent contract; for we believe in doing big bets on people;Always room for new ideas; if you have an excellent idea- please let us know and we can set it in action!About UsKraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Senior Analyst, Sustainability Strategy
description: About The RoleOur Global Strategy & Planning team is the global strategy arm of our Uber Delivery business and works with leadership to define and act on strategy, provide objective viewpoints and unbiased analyses, recommend and implement actionable business improvements, work to scale standard processes and empower local teams with global knowledge.Sustainability is an increasing focus for the Delivery business. After launching the program in 2022, we have hired teams in market, defined strategy and long-term targets and ramped up pilots and partnerships. This role, sitting in Global S&P, will report into our Global Delivery Sustainability lead, and focus on key workstreams that will shape our long term strategy. This is a unique opportunity to get in from the start and be part of the team managing and growing Delivery's sustainability efforts.This role will provide a unique opportunity to work across many of our most strategic and innovative projects and to work alongside a range of business leaders from across Operations, Data Science, Product, Policy, Marketing and Business Development.What You Will Do Own the business performance metrics, translating complex data into accurate, timely, and actionable insights & decisions which deliver business impact Conduct advanced analytics business analysis across Eaters, Merchants, Couriers & Suppliers, to identify areas for growth and improvement Complete customized pieces of analysis to determine our sustainability strategy, future investments and to understand the performance of our program, including from experiments and pilots. Develop and refine operational tools and levers which drive growth and improvement in our Sustainability metrics Develop and maintain robust data infrastructure, ensuring data integrity, reliability, and accessibility across the organization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including S&P, Operations, Data Science, Finance, and Product Stay up-to-date with industry trends and processes in data analytics, using new technologies and methodologies to drive continuous improvement within the team What You Will Need Bachelor's or advanced degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related field. 5+ years proven experience in data analytics, with a track record of delivering insights that drive business growth and performance. Strong technical skills in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization, using SQL Excellent communication and partner management skills, with the ability to effectively present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proficient in project management, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality results. Business sense: will need a strong grasp of the business opportunities and interdependencies to ensure recommendations and analysis are actionable and accurate Standout colleague: you will work with a range teams (Legal, Product, Marketing, local and regional operations) and will need to adapt to support teams get the job done Ability to take initiative in a constantly-changing work environment and implement quickly Creative solutions-focused attitude Experience using common open source tools - such as Python or R - to work efficiently at scale. Data Science experience or collaborating with a DS team Understanding of statistics concepts (distribution, confidence intervals, statistical significance, regression model, etc)

title: Data scientist
description: Functie­omschrijvingHet datateam (HDCV Data) van BZ valt onder de hoofddirectie Consulaire Zaken en Visumbeleid (HDCV) en heeft als doel om de consulaire informatiepositie te versterken. Om dat doel te bereiken verwerken we data uit verschillende bronnen in het consulaire data warehouse. Vanuit de verschillende afdelingen en posten komen allerlei informatieverzoeken, analyseverzoeken en wensen ten aanzien van rapportages. Binnen HDCV Data werken we vanuit verschillende datadisciplines (analisten, engineers en stewards) samen om deze vragen vanuit het consulaire domein te helpen beantwoorden.Als data scientist ben je relevante data voor het consulaire domein aan het verzamelen, opschonen, bewerken, analyseren en visualiseren. Je werkt met een veelvoud van datasets, gestructureerd en ongestructureerd, en vertaalt deze data naar bruikbare informatie. Je voelt je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit, actualiteit en rechtmatigheid van de informatieproducten die je ontwikkelt. Je werk begint bij een probleem en eindigt bij monitoring van de zelfgemaakte oplossing. Verder zijn we nadrukkelijk op zoek naar iemand die zich in meerdere datadisciplines comfortabel voelt.Binnen het team maken we gebruik van Azure Cloud Services Databricks en Azure SQL. In jouw analyses maak je gebruik van Tableau, SQL en Python. Tevens treed je ook op als vraagbaak voor zowel andere leden in jouw team als voor de business. Je houdt rekening met het feit dat deze vaak niet dezelfde technische kennis hebben als jij en jouw mede-dataspecialisten. Je bent op de hoogte van nieuwste technologieën en de inzetbaarheid daarvan voor het team.Omdat veel consulaire processen verdergaand aan het digitaliseren zijn, komen er steeds meer mogelijkheden. Eén van je taken is om creatief na te denken over hoe deze mogelijkheden het informatiegestuurd werken kunnen verrijken. Je zoekt de grenzen op van wat technologisch haalbaar is en hebt een natuurlijke nieuwsgierigheid. Je bent je bewust van de juridische kaders en je werkt zorgvuldig en altijd met respect voor privacy. Je ziet problemen eerder als een uitdaging dan een belemmering en je bent flexibel genoeg om je aan te passen aan een snel veranderende technologische wereld.Onderwerpen waaraan je mogelijk kunt bijdragen zijn:Beheren en ontwikkelen van pipelines.Monitoren van pipelines en datakwaliteit.Doorontwikkelen van Informatie Ondersteund Beslissen.‘Speech to tekst’-analyse van telefoongesprekken met het klantcontactcenter.Het verbeteren van het prognosemodel voor het inzetten van medewerkers op het klantcontactcenter.De totstandkoming van reisadviezen.Functie-eisenEen academisch werk- en denkniveau. Bij voorkeur heb je een universitaire studie afgerond met een kwantitatief of statistisch component of relevante werkervaring in het data engineering/analyse/science vakgebied.Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.Leergierig, creatief en het vermogen om zelfstandig problemen op te lossen.Goede communicatieve en analytische vaardigheden.Abstract kunnen denken en problemen op conceptueel niveau kunnen oplossen/uitwerken.Comfortabel met het toepassen van technieken in programmeertalen zoals Python en SQL.Ontwerpen en gebruiken van algoritmes is een pre.Ervaring met cloud-omgeving (bijv. Microsoft Azure) is een pre.Data engineering skills/ETL-ervaring is een pre.Ervaring met machine learning en data mining is een pre.Arbeids­voorwaardenSalaris­niveauschaal 12Maand­salaris: Min €4214 - Max €6227

title: Junior Demand Planner
description: General information All posting locations Amsterdam, , Netherlands Job Function 11 - Logistics Date Published 13-Oct-2023 Ref # R-75463Job Description Description & Requirements About The PositionWe have an excellent opportunity available for an experienced Junior Demand Planner to make a difference at Kraft Heinz. The Category Demand Planner role lies within the Benelux operations team. You’ll be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level. Get ready for a lot of exposure to internal senior stakeholders. Your primary responsibility will be to manage the meals category for the Netherlands retail market a combination of historical volume reviews and new data to contribute to discussions on new product launches, future innovations, factory planning, logistics planning and stock policy to ensure we have the right product in the right place at the right time.In brief, you are responsible for Delivering forecast accuracy targets through the development of robust demand forecasts and coordinating forecast inputs such as promotional and media plansManaging the forecast of a portfolio of FMCG products including the generation of base forecast down to SKU level through high quality analysis within our O9 platformCoordinating product flow to the Netherlands retail market through working collaboratively with our central supply planning teamPreparation and participation in meeting and process framework to ensure forecasts are constructively challenged to drive consensus and accuracyInventory levels and write off minimalization through robust monthly supply chain loss processesCustomer service levels (i.e. case fill rate and requested delivery date to ensure we have the right product in the right place at the right time) to manage operational efficiency.Updating and improving key demand planning reports and tools (excel) QualificationsMust havesPlease kindly note that you need to have an EU Working Permit (Orientation Year Visa not included) in order to proceed for this position.At least a completed Bachelor’s degreePrior supply chain experienceAdvanced Excel knowledgeSAP/ O9 experienceFluency in English is mandatory Professional AttributesCan do mentality - You are hands on; if you see a problem, you find and implement a solutionAbility to Simplify - We like to keep it simple. Your simplification skills will be highly appreciated. We want you to provide simple solutions when dealing with complex challengesHigh pressure - You don’t get easily stressed by pressure, on the contrary, a demanding and multifaceted environment is what keeps you energizedTeam player - Achieving results is nice, but achieving results with the team is simply the best. You’re a standout colleague, which means you’re sometimes a leader, sometimes a follower but always working towards the same common goal together with your teammatesWhat We Offer YouAn ambitious employer; we only want the best for you;A fast career track like only few other companies can match;A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);Permanent contract; for we believe in doing big bets on people;Always room for new insights; if you have an idea, please let us know, and we can set it in action!Our Hiring ProcessAfter the application and CV screening, you are invited to complete our Cognitive Assessment and will have an introductory telephone call with the Talent Acquisition Team. If positive, you will interview with Senior demand planner and HR business partner Head of Demand Planning Benelux and Cross-functional Interviewer All positive? Job offer!More information www.careers.kraftheinz.com About UsKraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Business Insights specialist
description: Red Bull Nederland blijft maar groeien! Ben jij op zoek naar vleugels en wil je meebouwen aan ons succes? Binnen het Trade Marketing team is een uitdagende nieuwe rol toegevoegd, namelijk de rol van Business Insights Specialist.Als Business Insights Specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het genereren van inzichten met impact op de business. Het transformeren en visualiseren van data vanuit diverse databronnen en tools behoren tot jouw kerntaken. Dit alles met als doel het ondersteunen en adviseren van interne stakeholders in het behalen van onze ambitieuze doelstellingen.We zijn op zoek naar een analytische persoonlijkheid met affiniteit voor commercie. Beschik jij over de juiste ervaring en drive, kun je je identificeren met het merk en pas je perfect in die ondernemende en levendige organisatie die Red Bull is? Solliciteer dan nu!Wat zijn jouw sterke punten?Alle verantwoordelijkheden die we jou toevertrouwen:ANALYSE & STRATEGIEAls Business Insights Specialist breng je middels het analyseren van data en inzichten de markt in kaart, presenteer je deze aan stakeholders en geef je daarbij concreet advies. Ook lever je input voor het jaarlijkse Business Plan en lever je een cruciale bijdrage aan de uitvoering van de Red Bull Trade Marketing plannen. Specifiek ben je verantwoordelijk voor leveren van marktinzichten binnen de grootste kanalen van Red Bull; Retail en Petrol. Hiermee heb je direct invloed op de dagelijkse business, maar draag je ook bij aan strategische keuzes die Red Bull structureel te laten groeien.TRACKING & PLANNINGDe Business Insights Specialist zorgt voor bruikbare inzichten, optimale analyses voor/na en tijdens activaties en voorziet het team van relevante dashboards en rapportages. Tevens zal je zorgdragen voor de informatie en (nieuwe) tools die het team nodig heeft om de marktbewerking te optimaliseren.OWNERSHIPRed Bull is een bedrijf met ambitie en biedt haar werknemers een grote mate van vrijheid, zelfstandigheid, ondernemerschap en beslissingsbevoegdheid binnen een levendige en dynamische omgeving. Dat moet je passen! Als Business Insights Specialist ben je het aanspreekpunt voor data vanuit verschillende tools en zul je zelfstandig binnen project teams werken. Flexibiliteit, creativiteit en doortastendheid zijn daarbij doorslaggevend om ook in complexe situaties succes te boeken. Het motto is daarbij making the impossible, possible!SAMENWERKENBinnen deze rol werk je aan veel verschillende projecten en taken, waarbij je de juiste focus aanbrengt en tegelijkertijd switcht tussen de diverse werkzaamheden. Je werkt hierbij veel samen met collega’s binnen je cross-functionele team, waaronder je collega’s van Trade Marketing en Sales, maar ook met andere afdelingen zoals Marketing. Tevens zal je gaan samenwerken met Insights specialisten van andere afdelingen.INTERNATIONAALOm de markt steeds een stapje voor te kunnen blijven, maken we gretig gebruik van de globale kracht van ons merk: er bestaat een nauwe samenwerking met het hoofdkantoor in Oostenrijk en onze internationale collega's.Jouw kennis- en expertisegebiedenwat het belangrijkste is voor deze baan:Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-diploma en full time beschikbaarJe hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring binnen een data gerelateerde functie (vb. Insights specialist of data analist) – en je kunt ons overtuigen dat je het expert level kunt bereiken als het gaat om data-analyseJe bent pragmatisch en analytisch aangelegd en bent hierbij in staat om verkoop- en klantgegevens te analyseren, de beste conclusie te trekken en initiatieven te ontwikkelenJe bent in staat om gestructureerd te werken en onafhankelijk verschillende projecten gelijktijdig op te pakkenJe hebt een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en bent flexibel ingesteldJe bent administratief sterk en kunt uitstekend overweg met Excel en PowerPointEen dikke pre: ervaring in het werken met FMCG data tools (Nielsen/Circana).Daarnaast is kennis van dataverwerkingstools zoals Power BI en/of R handig, maar niet vereistHBO-WO opleidingFluency in Dutch is requiredRed Bull Nederland gelooft erin dat het hebben van een diverse pool van talenten een belangrijke bijdrage levert aan ons succes. We nemen daarom aan op ervaring, skills en mindset. We staan open voor sollicitaties van iedereen uit onze maatschappij ongeacht leeftijd, geslacht, handicap, seksuele geaardheid, ras of religie.

title: Director of R&D Outsourcing Programs
description: Job TitleDirector of R&D Outsourcing ProgramsJob DescriptionIn this role you create, orchestrate and monitor a portfolio of hardware and software projects with a multitude of different (strategic) suppliers across the Image Guided Therapy Systems (IGT-S) ecosystem, while driving for operational excellence.ResponsibilitiesExecute and improve the R&D outsourcing strategy for IGT Systems in alignment with the business objectives and the R&D leadership team. Identify, select and manage strategic suppliers that can deliver high-quality R&D services and solutions at competitive costs and timelines. Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, such as R&D program managers, project leaders, architects, competence leaders, finance and procurement, to ensure clear communication, alignment and collaboration on outsourcing opportunities and challenges. Ensure compliance with Philips policies and procedures regarding outsourcing, contracting, intellectual property, data privacy, quality and security. Monitor and report on the performance, risks and benefits of the R&D outsourcing portfolio, and initiate corrective and preventive actions when needed. Drive continuous improvement and innovation in the R&D outsourcing processes, practices and tools, leveraging best practices and feedback from internal and external sources. Production and/or supply chain outsourcing is not part of the scope. Your role:Manage a portfolio of 15 - 30 distinct R&D projects with a strong outsourcing component through a variety of global suppliers. Role is cross-R&D, reporting line hosted by Head of MDC. Projects vary across the competence-scope of IGT Systems: Software, Hardware, Testing, Knowledge Management, Improvement Activities, etc., and are part of a multi-year funnel that is expected to grow to a stabile size around late-2025. Incumbent is accountable for E2E delivery along the key KPIs (quality, time, cost, deliverables, etc.), and manages a complex and interdependent stakeholder field accordingly. Drives for transparency and operational excellence, by working through the Philips tools and processes, and improving these where applicable. You're the right fit if:You bring at least 15 years of experience in medical device development, regulated environment, engineering and production suppliers, technical project management. You have demonstrated strong stakeholder management skills and have a proven track record in creating business impact. You have broad knowledge of mechanical and electrical hardware development and are also versed in software and System-level projects. You have a broad End-to-End understanding of R&D, Quality, PIE, Operations, Procurement, Production processes, Spend Management, and the Integrated Supply Chain. You have a technical background at B.Sc. / M.Sc. level, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to create clarity through e.g. Visual Management. Substantial experience in medical device development, regulated environment, engineering and production suppliers, technical project management Experience with outsourcing through the Philips tools and frameworks would be a big benefit (Fieldglass, Windchill, SAP, etc.). Role is based on-site in Best (NL), with some travel as needed. About PhilipsWe are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others. Learn more about our business. Discover our rich and exciting history. Learn more about our purpose.If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: Data Analyst
description: Powering our sustainable future, togetherWe live in an era where electric mobility is “the new normal.” Whereas over the past decade, electric vehicles were only for the few, today they are for everyone. Welcome to the electric era. Enter EVBox.Founded in 2010, EVBox empowers forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing flexible and scalable electric vehicle charging solutions. With its offering of residential, commercial, and fast charging stations, as well as scalable charging management software, EVBox ensures that electric mobility is accessible to everyone.We believe in a future where daily transportation is emission-free and sustained by smart charging infrastructure. That’s why we’ve made it our goal to accelerate the adoption of electric mobility by bringing the most accessible and scalable charging solutions to the world. However, the transition from gas to electric cars will change a great deal of what we know about transportation.The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company. Today, EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States, with hundreds of driven professionals from different wals of life working for us.About UsAt the Everon Platform Organization within EVBox, we empower forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing top-notch EV Charging management solutions.Our engineers build new products, enhance existing solutions and resolve many interesting challenges on a daily basis. This work is delivered in a culture that emphasizes ownership and excellence. Everyone is empowered to make bold decisions and take responsibility for the solutions they build.About The RoleAs a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team to expand the data capabilities of the Everon platform. We leverage the vast amounts of data from our global network of customers and charging stations to build high-quality data sets, generate valuable insights, and create innovative data products. We build and run data services and pipelines that validate and enrich incoming data, and provide convenient and secure access to teams across the organization. Our aim is to empower our customers and deliver a delightful user experience by responsibly leveraging data, learning from insights, growing our knowledge, and paving the way towards a sustainable future.In This Role You WillAnalyze transactional and operational data, leveraging data analysis and models to unlock actionable insights, identify business improvement opportunities, and provide recommendations to enhance performance and efficiencyDesign, execute, and interpret experiments to validate hypotheses, drawing detailed and impactful conclusions to drive innovation and optimize delivery processesCollaborate closely with various teams, aligning on data strategy and KPIs. Engage with stakeholders to collect requirements, deliver insights, and ensure clear communication of findings, recommendations, and progressProvide and support tools and data visualizations to stakeholders to empower their data-based decision-making processDevelop data-driven business insights to find opportunities and recommend the prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiativesBeing able to define and design business value from raw data and implement data models with an abstraction level close to the business domainsEnhance the data landscape by collaborating with peers to ensure data logging and data pipelines' availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliabilityAbout YouYou hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other related quantitative fields4+ years of experience in roles such as Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or in other data analysis-focused functionsAdvanced SQL expertise and strong Python proficiency for data analysis and modelling. Experience working with dbt is a plusExperienced with dashboarding/data visualization platforms such as Grafana, Tableau, Looker, or similarAbility to deliver on tight deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detailProven track record of handling large datasets, extracting insights, and summarizing key learnings and takeawaysProven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using dataBenefitsAt EVBox, we believe that when people feel valued and rewarded their potential is unlimited. We offer competitive salaries and review remuneration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. We promote within, offering learning and development opportunities, and we also provide the following benefits, as standard:A very diverse workforce and an open culturePrivate pension contribution25 vacation daysHoliday Swap (2 days) - ability to swap out a public holiday for a paid vacation dayCommuting allowanceUp to 3 days remote working, including working from home allowance of EUR 2 net per day (in consultation with your manager)Budget of 600 Euro to set up your home officeAbility to work remotely from anywhere outside of the Netherlands for 4 weeksAccess to learning platforms and personal development budgetAcross our 8 locations, more than 700 EVBoxers work together to provide electric vehicle charging solutions that help businesses move forward. Are you ready to join them? Hit apply.We at EVBox aim to take down historical and structural barriers that stand in the way of our employees. The chargers we manufacture are built for the sustainable future we believe in. We commit to sustained action in tackling processes and practices that systematically penalize our employees. Our DEI efforts are designed not just for the present, but create long-lasting change in the future of our industry. We continue to learn and dismantle the roadblocks that our people face in order to create positive outcomes for all.We believe in an equitable, diverse and inclusive environment where everyone, no matter their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, religious belief, education or ability, feel valued and respected. We embrace diverse life experiences and heritages and ensure that all voices are valued and heard.Do you want to get to know us even better? Then pay a visit to our Career page, blog or check out our social media channels: LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter.EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read about how EVBox processes your personal data here.EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read here how EVBox processes your personal data.

title: Senior R&D Technologist
description: General information All posting locations Nijmegen, , Netherlands Job Function 10 - R&D Date Published 15-Sep-2023 Ref # R-74653Requirements Description & Requirements Job Title Senior R&D TechnologistLocation Nijmegen (The Netherlands)About The PositionWe have an excellent opportunity available for a Senior R&D Technologist to make a difference in our R&D organization in Kraft Heinz. This position lies within the International Product Development team. You’ll be working in a high performing team- alongside peers always trying to reach the next level. You’ll be reporting to the R&D Core Growth Manager Taste Elevation- International. This role communicates very strongly with internal senior team members.In brief- you will be responsible for;Partnering with cross functional teams across the International Zone in strategy discussion- connecting on the R&D agenda for our long term vision.Leading technically large and/or high complex projects through company process- partnering with across functional team.Leading product portfolio management- translating consumers’ needs into meaningful business opportunities.Setting a R&D roadmap/ JTBD in your area of remit to drive innovation / renovation / value creation initiatives.Collaborating with BU R&D teams- supporting IZ pipeline deployment and using IZ capabilities.Ensuring connection between category strategy and Technology platforms and related future proof enablers.Coaching and mentoring product technologists.Managing budgets for projects & platforms and coordinating resources.QualificationsMSc (required) in Food Science &Technology (or equivalent in related field as Biology- Chemistry- Engineering).6-8 years of experience in Product Development in Food industry (expertise in sauces category is preferable).Proven experience working in international and complex / matrix organization.Ability to deal with complex projects and build effective partnerships with other functions.Consumer & customer focused.Ability to translate science & technology in consumers solutions- strategic thinking.Creative & energetic- flexible & pragmatic- resilient.Strong communication skills- influencing and presentation skills.Excellent communication in English.Professional AttributesGreat teammate.Fast integration in the team. High performance team mentality. You connect easily with people and feel motivated by international environment and experience different cultures.Ability to Simplify.Your ability to simplify and pragmatism will be highly appreciated- as your capability to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset.Ability to multitask.Lead multiple assignments/tasks concurrently with the ability to question the priority of work. Willing to work in a high pressure but rewarding environment.Possess strong technical functional skills- champion in with routines- processes- WoW- methodologies; suggest changes and improvements.Proven ability to influence stakeholders.Can work independently with a high degree of autonomy and ownership- open to give coaching and bring people along the journey.What we offer youAn ambitious employer; we only want to the best for you;A fast career track like only few other companies can match;A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market);Reimbursed travel expenses;Always room for new ideas; if you have an excellent idea- please let us know and we can set it in action!Hybrid working (3/2)Inclusion matters to usEveryone is welcome at our table. In fact- we thrive on learning and growing from our diverse group of backgrounds and perspectives.Doesn’t matter who you are- where you’re from- or who makes your heart sing. We want you to show up as your authentic self- excited to work with amazing colleagues to solve complex challenges and innovate in an ever-changing industry.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race- religion- colour- national origin- sex- gender- gender expression- sexual orientation- age- marital status- veteran status- or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process- to perform essential job functions- and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.About UsKraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Junior Business Analyst
description: In het kortDe wereld verandert snel – en onze rol als gatekeeper verandert mee. Vanuit onze purpose ‘Banking for better, for generations to come’ zetten we ons in voor een duurzaam, stabiel en veilig financieel systeem. Het opsporen van ‘Financial Crime’ (DFC) staat bij ons dan ook hoog op de agenda. Daarmee vertellen we jou niets nieuws, want je bent maatschappelijk betrokken, integer en innovatief. Je wilt het juiste voor de klant, de maatschappij en de bank.Binnen Detecting Financial Crime (DFC) hebben we alle activiteiten rond het opsporen van financiële criminaliteit samengebracht. De voortschrijdende technologie is zowel een kans als een bedreiging. Niet alleen kunnen wij hierdoor ons opsporingswerk verbeteren, ook maakt het de georganiseerde misdaad steeds geavanceerder. ‘Detecting financial crime’ is een ‘ongoing process’ dat dag in dag uit het uiterste vraagt van onze expertise en alertheid.Je werkAls Junior Business Analist bij Planning & Release Management Change werk je aan de kwaliteit, betrouwbaarheid, ontwikkeling en opschaling van de P&RM (data-)producten. Je bent data-gedreven, resultaat-, oplossings- en klantgericht. Ook kan je business context naar IT oplossingen vertalen of ben je bereid om dit te leren. Je bent een team player, deelt proactief kennis binnen het team en challenget P&RM collega’s om het team verder te brengen.Planning & Release Management Change kent 4 focusgebieden: Back End, Populatie, Prioritering en Release. Jij bent met name actief binnen het staff team. Binnen het team wordt het volgende van je verwacht: Het optimaliseren van de betrouwbaarheid van alle PRM producten Je vertaald business wensen naar concrete requirements Goede onderlinge communicatie & samenwerking met collega’s binnen en buiten het team.WerkomgevingPlanning & Release Management Change (P&RM, afdeling binnen DFC) is de centrale regisseur tussen IT (alle inkomende klant- & transactiedata) en de operatie. In het werk van P&RM worden elke dag duizenden klantdossiers geprepareerd, gelabeld, geprioriteerd en vrijgegeven voor onderzoek aan analistenteams, robots & andere systemen op basis van hun risicoprofiel.Deze workflow is continu in ontwikkeling met uiteenlopende initiatieven zoals bijvoorbeeld het aansluiten van API’s, het onboarden van nieuwe klanten, capaciteitsberekeningen en het pre-fillen van klantdossiers in onze systemen.Je profiel Afgeronde WO-opleiding; Minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring; Ervaring met Data en Business Analyse; Pré: ervaring met IT en OPS omgeving; Pré: ervaring met complex stakeholdermanagement; Pré: ervaring met Power BI; Pré: ervaring met Agile en Scrum werken; Communicatief vaardig in het Nederlands;Wij bieden Wij bieden je veel ruimte om te groeien en de vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen Af en toe thuiswerken? In overleg zijn er mogelijkheden. We bieden goede faciliteiten voor flexibel werken vanuit huis. Wij helpen je om fit & vitaal te blijven Een aanvullend benefit budget van 11%, waarmee je flexibel arbeidsvoorwaarden kunt kopen Een persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000 per jaar Een OV-jaarabonnement Een goede pensioenregelingInteresse?Ben je geïnteresseerd? Reageer dan nu op deze vacature. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Thomas Kamps (thomas.kamps@nl.abnamro.com). We maken graag kennis met je.Gelijke kansen voor iedereenHet succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt.Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureausExterne recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om cv's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.Wij vragen Een motiverende kracht Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Renewables International Graduate Programme - Europa
description: Erste Platzierung in Deutschland, Großbritannien, Italien, Polen, Schweden, Niederlande oder Dänemark Start zum 1. September 2024, Vollzeit, befristete für 18 MonateWie sieht die Energie der Zukunft aus? Bei RWE haben wir ein klares Ziel: Klimaneutralität bis 2040 durch umfangreiche Investitionen in innovative Technologien, den ständigen Ausbau grüner Erzeugungskapazitäten und talentierte Nachwuchskräfte. Dafür suchen wir die nächste Generation von qualifizierten und ehrgeizigen Absolventen wie dich!Lass uns gemeinsam die Energie von morgen gestalten – werde ein aktiver Teil der Energiewende und des #TeamRWE! Was wir bieten: Der Einstieg in deine Karriere Unser 18-monatiges Renewables International Graduate Programme bietet dir die Möglichkeit, vertiefende Einblicke in das Business zu erhalten, ein eigenes internationales Netzwerk aufzubauen und dein Wissen in anspruchsvolle Projekte einzubringen. Unser Ziel ist es, dir einen umfassenden Überblick über die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette von RWE zu geben. Nach erfolgreichem Abschluss des Programms besteht die Möglichkeit, unbefristet ein volles Teammitglied zu werden.Du wirst an drei Rotationen in verschiedenen Unternehmensbereichen teilnehmen.Außerdem hast du die Möglichkeit, maximal 6 Monate im Ausland zu verbringen - außerhalb deines Startlandes. Bewirb dich bitte nur auf eine der beiden Stellenausschreibungen (Europa oder USA) entsprechend deines gewünschten Startlands.Darüber hinaus wirst du während der gesamten Dauer des Programms von einem Mentor unterstützt und deine Entwicklung wird durch Schulungen, Peer-Coaching usw. weiter gefördert. Wen wir suchen: Talente für die Gestaltung der Energiewende Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Masterstudium im Bereich Ingenieurwesen oder Naturwissenschaften (Physik, Geowissenschaften, Geoinformatik, Umweltwissenschaften, Ozeanographie usw.)Außerdem punktest du mit ersten Berufserfahrungen, idealerweise im Bereich der erneuerbaren Energien.Du bringst Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien mit und hast den Wunsch, ein aktiver Teil der Energiewende zu sein.Du verfügst über ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten zur komplexen Problemlösung, kombiniert mit einem strategischen und zukunftsorientierten Mindset.Du bist für deine Neugier, Offenheit für Veränderungen und den Mut, den Status quo in Frage zu stellen, bekannt.Du bist zur Eigeninitiative sowie zur Umsetzung eigener Ideen und Konzepte motiviert und hast ein hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit.Du besitzt die Fähigkeit zur Interaktion und Zusammenarbeit in multikulturellen Teams und hast einen Sinn für Vielfalt und Integration.Du verfügst über verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, andere europäische Sprachen sind ein Plus.rwe.com/karriere rwe.com/graduates Von hier aus profitierst du von vielen weiteren Benefits – Neugierig? Dann klick hier!Jetzt mit wenigen Klicks bewerben: Anzeigencode 83903, Bewerbungsfrist 15.12.2023.Hast Du Fragen? Kontakt im Recruiting: renewables_graduates@rwe.comWir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Behinderung, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. #inclusionmattersNatürlich findest du uns auch bei LinkedIn, Twitter und Xing.RWE steht für Wandel, Innovationskraft und Nachhaltigkeit. Als einer der global führenden Stromerzeuger aus Erneuerbaren Energien wollen wir bis 2040 klimaneutral sein und der Welt ein nachhaltiges Leben ermöglichen. Hierfür suchen wir Macher, die gemeinsam mit uns eine nachhaltige und sichere Energiezukunft schaffen wollen.

title: Junior Research Consultant
description: Your roleWhat It Is AboutWe are looking for a Junior Research Consultant in The Netherlands (Rotterdam office), to perform analysis for quantitative and qualitative market research projects, and work closely with other Research Consultants and Research Managers across our global offices.Your responsibilitiesWhat you’ll doInitially, your focus lies on data analysis and full reporting: based on gathered market research data, you conduct analyses and co-design insightful reports that support our clients in their strategic decision-making process. You will work closely with Research Consultants and Research Managers who will coach and train you, and you will be in close contact with national and international clients to deliver high-value content and services. Depending on your interest and evolution, you will be involved gradually in the complete set-up, organization and execution of market research studies. You will build experience and gradually become responsible for complete methodologies (e.g. sampling, survey design, etc.). You will gain experience and knowledge in a broad range of marketing domains, both within the projects you are involved in and within training. You will be supported in developing commercial client contacts, and in due time you will develop and maintain a client portfolio and get account management responsibilities.Your profileWhat you’ll bringYou’re an ambitious young graduate, preferably with a master’s degree in Psychology, Sociology, Marketing or similar. You have a strong interest in market research and a proficient level of English (verbal and written). It’s a plus if you are comfortable with SPSS, R, Python or similar tools for analysing and interpreting the research findings.What’s in it for youLocal perks and benefitsGlobal hybrid working cultureDiversity & Inclusion initiativesTeam bonding eventsWorking at Human8Our promiseWe take a people-first perspective, fine-tuning what we offer to our people to the changing needs of the individual and context.We believe in giving our people the freedom and autonomy to act, trusting each other to do the right thing, and treating each other with respect.We are committed to helping our people grow personally and professionally, driving inspiration from colleagues, clients and partners all around the world.Being a truly global agency, we connect people and cultures all around the globe and work with the most iconic brands in the world.

title: Quality Engineer
description: IntroductionIntroduction to the jobASML is a Dutch, innovative high-tech company. ASML is one of the most important manufacturers of machines that are often used in the making of chips. Now, there is a worldwide shortage of chips, which means that technological developments worldwide come to an abrupt halt. The continued production of ASML machines is therefore essential for technological developments.The Twinscan Factory (TF) is responsible for the production of ASML lithography systems including planning and logistics. A place where we strive to be the role model Lean Factory where quality comes first but where safety goes before all.Within this sector ASML Motion is responsible for production and qualification of complex, high quality litho-specific linear actuators for the ASML Litho Systems (XT, NXT, NXE, EXE). These systems are built and delivered according to customer requirements, in time and at the right quality. To reach these goals we use the full capability and knowledge of our employees empowering them to excel in their jobs, work as a team and improve every day.Do you want to be part of our dynamic and innovating working environment to further strengthen our manufacturing process? We might be looking for you!MissionThe TF Motion Quality Engineer analyzes, coordinates and solves quality related issues by working in multidisciplinary teams during production and development of linear motors.By doing this you will help in the continues improvement of the production and development of linear motors for all ASML platforms and help to develop TF Motion as linear motor competence center.Job DescriptionThe Quality Engineer reports to the Team leader Quality.Analyze, coordinate and solve quality related issues within the production.Analyze manufacturing processes on capabilities with the aid of quality tools like capability studies and process control tools.Performs failure analysis on quality complaints and nonconforming products and processes.Participates in Continuous Improvement Teams.Support and participate in the NPI process and the competence center.Executes improvement projects in manufacturing.Direct support to suppliers in case of production stagnation due to supplier-Q issuesEducation & ExperienceBachelor Graduate Mechatronics, Mechanics, Electronics or Applied Physics.Vocational education with approximately 5 years of (extensive) working experience. Postgraduate level starter.General Q-methods / -techniques.Familiar with various aspects of the product realization process.Minimum 5 years working experience in a production environment.Administrative experience with common MS Office toolsPersonal skillsHas the drive to improve and can convince others if necessary.Analytical skills, asks questions to find cause behind the cause.Able to change priorities when necessary; keep long term view in mind.Communicator / networker to be informed well and knows to find relevant information.Can lead operational meetings with different disciplines.Knows what has to be done; determines easy major minor issues.Team player shares his knowledge in the team and contributes to long term quality development.Combining an analytical approach with a hands-on mentality. Focused on quality and continuous improvement.Good social and communication skills to work with other departments, such as production and production engineering. Dutch is the main language on the production floor; therefore, candidate must already have good Dutch language skills in speech and writing. Adequate English language skills in speech and writing.Diversity and inclusionASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.Other InformationSince we are located outside the main campus at Oirschot we are a small self-sustaining factory (240 FTE) within ASML. We therefore can organize and collaborate efficiently within our location. The production engineer reports to the Team Leader Production Engineering.Full-time position availableDay shiftUnique and challenging workExcellent guidance by experienced colleagues from the professionA work environment with an open culture where results are achievedTraining to upgrade your skills and development opportunities.This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R.730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.EOE AA M/F/Veteran/DisabilityNeed to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Trust
description: Brief info about VintedVinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.Information about the positionYou’ll become part of the Trust domain, Safety track, with a mission to protect the Vinted community from harmful activities and content. The Safety track of the Trust domain is engaged in detecting, understanding, and stopping fraud and other malicious activities within the Vinted Marketplace. As a product team Decision Scientist, you will become part of a cross-functional team and drive quality of decisions by bringing actionable insights from data.Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA), we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms. In this position, you’llBe your team’s primary point of contact to provide answers to data-related questionsEnsure these questions are answered in optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)Collaborate with your team and stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issuesEnable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) testsHelp to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analysesAbout YouStrong proven experience in Data Analytics (typically 4+ years of working experience or similar activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency)A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiencesStrong analytical, strategic, and business skillsA degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar fieldStatistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)Advantage: experience with Machine Learning techniques (especially NLP)Advantage: experience working in the Trust & Safety or Fraud-related areaWork perksThe opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 working days of holidayNewest MacBook modelsFree access to an office gymMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniturePrivate health insuranceOn-site canteen serving delicious homemade food at discount pricesFrequent team-building eventsA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly officeWorking at VintedIndividual Learning BudgetVinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.Hybrid WorkWe’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.Equal OpportunityThe Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.The salary range for this position is € 56,400 - € 79,925 gross per year.

title: Data Scientist Global Finance
description: At a glanceABN AMRO Clearing N.V. (AACB) is looking for a data scientist to join the Global Finance Data Science team. Do you want to be working in an ambitious data science team covering the financial markets and the clearing industry in an international environment? Thanks to our global network with offices in eleven countries and proximity to all major exchanges, you will serve the best trading firms on four continents.Your jobAs a data scientist you will work on multiple projects and do this with other Data Scientists in the team, where you will often take a leading role. Although we are part of the Global Finance department, our projects extend beyond the finance domain. For example, you will collaborate with colleagues from departments such as risk, operations, and commerce. In your work you will take care of the full development cycle. This includes the following topics:Identifying and exploring new opportunities, including experimentation with prototypes. Building explanatory (time series) models for data-driven business understanding and decision making. Examples are driver analyses for cleared volumes or pricing analysis. Building predictive / forecasting models. Examples are liquidity and trade volume forecasting.Building data pipelines of which the output can be used for our team (e.g. for feature engineering, or directly as input for models) or for colleagues to build dashboards on.Ad-hoc statistical analysis for senior management.Stakeholder management to make your projects a success, where stakeholders could be based in one of our offices in APAC, Europe, the US, or Brazil. Presenting your end-to-end data science solutions to a broad non-technical audience.Translating business use cases where we can apply innovative models such as GPT/large language models. The aim is to put models to production and for this we have supporting infrastructure to do so. With 6.2 billion transactions being cleared annually and with peak volumes of up to 51 million transactions per day, ABN AMRO Clearing produces a lot of data. In other words, lots of possibilities to do relevant and meaningful work for a data science professional.Working environmentABN AMRO Clearing is the cornerstone of global financial markets. We are a globally active multi-asset prime broker, custodian and general clearing member (GCM). We provide execution services, clearing, settlement, custody, securities lending, reporting and financing services for listed derivatives, cash securities, over-the-counter (OTC) products, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), commodities and foreign exchange transactions. We provide services from our offices across Europe, Asia-Pacific, Brazil and the United States. Our coverage includes all major exchanges and execution venues. AACB enjoys market share of 20% or higher for many of the major exchanges on which it operates. As a result, AACB consistently ranks among the top three clearers in every time zone, based on turnover and market share.Positioning in the organizationYou will be working in the Global Finance Data Science team in Amsterdam, reporting to the Global CFO, and closely co-operate with regional finance teams and other departments. We are a team of data enthusiasts, each with our own preferences and skills in the data science domain. With our diverse skillset, we strive for an open and supportive work environment that encourages professional growth and work pleasure. You will play a crucial role in our team as a technical lead in projects and as a mentor for our junior team members, offering you the opportunity to contribute your unique perspective and make your mark.Your profileWe are looking for the following criteria, we do understand that your skills might differ depending on your working experience:4+ years of working experienceMSc or PhD in STEM or related fieldExperience in applying ML and bringing ML models to productionExperience in Python for (statistical) analysis, ETL, feature engineering, and other data science tasksExperience in SQL to access databasesAbility to translate business opportunities to an end-to-end data science use caseAbility to communicate your results and solution to a broad audience, such as C-level management, IT colleagues, and finance professionals.Strong interest and motivation to work in the financial marketsExperience with Dataiku, Tableau, and AWS is a plusNL basedKnowledge about financial products and the financial markets is needed to do the job.
