This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skillsLead the ML team to new heights and bring your experience to solve any development issuesHad multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skillsWithin 6 months you'll:You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work bestHave hired additional ML Engineers to join your growing Enjins’ ML teamHave helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantlyRequirementsMinimum Qualifications:🚶‍♀️You have a relevant background with respect to Machine Learning Engineering and a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experienceYou are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum resultsYou have experience with cloud infrastructure and data engineeringYou have experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOpsPreferred Qualifications: 🏃‍♀️You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to productionYou consider yourself ambitious, responsible, pragmaticYou are fluent in English and are eligible to work in the NetherlandsBenefitsWhat to expect from us: ⚡️We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:A young, close and ambitious team of ML engineersDiverse and challenging projects and clients in The Netherlands and Berlin, read more about it here!A dedicated training program to improve your technical skillsOther knowledge sharing sessions ranging from project discussions to (room for) learning on the job1-on-1 coach for your personal growth and developmentA brand-new office in the city center (Oudegracht) of Utrecht!And last but not least, lots of fun! We promise!Have we spiked your interest? 🌎Let’s have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

title: Data Scientist
description: At Peaks we're looking for a Data Scientist to join our team.Do you love to analyse data and create valuable insights? Do you love saving and investing? Do you love to work in a fast-paced ambitious international scale-up? Well then, please, keep reading. There’s a big chance you and Peaks are a perfect match! Let us introduce ourselves first.About PeaksWe’re Peaks, a fast growing, innovative Dutch fintech scale-up on a mission to help 1 million Europeans build wealth with investing and feel better about their financial future.Since the launch of our app in November 2017 we have grown to one of the largest investment platforms in The Netherlands and Germany and serve more than 100.000 customers.We serve these customers with a team of 40 very ambitious talents. To help Peaks fulfil its mission and growth ambitions, we are looking for a (Marketing) Data Scientist.What You Will Be DoingAs our (Marketing) Data Scientist, you will look into our growth challenges from a data perspective and help to transform data into valuable insights for marketing, product and management, with a strong focus on improving our most important KPIs (customer acquisition retention, product use, customer satisfaction, referrals and revenues).You guide the team with your analysis and ensure they make the right decisions and help setting priorities.You build and maintain data dashboards and deliver reports to the finance team to track KPIs.You identify improvements and spot tracking issues on app and web across all our acquisition channels.You set-up and participate in projects that range from analysing our customer onboarding funnel for conversion improvements to analysing user behaviour (deposit- and withdrawal behaviour, the use of products, etc.).Own your product end-to-end from scoping them together with colleagues, to integrating it into the product with the engineering teams, and monitoring their results on an ongoing basis.You will be working in the marketing department and report to the head of marketing. Next to this, you will collaborate with the product and finance team.What You Will Need To ApplyMaster (MSc) degree in econometrics, quantitative finance, statistics or an equivalent degree.1-3 years work experience in data analysis; preferably in a B2C, scale-up environmentKnowledge and experience in implementing Analytics, Reporting and BI toolingKnowledge of unit growth metricsTechnical Expertise in Data Science: Proficiency in data mining, machine learning, and statistical analysis. Familiarity with programming languages like Python or R, and tools such as SQL, TensorFlow, or similar platforms.Experience with Large Datasets: Ability to work with and extract insights from large volumes of data. Experience with big data technologies and cloud computing platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure could be beneficial. You are eager to learn, you never settle with what you haveExceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both with engineers and business stakeholdersTeam player who thrives on helping and enabling others in a small, fast-paced teamLive in The Netherlands (Peaks is located in the heart of Amsterdam)What We Offer YouA good salary and participation in our employee stock participation planThe opportunity to develop yourself quickly within an ambitious and results driven fintech scale-upNo bureaucratic hassle: a flatter than flat organization and no-nonsense culture;An international environment with a great team of very talented peopleAn office in a prime location in the center of AmsterdamLots of social activities.Apply for the jobDo you want to join our team as our new Data scientist? Then we'd love to hear about you!

title: Data Scientist
description: Your ImpactAs a Data Scientist at Ordina, you’ll dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI). You’ll apply your skills to real scenarios and in different domains, such as the discovery and investigation of payment flows at governmental entities, fraud detection at banks, the development of recommendation systems in the retail sector, and the optimization of supply chains.We are active in themes such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AIOps and Explanable A.I. (XAI). You’ll carry out development and implementation of solutions with Machine Learning & Deep Learning at our clients and assess the quality and performance of existing predictive models through to bringing and keeping them into production.Where you're going to get startedWe create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data.The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them.We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone.This is you Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques:supervised and unsupervised learning algorithmsdeep learninganomaly detectionrecommender systemsnatural language processingcomputer vision and reinforcement learningautoencoders, transformers, forecasting Experience in one of the following languages:PythonRExperience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference casesIn-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learningExperience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantageGood command of the Dutch languageBenefitsPart of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers;focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients;you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative;working with less travel time; remote & flexible;an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged;a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key;a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute;20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits;adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefitschoice between a company car or a mobility scheme;Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Data Scientist
description: LocationLeiden, NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref22287Published7 days agoOne of our clients is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will utilize advanced analytics, machine learning, and deep learning to drive innovation.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign and deploy machine learning and deep learning models to analyze complex biological data sets.Work closely with R&D teams to interpret data and provide actionable insights.Apply deep learning techniques for AI-driven process optimization, enhancing operational efficiency.QualificationsMaster’s or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field, with a focus on deep learning.Demonstrated experience in deep learning, machine learning, and statistical modeling.Strong skills in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL, with a focus on deep learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).Previous experience in the biotech or life sciences sector is REQUIRED.Exceptional problem-solving abilities and communication skills.Permit to work in the EU.Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.Position: Data ScientistContract: Full time (12 months)Location: Hybrid - Remote possibilityStart Date: Immediately or by agreement

title: Data scientist
description: Data ScientistAls Data Scientist bij Zonneplan maak je echt impact op de energietransitie! We bevinden ons in een tijd waar de energiewereld in beweging is en moet zijn. Terwijl de energiebehoeften verschuiven, ben jij degene die met innovatieve oplossingen komt. Door gebruik te maken van de nieuwste data:analysetechnieken en slimme algoritmen, help je ons de energie van de toekomst te begrijpen en te optimaliseren. Wij hebben zelf al meer dan 150.000 IoT devices online staan in slimme meters, laadpalen en zonnepanelen, deze zijn elk moment uit te lezen. Deze data bricks verander je om naar waardevolle inzichten en goede modellen. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat onze klanten niet alleen energie besparen, maar ook bijdragen aan een duurzamere wereld!Over ZonneplanZonneplan, opgericht in 2012, is een pionier in de integratie van IT en data binnen de energiemarkt. Samen met meer dan 260 toegewijde collega's streven we dagelijks naar het versnellen van de energietransitie. We begonnen met het efficiënt inmeten van daken met behulp van satellietbeelden en het geven van nauwkeurige verbruiksvoorspellingen voor zonnepanelen. Maar door de introductie van zonnepanelen ontstond een nieuwe uitdaging: het gelijkmatig verdelen van energie over het netwerk. Daarom hebben we ons ontwikkeld tot een energiebedrijf met dynamische energieprijzen en hebben we onze assets aanstuurbaar gemaakt. Met onze controleerbare en aanstuurbare assets optimaliseren we het energieverbruik om echt voordeel te genereren voor de consument.Jouw rolIn ons team van data werk je aan het Zonneplan Smart Power Platform. Ons doel is het digitaliseren van de energiemarkt en dat realiseren we. Jij zorgt met jouw data:modellen voor real:time inzichten in energiehandel. Jouw voorspellingen sturen aan wanneer onze energiebronnen moeten worden ingeschakeld of uitgeschakeld.Je houdt je bezig met:Het optimaliseren van energievoorspellingsmodellen;Zonnepaneel output voorspellingen gebaseerd op weersdata;Prijselasticiteitsmodellen voor energieklanten;Optimaliseren van inkoop energie op de verschillende markten;Optimalisatie van energiebronnen zoals zonnepanelen, batterijen en laadpalen;Zelfs modellen maken om de ideale planningssystemen te hebben voor onze monteurs en logistiek;Prijspredicatie voor diverse energiemarkten en arbitragemogelijkheden onderzoeken.Wat verwachten we van jou?Expertise in data:analyse en machine learning modellen;Een WO:opleiding in data science, econometrie of vergelijkbaar;Ervaring met Python en SQL;Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en teamspeler;Kennis van de energiemarkt is een pré;Proactieve houding en daadkrachtig;Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Wat biedt Zonneplan jou?Werken bij Zonneplan betekent deel uitmaken van een IT: en data:gedreven organisatie met een focus op de klant en een passie voor duurzame ontwikkelingen. We dagen onze mensen uit om net dat stapje extra te zetten. We zijn innovatief waar mogelijk en altijd persoonlijk. Voor jou betekent dit:Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;Je werkt samen met 260 professionele collega's die de energietransitie willen versnellen;Duurzaamheidskorting op onze producten voor jou en je familie;Je draagt dagelijks bij aan een echte duurzame energietransitie;Jouw producten hebben direct impact op grote schaal;Er zijn geen grenzen aan wat mogelijk is; onze focus ligt echt op het beste product;We ontwikkelen alles intern, wat zorgt voor korte communicatielijnen, snelle besluitvorming en de mogelijkheid om ad hoc te kunnen werken;We zijn eerlijk, vriendelijk, informeel en loyaal naar elkaar en de organisatie;Reiskostenvergoeding; reis je met het OV? Dan krijg je van ons jouw traject vergoed en een échte Zonneplan fiets. Reis je liever met de auto? Dan krijg je een kilometervergoeding;Geweldige collega's en sociale evenementen met het hele bedrijf, zoals vrijdagmiddagborrels en speciale evenementen.Voor verdere informatie of vragen betreffende de vacature voor Data Scientist, gelieve contact op te nemen met Arend:Jan via 088 020 3012 of Arendjan.noordam@zonneplan.nl. We zien uit naar uw sollicitatie.

title: Data Scientist
description: The OpportunityAre you a passionate data scientist interested in diving deeper into esports? Are you curious to know which team is ruling the game and whether the worst-performing team in Asia can outshine the best-performing team in North America? Do you have a burning desire to explore whether supports are better than mid-players? If yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!Join us at Liquipedia as our Data Scientist and be part of our mission to create objective rankings of teams and players across multiple esports. We are seeking a dynamic commander who can take charge of this exciting project and help us uncover the answers to these intriguing questions (and many more!) for everyone interested in esports. As the ideal candidate, you should have a solid background in machine learning methods and a strong inclination towards self-starting. We are counting on you to guide us in the most efficient way to unravel these mysteries, taking charge of this project while getting stakeholder buy-in across the company.This temporary full-time role is available from January to September 2024.What You’ll Be Doing Collect and aggregate data from internal and external databasesPreprocess structured and unstructured dataWork closely with internal and external parties to define key dataExamine large amounts of data to detect patterns for rankingDevelop algorithms for ranking esports players and teamsPresent results to stakeholders, including those with limited technical knowledgePartner with design to display rankings in the best way possibleWhat You’ll Need2+ years of Data Science experienceProficient in PythonAbility to write SQL queriesFamiliarity with APIsIn-depth knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning methodsExperience with data wrangling and handling data imperfectionsHands-on experience with data science toolsProblem-solving and detail-oriented mindset with strong business sense.BenefitsPensionTrain card25 vacation daysLunchCompany events, Gameday, Summer parties, and much moreCompetitive salaryUsing your creativity to execute different types of projectsKeeping up with the latest trends and learning new skillsCreating strong relationships with experienced team members who will coach and mentor you

title: Software Engineer in Machine Learning
description: Just as every tooth is unique and requires precision in its care, our AI solutions demand precision in their design and implementation. At Promaton, we're revolutionizing dental healthcare with AI, and we need your expertise. See our company page to learn more about what we do.As a Software Engineer in Machine Learning you will be working closely with our platform and product teams, enabling fast iterations and scalable ML solutions.As part of our dynamic team, you will be:Making our AI pipelines work smoothly by solving complex problems.Implementing MLOps best practices.Working with an accomplished team of machine learning researchers and engineers that already have 8 patents on their name.Helping researchers launch new products and help maintain products already used by customers. Some initiatives on our MLOps roadmap for the next months: Improving speed and robustness of multiple machine learning products Continuous monitoring of incoming data in productionThe challenges you’ll face:All our products process large data points, ranging from 5 up to 700MB. This means that a lot of off-the-shelve tooling doesn't work for us, and we need to invent our own to process and manage our data. We are a cloud-native company, and cloud-native ML frameworks are still in their early days. You'll help us navigate the ever evolving ecosystem of tools, to make sure we find the right balance between off-the-shelf and home-grown tooling. Medical AI has to comply with the highest quality standards. While in other industries failing to predict for example a recommended product has little consequence, in the medical field you really don't want to be wrong.The perks of working at Promaton:💰 Attractive salary package, and excellent employment terms🏡 Excellent work/life balance. Freedom to work from home or anywhere you like (and any time you like). We only have a few touchpoints👩‍🔬 Dedicated time for hackathons and growth, to explore new ideas of your own. Every quarter we have a hackathon week where you can work on anything you like to expand your skill set!🙌 Staying up to date with the latest happening in the ML field can be hard. That is why we organize monthly paper review sessions to discuss the latest developments in the field to stay up to date with the current state-of-the-art. Next to that we regularly hold “ML Sparring Sessions” where you can spar with other MLRs in the company on potential directions for projects you are working on.🎓 Real training budget for books and conferences or anything else you need to grow🚀 Work with the latest technology, at the forefront of a rapidly developing field in medical imaging AI💪 Loads of responsibility and autonomy (we hate micromanagement) and a chance to make a real impact🏖 Awesome yearly company retreat, and quarterly team events⛺️ 32 days of annual leave💻 Top-notch gear, and even bigger servers to play with🏄‍♂️ Promaton is funded for many years to come, meaning you can have the impact you only get at a startup, but with the job security of an established company🛬 For international engineers, based in the NL (already relocated to the Netherlands) we are able to offer visa sponsorship🎈Inclusive environment, we value and celebrate diversity3+ years experience working with PythonSolid understanding of software development best practices, including:proficiency in Git understanding system design conceptstesting Experience with AWS/GCP/Azure or Kubernetes deploymentA passion for growing and expanding your skillset Experience with iterations on live productsGood collaboration and communication skillsBonus points:Interest or experience in MLOps Experiment and data versioning Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals Experience working asynchronously with a distributed teamPrevious experience in medical or other regulated fieldWe're excited to see how you can make a difference in our team. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in healthcare through AI, we'd love to hear from you!Good to know:It goes without saying that we love the power of AI, but we believe the human touch is irreplaceable in recruitment. We are looking forward to your personalized answers to our screening questions, not ChatGPT's insights!Wondering if you should you apply if your experience doesn't fit all of the job requirements? In general, we are aiming for an 80% match, so please go ahead if you got excited by the role and by the idea of joining our team! Not the right role? You can still send us an open application!Read our blog about How to be successful in our selection process for more tips and tricks!

title: Applied Scientist
description: The Impact You Will Make:As an Applied Scientist within our ADAS/ADS unit, you will be at the forefront of translating recent scientific advancements and cutting-edge technologies into real-world applications and products. Your impact will encompass: Collaborating closely with a multidisciplinary team of Engineers, Data Scientists, and Applied Scientists to transform scientific breakthroughs into Advanced AI software solutions. Utilizing your analytical skills to develop automated approaches that harness the full potential of data streams, optimizing the quality and efficiency of our mapping processes. Taking a leading role in designing and implementing advanced (AI-enabled) systems that leverage multisensory data and multimodality models, with a specialized focus on autonomous driving and real-time map generation. Applying deep learning methodologies and machine learning algorithms to develop pioneering systems that empower the capabilities of our real-time map creation. Adapting and fine-tuning deep learning and machine learning models for seamless deployment on low-power embedded devices, ensuring enhanced performance and operational efficiency. Driving transformative changes by taking ownership of your responsibilities, contributing to the elevation of team performance and successful project outcomes. Demonstrating adaptability through embracing iterative development methodologies and addressing evolving technical challenges head-on. Leading the initiation of new projects, positioning yourself as a key technical influencer within the unit and departments, and guiding strategic technology decisions. Balancing intricate technical decisions with their broader business and operational impacts, making well-informed trade-offs to effectively meet the company's overarching objectives. Crafting code and designing structures that promote collaborative teamwork and facilitate enhanced productivity and engagement among team members. Facilitating the resolution of contentious technical discussions by building consensus and showcasing your adeptness at leading through influence. What You Will Need:A PhD or MS degree in computer vision, machine learning, or a related field, complemented by multiple research publications in top AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR etc.) or journals, or equivalent industry experience solving intricate AD and Mapping challenges. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and/or C++, enabling the seamless development and implementation of your solutions. An in-depth understanding of sensor data processing and multimodal sensor fusion, especially in working with Cameras and LiDAR. Prior experience with GIS and RADAR is a plus. Extensive expertise in various computer vision approaches and deep learning methodologies including image / point cloud registration and structure from motion, 2D / 3D object detection and segmentation, self-supervised learning, active learning, uni-/multi-modal foundation models etc., allowing you to continually innovate and adapt in response to evolving ADAS technologies. Keep abreast of related literature and a documented history of successfully steering ML research projects from inception to completion, covering problem formulation, experimentation, iteration, and eventual publication or product integration. Effective communication skills, encompassing both written and verbal proficiency, to clearly articulate complex technical concepts and collaborate harmoniously within a diverse team. Familiarity with programming tools and deep learning frameworks, including Git, OpenCV, PyTorch/TensorFlow etc. Nice to have:Proficiency in map-related technologies such as SLAM, HD mapping, and geospatial data processing. Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning tools: Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, NumPy, Databricks, Spark, MLFlow, Hyperoptetc. General software tools: Docker, Azure/AWS, GIS softwares like QGIS etc. What we offerA competitive compensation package, of course.Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.Meet your teamWe're Product Unit Automation. We develop and operate map production systems for high-quality map data. This data goes on to power ADAS speed control, localization for L2+ robotics driving and more, helping TomTom on its mission to create the smartest, most useful map on the planet. In our team, you'll build data-oriented systems that leverage the freshest data through various sources, utilize machine learning techniques and improve themselves with quantitative and qualitative feedback.At TomTom...You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.Work with a team of 3,800+ unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.After you applyOur recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.TomTom is an equal opportunity employerTomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Scientist
description: Voor een van de grootste bedrijven van Nederland, met een jaaromzet van meer dan € 8,1 miljard en meer dan 16.000 medewerkers wereldwijd, zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Met enkele honderden vestigingen in 65 landen staat de organisatie midden in de samenleving en spelen in op trends als verstedelijking, elektrificatie, duurzaamheid en digitalisering. Daarnaast ondersteunen zij verschillende maatschappelijke initiatieven en nemen we actief deel aan maatschappelijke sponsoring. Een werkgever die werkt met topmerken, duurzaamheid actief omarmt en in jou investeert en mooie kansen biedt.Onlangs is de organisatie de trotse mede-eigenaar geworden van Europcar Mobility Group. Nu zijn zij op het moment aangekomen om deze overname verder uit te bouwen. Hiermee zet men een belangrijke stap voorwaarts om marktleider te worden in duurzame mobiliteit. Onze ambitie is om tev groeien tot een toonaangevend mobiliteitsplatform. Hierbij moet je denken aan een hoogwaardige, duurzame en innovatieve aanbieding van mobiliteit voor 1 minuut tot 24 maanden. Met dit initiatief kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat we centraal staan in de wereld van ‘’nieuwe mobiliteit”. Denk hierbij aan rental, car subscription en (car) sharing. Voor de vormgeving van de organisatie die hier aan bij moet gaan dragen, zijn wij het team aan het samenstellen.Data ScientistWij zoeken een Data Scientist die het als uitdaging ziet om het proces te ontwerpen en te realiseren waarmee we komen tot het optimaal verzamelen, integreren en analyseren van waardevolle data en informatie voor de rental business. Dit moet de nieuwe organisatie in staat stellen om optimale besluitvorming en digitalisering van processen te realiseren met behulp van Advanced Analytics. Dit doe je door jouw deskundige kennis en ervaring in te zetten en daarmee bij te dragen in het team van de Business Information Manager. Dit team is in ontwikkeling en zal zich vormen tot een team met een Data Scientist een Business Information Analyst en een Application manager.In dit team zorg je voor betrouwbare en bruikbare analyses die worden voorgelegd als waardevolle inzichten aan de gebruikers. Door het ontwikkelen van analytics tools voor eindgebruikers in de business maak je de informatie bruikbaar en verzorg je Data Science oplossingen (op basis van statistische modellen en/of algoritmes). Je levert een proactieve bijdrage in projecten om continue meer data driven te worden. Tevens ben je onderdeel van het netwerk bestaande uit verschillende data science functies binnen de organisatie.De Data Scientist bezit:Een afgeronde HBO/WO Business Analytics, Data Science, Econometrie en/of elk ander exacte wetenschap / STEM opleiding; Ruime ervaring (5+ jaar) als Data Science specialist; Uitstekende kennis van relevante software; Een visie op het gebruik van data science en ervaring met van fleet/yield management; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse- en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Een initiatiefrijk karakter en zoekt naar nieuwe invalshoeken en andere mogelijkheden voor verbeteringen/oplossingen.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Sogeti is een organisatie met een goede werksfeer en zo min mogelijk hiërarchische verhoudingen. Ga je bij ons als Machine Learning Engineer de slag? Dan kun je rekenen op honderden collega’s die klaarstaan om klanten te helpen, en ook elkaar graag een helpende hand bieden. Sogetisten gaan niet alleen voor goede resultaten, maar ook voor lol tijdens het werk. Deze snelgroeiende groep collega’s krijgt energie van hun vak en dat merk je op de werkvloer. Sogeti is een fijne werkgever en geeft jou de ruimte om de inhoud in te duiken!Werken bij SogetiAls Machine Learning Engineer help je onze klanten vertrouwd te maken met het verwerken van complexe data door middel van machine learning, data mining en deep learning technologieën. Je zet statistische modellen en voorspellende algoritmes in om verborgen patronen te onthullen. Daarbij ontwikkel je end-tot-end oplossingen om je werk te operationaliseren. Niet alleen PoC’s maar ook robuuste oplossingen die in productie worden gebruikt. Dit doe je samen met het Center of Excellence (CoE) van ons AI-team, of in directe samenwerking met de klant. Je creëert echte impact door middel van het toepassen van machine learning en AI-technieken.﻿Vragen waar jij voor onze klanten een antwoord op gaat geven zijn bijvoorbeeld: Hoe kunnen we ongestructureerde data analyseren en begrijpen? Kunnen wij klantgedrag voorspellen? Na de POC fase blijven we hangen, wat doen we met onze AI modellen? Hoe kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat onze modellen efficiënt werken blijven doorontwikkelen? Hoe zorgen we ervoor dat onze modellen businesswaarde genereren? Hoe kunnen we generative AI veilig en ethisch inzetten?Wie ben jij?✔ Je hebt een HBO of masterdiploma (WO) ;✔ Je hebt minimaal drie jaar werkervaring als Machine Learning Engineer of consultant in het werkveld van Data Science en AI. Veel werkervaring met EDA en Machine Learning (Computer Vision, NLP, Timeseries, Generative AI) is belangrijk;✔ Implementeren van technologieën aan de hand van de AI stack van Python (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Pandas, Numpy, HuggingFace’s Transformers)? Geen probleem!✔ Je hebt ervaring met het operationaliseren van ML/AI-modellen✔ Naast het toepassen van kijk je kritisch naar de impact van de techniek en zorg je dat (generative) AI veilig en ethisch kan worden gebruikt✔ Je bent in de wolken van Cloudoplossingingen (Azure, AWS, GCP) én kan agile werken? Ja!✔ CI/CD Tools zoals Jenkins, Travis CICurrently we are specific looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch on C1 levelDit bieden wij jou✔ Uitdagende opdrachten bij toffe klanten zoals het onderzoeken en implementeren van synthetische datageneratie, gebruikmakend van state-of-the-art technieken.✔ Top Notch begeleiding bij al jouw werkzaamheden, ontwikkelingsvraagstukken, ambitie en uitdagingen!✔ Een salarisindicatie tussen de €3000,- en €5000,-. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring;✔ Onbeperkt ontwikkelbudget;✔ Aantrekkelijke lease regeling met hybride en volledig elektrische auto’s;✔ 26 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid tot extra bijkopen)✔ Goede pensioensregeling✔ Groeien en genieten. Wij zorgen voor een cultuur waarin jij tot je recht komt.✔ Vette events zoals Pizza avonden, ski-trips, game nights, movie nights en de befaamde AI karaoke nights.﻿Weet jij nog iets? The sky is the limit.You make technology work. Solliciteer nu!Dus durf jij de uitdaging aan en wil jij meehelpen het succes van onze community verder uit te bouwen? Solliciteer dan direct!﻿Een PES-screening maakt onderdeel uit van de onboarding van Sogeti.﻿Currently we are specific looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch on C1 level.

title: Data scientist | Valcon NL
description: Wat ga jij doen?As a Data Scientist, you are able to understand specific questions from our customers and answer them with data-driven analyses. In this role, you are responsible for gathering the right information, formulating working hypotheses and testing these in order to solve problems step by step. In addition, you are able to communicate the analysical steps, outcomes and impact in a clear way to both team members and (external) stakeholders. Similarly, you will be responsible for implementing and possibly automating these steps and their integration into our clients’ data systems.Waar kom je te werken?Valcon is a north-western European consulting, technology and data company based in the Netherlands, Denmark, UK, Sweden, Germany and Croatia. Our mission is to combine premium consulting with deep technology and data knowledge to add value to our clients. With our capabilities, we help clients to create value in transformations, from operational strategy to implementation, supported by a wide array of IT tools.Wat wij vragen?A completed technical university degree or PhD.Minimum of 2 years work experience as a Data Scientist, or as a Business Consultant with experience in data related issuesStrong team player with good communication skills.Curious and self-critical with strong analytical skills.Experience with analysis and programming of business issues and solutions (in e.g. Python, R, C/C++, SQL).You are fluent in Dutch and EnglishWat wij bieden?An energetic, ambitious and international environment with a great working atmosphere.An environment with significant autonomy and responsibility.A steep learning curve and structured coaching from your own mentor.A thriving community, active in both business and social events.Market relevant employment package (salary, benefits fund, bonus, lease car or mobility allowance and laptop).

title: Data Scientist | Interfood Group
description: Wat ga jij doen?Interfood is one of the leading global dairy trading firms, both in physical as well as financial products. To support further growth of our business, Interfood is putting digital and analytics in the core of our business strategy. Our Global Analytics team acts as the innovation center on advanced analytics and data science, supporting the strategic agenda set by the Executive Committee. Over the past years, we have built a healthy analytics environment and we are keen to keep working on more use case developments and continuous improvement. This opportunity is for supporting data professionals to grow fast with our organization. You and your team will work in close collaboration and will maintain close ties with the other IT teams (Process & Projects, Digital & Integrations, Cloud & Ops) as well as business functions.Therefore, we encourage data scientists and data analysts with DS skills who want to develop further in DS roles to apply.In This Role, You WillCollaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and other teams to collect data/modelling requirements.Implement time-series analysis, statistical analysis, simulations and optimizations, etc.Market forecast, risk management, and supply chain optimization use cases.Identify model improvements.Present your results and think along with the stakeholders.Waar kom je te werken?We work together as one team towards one goal, that is why we help each other to be successful.We take ownership for long-term success, that is why we treat the business as if it were our own.We challenge to drive progress, that is why we embrace new ideas and fresh perspectivesWat wij vragen?Advanced working knowledge of Python.Knowledge of PySpark, SQL, and R is a plus.Expertise in data analysis, statistical/ML methods. Experience with time-series analysis is a plus.Experience with delivering ML solutions in a cloud environment.Experience with dashboarding / data visualization (e.g. Tableau, Lookup).Experience in Agile working.Wat wij bieden?Competitive compensation and benefits. Salary depends on your experience and education.We commit to help you stay on top of your game through tailored training and coaching organized with our partner companies.High exposure to business and projects with tangible impacts.Career development and rotation possibility to offices in other regions.40 hour work week, 25 holidays.Travel internationally.We provide healthy food and gym training for free.Participate in fun team activities.

title: Data Scientist
description: For this position we are only considering applicants based in the Netherlands.*About UsAgap2 is a European IT Consultancy, active in 14 countries with over 7.000 employees. Since 2014 we are based in the Netherlands with our Amsterdam office to provide our IT expertise to the Dutch market.PositionAs a Data Scientist at agap2 you take on the challenge within an international environment with a local focus. You will have the opportunity to work on various projects along the years, based on your experience and interests. Projects within industries such as Banking, Fintech, Telco, Retail, Sports and Healthcare.While working at agap2 you are expected to share your knowledge while also having the opportunity to learn new technologies. We believe that sharing knowledge is the key to personal development. Our talent management program is tailor-made to give you the opportunity to develop and grow in your career, the way you envision it. Because we work with various customers, you are also expected to be able to adapt to different environments.RequirementsDegree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence or similar;At least 3 years of experience as Data Scientist/Engineer in Cloud infrastructure;Experience with data warehousing, data processing, pipeline design and orchestration;General knowledge of object-oriented programming is valued;Knowledge of Databases, SQL and/or NoSQL;Experience with deployment tools like GitHub, Jira, Docker, Kubernetes;Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies;Being result and quality oriented;Having strong communication skills and a fluent command of the English language and preferably the Dutch language;Being a team player. Want to share, dare to learn!What We OfferCompetitive salaryFull travel allowancePension plan25 vacation daysLaptop and mobile phoneDutch coursePleasant and informal working atmosphere within an international organisationChallenging projects based on your interests and experienceRoom for own input and ideasTailor-made talent management program to help you achieve your professional goalsAccess to tech events and meetupsIs there still room for fun? Of course! The combination of fun and development is important in our team. A small impression: our team consists of more than 10 nationalities, we play football and regularly organize tech meetups, Friday afternoon drinks and pub quizzes.

title: Data Scientist
description: Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.Who We Are SupportingThe NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.The program Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.In order to provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorises: NATO International Civilians (NIC)s, Military (Mil) and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.Role Duties And ResponsibilitiesUnder the direction of the Section Head, they will perform duties such as:Applies existing data science techniques to new problems and datasets using specialised programming techniques to meet needs of the Agency and its customers;Selects from existing data sources and prepares data to be used by data science models;Evaluates the outcomes and performance of data science models. Identifies and implements opportunities to train and improve models and the data they use;Publishes and reports on machine learning model outputs to meet customer needs and conforming to agreed standards;Supports review of data science and AI activities, processes, products or services;Support development and maintenance of data pipelines for structured and unstructured data;Support maintenance of the Agency's data lakes, implementing updates and working with system owners to ensure data is available for analysis;Contribute to machine learning initiative across the Business Area with suggestions for ML approaches and implementation, including the processing of training data and performance assessment of machine learning techniques on datasets;Contribute to new/modifications to data science toolsets and metrics;Remain up-to-date with new developments in data science and AI to bring innovative ideas into implementation;Deputize for higher grade staff, if required;Perform other duties as may be required.Professional Contacts:They are responsible for:Active engagement with colleagues across the Agency;Supporting engagement with stakeholders, including industry and academia.Essential Skills And ExperienceUse of data science tools to support data analytics and data visualisation;Experience involving supporting data focused operations in a technical organisation. Such experience should encompass at least 2 skills listed below:Experience of working within a Big Data ecosystem, with tools such as DataBricks, Spark etc;Planning, executing and maintaining data pipelines;Knowledge of Machine Learning, statistical and mathematical models and ability to effectively explain them to both technical and non-technical colleagues;Proven ability to effectively communicate orally and in writingEducationA minimum requirement of a Bachelor's degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (such as; Data Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering) with 3 years of post-related experience;Desirable Experience and Education:A Master's degree or higher at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (Data Science, AI engineering);Experience in data presentation tools e.g. Microsoft Power BI,Spotfire, Tableau; Kibana; Dash; Streamlit;Knowledge of DevOps best practices (git, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery pipelines etc)Experience with Cloud ComputingCompetencies or Personal Attributes:Creating and Innovating –Produces new ideas, approaches, or insights; creates innovative products or designs; produces a range of solutions to problems.Achieving Personal Work Goals and Objectives –Accepts and tackles demanding goals with enthusiasm; works hard and puts in longer hours when it is necessary; seeks progression to roles of increased responsibility and influence; identifies own development needs and makes use of developmental or training opportunities.Delivering Results and Meeting Customer Expectations –Focuses on customer needs and satisfaction; sets high standards for quality and quantity; monitors and maintains quality and productivity;works in a systematic, methodical and orderly way; consistently achieves project goals.Language ProficiencyA thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.Working LocationThe Hague, NetherlandsWorking PolicyOn-SiteTravelBusiness travel to NATO and national facilities as well as frequent travel between the NCIA offices;Contract DurationJan 2024 – Dec 2024Security ClearanceValid National or NATO Secret personal security clearanceWe never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

title: Data Scientist duurzaam werk en smart organisations
description: Over deze vacatureBij TNO werken bevlogen experts die hun stempel drukken op deze tijd. Want dit is de tijd om te innoveren. Om de wereld van werk verder te helpen. Dit is de tijd om te werken aan systeeminnovaties voor het verbeteren van de duurzame inzetbaarheid en productiviteit van werkenden voor Nederland en andere Europese landen. Kom werken bij TNO als Data Scientist duurzaam werk en smart organisations en druk ook jouw stempel op deze tijd!Wat ga je doen?Duurzame inzetbaarheid van mensen is van groot belang. Niet alleen voor Nederland, maar ook voor Europa. De expertise groep Sustainable Productivity and Employability bestaat uit psychologen, bewegingswetenschappers, gezondheidswetenschappers, sociologen, data scientists en methodologen (ruim 45 medewerkers). Zij zetten zich in voor het verbeteren van duurzame inzetbaarheid van werkenden. Dat doen wij door te werken aan oplossingen waarmee de totale groep werkenden zo lang mogelijk gezond, vitaal en bevlogen aan het werk blijft. Om dit te bereiken doen we onderzoek, ontwikkelen en evalueren we interventies en oplossingen op het terrein van Foresight, skills matching, ontwikkeling (“leven lang leren”), het aanpassen van het werk (job crafting) en mobiliteit (met aspecten rondom flexibilisering).Als Data Scientist werk je in het team Smart Organisations. Dit team bestuit uit 7 collega's. Er is veel kennis over arbeidsmarktonderzoek, statistiek en modelleren. Wat we nu nog missen is kennis van machine learning, deep learning en neural networks. Hier kom jij om de hoek kijken. Jij voert in teamverband verschillende (inter)nationale onderzoeks- en adviesprojecten uit. Doel hiervan is om de duurzame inzetbaarheid en productiviteit van werknemers te bevorderen en te borgen. Daarbij ligt jouw focus op het uitvoeren van kwantitatief onderzoek, zoals Het voeren van complexe data-analyses voor gezondheids- en arbeidsdata uit met behulp van statistische methoden, machine learning-algoritmen en data visualisatietools om trends, patronen en inzichten te identificeren; Analyseren van teksten met textmining en Natural Language Processing; het ontwikkelen van data infrastructuur; koppeling van databestanden (big data); tooling en implementatie; het borgen van kennis over machine learning, deep learning en neural networks in het team; het publiceren van onderzoeksresultaten, ook in wetenschappelijke tijdschriften. Je gaat samenwerken met vakinhoudelijk experts en een TNO breed netwerk van Data Scientists die werken aan geavanceerde analytische methoden en artificiële intelligentie (AI). Bijvoorbeeld de ontwikkeling van conceptuele en theoretische verklaringen omtrent beroepsmobiliteit en de betekenis van vaardigheden (skills). Vanuit je rol zorg je voor de verbinding tussen de sociale wetenschappers van de afdeling en de AI specialisten van andere afdelingen. Zo draag je bij aan ontwikkeling en innovatie binnen de afdeling SPE en de unit Healthy Living and Work. Daarnaast werk je mee aan projectvoorstellen, offertes, (beleids- en advies) rapporten en artikelen in het Engels en bij voorkeur ook in het Nederlands.Wat wij van jou verwachtenJe hebt aantoonbare ervaring met machine learning, deep learning en neural networks. Denk aan werken met analyse- en programmeersoftware (R, Python, Matlab), up-to-date kennis over artificiële intelligentie en tekst miningJe hebt een relevante (wetenschappelijke) opleiding. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan data science, sociologie, psychologie, econometrie of een andere discipline binnen de sociale wetenschappen).Je hebt ervaring als onderzoeker en je vindt het ook leuk om te publiceren. De ervaring kan je prima opgedaan hebben in bijvoorbeeld een PhD.Je hebt affiniteit met maatschappelijke vraagstukken en arbeidsmarktonderzoek. Het maken van maatschappelijke impact is waar jij het voor doet.Wat wij jou biedenUitdagend én afwisselend werk met serieuze impact. En volop kansen, want bij TNO heb je grotendeels zelf de regie over je carrière. Naast een bruto (fulltime) maandsalaris tussen € 4.500,- en € 5.750,- (afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring), vakantiegeld (8%), een dertiende maand (8,33%) en een flexbudget (5,58% + €180), krijg je alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen.Daarnaast kun je bij TNO een ‘menu’ aan arbeidsvoorwaarden samenstellen dat bij jouw persoonlijke situatie past. Wat je ook mag verwachten Een uiterst professionele, innovatieve werkomgeving, met topexperts als collega’s. Mogelijkheid om cursussen, opleidingen en workshops te volgen en congressen te bezoeken, en coaching als je daar behoefte aan hebt. 33 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband). Een werkgever die divers talent waardeert en stimuleert, met initiatieven als het Female Leadership Programma, onze Rainbow Community en round tables over inclusiethema’s. Een uitgebreide en flexibele mobiliteitsregeling , inclusief volledige vergoeding van openbaar vervoer voor woon-werk en zakelijke reizen. Gezellige activiteiten met je team en andere TNO'ers . Zo leer je snel veel mensen kennen. Flexibele werktijden, de mogelijkheid om parttime (32 of 36 uur) te werken en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken. Een goede pensioenregeling. Lees hier uit welke arbeidsvoorwaarden je verder kunt kiezen.TNO als werkgeverBij TNO innoveren we voor een gezonder, veiliger en duurzamer leven. En voor een sterke economie. Sinds 1932 ontwikkelen wij kennis en technologie voor het algemeen belang. We vinden elkaar in verwondering en vindingrijkheid, en we zijn gedreven om grenzen te verleggen. Voor jouw talent en ambitie is er alle ruimte en ondersteuning. Je werkt samen met mensen die aan je gewaagd zijn, die jou inspireren én van jou willen leren. Onze state-of-the-art-faciliteiten zijn er om jouw visie te verwezenlijken. Wat je bij TNO doet, doet ertoe impact maakt het verschil. Want met elke innovatie draag je bij aan het leven van morgen. Lees meer over TNO als werkgever .Bij TNO stimuleren we een inclusieve werkomgeving, waar jij jezelf kunt zijn. Wat je verhaal ook is en welke unieke eigenschappen je ook meebrengt. Juist door onze unieke krachten en perspectieven te bundelen zijn we in staat om innovaties te ontwikkelen die een wezenlijk verschil maken in de samenleving. Meer weten? Lees welke stappen wij zetten op het gebied van diversiteit en inclusie .Hoe ziet het proces eruit?Reageren kan tot en met 6 december 2023. De sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gespreksrondes. In een laatste gesprek bespreken we de arbeidsvoorwaarden die je zelf samenstelt. We streven ernaar de hele procedure binnen vier weken af te ronden.Een online assessment en referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure.Als je bij ons komt werken vragen wij je ook een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) te overleggen.

title: Data Scientist
description: A Data Scientist is required for a market leading digital marketing company located in a highly popular area in Amsterdam. My client is a recognisable Digital marketing company across The Netherlands, leading the transformation of their customers' digital channels. At the heart of their culture is their 'getting things done' mindset and they strive to deliver the right solution, first time. They continue to gain real insight into the actual issues and associated objectives. The people do not only have a lot of technical knowledge, but also domain knowledge in the field of digital commerce, transactional systems, and financial services.What You Will Get €75,000 DOEFlexible/Hybrid WorkingAward winning training and development programme10% dedicated to your personal/professional development.ResponsibilitiesThe Data Scientist will be responsible for the statistical analysis and computing of the companies’ data. Ideally 2-3 years of experience working in the field of Data Science. The ideal candidate should have a creative and structured approach to problem-solving and strong mathematical skills and have experience of working with large data sets.RequirementsExperience in a wide range of machine learning techniques, with practical knowledge of the advantage and pitfalls of different approaches, as well as a strong grounding in the theoretical foundationsExperience in a variety of methods to evaluate and improve the performance of ML modelsExcellent Python programming skillsFamiliar with popular data science tools and librariesBSc or equivalent in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Mathematics / Statistics / Data Science (MSc or PhD is desirable)Knowledge of best practice in MLOps, model deployment and monitoringDesirable) Experience using Databricks and other cloud tools.(Desirable) Experience of deep learning(Desirable) Knowledge of NLP, e.g. sentiment analysis, topic modelling, topic classification(Desirable) Interest in the data science communityThe primary focus of your role will be delivering projects as part of our 'Advanced Analytics' programme and so in addition to the data science skills above, this will typically involve the followingScope technical elements of tasks in the context of delivering a project, explaining tasks to the team, reviewing their outputs, and ultimately ensuring successful delivery without doing all the work yourself.This is an exciting opportunity for a Lead Data Scientist working for a leading digital marketing company. If you are interested, please apply with your CV.

title: Data Scientist
description: Functie­omschrijvingDe Data Scientist is verantwoordelijk voor het afstemmen van de business behoeftes en nagaan wat de mogelijkheden zijn op het gebied van data. Hiervoor modelleert de functionaris verbanden, werkt formele nummerstelsels uit en bouwt in samenwerking met de business en collega’s aan slimme oplossingen, van analyse tot modellen. Hiervoor dient de medewerker grote hoeveelheden data te verwerken.De functiehouder voert wetenschappelijk onderzoek uit op een deelgebied met een beperkte vak proble-matiek, voert zelfstandig en in teamverband onderzoeks- en ontwikkelprojecten uit op het gebied van da-tascience. Daarbij experimenteert de functiehouder met nieuwe toepassingen op het raakvlak van IT, sta-tistiek en het toezichtdomein (datascience) en rapporteert over de bevindingen en doet voorstellen voor inrichting en beheer van de datalab-omgeving.De functiehouder is verantwoording schuldig aan de Operationeel Manager Ontwikkeling IV over de uitge-voerde data-analyses, profielaanpassingen en informatieverzoeken.Functie-eisenFunctie-eisen:Werk- en denkniveau: WO-opleiding op master-niveauBeheersing Nederlandse taal in woord en geschriftMinimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.Goede kennis van datascience-toolsGoede kennis van statistische technieken en modellenVaardig in computerprogrammeringVaardig in gebruik van een aantal operationele datascience-toolsVaardig in gebruik van gangbare statistische technieken en modellenDomeinkennisAdviesvaardigVermogen om kennis over te brengenKennis (bijvoorbeeld specifieke opleidingen, trainingen, etc.)Programmeertalen: Python, R en SQL (ervaring en kennis)Brede kennis op het gebied van onderzoeksmethodologieDe volgende kennis is een pré: Research Methods, Data Management, Applied Statistical Methodolyg, IT Architecture for Big Data, Policy Assesment, Predictive Anallytics en Deep learningBij voorkeur een opleiding/certificaat in BABOK of IREB.Arbeids­voorwaardenSalaris­niveauschaal 10Maand­salaris: Min €3045 - Max €4848

title: Data Scientist
description: Job DescriptionDIGITAL Are you inspired to be part of the team that digitally reimagines the way we work at Mars?Do you want to practice your digital muscle and ability to engage others on the journey?Do you want to be part of the Planning Centre of Excellence, the driving force of a human centric digital planning transformation. And do you want to contribute to inspire moments of everyday happiness?Read more below….CONTEXT &THE TEAMIn this rapidly changing world, an agile supply chain (SC) makes the difference for our customer and consumers. Mars is transforming their supply chain to become more end to end connected, transparent, faster, agile, customer focused and digital. Mars believes that a human centric and digitally connected planning team is key to unlock this as it is the glue for one end to end SC team.The End to End Planning Center of Excellence (CoE) sits at the heart of this transformation. It can be seen as a digital catalyst to speed up and strengthen the planning transformation. We will share the common passion to bring the benefits of a digital way of working to the people in the (planning) operation all around Europe for their own benefit and that of customers / consumers. The team focusses on production sites in Europe and sales in 90 countries all over the world. It will operate by the principals of; full transparency of processes and data, planning by exception and continuous improvement of people processes and systems.Within the CoE the Insights & Analytics team (IA) is building the data driven decision making muscle to empower our EU MW planning & logistics colleagues. The IA team exists of business analysts who translate business needs and clarify real problem statement, and data scientists who are working on digital prototyping and solutions. On expertise and best practices, the regional team is linked to a Mars global analytics and data scientist network.THE ROLEThe data scientist have to make sure that data needs to be gathered in a way that can be easily re-used in the future (data infrastructure), the statistical analytics and forecasting tools need to be optimised and the reporting dashboards provide a real time intuitive summary. The DS engages with the business users to understand the real problem, engages with users to secure data quality and to provide a trusted solution required to create a user-friendly and intuitive dashboard. To face these activities the data analyst is working together with multiple teams that will help with the process knowledge and the stakeholder engagement the data analyst collaborates on these topics and gives guidance through his/her data insights and then leads the technical solutioning where needed. In this way the ideal data scientist has a strong technical profile with high business acumen and a passion to help people utilise digital tools.In practice this means the role has 5 key elements that are based on continuous improvement: 1. Agree and emerge themselves in the priority business problems to be solved. 2. Build the required and reusable data infrastructure for the best analysis 3. Solve data issues through technology or organisational alignment 4. Co-develop a repetitive mechanism to analyse and solve the problem. 5. Repeat the cycle.Key to this is to ensure that the digital solution is communicated and explained to the planning team in a non-technical way to ensure the result is accepted and not overwritten. This requires the ability to listen to market feedback, evaluate statistical findings / improvements, provide business insights on different level an aggregation and clearly communicate to stakeholders in their language.As this is a complete new way of planning in Mars this approach will to evolve over time. The data scientist will need to amend his leadership and stakeholder management style to this. Especially in the beginning it will be crucial to be able to bridge the gap between statistics and standard business way of working.Key ResponsibilitiesDefine focused value added planning problem-statements for balancing service, stock and cost for the business based on use-cases, design thinking and value stream analysis.Providing insights from data to support the organization making more and more data driven decisions in the area of: forecasting, supply planning, risk analyst in supply & demand, inventory settingPresenting results in a compelling and clear manner to drive business decision makingSupports demand sensing activities in E2Open through the provision of analysis and insights to optimize forecasting resultsBuild algorithms and design experiments to merge, manage, interrogate, and extract good quality data needed for this.Look for opportunities to improve the flow of data and evaluate new and emerging technologiesIdentifying new relevant data sources and incorporating these in the data structure.Enhancing data collection procedures to create new data sourcesExperience / BackgroundEducation and ProfessionalB.S. or BA in computer science, data science, machine learning, mathematics, statistics or related natural science or technical degree. Master or advanced degree preferred3-5 years of experience working in a technical / analytics roleKnowledge / ExperienceExperience in a programming language such as PhytonExperience with data structures (SQL, Azure)Experience with ERP and Advanced Planning Systems (preferably E2Open or Rapid Response)Working knowledge of data mining, machine learning and other statistical techniquesUnderstanding of Lean / Six Sigma / root cause analysis, e.g., 5 why’sAbility to support complex analysis in understandable forms to business stakeholdersAttention to detail and a passion for data accuracyFluent in EnglishExperience in the aera of Supply Chain ManagementStrong expertise in combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Business acumen and programmingStrong expertise in combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Business acumen and programmingMars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: About the job✔ Are you a skilled machine learning engineer with a strong background in algorithm development and implementation?✔ Are you looking for a role that combines hands-on technical work with consulting?✔ Do you get satisfaction from seeing your models and algorithms being used in real-world applications?✔ Do you enjoy being part of a team of experts who are passionate about machine learning and AI?Then Xomnia is the place for you!As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xomnia, your work for our clients will range from building data pipelines, to data exploration and modelling, to productionizing your models, and deploying them in a cloud environment. In the past our team has for example optimized the electricity grid for the future, ensured you have stable internet connection at home and worked together with LUMC on cancer research.Together with the team, you will follow and set the best practices in modelling, programming, automation and CI / CD. At Xomnia, we value knowledge sharing and staying ahead of the curve in our constantly evolving field. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to keep learning, and enjoys sharing knowledge with others.Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates that have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not offer visa sponsorship.What you will be working onCollaborating with a cross-functional team at our client to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learningDesigning and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniquesDeveloping and maintaining machine learning pipelines, including data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deploymentAnalyzing and interpreting results to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvementStaying up-to-date with the latest machine learning techniques and technologies and apply them to business problems as appropriateFollowing and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CDWhat you will needA minimum of 3 years experience in a position such as a machine learning engineer, data scientist or data engineer, building scalable solutions to bring models to productionA degree in computer science, data science, artificial intelligence or similarExperience in data wrangling and building data pipelinesAdvanced knowledge of statistics and mathematicsExperience with building batch and streaming ETL pipelinesExcellent Software Engineering skills in Python (bonus: Scala or Java)Experience with containerization (Docker), CI / CD and testingExperience in working with at least one cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS)Keen on sharing knowledge and being eager to keep developing yourselfAffinity for consulting and a drive to help clientsFluency in Dutch is a mandatory criteria for this role What we offerCompetitive salary25 vacation days and the possibility of taking unpaid leaveRoom to grow and develop yourselfPaid time for self developmentChallenging assignmentsCompany laptop of your choiceWork from home packageA monthly in-depth training facilitated by colleagues or external trainersNice colleagues who besides work also like to undertake activitiesCompany trips and activities like the Xomnia WKD, ski trip, and weekly sports activitiesAbout usAt Xomnia, we're passionate about helping organizations make data driven decisions, and we're looking for someone who shares that passion. If you're ready to use your analytics and data warehousing skills to help our clients achieve their goals and have the opportunity to work on diverse projects, then we want to hear from you!We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses and it still feels like home. Like any family, we all feel comfortable just being ourselves.

title: AI Engineer
description: Zonneplan staat op een keerpunt te midden van grote veranderingen in de energiemarkt. Het verschil tussen vraag en aanbod van energie groeit. Dankzij onze geavanceerde hardware en software kunnen we dit groeiende verschil tussen energieaanbod overdag en het werkelijke verbruik overbruggen. Met meer dan 150.000 assets, elk uitgerust met een aanstuurbare 4G:module (zoals laadpalen, zonnepanelen en meterkasten), zetten we data om in bruikbare inzichten. Zo zorgen wij voor modellen die daadwerkelijke winst voor de consument opleveren.Over ZonneplanZonneplan, opgericht in 2012, is een pionier in de integratie van IT en data binnen de energiemarkt. Samen met meer dan 260 toegewijde collega's streven we dagelijks naar het versnellen van de energietransitie. We begonnen met het efficiënt inmeten van daken met behulp van satellietbeelden en het geven van nauwkeurige verbruiksvoorspellingen voor zonnepanelen. Maar door de introductie van zonnepanelen ontstond een nieuwe uitdaging: het gelijkmatig verdelen van energie over het netwerk. Daarom hebben we ons ontwikkeld tot een energiebedrijf met dynamische energieprijzen en hebben we onze assets aanstuurbaar gemaakt. Met onze controleerbare en aanstuurbare assets optimaliseren we het energieverbruik om echt voordeel te genereren voor de consument.Jouw rolWe hebben een team van business developers, software engineers en data engineers en :scientists samengesteld om het Zonneplan Smart Power Platform te ontwikkelen. Ons doel is het digitaliseren van de energiemarkt, en dat lukt! Het grid is operationeel. Dagelijks functioneren jouw live voorspellingen voor het kopen en verkopen van energie. Bovendien zorgen jouw modellen ervoor dat op elk moment besloten kan worden of de regelbare assets, zoals onze laadpalen of thuisbatterijen, aan: of uitgezet moeten worden. En dit is nog maar het begin.Je houdt je onder andere bezig met:Het verbeteren van de verbruiks: en opwekvoorspellingen van ons energieportfolio;Forecasting voor zonnepaneelopwekking en schaduweffecten op basis van weermodellen;Het berekenen van prijselasticiteit voor onze energieklanten;Day:ahead & intraday trading;Onbalansoptimalisatie met behulp van onze aanstuurbare producten (laadpaal, batterij, zonnepanelen);Het voorspellen van prijzen op verschillende handelsmarkten en het onderzoeken van arbitragemogelijkheden.Wat verwachten we van jou?Je hebt diepgaande kennis van het maken en optimaliseren van AI en ML modellen;Je hebt een technische WO:opleiding in de richting van econometrie, data science of een vergelijkbare studierichting afgerond;Ervaring met Python en SQL;Uitstekende samenwerkingsvaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan besluitvormers, en samen te werken met andere afdelingen;Kennis van de energiemarkt en diverse handelsstrategieën is een pré;Op dit niveau actief zijn in de energietransitie vergt het vermogen om snel en daadkrachtig te handelen.Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is vereistWat biedt Zonneplan jou?Werken bij Zonneplan betekent deel uitmaken van een IT: en data:gedreven organisatie met een focus op de klant en een passie voor duurzame ontwikkelingen. We dagen onze mensen uit om net dat stapje extra te zetten. We zijn innovatief waar mogelijk en altijd persoonlijk. Voor jou betekent dit:Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;Je werkt samen met 260 professionele collega's die de energietransitie willen versnellen;Duurzaamheidskorting op onze producten voor jou en je familie;Je draagt dagelijks bij aan een echte duurzame energietransitie;Jouw producten hebben direct impact op grote schaal;Er zijn geen grenzen aan wat mogelijk is; onze focus ligt echt op het beste product;We ontwikkelen alles intern, wat zorgt voor korte communicatielijnen, snelle besluitvorming en de mogelijkheid om ad hoc te kunnen werken;We zijn eerlijk, vriendelijk, informeel en loyaal naar elkaar en de organisatie;Reiskostenvergoeding; reis je met het OV? Dan krijg je van ons jouw traject vergoed en een échte Zonneplan fiets. Reis je liever met de auto? Dan krijg je een kilometervergoeding;Geweldige collega's en sociale evenementen met het hele bedrijf, zoals vrijdagmiddagborrels en speciale evenementen.Heb je vragen over de vacature voor AI Engineer? Neem contact op met Arend:Jan via 088 020 3012 of Arendjan.noordam@zonneplan.nl. Hij helpt je graag verder.

title: Data analist en scientist luchtkwaliteit
company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
description: Functie­omschrijvingGa jij met ons de uitdaging aan om onze data over luchtkwaliteit actueel te houden? Wil jij bijdragen aan wetenschappelijke kennis op dit thema om burgers en beleidsmakers van goede informatie te voorzien? Wellicht word jij dan wel onze nieuwe collega, lees verder!Ons teamRuim 2500 collega’s zetten zich bij het RIVM elke dag in voor de zorg van morgen, door onafhankelijk en deskundig onderzoek te doen. Als data analist en scientist luchtkwaliteitkom je te werken op de afdeling Luchtkwaliteit en Geluid van hetCentrum Milieukwaliteit. Op onze afdeling werken wij met 31 bevlogen medewerkers samen aan analyses die bijdragen aan een verbetering van onze leefomgeving. We werken ook veel samen met deskundigen van buiten onze afdeling op het gebied van emissies en van effecten voor gezondheid en natuur. We hebben in ons team meerdere experts, projectleiders, data scientists, luchtkwaliteitsmodelleurs, onderzoekers en twee IT-ontwikkelteams.Jouw werk aan data science en data analyseBinnen onze afdeling werken we met een team van vijf data scientists nauw samen. Je gaat aan meerdere projecten tegelijk werken. Zo ga je onderzoeken ondersteunen bij bijvoorbeeld de monitoring rond hetSchone Lucht Akkoord en deGrootschalige concentratie- en depositiekaartenof deNSL monitoringstool. In deze projecten ga je aan de gang met de onderliggende data. Want alleen door goed gebruik te maken van data kunnen we deze monitoring doen en kunnen we beleidsmakers en de politiek van juiste informatie voorzien.Hoe ziet jouw bijdrage aan deze projecten eruit?Het structureren en analyseren van luchtkwaliteitsdata met behulp van R en documentatie hiervan in een GIT omgeving. Je selecteert kritisch en systematisch juiste en relevante gegevens uit verschillende informatiebronnen en toetst dit bij collega’s;Bouwen en beheren van tools en modellen in de context van luchtkwaliteit, waarbij kennis van geografische tooling een pre is. Natuurlijk is wat je oplevert conform vooraf geformuleerde opdracht of onderzoeksvraag en voldoet je werk aan wetenschappelijke standaarden, kwaliteit en methoden en technieken;Ophalen en opslaan van data in SQL databases. Jouw werk documenteer je op dusdanige wijze, dat collega’s ook met jouw werk aan de slag kunnen.Bijdragen aan de interpretatie en duiding van de onderzoeksresultaten. Je ordent complexe informatie zodat deze bruikbaar is voor het onderzoek en legt de juiste verbanden en natuurlijk werk je nauwkeurig;Je levert van een bijdrage aan het ontwikkelen van methoden en technieken op het gebied van data analyse in de projecten waarop je wordt ingezet;Uniek aan deze baanHet werk van het RIVM is dynamisch en voortdurend in beweging. Je bent dus geen jaren met hetzelfde onderzoek bezig. Dat vraagt enige flexibiliteit van jou, maar maakt het werk ook afwisselend en altijd actueel.
