The job requires excellent analytical skills and an eye for detail.You have an affinity with HRStrong analytic skills and affinity with Power BI development, data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling;Experience in Power BI Platform, in particular: DAX, M/PowerQuery, Tabular Editor (c#), DAX Studio is a mustExpertise in Python, Notebooks and Pandas is a mustExpertise in Azure Databricks, Python, PySpark, SQL Experience handling structured and unstructured datasets (must)Experience in data modelling and Kimball methodology (must)Experience in stakeholder management / alignment with IT as data supplierExperience in migration of data backendsExperience with batch, streaming and APIExperience with data management, data governance, DQ, and meta dataPro-active attitude and an excellent team player. We are offeringWe are offering a role within a global leading people analytics team in a challenging environment. Additionally we offer you:The opportunity to develop yourself on hard as well as soft skills. A good work-life balanceThe opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionallyA hybrid way of workingA salary based on your experience*A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefitsA personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per yearAn annual public transportation pass A solid pension planInterested?If you find this vacancy interesting and it fits your expectations and qualifications, you can apply online. If you have questions, please contact jaap.veldkamp@nl.abnamro.com (Lead HR Analytics) or marc.henselmans@nl.abnamro.com (PO HR Reporting and surveys).Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen Een creatief brein Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Platform Operations Engineer
description: Job TitlePlatform Operations EngineerJob DescriptionNote For candidates residing in India, the work location will be Pune and for candidates residing in the Netherlands the work location will be Veghel.Are you passionate about unravelling the potential of data and turning it into valuable insights? Do you thrive on collaborating with technical and business stakeholders to shape the future of data-driven solutions? If your answer to these questions is “yes”, then look no further than Vanderlande!Join our Central Data & Analytics Organization as Platforms Ops Engineer, where you’ll play a crucial role in maintaining and supporting our Data Platform.We’ll give you the opportunity toWork in a highly motivated, global team of Data & Analytics enthusiasts.Play a crucial role in advancing the maturity of the Data Platform, contributing to delivery of analytical products and services offered by our department to the Vanderlande organization.Work within a cloud based architecture based on Data Mesh principleYour ResponsibilitiesAs a Platform Operations Engineer, your primary focus is on maintaining high availability, scalability, and reliability of the data platform to meet the needs of users and customers. Your values as a tech-savvy, action-oriented, and collaboration-focused colleague are evident in your proactive nature and dedication to self-development. You play a central role in ensuring seamless operation of the data platform, fostering cooperation between teams, and making a meaningful impact through your expertise.As part of the Operations (Ops) team, you are serving developers of cross-functional full stack teams, developers, technical specialists, and peers from various business domains. You act as a support system for stakeholders of the data platform, helping them overcome challenges while working with the data platform. Your approach to driving success is through influence, not mere authority, which empowers and inspires others. Your continuous improvement mindset and willingness to take initiative are integral to your role as a Platform Ops Engineer.In this role, youProactively oversee the performance and condition of the data platform, detecting and resolving potential issues while also taking preventive measures.Perform routine maintenance tasks, such as updates, patches, and system backups, to keep the data platform running smoothly.Resolve complex problems and provide operational support for platform issues and service requests, and actively participate in incident reviews requiring diagnosing problems and applying appropriate solutions to restore services as quickly as possible.Engage in a collaborative handover process with full stack developers, offering technical expertise, knowledge transfer, and conducting thorough testing and acceptance of their deliverables.Manage and monitor data pipeline stability and dashboard data refreshes.Design, test, deploy, and maintenance of monitoring dashboards.Knowledge of Python, Pyspark, SQL, or R for data retrieval and manipulation would be beneficial.Assist in the migration of Landing Zones / Data Products.Implement security best practices and adhere to regulatory compliance requirements to protect the data platform from potential threats and vulnerabilitiesCreate and maintain comprehensive documentation for processes, configurations, and troubleshooting procedures to support knowledge sharing across the team.Advise on efficiency improvements through automation and self-service solutions to ensure more efficient and reliable operations.Stay up-to-date with the latest developments and actively share knowledge.Familiar with agile methodologies and thrives in its dynamic and collaborative environment.Your departmentThe Central Data & Analytics department is tasked with extending, operating and further maturing the data platform of Vanderlande. We provide Data & Analytics related products and services to Vanderlande, primarily catering to internal customers, but supporting our digital service portfolio. Following a hub & spoke model, we establish centralized standards that are then adopted and implemented by decentralized teams within the business.At the heart of our efforts lies the Data Platform, the core product we are diligently enhancing. This Azure cloud enabled platform based on the Data Mesh principle empowers us to deliver valuable Data Products by transforming, processing, combining, and enriching data from various source systems, ultimately creating a reliable source of truth for our customers. To enable efficient data analysis and visualization, we actively govern, and maintain the Vanderlande Qlik Servers and Power BI Premium capacity. In addition, we provide templates, establish a clear workflow, and foster a community of experts.Our work centers around our Federated Governance model, with the Central Data & Analytics Organization as the hub serving the spokes. Our scope encompasses Data Governance, Platform Operations, Core Platform Development, and Full stack Development. The technologies we use span across the Azure stack and Databricks ecosystem, ensuring seamless integration and optimal utilization of resources. By utilizing advanced analytics techniques and the latest technology, our focus on innovation empowers us to continuously improve and innovate the Data Platform.Operating as a scaled Agile organization, we embrace the SAFe Agile framework and work collaboratively across different teams, all united by a common backlog and shared roadmap. This approach allows us to be highly adaptable, continuously adjusting to the evolving strategic needs of stakeholders within Vanderlande.Your Qualifications And SkillsIf you’re an experienced, enthusiastic and versatile Platform Ops Engineer, you will bringMinimum bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).2+ years of experience working in a similar role as a support engineer.Service-oriented mindset is mandatory, you have the desire to help people in any way possibleExcellent analytical and troubleshooting abilities.Excellent communication skills with an open and clear way of expressing ideas.Passion for IT technology and a strong motivation for continuous learning and improvement.Experience working in the Azure cloud, with a preference for knowledge in security and access management, API management, infrastructure management, event-based solutions, monitoring and logging, and metadata management.Comfortable with a dynamic work environment and adaptable to change.Familiarity with Agile way of working.Practical experience with CI/CD and DevOps practices is a plus.Proficiency in utilizing Python, Pyspark, and SQL for retrieving and manipulating data is a valuable asset, though not a strict requirement.What We OfferPlease note working conditions differ per country. The conditions in this article are applicable to the Netherlands.In this challenging and responsible position, you will have the chance to make a significant contribution to industry-leading projects and be connected to our dedicated people and customers. We offer a position in an informal, international and professional working environment with a lot of opportunities for personal development. By joining our profitable and growing company you will be able to reach your goals and focus on your future.On top of your fixed salary, you will receive the following secondary benefits40 vacation days (20 statutory days and a flexible budget worth 20 days).Flexible working hours.A hybrid workplace (40% working from home and 60% in the office).Commuting allowance, including full reimbursement of travel by public transport.Working from home allowance.Collective pension scheme and discount on health insurance.On-site company health centers with a gym, physiotherapists and occupational therapists.Vanderlande Academy and training facilities to boost your skills.A variety in Vanderlande Network communities and initiatives.And a great company restaurant and coffee bar with barista.Our CompanyVanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports – from London Heathrow to Singapore Changi – and in the parcel market, for main players such as UPS and FedEx. Furthermore, we are also a leading supplier of solutions for warehousing giants, such as Walmart, which seamlessly integrate innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services.If you aspire to a position of responsibility – and want to make a difference by facilitating the delivery of what matters most to consumers, passengers and businesses – then the next step on your path to global opportunities is to join Vanderlande. As part of our network and unique culture of freedom and flexibility, you will be connected to our dedicated people, build strong relationships and rise to the challenge of industry-leading projects.You will grow, take ownership and make every day better as you continue on the road to success with your spirit of adventure – and fulfil your ambitions for personal development through our Academy. Vanderlande will give you the necessary knowledge, tools and support, so that together we have the confidence and ability to exceed our customers’ expectations in over 100 countries.To achieve our collective goals, you will have a hands-on role working in a positive environment to deliver tangible, state-of-the-art products and improve the competitiveness of our highly visible customers. As an integral part of our team, you will have the enthusiasm and be driven to reach our destination before your next journey with Vanderlande begins…Your applicationIf the role of Platform Operations Engineer appeals to you, then please apply now by completing the application form, and uploading your CV and covering letter.

title: Data Engineer | Amsterdam | Ilionx
description: Wat ga jij doen?Als Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten en ontwikkelen van een dataplatform voor of bij onze gewaardeerde klanten. Je bent pragmatisch, sociaal, analytisch en in staat om conceptueel te denken. Dit doe je allemaal samen met gedreven collega’s in kleinschalige teams. Als ervaren consultant is het mogelijk om binnen jouw opdracht de lead rol te pakken, je collega’s te ondersteun en begeleiden en je speelt een belangrijke rol in het opbouwen van een sterke relaties met klanten en opdrachtgevers.Je werkt veel binnen de Microsoft Azure Cloud met Azure SQL Database, Synapse, Databricks en/of Snowflake cloud dataservices. Deze werkzaamheden kunnen ook binnen AWS of Google Cloud plaatsvinden. Voor ELT/ETL gebruik je onder andere SQL, Data Factory, PySpark, Python, DBT en Matillion. Binnen onze teams werken we vaak op basis van DevOps en voor het development en releasen maak je gebruik van CI/CD. De infraservices genereren we op basis van IAAS met ARM, Bicep en/of Terraform.Waar kom je te werken?Bij ilionx is ons doel eenvoudig: jou als IT-professional helpen om expert te worden, te zijn en jouw expertise te delen. We zetten complex om naar helder en menselijk, altijd met het oog op vooruitgang en resultaten.We stellen vragen, versimpelen processen en leren van onze klanten om tot concrete oplossingen te komen. Met durf en vernieuwing zetten we stappen vooruit en dit doen we samen, in een omgeving waar jij de vrijheid krijgt om te experimenteren en te groeien.Dus of je nu net begint of al een doorgewinterde expert bent. Wij bieden je de tools, jij creëert de toekomst.Wat wij vragen?Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of academische opleiding. Je hebt minimaal drie jaar ervaring met data engineering. Je hebt ervaring met Azure data services zoals: Data Factory/Synapse/Data lake(house)/Delta Lake. Je hebt hands-on ervaring in een of meer programmeertalen, zoals C#, Python en Spark is een pré. Kennis van dimensionaal datamodelleren en/af Data Vault. data-architectuur kennis is en pré. Wat wij bieden?Uitdagende werkomgeving Reiskostenvergoeding of lease auto Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen ontwikkelen Tijd voor ontspanning Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden Werk hybride, thuis of op kantoor Thuiswerkvergoeding Aantrekkelijke bonusregeling Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd Goede pensioensregeling

title: Manager Data Engineering - Team management/growth and Data Architecture / Vision - Latest tech/tooling incl. Streaming on Databricks/Serverless Cloud - Amsterdam, Netherlands
description: If you’re into the latest Data related technology/tooling, architecture and Team Leadership this Chapter lead / Data Engineering Manager role is the best.This is your role…- You’ll lead and grow the internal Data Engineering team to ~8 direct reports in the next year or 2 whilst you’re able to zoom out to further establish the best Data Architecture Vision for the team/company.- Your team is using the latest tech/tooling like Databricks Workflows, Apache spark structured streaming, Delta Live Tables, Change Data Capture, PySpark, Unity Catalog which all runs on AWS Serverless with IaC (Terraform/Cloudformation) with mainly Python for coding and ELK, Grafana and Prometheus for monitoring/logging. You don’t need expert knowledge in all of them! 😉- The company has many different data sources and feeds data to AI models and machine learning in production. Big volumes of on-demand requests by clients are handled by Stream processing;- 95/100% is greenfield work. They don’t do much ‘lift and shift’ or migrations and most of the work for your team is completely new and absolutely cutting edge;- Domain based teams… You advocate the Data domain within the larger organization and work with domain driven design;- Solid budget to stay up to date with (leadership/tech) courses, experimenting, conferences etc.What do you bring?- You have at least 6+ years of relevant working experience in the data sector;- Expert experience in production grade data ingestion, processing, pipelines, and modelling;- Experience in managing or coaching people / teams;- Strong leadership, communication skills (English), and collaboration skills;- You have a drive to develop innovative solutions and focus on continuous improvement;- Preferably experience with cloud environments.The company:This is a pure tech company with a lean mindset. Tech/Data drives the company and the Engineers drive the decisions and take responsibility in tech. Data is the core business and the products / services drive an important part of the Dutch (financial) economy. The product is moving abroad which means more scale challenges. This company works with huge amounts of data that is delivered to users by near real-time Stream processing. Platform latency, reliability, availability and performance are top priorities.Located near a train station in the Centre of Amsterdam means you can access the office easy by car, public transport or bicycle. You're working in a dynamic, industrial environment with a total of 90 colleagues of which 60% is tech/product. The team is international and in-house language is English.Salary & Benefits:The salary is competitive and depends on what you bring to the table in terms of skills, personality and experience. The secondary benefits are good; 30% knowledge migrant ruling, VISA sponsorship, pension, hybrid work, flexible working hours, option to work part time (32h/36h a week), bonus, laptop, travel allowance, holidays, holiday allowance, personal development budget, etc.

title: Medior/ Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description: About XITEIt’s our mission to share our passion for music videos with the world and invite people to experience music beyond listening: to see your music.XITE is dedicated to building the best music video experience in the world. Based in Amsterdam, XITE now reaches 100 million households across multiple territories through linear networks, interactive TV apps and on-demand streaming services. The company revolutionised the way audiences experience music videos by allowing viewers to search, like and skip through its entire catalogue, enjoy channels curated by its team of music experts and create their own channel based on a genre, decade, style or mood using its unique Mixer feature. XITE has a full music video catalogue through agreements with all major and top independent music labels and distributors, and works to expand this offering every day.About The Role And The TeamWe are looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join us. As part of the MLE+DE team, will be bringing machine learning / data science based products and services to production, and monitor and improve their performance. You will be working mainly with Python, Kafka, ClickHouse, Docker, Bazel, Kubernetes, GCP, Superset and many other, mostly open source, technologies. To accomplish your tasks, you will be working closely with other MLEs, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, as well as the Data Analytics and Backend Engineering team, other technical teams, and - sometimes - non-technical stakeholders within XITE.ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop and scale new/existing machine learning pipelines, data products and services.Monitor model/data product performance, and act in accordance to findings.Work closely with relevant teams and individuals, often be involved in data/ML product development from idea and initial experiments till deployment and monitoring.Maintain the technical excellence of data and MLOps practices.Work on shared libraries, infrastructure and building blocks within monorepo space.At least 3+ years of proven professional experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or ‘Full stack’ Data Scientist, working with systems and data infrastructure at scale.Broad interest and experience within the Machine Learning domain, including model deployment and monitoring.Experience with model deployment and maintenance in distributed environments with technologies such as Kafka, ClickHouse, Elastic, Spark/PySpark or similar.Experience in building and deploying ML models, using tools such as BentoML, MLFlow, etc.A Master’s degree in a relevant field.Experience with data streams processing tools and concepts.Knowledge of the main architecture models and concepts like replication, sharding, consistency, horizontal and vertical scaling, quorum, idempotency.Excellent analytical and communication skills.Experience in working with monorepo environments (e.g. Bazel) is a plus.Experience specifically in operationalising recommender systems, or working with graph databases are a plus.Our Tech StackPython (Pandas, NumPy, BentoML, Pydantic, gRPC).Kafka, ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, Redis, GCP Buckets, MLFlow, Prometheus.Bazel, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, GCP.GitHub, CircleCI, Ansible, Superset, Grafana and many other, mostly open source, technologies.Our hiring process Apply: Apply for a role, and we will contact you. HR Interview: One of our recruiters will contact you, because we’d really like to find out more about you and to see if there is a culture fit between you and XITE. During this interview you can ask all your questions about the company. Interview with the hiring manager: In this interview our Head of Data Science and Personalisation and Machine Learning Engineer want to get to know you a bit better, and in this interview you will dive deeper into the role and your technical experience. Interview: The next interview will be with our Director of Engineering. Final team interview: During this interview, you will meet the rest of the Data Engineering and Data Science team. Reference check: We ask you for 2 references that we can give a call and ask a few questions as a part of our hiring process. Offer: Hopefully with our offer, we can welcome you to the team of XITE!Working at XITEHere at XITE we make sure you’re taken care of by providing you the opportunity to develop your career in a young, fast growing and international company. We provide a challenging work environment where you have a lot of autonomy and flexible working hours. We don’t hire assholes! All XITE’ers are different and authentic in their own way, but we all have kindness in common, as well as professionalism and an optimistic attitude. Let’s not forget - we have a passion for good music and good food. That’s why we have chef prepared lunches, Friday afternoon drinks and rooftop parties! Click here to see our benefits.Up for the challenge? Then hit that ‘Apply for this Job’ button!

title: Chapter lead Finance & Risk Data Domain Azure / Databricks
description: At a glanceAre you a technical expert and enthusiastic person who inspires others to create innovative solutions? Then we need your help in making ABN AMRO a personal bank in a digital age!One of our strategic goals is to become a data-driven organization so we can get to know our clients even better and serve them in a better way. As a chapter lead, you contribute to these goals by focusing on IT craftmanship within your department. You stay up-to-date on the latest developments and you mentor your team members in becoming technical experts. How are you going to shape craftmanship and innovation within your department?Our Engineers get the freedom to grow and experiment. You support and guide them so that they can grow their technical expertise that contribute to a future-proof bank. When and where you and your team do your work is up to you! We work hybrid, which means you can flexibly decide where and when you can work most comfortable and effectively.As Chapter Lead, you will work at the department Risk Data & Modelling. You and your chapter members are responsible for multiple data platforms like the Risk Analytics Platform and the CoDaC Platform, two Azure platforms used for credit risk data modelling purposes and non-financial risk analysis and reporting. Besides that we are setting up a platform for Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) use cases.Your jobYou will combine working as an IT Engineer with your role as Chapter Lead. About 60% of the time, you will work in your own Scrum Team but also closely with Data Engineers and Data Analysts in other teams on designing and developing future-proof IT solutions of the highest quality.The rest of the time you will manage your chapter. This includes:Educating yourself and others with the right technical capabilities and the latest innovations.Mentoring your Chapter members on technical craftsmanship.Actively participating in knowledge gaining and sharing by joining triangles, circles, communities and events.Proper alignment with stakeholders. For example, informing leadership on the alignment you have with the Solution Engineer on the technological landscape and lifecycle. Working in an Agile environment and advocating the Agile and CICD processes.You mentor your Chapter, evaluate technical assessments, do interviews and ensure that new employees are properly onboarded.Take care of the HR processes to facilitate all aspects relating to the influx, development, performance and outflux of employees.Create and foster a healthy working environment and an inclusive culture for your Chapter.Working environmentThe Risk Data & Modelling department is a young department within Risk. We are an ambitious and very international group of people. We have embraced an Agile way of working where we strive towards a flat organization with self-organizing teams that have the autonomy to make quick decisions. The atmosphere in the team and the department is open and informal. You will work in a diverse team with many different nationalities, and a good ratio of Juniors, Mediors and Seniors. We work hard, but we also know how to have fun!You will work in a fast paced and accessible environment. We love to share knowledge and to challenge each other, for example by sharing our expertise in our blog, during the events of our developer community and by organizing hackathons.Your profileYou feel at home in a technical environment and are always up to date on the latest technologies. At the same time, you are people-minded and an inspirator. You get enthusiastic from creative and innovative solutions, and you inspire others to get started with these new opportunities.Do you think you‘re a fit? Check your profile:Expert in data engineeringExperienced with cloud solutions and infrastructure (preferably Azure)Hands on with building data solutions with Data and Orchestration tooling (i.e. Data Factory, Databricks/PySpark and Airflow) and PythonDeep understanding of data processes, data pipelines (ETL), and data lifecycleExperience with coaching and mentoring your less experienced team members in their design and development activities You have knowledge of and are interested in the latest IT-trends, both within and outside your area of expertise (cloud, API, Open Banking, DevOps, CI/CD, SOA, etc.)Fluent in EnglishWe are offeringYou are given every opportunity and independence to demonstrate your professional expertise in a no-nonsense environment and to further develop yourself. We attach great value to personal development and thereby offer you many training and development opportunities. In addition:A Hay 10-11 salary.The freedom to optimize your performance in a flexible working environment.Possibilities for flexible working hours and good facilities for remote working.A supplementary benefit budget of 11% with which you can buy flexible benefits (including vacation days, mobile phone, (electric) bicycle and additional salary).25 vacation days.Apart from the departmental training budget for the department you will receive a personal development budget of € 1.000 per year which can be save up to a maximum of € 3.000.An annual public transport pass.A generous pension scheme.Banking for better days. These are days you can use for your personal development or on which you can contribute to society.Interested?Are you interested? Then respond to this vacancy!We would like to get to know you!Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.Wij vragen Natuurlijk leiderschap Passie voor je vakgebied

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description: Job DescriptionIs this you?You love to solve real world problems with data & algorithms. You can bridge the gap between Data Scientists, Data Engineers & DevOps. And you are highly motivated to create valuable solutions for our customers with the latest machine learning, cloud and MLOps technologies.Your roleAs a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Future Facts Conclusion you are at the center of productionizing our AI solutions. You will coach, train and lead the team on the latest innovations in ML. You will orchestrate data pipelines for model training and prediction, industrialize and train ML algorithms and build high performance, low latency API’s.You will do this in close co-operation with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other stakeholders and will have the lead in code reviews and pair programming sessions. Therefore, it is key that your knowledge of code and CI/CD best practices is solid.You will work on different ML projects with a wide range of topics. Projects we have done in the past include topics like; package return prediction for a logistics company, fraud detection for an insurance company and subscription cancel prediction for a telecom company. Depending on the projects you will work either on site or remote.Since most of our clients work in agile, DevOps and cloud environments, we have adapted this into our standards.A few examplesAt Dura Vermeer, a smart building concept has been set up in Azure by means of AI & IoT, in which occupancy rate and atmosphere are calculated and processed in real time. This is crucial for the health of the company's employees.For a large waste processor we use computer vision and camera-wide inspection to detect the different waste flows and to find out how they can be optimized for processing.RequirementsA gross salary between €4.000,- and - €6.000,- o.b.v. 40hBonus package, a phone and laptop are of course includedMobility budget, a private internet plan and a general expenses allowance.A learning and development budget and a personal development scheme.A steady job in a company that has over 24 years of expertise in data.A young and ambitious team of data fanatics to share knowledge with.A flexible workspace where you can organize your work-life balance just the way you like it.Our very own Danz Café with a roof terrace and lots of team events where you can socialize with your colleagues.Weekly chair massage, a gym with personal training and a company longboat to go out onto the Amsterdam canals.What You NeedAs a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Machine Learning infrastructure is something you know everything about. Besides that, it is mandatory that you can communicate complex concepts and make them understandable for other disciplines, both technical and non-technical. To do this you need to be a team player and have excellent communication skills.English speakers are welcome to apply, but you need to be able to understand Dutch to some extend and have the willingness to learn it.Our ideal candidate would look like this:A MSc or PhD in e.g. Computer Science or other STEM related fields, and experience as a Machine Learning- or Software EngineerExperience with ML frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc. preferably on large scale projectsDeep understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning related conceptsHands on programming skills in Python, experience with API design and the DevOps and CI/CD way of workingKnowledge of big data processing tools, platforms and infrastructures such as Spark, PySpark, Kafka, AWS EMR, Databricks Linux, Docker, Kubernetes (nice to have),Experience with Cloud frameworks like AWS, Azure or GCPExperience with both SQL and NoSQLAnything else you’d like to add?Your Future Facts Conclusion?With a skilled and ambitious team of 40+ data professionals you will work on projects for new and existing clients all over the Netherlands where you will implement valuable AI solutions. We actively pursue projects in many different sectors. A few examples of our clients are PostNL, IKEA, ANWB, VodafoneZiggo and NS.Our data engineers and data scientists focus on productionizing valuable machine learning & AI solutions, and developing and deploying Machine Learning models. Every project is different, and therefore needs a different approach. With your team, you will determine the most efficient approach, and the appropriate tooling for each project. Your expertise and seniority makes you the perfect advisor on how to implement the solutions.

title: Data Engineer
description: Over onsagap2 is een Europese IT Consultancy, actief in 14 landen met ruim 8.000 werknemers. Het bedrijf is in Portugal opgericht en sinds 2014 actief in Nederlands met ons kantoor in Amsterdam om de Nederlandse markt te voorzien van onze IT expertise. Onze werknemers worden gekenmerkt door de zogenaamde “agapian spirit”, die in 5 woorden wordt samengevat: familie, samenhorigheid, vriendschap, teamgeest en leren.Kun jij je vinden in hetgeen waar wij voor staan?Lees dan verder om meer te weten te komen!FunctieomschrijvingAls Data Engineer bij agap2 ga je de uitdaging aan binnen een internationale omgeving met een lokale focus. Jij krijgt de mogelijkheid om aan diverse projecten te werken, op basis van jouw ervaring en interesses. Denk hierbij aan projecten binnen diverse industrieën zoals Banking, Telecom en Healthcare.Bij agap2 wordt er verwacht dat je jouw kennis deelt, terwijl je ook de kans krijgt om nieuwe technologieën te leren en nieuwe vaardigheden te ontwikkelen. Wij geloven dat het delen van kennis de sleutel is tot persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Ons talent management programma is op maat gemaakt om jou de mogelijkheid te geven om jezelf te ontwikkelen en te groeien in je carrière, op de manier die jij altijd al voor ogen hebt gehad. Doordat we met een breed scala aan klanten samenwerken, wordt er ook van je verwacht dat jij je kunt aanpassen aan verschillende omgevingen.Wat breng jij meeEen afgeronde opleiding op HBO/WO niveauMinimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data EngineerErvaring in de Microsoft Azure Business Intelligence Stack (DataBricks, Synapse Analytics, DataFactory en LogicApps)Ervaring met het bouwen van ETL's/ELT's, bij voorkeur in PySpark en Airflow.Ervaring met Python en SQL is een must.Ervaring met werken in Agile omgevingen met behulp van Scrum (SAFe, Less, Nexus).Je spreekt en schrijft goed Nederlands en EngelsJe bent een teamspelerWat wij je biedenCompetitief salarisVolledige reiskostenvergoedingPensioenregeling25 vakantiedagenLaptop en mobiele telefoonOp maat gemaakt talent management programma om jouw professionele doelen te bereikenPrettige en informele werksfeer binnen een internationale organisatieUitdagende projecten op basis van jouw interesses en ervaringRuimte voor eigen inbreng en ideeënToegang tot tech events, teamuitjes en andere evenementenIs er nog ruimte voor plezier? Jazeker! De combinatie van plezier en ontwikkeling is belangrijk in ons team. Om een kleine impressie te geven: ons team bestaat uit meer dan 10 nationaliteiten en we organiseren regelmatig tech meetups, teamuitjes, vrijdagmiddagborrels en pub-quizzen.Bij agap2 verdedigen wij gelijkheid en waarderen wij diversiteit. Wij creëren een veilige en diverse omgeving waar kansen voor alle medewerkers gelijk zijn!Alle kandidaten met vaardigheden die aansluiten op deze vacature zijn welkom om te soliciteren. There is agap2 join us!

title: Data Engineer
description: The latest techniques, the coolest projects, the best clients. If you are looking for a challenge, look no further. This is your chance to put your skills to the test. Please continue... The digital transformation, industry 4.0, the energy transition - give it a name, every company has to deal with it in its own way. Technology has an increasing impact on the world around us. What was recently seen as the bleeding edge is now the standard, from VR and AI to IoT. We just still have to make sure we don't cut ourselves on that bleeding edge.Fortunately, this market-leading technology company is committed to making innovation easy every day. They only work with the best talents and give them the freedom and the tools to make their customers' wishes a reality. In any industry, from food producers to energy suppliers. They work closely with their customers, in very short feedback loops, in order to arrive at the perfect solution within a short time. And they could really use your help.That’s great! How can I contribute?As the Data Engineer, clients will be dependent on your work. If they want to transform their business and use the technological opportunities, you are the one to facilitate that. To combine the business of the client with the best IT solutions and make them much more productive, is why people are so thankful for what you do. In the Agile environment, you make complex designs and high-performance architecture in AWS and Big Data technologies.I would like that, but can I do it?You can, because you know your systems and technologies. Python, PySpark, and Apache Spark are familiar to you, just as AWS Cloud technologies like S3, EMR, EC2, and Lambda. And when you have experience in a CICD tool or DWH on-Cloud solutions like Redshift or Snowflake, you’re settled. The drive you get from solving problems for clients in the most effective way makes your desk a real playground.That’s me! But will it be worth it?Of course it will, thanks to the sum of salary and secondary working conditions. A laptop and smartphone are where you start with, together with the NS Business card. And a yearly salary of up to a whopping €90.000 gross is what makes this extra interesting. But are you interested? Let us know and we’ll tell you more.

title: Data Engineer
description: Essent is the no. 1 retailer in the Netherlands and IT has a crucial role in the innovation and development of our services. For example to provide insight in energy data through apps.Essent IT is working agile for a long time, at this moment we are shaping our organization towards DevOps to shorten our development cycle, innovate faster and become even more agile. For this transition we are looking for a DevOps Engineer Data in Den Bosch.Developments in the energy market are moving rapidly. As Essent IT, we want to be able to respond quickly to the changing market, be sure that our IT services are always available and our customer data is safe.As a DevOps Engineer Data you will:Work on building robust and scalable data processing pipelines using Python, PySpark in combination with services like Glue, Lambda, Kinesis on AWS.Take ownership to further develop the data platform and help innovate new capabilities on our roadmap such as personalization.Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines in GitCollaborate with Data Scientists to implement data science modelsKeep the Data platform stable and continuously improve the system.Design, develop, and implement reusable components.Work closely together with your Agile DevOps team and take part in the rituals of our SAFe way of working.Work closely with our business stakeholders and system engineer.You embrace the DevOps mentality by giving and taking ownership, and the will to constantly improve. You are always looking for ways to make development life cycles better, simpler and more reliable.You have a “you-built-it-you-own-it” mind set. You revel in continues improvement and are eager to develop your skills.You adjust to constant business change; common types of changes include new requirements, evolving goals and strategies, and emerging technologies.At Essent IT you work agile within a scrum team to the next sprint. We believe that quality and craftsmanship go hand in hand. As an engineer, you decide how much you invest in your own craftsmanship. Everything can always be better. If you also have that drive, then you might just be a good fit for us if you also:Have experience with design, configuration and set up of a cloud data warehouse in Snowflake.Have proficiency in data modelling and very good understanding of data management concepts and their applications.Have solid understanding and experience with SQL and relational databases as well as data pipeline tools such as DBTHave experience in implementing CI/CD pipelines and automated testing,Are experienced with Infrastructure as Code frameworks such as Terraform, Cloud formationHave experience with Airflow, PySpark and PythonKnowledge of and experience in AWS, Azure or Hadoop Eco SystemsFortunately, working in an Agile team with DevOps becomes responsibility.You are customer-oriented: internal or external customer, your solution fits – or even transcends! – the wishes, needs and expectations of our customers.Is open to non-traditional IT solutions and also proposes themOwnership takes hold in your field and actively shares this within your own team and networkFocus on continuous improvement: good is not good enoughYou’ll be joining an organization that affords you freedom to experiment and in which taking risks is rewarded. In terms of salary, opportunities and personal growth. What can you expect from us?A job in a successful and leading European energy company that’s always on the move.A salary matching your level of education and work experience, between € 5.296 en € 7.568 gross per month based on 40 hours per week, excluding holiday allowance.Additional 10% performance bonus.30 holiday days and plus an attractive bonus.An inspiring office environment and top-notch location in Den Bosch! And as our office is a mere 850 meters from Den Bosch central station, travelling by public transport is a great option. Particularly when travelling with the NS Business Card which we will issue you. Prefer your own car? In that case you will of course receive a kilometer allowance.A wide range of development and career growth opportunities.Interested? Please apply with short motivational letter and resume. We’re the market leader in the supply of energy and gas in the Netherlands. A position we’re proud of. Every day, we find newer and smarter ways of being the best together, as one team. We have focus, ownership and discipline. Our straightforward mentality helps us retain the loyalty of millions of consumers and businesses. Not just in energy and gas, but also in energy-related products and services that help the Netherlands become more sustainable. And we don’t wait until tomorrow. As part of E.ON, and with our brands Essent, energiedirect.nl, Powerhouse and Vandebron, we create impact for our customers. Together, we bring affordable energy solutions within reach for everyone.

title: Data Engineer | Bincy
description: Wat ga jij doen?Als Data Engineer voel je je helemaal thuis op het grensvlak tussen business en IT en je weet als geen ander wat data kunnen betekenen voor bedrijfsprocessen en ben je goed bekend met datawarehousing, data-integratie en visualisatie oplossingen.Waar kom je te werken?Bincy staat voor Binary Consultancy. De rol van de binaire code als kern in de ontwikkelingen van de Informatie Technologie en de oneindigheid aan mogelijkheden die deze biedt, is inspiratie geweest voor de naamgeving. Parallel hieraan geloven wij er ook in dat zolang jij bij de kern blijft van jezelf, je jezelf ook als consultant oneindig kan blijven ontwikkelen.Wat wij vragen?Minimaal een afgeronde hbo-opleiding richting IT.Ervaring met cloud architecturen.Ervaring met Cloud (bijvoorbeeld Microsoft Azure, AWS, etc.).Ervaring met technologieën als Databricks, Spark Structured Streaming en PySpark.Creëren dataconnectoren d.m.v Python en andere codingtalen.Definiëren data validatie test om te runnen in de data pipeline.Definiëren van monitoring en alerting om zichtbaarheid te garanderen wanneer de data flow onderbroken is of niet verwacht gedrag vertoont.In het geval van incidenten, snel de root cause analyse kunnen doen zodat het incident opgelost kan worden met zo min mogelijk impact voor de eindgebruiker.Verantwoordelijk voor bouwen, deployen, onderhouden en optimaliseren van data connectors om een data flow naar het datalake te maken.Wat wij bieden?Bij Bincy geniet je van het beste van twee werelden. Zo krijg je bij ons de vastigheid van een werknemer maar een beloning als een Freelancer.Contract voor onbepaalde tijdWerken aan de leukste opdrachten.Bij ons krijg je 70% van je verdiende uurtarief40/36/32 uur werkenMogelijkheid tot Leaseauto, Laptop/Telefoon.Events, kennissessies en meetups

title: Data Engineer | SQL, Python, ETL Processen in Utrecht.
description: SamenvattingBen jij een gedreven Data Engineer op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging in de omgeving Utrecht? Wij zijn op zoek naar een gedreven professional die een cruciale rol speelt in het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van data-infrastructuur en het transformeren van ruwe gegevens naar bruikbare inzichten.Je komt te werken in een echte data gespecialiseerde organisatie, waar de persoon centraal staat. Voor verschillende klanten in het land verzorgen ze de data pipelines en ETL-processen. Het is een gezellig bedrijf met een team van specialisten waar regelmatig leuke events, meetups en workshops worden georganiseerd. Naast hard werken wordt er dus ook veel plezier gemaakt. Is dat iets voor jou? Lees dan snel verder.What's in it for you?Bruto maandsalaris vanaf €5.000Vakantiegeld 8%Pensioenregeling via STiPP25 vakantiedagenJe krijgt alles wat je nodig hebt om je werk goed uit te kunnen voerenReiskostenvergoeding/NS business card/auto van de zaak met tankpasOveruren uitbetaaldDeelname aan ons persoonlijk ontwikkelingsprogramma: The QuestFlexibele werktijden en hybride werken (in overleg)Een legendarisch nieuwjaars-/kerstgeschenkLeuke borrels en events: game nights, padellen en veel andere teambuilding activiteiten!De mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan onze regelmatige meetups, waar trends en zaken binnen jouw specialisme worden besproken (of daarbuiten!)Wat ga je doen?Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van data-pipelines en ETL-processenWerken met Python en SQL voor het implementeren van gegevensverwerking en -transformatieWerken met Databricks-platform, inclusief PySpark en SparkSQLUitvoeren van unit tests en data tests om de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid van gegevens te waarborgenBeheren van stakeholders en verzamelen van vereisten om aan de behoeften van het bedrijf te voldoenActief deelnemen aan CI/CD-processen en het gebruik van git voor versiebeheerUitvoeren van data-analyses en het ontwikkelen van inzichten om bij te dragen aan datagestuurde besluitvormingWerken met Airflow voor het beheren en plannen van data-pipelines (ervaring is een pluspunt)Samenwerken met het team om nieuwe technologieën en beste praktijken te verkennen en te implementerenHerken jij jezelf hierin?Je hebt een hbo- of wo-diploma in de richting van Computer Science, IT of iets vergelijkbaarsMinimaal 1-2 jaar ervaring als Data EngineerUitstekende kennis van Python en SQLErvaring met Databricks-platform, inclusief PySpark en SparkSQLEnige ervaring met ETL-processen, data-transformatie en het werken met complexe bedrijfslogicaErvaring met CI/CD-processen en git is een vereisteJe hebt sterke communicatievaardigheden en weet hoe je met stakeholders te werk gaatErvaring met Snowflake is een pluspuntErvaring met AWS is een pluspuntLet op: voor deze vacature is minimaal C1 niveau Nederlands vereist. Please note: this job has a required minimum of C1-level Dutch.Over True LegendsOp de vijfde verdieping van het B2.Amsterdam gebouw in Amsterdam Nieuw-West, is ons mooie (al zeggen we het zelf) kantoor gevestigd. True Legends richt zich op het werven, selecteren, opleiden en detacheren van IT en Data Professionals. We bemiddelen hoogopgeleide professionals met 0-3 jaar werkervaring en ervaren IT-professionals die al langer in het vak zitten: ware legendes. De kandidaten van True Legends kenmerken zich door hun hoogwaardige IT-kennis, frisse blik en positieve energie.Voor iedere kandidaat bieden wij een maatwerk oplossing. True Legends is namelijk altijd in beweging, net als de wereld van IT. Dat zie je bijvoorbeeld terug in onze IT Traineeships in de richting van: Software Development, Cloud & Infrastructure, Data & AI, Internet of Things en Security.Wij geloven dat iedereen, met de juiste begeleiding, zijn volledige potentieel kan benutten. We bieden kennis, advies, en tools om groei te verwezenlijken. De mens staat op de eerste plaats, zo bieden wij voor iedere opdracht een intensief Talent Management traject en een op maat gemaakt persoonlijk ontwikkelingsprogramma. Zo onderscheiden we ons van andere bedrijven. True Legends is meer dan een business partner. True Legends is een business en career friend!Jouw sollicitatieprocedure

title: Data engineer
description: Requirements:Bachelor's or Master's degree in a STEM field.Hands-on experience in developing and deploying data pipelines and data models in a cloud environment. Experience with data warehouse modeling is a significant advantage.Proficiency in Python, including PySpark, Pandas, and other analytics libraries.Proficiency in SQL.Proficiency in CICD tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Airflow/Dagster.Desired Skills and Qualifications:Strong consulting skills and the ability to engage with business and leadership to provide tactical and operational insight-based recommendations.Comfortable working for an international company that utilizes various operational models.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.Strong problem-solving ability.Composure in pressurized environments.A self-starter with a positive energy and a proactive approach to work.Experience in e-commerce, digital marketing, digital analytics, business intelligence, or conversion optimization roles is a plus.Experience with Agile product management is a plus.Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.Nick Wartena

title: Technology Lead (DevOps)
company: K&K social resources and development GmbH
description: K&K Social Resources & Development GmbH is an international recruiting agency that has been providing technical resources in the European region since 1993. This position is with one of our clients in Netherlands who is actively hiring candidates to expand their teams.Role: Technology Lead (DevOps)Employment Type: Full-time PermanentLocation: Amsterdam, NetherlandsJob Description: You will be in charge of setting up DevOps (CI/CD) pipeline within Big Data application landscape: Build and maintain operational tools for deployment, implement health monitoring for containerized applications on AWS and GCP platform. Supporting release and testing activities. Design cloud infrastructure that is secure, scalable, and highly available on AWS/GCPEnsure configuration and compliance with configuration management tools Managing and deploying AWS/GCP services Required: Must have strong hands-on experience with– AWS/GCP, Docker, Performance troubleshooting, Linux / Git / ELK stack / Grafana / Prometheus, SRE capabilities. Intermediate understanding of Data engineering concepts. Basic to intermediate experience in data engineering concepts like Scala spark, HDFS, Kafka, Data bricks concepts. Experience in Ansible for automations. Intermediate in Pyspark concepts. Expertise in Linux operating system - commands and Unix shell scripts. Intermediate knowledge of Python language. Understanding on Docker, basics of Kubernetes Experience working in Agile environments. Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Problem-solving skills and ability to follow through to completion. Able to analyze and solve complex software release problems under deadline constraints. Must have: Valid Work Authorization in the Netherlands.Note: Applicants for employment in Netherlands should possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa.

title: Data Engineer
description: Essent IT is met zo’n 250 collega’s groot genoeg om de voordelen van een volwassen bedrijf te ervaren en tegelijkertijd klein genoeg om dynamisch te reageren. Met ongeveer 200 DevOps engineers in 25 teams hebben we de teams zo opgesteld dat elk team een duidelijke scope heeft en elke engineer ten volle zijn eigen inbreng en impact kan hebben. We zijn voortdurend in beweging en hebben een tomeloze ambitie. Daarom zijn we steeds op zoek naar Devops Engineers en Architecten met dezelfde energie om onze DevOps teams te versterken en naar het volgende level te brengen.Bij Essent IT werk je met state-of-the-art technologieën en methodieken zoals Snowflake, DBT, Databricks, Python, AWS, Terraform, Kafka, PySpark. De impact die je als open-minded IT-professional bij Essent hebt op de energietransitie kan groots zijn. Denk daarbij aan het creëren van inzicht in het energieverbruik van onze klanten, en dan echt end-to-end. Maar ook dingen als het automatiseren van data pipelines door middel van gave technologie en de vrijheid om met tools en technologieën te experimenten om je werk zo goed en efficiënt mogelijk in te richten. Neem het initiatief en werk aan applicaties voor meer dan 2,5 miljoen klanten van Essent, energiedirect.nl, Vandebron en/of Powerhouse. Je wordt continu uitgedaagd om je skills te verbeteren en je kennis te verbreden. Van gave producten die zorgen dat onze klanten de beste beleving krijgen tot applicaties die het werkend leven van onze eigen medewerkers een stukje makkelijker maken. Bij Essent IT zijn er volop kansen om verder te komen, mee te gaan in onze journey naar een tech company met praktische verduurzaming voor onze klanten. Wanneer je eigenaarschap pakt krijg je de ruimte om jouw ideeën te implementeren.We plannen ons werk in sprints van drie weken en PI’s van een kwartaal. Dit geeft focus en helpt ons om voortdurend onszelf te verbeteren. Iedereen brengt zijn/haar onderwerpen in en samen zetten we dit uit in de tijd. Zo is iedereen met zijn/haar talent en ambitie aangehaakt en werken we samen aan onze doelstellingen. Niet alles draait om leveren. Hackathons, knowledge markets, PI Planning Events en af en uiteraard borrels of een escape room brengen ons dichter bij elkaar.Wil je meer weten over wie we zijn, wat onze visie is en waar we aan werken? Kijk dan eens op it.essent.nlBij Essent IT werk je binnen een scrum-team agile naar de volgende sprint. We geloven dat kwaliteit en craftsmanship hand in hand gaan. Als engineer bepaal jij zelf hoeveel je in je eigen craftsmanship investeert. Alles kan altijd beter. Als jij ook die drive hebt, dan zou je zomaar goed bij ons kunnen passen als je daarnaast:Ervaring hebt met distributed computing frameworks zoals PySpark of Snowflake,Ervaring hebt met het implementeren van CI/CD pipelines en automated testing,Ervaring hebt met SQL en relationele databases,Gelukkig wordt van het werken in een Agile team met DevOps verantwoordelijkheid.Klantgericht bent: interne of externe klant, jouw oplossing past bij – of overstijgt zelfs! – de wensen, behoeften en verwachtingen van onze klanten.Openstaat voor niet-traditionele IT-oplossingen en deze ook aandraagtEigenaarschap pakt op je vakgebied en dit zelf actief deelt binnen eigen team en netwerkDe focus hebt op continu verbeteren: goed is niet goed genoegBij Essent ontvang je uiteraard een mooie arbeidsvoorwaardelijke waardering (5.296 - 7.568 euro bruto per maand) en daarnaast veel ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en groeikansen. Verder bieden we:Vast contractRuimte voor groei en ontwikkeling, binnen en buiten je vakgebied, binnen Essent en daarbuiten (bijvoorbeeld bij ons moederbedrijf E.ON)Een werkomgeving waar je helemaal jezelf kunt zijn. We geloven erin dat juist de verschillen in onze Essenters ons helpen om de nummer 1 in energie te blijven.Een bonus opportunity om onze waardering nog meer uit te spreken30 Vakantiedagen omdat je naast je werk nog andere hobby’s hebtAlle faciliteiten om goed te kunnen werken zoals een laptop, telefoon, thuiswerkplek etc.Hybride werken inclusief bijbehorende thuiswerkvergoedingKorting op energie en energiebesparende producten van onze merken en servicepartnersEen inspirerend hoofdkantoor met goede koffiebar, twee bedrijfsrestaurants en op loopafstand van Centraal Station Den Bosch.We raden je aan om met het openbaar vervoer te komen. Een fijne extra: je ontvangt dan een NS Business Card van ons. Liever reizen met eigen vervoer? Dan krijg je een kilometervergoeding..Wil je meer weten of gewoon kennismaken? Solliciteer dan. Je hoeft geen motivatie of CV achter te laten: we komen gewoon graag met je in gesprek.Essent is marktleider in het leveren van energie en gas in Nederland. Een positie waar we trots op zijn. Elke dag vinden we weer slimme manieren om als één team de beste te zijn. We hebben focus, eigenaarschap en discipline. Met onze rechtdoorzee-mentaliteit weten wij miljoenen consumenten en ondernemers aan ons te binden. Niet alleen met energie en gas, ook met energie-gerelateerde producten en diensten die Nederland helpen verder te verduurzamen. Als onderdeel van E.ON en met onze merken Essent, energiedirect.nl, Powerhouse en Vandebron maken we impact voor onze klanten. Samen maken we duurzame energieoplossingen bereikbaar en betaalbaar voor iedereen.

title: Data Engineer
description: Als Data Engineer Consultant is je voornaamste taak om gegevens voor te bereiden voor analytisch of operationeel gebruik. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het bouwen van datapijplijnen om informatie uit verschillende bronsystemen samen te brengen. Je integreert, consolideert en zuivert gegevens en geeft die structuur voor het gebruikt kan worden in analytische toepassingen.Wat wij van jouw vragen:Kennis van en werkervaring op gebied van data engineering;Kennis van datamodelleren conceptueel en dimensioneel;Ervaring met cloud architecturen;Ervaring met Cloud (bijvoorbeeld Microsoft Azure, AWS, etc.);Ervaring met Scrum, Agile en Devops werkwijze;Ervaring met technologieën als Databricks, Spark Structured Streaming en PySpark;Ervaring met vertalen van de functionele en non-functionele wensen van de gebruiker naar passende oplossingen;Ervaring met analyseren van brondata en het ontwerpen van datamodellen.Wat wij jou bieden:Uitdagende opdrachten bij de top-500 Nederlandse organisatiesEen professionele werkomgeving met zeer ervaren collega’s;Keuze in opdrachten;Uitgebreide trainings- en certificerings mogelijkheden;Vast dienstverband;Een goed salaris, aangevuld met een aantrekkelijke bonus;Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals leaseauto, laptop en vaste vergoeding voor mobiele telefoonkostenWe willen dat jij je kunt richten op je passie. Sc.Tiger helpt je bij elke stap in je carrière. Ons team en collega-experts zijn er voor je en staan achter je. Laat Sc.Tiger je helpen in je journey.

title: Senior Azure Data Engineer
description: Together, we Win by Striving Forward: the Jumbo DNA! It is what we stand for at Jumbo Supermarkets. As Senior Azure Data Engineer, you will work within the Analytics department of Jumbo Tech Campus. Our ambition is to develop a futureproof and robust data platform using state-of-the-art technologies in empowering self-service BI & analytics, Mobile BI, and support of modern machine learning and data science use cases.As a Data Engineer, you will design and set up our Azure data platform by creating end-to-end solutions for ingesting, processing, analyzing, and presenting data to enable a data-driven mindset. Together with your team, you manage the flow of structured and unstructured (big) data, coming from various sources, in Azure as well as work on a centralized cloud data platform (Data Core). Data Core is being developed and used across the entire Jumbo organization to create business value by delivering actionable insights. In close collaboration with the (internal) customer, you will gather their needs and requirements to maximize business value. The goal of the scrum team is to enable Jumbo to become a more data-driven organization.We are strengthening the relationship between businesses and the analytics teams and aim to extend intelligence at Jumbo. Every day again.In the role of Senior Azure Data Engineer, you contribute to the most enjoyable shopping experience by: Design, implement, and standardize end-to-end CRM data solutions to facilitate advanced customer journey orchestration data solutions within the Data Core Platform;Ingest, transform, and validate data from multiple sources;Facilitate and challenge businesses to provide the necessary data/solutions to support and optimize customer journeys;Proactively collaborate with business stakeholders in the areas of CRM, Marketing, and other data domains;Make sure that data pipelines and data products are high-performing, automated, and monitored, following the CI/CD practice and the DevOps approach;Team up with the scrum team(s) on solutions and developments;As a Data Engineer at Jumbo, you are part of an enthusiastic scrum team which usually consists of 6-7 people with different skills (analysis, development, test, ops), a scrum master, and a product owner.Do you have the Jumbo DNA: togetherness, entrepreneurship, and winning? And do you also have:A bachelor or master in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience;At least 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in a similar role;Knowledge of (and ideally certification in) Azure or cloud-based applications and pipelines;Strong knowledge of data engineering languages (.Net, Python, PySpark, SQL, Java, T-SQL, U-SQL);Solid experience with data engineering technologies (MS SQL, SQL Pool, Synapse analytics, Data Factory, Azure data lake, Logic apps, Azure functions, Azure event grid, Databricks).What do we offer:An opportunity to be part of the most customer-friendly company in the world. This means responding to the wishes of our customers and colleagues. As a Senior Azure Data Engineer, you can also expect something from us in return. Because we ensure that you feel good about yourself, with job satisfaction and career growth. You also get:A salary between € 5.000 and € 6.800 per month, based on your education, knowledge, and experience.An annual bonus of up to 5% of your annual salary.30 days of paid holiday per year and 8% holiday pay.A personal development budget and training opportunities through Jumbo Academy.The possibility to work partly from home and a work-from-home allowance.A cycle to work plan.The option to participate in our collective health insurance.Fresh fruit waiting for you in our food café and the tastiest coffee with fresh milk.Access to the Jumbo Gym to help you stay fit.10% discount on your groceries, which we pay out with your salary.Do you live outside of the Netherlands? Then we will take care of your relocation process! Read more about this here .Bart Gerritse 0657458753 bart.gerritse@jumbo.com

title: Internal Audit Data Analytics Manager
description: We are JTI, Japan Tobacco International, and we are present in 130 countries. We have spent years innovating, creating new and better products for the consumers to choose from. This is our business. But not only. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe that when they are free to be themselves, and they are given the opportunity to grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen.That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It is why 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, nine years running.So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.Learn more jti.comInternal Audit Data Analytics Manager- Shaping Tomorrow, TodayPosition purpose Internal Audit serves as an independent monitoring function that reports to the Chairman of the JT International Holding B.V. Board. We drive value through the audit process and our advisory assignments, working with the business and IT to improve the way JTI works.Step into the dynamic world of JTI as a Data Analytics Audit Manager, a role at the intersection of technology and innovation, governance, and change. You will be far more than a gatekeeper for compliance; you’re an enabler of transformation. Your insights and expertise will support JTI in mitigating its strategic and operational risks today and contribute to a better, sustainable, tomorrow.What Will You Do – ResponsibilitiesDrive forward the use of data analytics across the Internal Audit department and significantly contribute to the continuous improvement of IAD activities by acting as a subject matter expert for data analytics.Identify and make suggestions to the Data Analytics Team Manager and Directors for enhancing the use of analytics in audit processes and programs and/or the overall effectiveness and efficiency of the Internal Audit function (eg. in the evolution to continuous auditing / controls monitoring)Be updated on emerging data analytics trends, tools and techniques (e.g. Process Mining, AI, ML) and assess suitability for adoption in Internal AuditTrain & support users to effectively use the analytics solutions (e.g. PowerBi, MS SQL) for data analysis during Internal Audit assignments Identify and obtain relevant data from data sources to support process and controls analysis during Internal Audit assignments.Together with the relevant IT and business support teams, identify and build solutions to automate the extraction of necessary data. Perform holistic (cross-function and cross-entity) analysis of key process data, adding to the analytics catalog supporting data-driven audits.Develop and support the data analytics solutions (e.g. MS Azure, MS SQL) for the use of the Internal Audit Department. Ensure the implemented solutions are working accurately and consistently.Continue the development/refinement of the standardized analytics for use on relevant audits. Create and maintain the library of scripts available for all IAD users and document all scripts/knowledge.Integrate data analytics into Internal Audit working programs and planning.Liaise with Group IT to provide support for changes.Liaise with other JTI departments to drive forward the use of analytics in line with the Company's data & analytics strategy. Execute audit assignment tasks under the supervision and guidance of the Team Managers and Directors, ensuring that they are completed within the allotted timeframeIn this role, your expertise, diligence, and collaborative spirit will not only be recognized but will be instrumental in driving the Internal Audit Department’s evolution, aligning it with JTI’s operational and strategic imperatives.Who Are We Looking For – RequirementsA relevant university degree in Analytics, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Statistics, IT or Computer Science. Technical accreditations (e.g., PL-300, DP-203, SAP Hana) will set you apart.Minimum of 5 years of work experience in a relevant role with a strong working knowledge and hands-on experience of data analytics. A genuine interest in the application of data analytics to improve business performance and add value to the business. Experience with ETL and analytics tools (e.g. Azure Data factory, Databricks) and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI). Understanding and exposure to programming languages (SQL, Python, PySpark).General understanding of business processes, corporate governance, audit principles and standards. Working experience with S/4 HANA and knowledge of SAP data structures highly beneficial.Analytical and critical thinking, inquisitive, problem-solving, self-starter mindset. Familiarity with diverse project management methodologies, including but not limited to Waterfall and Agile, demonstrating adaptability and effectiveness in managing projects from initiation to completion.Excellent command of written and spoken English, with proficiency in additional languages being a highly valued asset.Being internationally mobile for career progression opportunities.What Sets You ApartAnalytical Prowess Your ability to unravel complex problems, offering insights and solutions that drive progress.Communicative Excellence A knack for communicating complex ideas with clarity, ensuring alignment and collaboration across diverse teams. Adaptive Innovation A readiness to evolve, adapt, and apply new ideas to support JTI’s growth.We’re looking for someone who’s not just skilled but is visionary, someone who is not just about ticking boxes but is about innovation, efficiency, and strategic contributions to risk mitigation. If you are conversant with emerging trends in analytics and audit and can integrate this knowledge into actionable insights, then you are the candidate we are looking for.Why Join Us High Impact Be part of a team that directly influences strategic risk management, governance, and operational excellence right across the company.Diverse Community Immerse yourself in a vibrant culture that truly values our differences to enhance teamwork and delivery excellence. Be part of a global family that respects diversity, encourages inclusivity, and fosters a supportive work environment.Innovative Culture Thrive in a culture that values innovation, creativity, and individual contribution, ensuring your skills and talents are not just recognized but celebrated and nourished.What Are The Next Steps - Recruitment ProcessThank you very much for your interest in the role – we look forward to your application! If your profile matches the role requirements, our recruiter will get in touch to schedule a meeting. If successful, you will then have up to two rounds of interviews and discussions with a couple of our Internal Audit Team Managers and Directors. We provide feedback to all candidates.

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Data Analyst
description: Sam Media is a team of passionate and fearless creatives, marketing experts, Data wizards, and developers focused on delivering great products and services to hundreds of millions of mobile consumers worldwide. We are one of the pioneers and a leader in the mobile micropayment sector.We are an online performance marketing company, we build and market our products including Mobile Apps, Streaming Video and Music Services, Online Learning Portals and Mobile Games. Millions of users engage with our promotional content and digital ads every single day.We are a diverse team of more than 34 nationalities based in Kuala Lumpur, Amsterdam, Dubai, and Hanoi. We value ambition, open communication and learning from each other.As a data analyst, you will have a central role contributing to many decisions that we make every day. You develop actionable, data-driven insight for optimization of our creative campaigns, discovering hidden opportunities, or digging into the root cause of a discrepancy. You make sound arguments, supported by data for taking or discarding an opportunity.We are looking for a motivational candidate who can support our multidisciplinary teams finding actionable insights from our data and also work on developing new tools that help our company improve business performance from our Amsterdam office.About YouYou have hands-on software development and analytical skills. Our ideal colleague should love getting their hands dirty with building solutions, doing research, analyzing data and programming. You will need knowledge in designing and shipping solutions and tools across the whole stack.What will you be doing?Supporting our cross-functional teams. This includes developing and maintaining dashboards, generating reports, preparing data visualizations, and using data to forecast or guide business activity. Our main tools for this are Redshift (SQL) and Quicksight.Find actionable insights on our data and communicate them to improve and optimize our business.Design, build/improve and maintain internal projects built in Python, such as our early alerting system or our IP targeting optimization project. Both projects are currently being used within the company for error monitoring and process optimization respectively. And if you feel brave enough you can help to deploy them with Docker and Airflow!What do we expect from you?You should have a passion for coding, optimizing for business value and enjoy solving problems and building correct, extensible and simple solutions that match our scale and load.You should be proficient with Python and SQL. Having 3+ years of relevant experience as an analyst and/or software developer.Several of our projects are being built using Django, would be a plus if you have previously worked using this framework as we are continuous developing these projects.We use AWS suite (Redshift as our main analytical database along a swarm of EC2 to keep our services alive), Docker, Git, Airflow so a basic understanding of these technologies would be a nice to have.You are able to work in a fast-paced and multicultural environment where the main working language is English so fluency in verbal and written English is a must.What do we offer?A Competitive salary in line with market conditions and your skills and experienceAlthough this position isn't remote, we offer flexible working schedules.Established in 2006, we are a market-proven, well-established, international company with an informal culture. We trust our team members to get the job done, how they do it is up to them.We invest in the personal development of each Sam Median by taking courses, attending conferences, and other learning opportunities;We have regular team(building) events, including lunches, monthly office birthday celebration, and a yearly company tripWe have a creative office in the heart of Amsterdam with tasty coffee, tea, fresh fruit, daily fresh lunch, and beers on Friday afternoons.We offer visa sponsorship and a comprehensive relocation package when applicable.

It’s pretty hard to create the same thing elegantly simple.
