title: Business Analyst
description: Business Analyst – Cartier Benelux & Nordics(7 month FTC, full time)Want to join Cartier Benelux & Nordics team to actively contribute to data management and business analysis to support our Commercial initiatives?Join us as our Business Analyst.HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?As Business Analyst, reporting to the Commercial Operations & Performance Manager, you are mainly responsible for supporting the Commercial Management & Local Executive committee with data-driven insights & recommendations.Below the main responsibilities: Collect, clean, organize data from various sources, and contribute to the continuous improvement of network performance dashboard elaboration. In particular, design and create dashboards and visual reports to present findings in a clear and understandable manner, for Commercial management to constantly spot business opportunities. Proactively collaborate with Business teams, but as well Client, Marketing and Finance teams, and acquire necessary data to enrich analysis combined with market insight and business result for decision making. Support Commercial management in the sales forecast and ensure accurate upload of the Budget on a quarterly basis. HOW WILL YOUR EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US? You have a keen eye for detail and ability to understand where and how to look for errors in large datasets. You possess strong data visualization skills: ability to analyze data for strategic insights and develop materials that showcase data that summarizes performance for Leadership. You possess a problem-solving mindset, and you are comfortable in a fast-paced changing environment, always driving for excellence You have a “team player” spirit, and the ability to work well within a group / team dynamic. Advanced skills in MS office tools, Excel, PowerPoint. Ability to use POWER BI reports, Google Looker & ANAPLAN sales planning is a plus. HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?A great opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that goes the extra mile.We value our people, and you will be provided with an complete on-boarding and continued training throughout your career to grow with Cartier.This role will also help deepen your knowledge of luxury and its business.YOUR JOURNEY WITH US:If your application is successful, you will receive an introductory call from a member of our Talent Acquisition team to discuss the opportunity.If you are successful through the interview, you will be invited to attend an interview with our Commercial Performance & Operation Manager to assess your fit for the role and who will share insights on our team dynamics and the overall vision.Finally, you will meet the HR Business Partner to ask any questions and have the final feedback.

title: Data Science Internship
description: Data Science InternshipAs a Data Science Intern at RespiQ you will be responsible for developing classification algorithms for the detection of volatile compounds in the measured spectrographic data. You will also be involved in the development of the portal for data collection and processing. You will benefit from the close collaboration with your peers, learn spectroscopic techniques and acquire knowledge from the data science lead. Your expertise and contributions will help advance the company's mission of revolutionizing respiratory healthcare.Responsibilities:Algorithm Development (Python):Collaborate with our data science team to design, develop, and fine-tune classification algorithms for respiratory data analysis.Implement machine learning models, data preprocessing, and feature engineering to enhance algorithm accuracy.Perform rigorous testing and validation to ensure the algorithms meet performance and reliability criteria.Data Portal Development (FastAPI/NextJS):Work closely with the team to design and develop our data processing system.Implement user-friendly features, interactivity, and data visualization tools to improve the user experience.Data Integration:Assist in data collection, cleaning, and integration from various sources into the data pool.Collaborate with the backend development team to ensure seamless data flow and optimize data processing.Documentation and Reporting:Create and maintain documentation for algorithms and front-end components.Present findings, results, and progress reports to the team regularly.Qualifications:Student from a master’s programme in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, or Computational Physics)Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, JavaScript, or similar.Knowledge of machine learning and data analysis libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch).Understanding of data processing, data cleaning, and data visualization.Some experience with front-end development (React) and databases (PostgreSQL) would be appreciated.Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.A passion for healthcare technology and a desire to make a positive impact on patient care.Location:- Hybrid: 20% on site, 80% remote.- Leiden, The NetherlandsJob Conditions:- A stipend of 400eur per month.- A 6-month internship contract with the possibility of extension.- Flexible work environment, flexible hours and a hybrid setup.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: About us; iconic brand, tiny companyPolaroid was founded in 1937 by one of the most seminal innovators of the 20th century, Edwin Land. His motto was, “don't undertake a project unless it is manifestly important and nearly impossible.” In 2008, Polaroid shuttered its last factory, but a group of diehard fans came together as The Impossible Project to save instant film. Over 10 years later that start-up acquired what was left of Polaroid and today we’re again a small group of people passionate about empowering creators to change the world in the name of Polaroid.What we are building; tools for creatorsThroughout its 80-year history, Polaroid was at its best when we made tools for people to express themselves, push boundaries and move culture forward. In the next decade, we are getting back to this purpose. We're not solving small problems, and we're not addressing a small market; our goal is to make products that will make the world more meaningful and human.The roleWe are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled individual to lead our digital analytics implementation and manage our customer data platform (CDP) initiatives. This dual role requires expertise in setting up, maintaining, and troubleshooting web analytics tracking systems, along with engineering and integrating customer data platforms.Responsibilities:1. Implement, manage, and troubleshoot web analytics tracking systems using tools like Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.2. Collaborate with various teams to understand their tracking and data needs, ensuring accurate and effective implementation.3. Test, validate, and debug tracking setups to ensure data accuracy and integrity.4. Identify and resolve tracking, data integrity, and CDP-related issues.5. Design, deploy, and manage CDP systems to centralize customer data, ensuring it's accessible and actionable for marketing initiatives.6. Assist in setting up and maintaining Google Analytics accounts, views, properties, Google Tag Manager containers, tags, and CDP integrations.7. Create and maintain technical documentation related to web analytics tracking implementation and CDP processes.8. Assist in data analysis, report generation, and offer insights from both web analytics and CDP data.9. Train team members on tracking tool setup, CDP usage, and best practices.10. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.Requirements:1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field plus 3 years commercial experience2. Proven experience in implementing and maintaining web analytics tracking systems and CDP platforms.3. Strong understanding of digital marketing, web analytics, and customer data management.4. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, and relevant CDP technologies.5. Familiarity with data layer concepts, structures, and data integration methodologies.6. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail.7. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Preferred:1. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and major CDP platform certifications.2. Experience with other tag management systems, web analytics tools, and CDP integrations.3. Knowledge of SEO, SEM strategies, and data privacy regulations.If you apply for a position at Polaroid, we will process your personal data. Please see our Job Applicant Privacy Policy for more information about how we handle personal data of job applicants. https://www.polaroid.com/privacy-policy

title: Quantitative Analyst / Prism
description: About UsCryptology is a full-featured next-generation asset trading platform. With us one can easily and efficiently sell, buy, exchange and invest cryptocurrency. What is special about us? Reliability. This is the most important criterion in our every-day-changing world. You can trust us. Trust us with your assets, accounts, financial plans and your future.Job purposeMore and more people rely on Cryptology. We are growing, improving our team, and now we are looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst.Duties and responsibilitiesData mining and analysis from different sources, development and optimization of mathematical models based on timeseries structures.Perform analytical research within the supervised project.Statistical hypotheses testing and processing ad-hoc requests.Visualization and interpretation of the research results.Assessment with internal data processing and reporting. Find anomalies and proposals for their elimination.QualificationsBSc in STEM subjects - Maths, Statistics, Physics or Computer Science preferred.Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation of large data sets is a must.Good knowledge and deep understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, probability analysis, linear algebra.Familia with base ML approaches and techniques. Experience with time series analysis, feature engineering, interpolation / extrapolation, dimension reduction etc.Knowledge of financial markets microstructure and trading environment.Programming experience in Python / R /Julia. Familia with visualization tools like Tableau, MS BI, Grafana, Plotly, Shiny etc.Terms and benefitsRemote, full time work;Competitive salary based on qualifications and experience;Truly flexible schedule;Paid holiday;Continuous professional development.We at Cryptology stand for equal opportunities, fairness and diversity. Therefore, the selection of candidates takes place regardless of race, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, religion, age, civil and marital status, and health condition. So, evaluate only your professional knowledge and experience, and apply.Powered by JazzHRcNunu43RpS

title: BI Engineer
description: Company DescriptionAt Sana Commerce we're committed to an inclusive environment and recognize that our diverse workforce is one of our greatest strengths.It all started in 2007, with a pizza and a plan. Sana Commerce is an e-commerce platform designed to help manufacturers, distributors and wholesalers succeed by fostering lasting relationships with customers who depend on them. We’re a fast-growing SaaS company that allows you to take ownership of your career.You are actively involved in the further development of Sana Commerce Insights – where you are responsible for developing our Power BI analytics solution. You will be building Power BI data models, creating measures in DAX, and visualizing important B2B eCommerce metrics on top of our customer data warehouses. You will also translate the requests of the SCI product owner to the right data, metrics, and visuals that you will integrate into the dashboard in the most user-friendly wayWhat you'll get:A hybrid working model - 3 days from the office, 2 days from home; Up to 3 weeks “work from anywhere” per year; A global and customized team onboarding program (9,1/10 rated by previous new hires); Thursday lunch on us (toasties, sandwiches, salads). Job DescriptionWhat you'll be doing:Creating user stories for SCI development in Microsoft DevOps for building features and fixing bugs;Estimating technical complexity of user stories by assigning story points;Leading sprint planning, sprint progress and retrospective meetings to evaluate the work being done on SCI development;Testing SCI thoroughly before a new release;Integrating new data in the SCI data model using data modeling best practices;Writing clear and efficient DAX code;Building visuals, bookmarks, buttons etc. to make data discovery as user-friendly as possible for our customers;Translating requirements given by the SCI product owners to concrete additions to the Power BI dashboard. QualificationsWhat you'll bring:Completed University Degree in the field of Economics, Business Administration, Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science, IT, or similar;Expert in Power BI, with at least 2 years of experience creating Power BI reportsAble to build state-of-the-art Power BI data models and are familiar with different. data modeling techniques and their impact on report performance. Having worked agile using DevOps and Experience with SQL, Azure Data Factory, and Python is an added advantage. Who we are:So, what does it mean to be a part of the Sana Commerce team?Entrepreneurial. Sana Commerce exists today because a few people had a great idea and brought that idea to life. Result-driven. We also know that being result-driven is about more than just KPIs. It’s about creating value, tackling challenges head-on, and supporting our colleagues in reaching their goals. Customer-Centric. We’re in it for the long haul. Through good times and bad, we stick together because we believe in our product, our promise, and our people. Team spirit. At Sana Commerce, everyone is eager to help their colleagues and success is always a team effort. Learning mindset. Sana Commerce people are constantly looking to improve and challenge their existing knowledge base. Job descriptions can be tough to interpret. Even if you may not tick all the boxes, please explain your motivation for the role of BI Engineer in a cover letter, we strongly encourage you to apply if you still feel like you are a great match for this role. Apply now!

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: About UsDyson is growing fast, and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Pioneering technology takes more than just inventive engineers. At Dyson, we take a problem-solving approach to everything we do. And across our support teams, we’re proud to be different supporting change to maintain our rapid growth. We push the boundaries of what others have defined as possible. Our approach starts with an engineering mindset and different thinking. Then we continuously refine our ideas – unwilling to compromise and driven by an obsession for finding a better way.The EMEA Business Intelligence & Analytics team supports our commercial operations to develop insightful dashboards that supports data driven decision making. The team reaches across the value chain from supply operations to customer retention delivering actionable reporting, supporting measurement of initiatives and operationalising our data. Our responsibility is delivering scalable insights and tools through close market partnership.About The RoleAs a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the advancement of the Analytics team by automating and transforming solutions for our partners in the EMEA Region. We are a project-based team where you will own 2-3 projects concurrently capturing requirements, defining and delivering insights. You will leverage structured and unstructured data sets to produce recommendations that enhance our financial performance.Every day will be different, and you will have the opportunity to engage with stakeholders across the business. This role requires a consultative approach to provide support & guidance in delivering Business Intelligence needs in a variety of ways, be it data acquisition, visualization or analysis depending on the project.About You3-5 years of Tableau Development experience (or equivalent tool)Self-motivated with the ability to work independentlyAbility to understand, analyse, report on and present/visualise data in an engaging wayCommercially astute and financially savvy in contextualising business valueInquisitive mind-set and can collaborate with individuals and teams both cross-functionality and geographicallyConfident and credible when working with a wide range of people across the business.Benefits Discount on Dyson products Company Pension scheme 29 days annual holiday plan Company Fitness plan EAP (Employee Assistant Programme) Life Assurance Plan Transportation allowance (0,21€/km regardless of the means of transport) Health Insurance – Medical Contribution Eye Examination & Computer Glasses Reimbursement Please noteWe do not offer remote working for this position Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

title: Head of Global Consumer Insights
description: ROLE: Head of Global Consumer InsightsBUSINESS: Stoli Group GlobalDEPARTMENT: Global MarketingLOCATION: Europe, HybridREPORTING TO: Global CMOROLEStoli Group has an incredible portfolio of brands, including our premium vodka Stoli & an amazing stable of ultra-premium wine & spirit brands. The ultra-premium category is the fastest growing & most dynamic part of the beverage alcohol market. Stoli Group is looking to reshape the market landscape by becoming the global leader in exceptional adult beverages. With a huge growth ambition to be the ultra-premium brands of reference in spirits industry, we are looking for a superstar Head of Global Consumer Insights who can work to deliver our plan today, whilst building the foundations for a brilliant future. Want to get on a rocket ship establishing and growing these brands across the globe? Read on…. To take on this mission we are looking for a truly outstanding person- to fit the bill you will need to be ….A citizen of the world: you will have an exceptional external radar, be tuned into global and local trends with a keen eye on the future Structured: You need to be able to inspire people, but keep things simple, succinct, consistent (and fun!).A creative: you will be able to demonstrate incredible creative thinking that disrupts and delights, but which responds to our strategy and insight.A get stuff done person: we need people who can make things happen quickly and execute brilliantly in the everyday.Self-starter: you will have a proven track record of working well in ambiguous and rapidly changing environments. The ability to define a way forward, execute and anticipate the challenges along the way is essential. Influencer: be comfortable at driving your agenda across multiple stakeholders (internal and external) and counties. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES Functional:Contribute to a world class consumer insights capabilityDrive strategic thinking on overarching vision, frameworks and ideas for brands in order to achieve ambition by translating business objectives, insights and cultural trends into long-term brands strategy.Marketing lead for specific category research, as well as other ad hoc market intelligence gathering, to best identify and understand complex human motivations and behaviors as they relate to business solutions. Proactively gather insights through internal & external analytic reports including Retail panel (such as AcNielson, IWSR etc), Internal sales data, Brand tracking, Advertising tracking, NPD, and ad hoc projects. Lead group working sessions with stakeholders where necessary to uncover spirit industry and competitor insight.Rigorously analyze strategic landscape and relevant trends to enable STOLI GROUP to stand out globally, supporting long term industry /consumer trends for existing portfolio categories and new high growth/ high value categories Stoli Group could enter, but not limited to, innovation, customer activation and shopper marketing, etc.Partner with MLT to take a lead role on all Stoli brand creative, comms, positioning and re-positioning briefings including agency pitches, developing price positioning, contributing product demand & sales forecasting, innovations, goals setting etc.Champion a test and learn environment that optimizes marketing effectiveness for the short term and overtime. Brand tracking & ROI measurement globally!Being the bridge between DATA (digital) and the business.In collaboration with Digital, drive current & future data, segmentation, consumer journey + channels – and strategic plans and KPIs.Marketing Budget control and proactively advise on its most efficient investments.Drive continuous process improvements and continually evolve ways of working smarter by refreshing and generating new approaches and thinking about planning capability as well as Planning team developmentBe a central figure in STOLI Consumer Insights thought leadership efforts (e.g., speaking engagements, workshops, panel discussions, etc.) to build departmental reputation.Be prepared to participate in cross-functional special projects, tasks and workstreams as assignedCAPABILITIESHigh energy and ambition to achieve successful outcomes and high standardsPassionate and curious about consumers – exhibit a constant thirst for discovering consumer insights and ability to communicate the insight and its importance to the business.Practical, pragmatic, results-driven, outcome-oriented, efficient operator, good multi-taskerActively spot opportunities or issues and identify which are urgent and importantSeeks simplicity and commonality ensuring that Brand strategies are applied widely, consistently and effectively.Sensitive to a diverse range of audiences; able to adapt quickly and make it look effortless.Strong presentation skills across materials (data visualization, inspiring decks, multi-media) and deliveryAbility to multitask and adhere to deadlinesQUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE Education Bachelors Degree: Market Research, Statistics, Economics, Industrial Engineering, and/or Applied Mathematics. MBA Preferred10+ years working as a Planner or Insight Professional, in either a leading consumer goods company, a Comms/Creative Agency, or a consumer research consultancy. Expertise in FMCG or Spirits industry is a plus.Proven track record of leveraging consumer and shopper insights into successful activity.Ability to lead strategic discussions with Sales, Finance, cross functional teamsAnalytical rigor and a challenging outlook on all new informationMust have technical aptitude to include expert level Excel or Access skills and broad-based awareness of other analytical toolsExpertise with modern, up-to-date theories of Brand growth and decline, and an interest in how these are evolvingDemonstrated proficiency in modeling tools like trend analysis and optimization.Ability to inspire and influence a team of experienced Brand Marketers and Consumer Planning Directors as well as a wide range of stakeholdersAbility to manage complexity. Distils and simplifies consumer and market knowledge from multiple sources into relevant priorities and then into clear, actionable implicationsExcellent facilitation skills – able to lead a team to unlock creative solutions to consumer issues.Proven record of handling complex analysesDisclaimer: Stoli Group is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. title: Data Scientist
description: Role -Data ScientistLocation - Utrecht, NetherlandsJob Description: STEM education, with a preference for econometrics or mathematics.Experience with Python, knowledge of Java and PySpark is an advantage.Experience with data and data products (e.g. data management, data analyses, artificial intelligence, machine learning, forecasting, dashboaring).Knowledge and experience within the financial sector and specifically in the field of the Customer Integrity domain is an advantage for those moving up.

title: Data Analyst at Chapter Data
description: Data Analyst at Chapter DataRequirements2–4 years of experienceA Master’s degree, preferably in a business or quantitative direction such as Econometrics, Statistics, Finance, Marketing, or Business AdministrationExperience with Google analytics, SQL or other programming language is a plusWe won’t actually want you to work with Microsoft Excel but there is a high probability that finance will ask for it somedayWell-versed in Storytelling and Stakeholder ManagementVacancy: Data AnalystAs a Data Analyst at Chapter Data, you’ll Fast-Track your career while working with our diverse clients, of different sizes, and at various levels of data maturity. You’ll help them navigate the future by taking lessons from the past, getting the most useful and applicable insights out of the available data. You will answer questions such as ‘What happened?’ and ‘Why did it happen? Chapter Data: Supercharge your professional GrowthAs a Data Analytics professional, what you want more than anything is to learn and to grow. At Chapter Data we strongly believe that one-on-one coaching, tailored to your personality and growth goals, works better than any cookie-cutter trainee program — in getting you to that next step as fast as possible.Our clients and their challengesOur clients and their work can range from the Dutch market leader in online shopping Bol.com, exciting fintech companies building innovative solutions in the financial industry, to one of the world’s most famous, socially and environmentally responsible FMGC brands at Ben & Jerry’s. What they all have in common, is that they need help with identifying and tapping into the true value ofthe data available in their company. And to do so in the most innovative, ethical, and sustainable way.We help them create a company-wide Data Strategy, build their engineering and Data Analytics capacity, and to implement a truly Data-driven culture and ditto leadership. And that’s where you come in.The challenge and environment for youAs a Data Analyst at Chapter Data, you will work with clients of different sizes, and at various stages of data maturity. Your work will help clients develop insights and recommendations that solve complex business problems.Your main challenge will be to collaborate with various stakeholders to understand their business problems, and to translate their questions into data-driven insights. You will use storytelling techniques to explain the story behind the numbers, to elaborate what happened and why it’s happened, to communicate it to stakeholders at all levels of the client organization.Practically, you will focus on data reporting, creating meaningful and easy-to-understand and easy-to-use dashboards around subjects like key performance indicators (KPIs), sales growth, profitability, cashflow, or days of inventory on hand (DOH). You’ll apply data analysis and basic statistics to identify trends, patterns, and potential anomalies. You’ll develop your capability for the application of statistics such as in A/B testing, and you’ll continuously explore the broader possibilities that Business Intelligence has to offer – advising on how organizations can leverage them, fitting to their strategic needs.You’ll do all of this with one-on-one coaching and on-the-job learning, from a very experienced senior Data Expert; our co-founder Sander Klinkenberg.Fast-Track your Data Analysis CareerTaking up the role of Data Analyst at Chapter Data really means pushing your career forward. Especially if you have or are currently developing both the technical knowledge and the business acumen that a truly exceptional Data Analyst needs. If you’re a junior or medior Data Analyst who really wants to take the next step and who also wants to put in the effort to get it — this can be a great opportunity to put your career trajectory on the Fast Track. Apply nowSounds like the next step for you? Contact Daan Bouman at daan.bouman@topofminds.com to express your interest – and let’s set up an introductory call to get acquainted.

title: Junior Data Reporting Analyst
description: For one of our clients operating a hotel booking platform we are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to preferably start as soon as possible.Data analysts in the organisationData Analysts work on analytics tasks such as reporting, visualization and analysis within the scope of their team. They consult with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience.The roleIn this role we look for somone with preferably prior experience in managing stakeholders, and someone who can do this largely autonomously (seeking for help in complex scenarios). You will prioritize work for business impact, efficiently adapt to business needs, and manage expectations accordingly. Additionally you combine your understanding of the business with the knowledge of data, workflows, methods and tooling to largely autonomously drive analysis and reporting within the scope of the team. Key ResponsibilitiesOwning the design and delivery of parts of Data Analytics solutions based on business requirements, contributing to bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation with some supervision.Working independently on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use and translating business problems to data stories. Can ask for guidance on more complex tasks.Working within the scope of their team and delivering work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on.Leveraging foundational skills in data analysis and data visualization to answer business questions. They incorporate stakeholder requirements when creating intuitive and insightful visualizations that translate data into actionable insights.Connecting and collaborating with stakeholders in operational and project-based roles under the guidance of a manager. Being flexible in adopting existing internal Data Analytics approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.Growing your own craft skills while leveraging Data Analytics for impact on well defined business problems.Supporting junior peers when opportunity presents itself through knowledge sharing and setting a good example.Does this sound like you? Share your most recent CV and contact details so we can get in touch! Please not that this position is only available for people residing in the Netherlands.

title: Junior Data Scientist
description: Als Junior Data Scientist kom je te werken bij één van de grootste ingenieursadviesbureaus van Nederland. Dit bedrijf heeft ruim 2.000 medewerkers, verspreidt over 5 locaties en richt zich op grote infrastructurele projecten. Hierbij kan gedacht worden aan projecten op het gebied van (rail)infrastructuur, mobiliteit, ruimte, water en energie.Als Junior Data Scientist maak je onderdeel uit van de adviesgroep dat zich bezighoudt met een diverse scope aan civiel technische vraagstukken. Dit zijn veelal vraagstukken met een forse schaalgrootte gerelateerd aan dynamische problemen. Hierbij kan bijvoorbeeld gedacht worden aan trillingsvraagstukken. Je zal dan ook dagelijks worden uitgedaagd om jouw analytische vaardigheden ten volle te benutten! Als Junior Data Scientist voer je complexe analyses en berekeningen uit op basis van zelf gebouwde modellen en kan je de volgende werkzaamheden verwachten: Je gaat je bezighouden met het verzamelen van data omtrent een klantspecifiek vraagstuk met behulp van de door jou gebouwde modellenJe zal naar buiten gaan voor het uitvoeren van metingen in het veldJe bent bezig met het bruikbaar maken van verzamelde dataJe zal je analytische skills loslaten op de dataJe zult je bezighouden met het valideren van modelberekeningenTot slot zal je adviesrapporten opstellen op basis van de door jou verzamelde gegevens.Als Junior Data Scientist moet je voldoen aan de volgende eisen:Je hebt een afgeronde WO opleiding in een sterk technische richting zoals Applied Physics, Civiele techniek, Mechanical Engineering of soortgelijkJe bent communicatief goed vaardigJe hebt sterke affiniteit met automatiserenJe beheerst zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal

title: Data Scientist
description: I am currently working with an Agritech scale up, who are on the look out for an experienced data scientist to join their growing team in Amsterdam. They are innovating in the field of vertical farming and autonomous greenhouses, with the aim of solving global food insecurityResponsibilities:You will play a vital role in development and implementation of data science strategy and use data to improve organizational growth, continuous improvements and iterations.Be a part of the main link between the business, customers and technology solutions by providing valuable insights through modelling and transforming datasets to help us make decisions and build customer solutions.Lead the strategic design, delivery and maintenance of the data science work that give meaningful insights on our performance, support the company's priorities and accelerate innovation.Have end-to-end ownership of data science work and lead alignment on all solutions developed through collaboration.Help build a data-driven culture within through data science workRequirements:- Strong knowledge of Python- Professional working experience within data science (2+ years of experience)- Experience with machine learning models is essential- Experience with the agriculture sector is beneficial but not required- Willingness to work with or previous experience in sensor dataSalary Package:• Up to €95,000 per annum (D.O.E)• Travel allowance• Hybrid working and the ability to work remotely for 4 weeks of the year• Annual bonus. (usually 5-8%!)• Pension scheme and 25 days of holiday (possibility to buy extra days)Feel free to apply below, or contact me on the following:Phone: +31203997864Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

title: Data Scientist | Digital Marketing & AI | Growth opportunities
description: You're a Data Scientist who wants to join a fast growing company in the digital marketing sector, where innovative AI and machine learning solutions are at play. Their mission is to revolutionise online marketing by enhancing precision, intelligence, and efficiency.What you will doAnalyse raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processingDesign accurate and scalable prediction algorithmsCollaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to productionGenerate actionable insights for business improvementsWhy I should take this job if I couldImpactful role in a unique, ambitious startup with a strong vision.Salary around €5000Hybrid work in Amsterdam's city center with room for personal ideas.Training opportunities and unforgettable team outings.What you need2-3 years of experience as a data scientist, with Python and Pandas skills.Proficiency in Machine Learning algorithms and PySpark.Strong project management skills and ability to simplify complex matters.Bonus: Knowledge about Online Marketing, AWS, Databricks.The company in question is completely revolutionising the digital marketing space through data and AI. The mission is to free marketers from data management and repetitive tasks to fully focus on the creative process. The product they are building is truly like a colleague for marketing teams.Want to know more? Get in touch!

title: People Analytics Lead
description: About The TeamOur People team is a highly collaborative team and each individual proactively contributes to critical initiatives that will change the organization on a local and global scale. We are passionate about helping Mironeers grow their careers at a hyper growth organization! This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to grow their career and change the world together with our super talented team.Each role at Miro is based at one of our physical hubs, and we look for talent who wants to be part of these local, highly connected communities. Mironeers work in a hybrid model, with three days a week in-the office as our baseline.About The RoleTo deliver on our People Team mission, Miro is looking for a People Analytics Lead to serve as our subject matter expert and consult business on everything related to the analysis of employee and workforce data to reveal insights and provide recommendations to improve business success. This requires this role to build and optimize a solid data foundation for high quality data and insights, ethical and compliant processing of data, manager and leader self-serve, agile & compliant tooling, approach to ad hoc data analysis and regular dashboarding.You will be a key member of the People Technologies team, reporting into the Head of People Technologies. You will be focused on working with People Team Leadership as well as business to find opportunities to drive decisions efficiently and identify innovative ways to work with data.What You’ll DoDevelop the foundation for excellence in People Analytics, which means having a strong governance, clear methodologies (processes and frameworks to be established for repeatable and dynamic people analytics) and effective stakeholder management Build the right skills (expertise in People Tech as well as the broader People team). Drive data stewardship, data management and how to use data to deliver more value to the business Deliver value to Miro, by providing enhanced experiences to the workforce (e.g. measuring the employee experiences, the democratization of data to managers and leaders) , creating impact through business outcomes and developing a data-driven culture for analytics ○ Share information and insights from people data in reports and dashboards regularly in a formal, standardized and repeatable fashion○ KPIs & Metrics: Measure the most important metrics○ Predictive & Advanced Analytics Be a People Analytics Advisor ○ Be a trusted partner with People Partners and business in strategic business discussions and take an active approach to spot opportunities to solve business problems○ Frame business questions and build hypothesis, consider statisticalmethodologies for solving problems and collaborate with data scientists to build model and identify insights○ Be a storyteller with data; translating analytics into comprehensible insight and actionable recommendations, tailored for each audience○ Effectively prioritize the most impactful work○ Work on key initiatives and provide recommendations to your main stakeholders What You’ll Need6+ years of experience in Analytics or Data Science fields 4-6 years working in a similar role in a Saas/tech company will be a plusExperience in building something from scratch in a people analytics area will be a plus A proven track record of translating data into business outcomes and helping driving business decisions with data What's In It For YouCompetitive equity packageMedical insurance coverageLunch, snacks and drinks provided in the officeWellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowanceAnnual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and careerTravel allowance for your commuteOpportunity to work for a globally diverse teamInspiring workplace in the heart of AmsterdamAbout MiroMiro provides a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to dream, design, and build the future together. Our mission is to empower teams to create the next big thing by creating a place where teams can create together seamlessly, regardless of location.Today, more than 50 million users in 180,000 organizations including Nike, Ikea, Deloitte, WPP, and Cisco depend on Miro to improve product development collaboration, to speed up time to market, and to make sure that new products and services deliver on customer needs.Miro's visual workspace enables distributed teams to come together to synthesize information, develop strategy, design products and services, and manage processes all throughout the innovation lifecycle. When you look at a Miro Board, you can see hundreds of collaborators moving through the space as named cursors on the screen designing, contributing ideas, providing feedback, and co-creating together with shared tools and information.Everyone in Miro has access to the same shared capabilities designed for innovation including diagramming, wireframing, real-time data visualization, and built-in support for agile practices. Miro's workspace is integrated with more than 130 other applications including Jira, Azure DevOps, Asana, Zoom, Slack, and Teams, many of which offer two-way integrations and can be dynamically updated directly from Miro.Miro enables organizations to accelerate time to market and ensure continuous alignment with customer needs and company strategy. In most organizations, Miro is used by product development teams looking for a new, better way to drive innovation. However, we see more teams including marketing, sales, management consulting, architecture, creative design, and HR that are increasingly applying innovation methodologies such as design thinking and agile practices and adopting Miro for this work.Check Out More About Life At MiroYoutube: https://www.youtube.com/@lifeatmiroBlog: https://miro.com/careers/life-at-miro/all/Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wearemiro/At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro’s mission — Empower teams to create the next big thing — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. Diversity invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles to step in, and inclusion invites them to step closer together. Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.Miro handles and uses personal data of job applicants in line with its Recruitment Privacy Policy found here.

title: Data Scientist
description: Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.Role Overview:Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.Skills and Qualifications:Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great assetOffered:Competitive salary: up to €55,000Pension scheme for financial security€30 net gym budget for well-beingSwappfiets subscription for convenient commuting25 days of holiday leave for work-life balanceHybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

title: BI Specialist
description: Wat maakt het zo interessant om als Business Intelligence Specialist bij HSO te werken? Data & Analytics is een snelgroeiende serviceline binnen de internationale organisatie HSO; Microsoft Gold Partner en onderdeel van de Microsoft Inner Circle. Large enough to serve, small enough to care! Groei met ons mee en geef zo je eigen carrière vorm. Jij bent: Een samenwerker! Een goed resultaat bereik je niet alleen: in een hecht team werk jij samen met hoogopgeleide professionals die altijd voor elkaar klaar staan en elkaar graag intellectueel uitdagen. Werken met mensen geeft jou energie! Een verbinder! Je weet wat nodig is om de gebruikers van data optimaal te bedienen. Je inventariseert de eisen en wensen van onze klanten door de gebruikers actief te benaderen. Zo breng je businesseisen en de oplossing bij elkaar. Je bekleedt een spilfunctie en weet tegelijkertijd inhoudelijk waar je het over hebt. Een sterke gesprekspartner! Je bent communicatief vaardig op verschillende niveaus. Je hebt consultancy skills en bent sterk in het managen van de verwachtingen van eindgebruikers. Jij hebt begrip voor wat gebruikers wensen en speelt daar praktisch en pragmatisch op in. Een innovator! Jij blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste Microsofttechnieken. In jouw vak zie je jezelf als ondernemer die graag buiten de gebruikelijke denkkaders denkt. Wat ga je doen?Je start met je klantopdracht; Je vertaalt (management) informatie en rapportagebehoefte van de afdelingen naar een te implementeren oplossing met PowerBI.Je maakt data vindbaar, begrijpelijk en toepasbaar in één loket. Je vertaalt de wensen van de business naar functionaliteit. Je toetst fits en gaps aan de integrale informatievoorziening van onze klanten.Je beoordeelt en implementeert verzoeken voor aanpassingen of verzoeken tot scopewijzigingen op de informatievoorziening.Met je collega's houd je je bezig met het visualiseren van data en je ontwikkelt managementinformatieoplossingen waarmee bedrijfsinformatie op een efficiënte en veilige manier ontsloten en gebruikt wordt.RequirementsJe hebt minimaal een HBO-diploma in de IT of Bedrijfskunde;Bewezen werkervaring als Data Analist; Dashboard Ontwikkelaar of Management Informatie DeskundigeAantoonbare kennis van SQL;Kennis van principes van de Database structuur, Data Modelling, Data Warehousing (extract, transform en loading);Ervaring met Azure Data & Analytics producten en services (SQL en NoSQL Databases en PowerBI);Bewezen analytische vaardigheden;Probleemoplossende en pragmatische houding;Ondernemend en innovatief denkvermogen;Ervaring met werken met data in een technische en commerciële omgeving;Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal om goed te kunnen communiceren in onze internationale (klant) omgeving. BenefitsEen goede beloningWerken bij HSO is uitdagend, we willen je daar graag een goede beloning voor teruggeven. Naast goede primaire voordelen bieden:Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;Jaarlijkse bonus op basis van bedrijfs-, team- en individuele prestaties;25 Betaalde vakantiedagen per jaar (met de mogelijkheid om tot 10 extra vakantiedagen per jaar te kopen);Mogelijkheid voor workation;Pensioen van Be Frank;Mobiliteitsvergoeding waarbij je of een auto kunt leasen of het bedrag toe kunt voegen aan je salaris. Daar bovenop krijg 100% betaald van de ov-kosten;EUR 65,- Netto vitaliteitsbudget - we vinden het belangrijk dat we gezond blijven en een veilige werkplek hebben, zowel op kantoor als remote;Telefoonabonnement & standaard telefoon of CYOD met bijbetaling of EUR 10,- netto per maand voor eigen telefoon;Je kunt deelnemen aan het leasefietsplan;En vooral een leven lang leren. Al vanaf dag één begin je aan je onboarding programma en vanaf dan heeft onze Academy een hele leerreis voor je. Je ontvangt ook een GoodHabitz accountVrijheid, flexibiliteit en funHSO heeft een ondernemerscultuur met veel ruimte voor initiatief. Zie je kansen? Wij geven je de mogelijkheid om ze te realiseren. Je hebt veel vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je werkdagen in te delen, maar vooral om je eigen carrière vorm te geven.Je werkt in een internationale omgeving en werkt met bekwame mensen met verschillende nationaliteiten die worden aangemoedigd om verder te denken. Werkweken van 40, 36 of 32 uur behoren tot de mogelijkheden omdat wij van mening zijn dat de manier van werken bij jouw levensstijl moet passen. HSO heeft professionals in dienst die plezier hebben in hun werk en klaar staan voor elkaar. We omarmen een cultuur van bedrijfsgerichte activiteiten zoals twee keer per jaar bedrijfsfeesten en wekelijkse zomerborrels op ons dakterras en er zijn allerlei sportinitiatieven.Enthousiast? Heb je vragen vooraf?Neem dan contact op met onze recruiter Joseph. Hij helpt je verder met al je vragen. Voldoe je niet aan één van de eisen. Dan gaan we nog steeds graag met je in gesprek (jyoussef@hso.com).

title: Business Data Analyst
description: **BUSINESS DATA ANALYST****DUTCH SPEAKING****UP TO €72,000****AMSTERDAM****HYBRID**THE COMPANYThe company is a cutting-edge Software as a Service (SaaS) company based in the Netherlands, at the forefront of digital transformation and innovation. Established with a vision to empower businesses and organizations with smart, cloud-based solutions, they have quickly become a trusted partner for companies seeking to streamline their operations, enhance productivity, and drive growth via offering:- Innovative SaaS solutions- User-centric approach- Data-driven insights- Customisation and scalability- Continuous innovation- Global reach- Exceptional support- Security and ComplianceTHE ROLEAs a Business Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in shaping data-driven strategies and helping make informed decisions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and leverage your analytical skills to extract meaningful insights from data, enabling us to drive growth and innovation in the business.Responsibilities:Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with teams across the organization to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs).Develop predictive models and conduct statistical analyses to support decision-making.Assist in the design and implementation of data-driven experimentsIdentify areas for process improvement and efficiency gains through data analysis.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.THE REQUIREMENTSBachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or related).DUTCH SPEAKINGMinimum 1-year experience in a commercial or SaaS backgroundProven experience in data analysis and data visualization using tools such as Python, R, SQL, or Tableau.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Knowledge of business processes and a strong business acumen.Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus.WANT TO APPLY?Please apply below to find out more! Or send your CV directly to:Please note, only SUCCESSFUL applicants will be contacted.

title: Data Science Specialist
description: Our client is a top player in the Dutch finance market, providing their clients with data models and predictive analyses on investments, risk mitigation, security/fraud and environmental impact. They work with most big banks and financial institutions in the Netherlands, where they have their teams build the necessary models (usually of the complexity the clients cannot solve themselves). Sometimes the complexity is translating of business problems to the actual data solutions, sometimes the complexity is in the solution itself, the mass of the data, the regulations, etc.We are looking for Seniors and Managers, experienced Data Scientists / Consultants that can bring something extra. Of course, your bread and butter will be in the projects and working on Data Science challenges as described above, but next to this there is a variety of roles/domains where you can contribute within the organization. Think about managing a small team, taking on project management tasks, helping to scale the organization, inspire/mentor juniors, etc.The sky is the limit, and the company can create roles accustomed to the interests you have as a senior in the field!We are looking for experienced people who bring:At least 5+ years’ experience within the Data Science field.Strong Python and SQL skills as a bare minimum on the technical side.Education background in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Astronomy,Computer Science, etc.Strong communication and commercial skills, you are client facing after all.Go getter, pragmatic, analytical and positive.So, are you pragmatic and analytically strong? Do you like client facing work, creating out of the box data models for clients? Do you like to do something extra in your work on a variety of topics (leadership, PM, growth, etc.)? Please apply!Location: Amsterdam, client side and remote (hybrid, unpredictable)Salary: up to 120kRelocation: possible

title: Data Visualization Engineer
description: Optiver are looking for a skilled Data Visualization Engineer to design, develop and implement solutions for our trading teams in Amsterdam and globally. The successful Engineer will bring a strong technical capability as well as an approach that will enable them to integrate with our high-paced trading teams, collaborate with trading stakeholders to formulate requirements and create innovative visualizations and tooling on the trading floor.WHO WE ARE:Our Amsterdam office is where it all began. Over 35 years ago, Optiver’s business started with a single trader on the floor of Amsterdam’s European Stock Exchange. Since our 1986 founding, Optiver’s Amsterdam office has grown into one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. Our culture reflects the Dutch capital city’s progressive, innovative and inclusive nature. With its unique spirit, Amsterdam is the ideal hub for our teams to trade a wide range of products from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange.WHAT YOU’LL DO:You will work on creating and maintaining data visualizations and UI applications that are used by traders to form trading decisions and to interact with other Optiver systems.The goal of the team is to provide users with highly responsive, flexible and reliable tools that can be used to monitor the state of global financial markets and to control our internal strategies. The impact of the work you will do spans across multiple different teams and levels of the organization. Apart from creating user interfaces and their backends, the UX team also owns and develops internal frameworks and standards describing how to create user interfaces within the company.As a Data Visualization Engineer you can expect to:Create web based data visualizationsWork closely with traders, developers and other stakeholders to discover requirements and design solutionsDesign and build data processing pipelines used during data pre-processing stagesContribute to the UI framework and ecosystem used across multiple teams within the companyBe involved in a very short feedback loop and see your products having actual impact on daily work of their usersWork on data and UI optimization problemsHelp members of other teams create and optimize data visualizationsWHO YOU ARE:Trading applications need to be reliable and robust, therefore we look for developers with a strong engineering mindset that can work in a highly dynamic environment while creating simple and solid solutions. Those solutions must integrate well with the broad ecosystem of Optiver data sources and backend services.In terms of skills and qualifications we're looking for:A degree in computer science or a related fieldStrong knowledge of PythonExperience with creating data visualizations and user interfacesExperience with creating web applications and working with distributed systemsFamiliarity with one or more of the following technologies: Plotly Dash, Bokeh, React.js, SQL, C++, JavaScript, HTML/CSSStrong communication skillsProblem solving mindsetEagerness to learn(including financial and trading knowledge)ProactivenessWHAT YOU’LL GET: The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.HOW TO APPLY:If you’re interested in taking your career to one of the most exciting trading floors in Europe, please apply via the form below. While we love how bilingual our teams are, be sure to write your CV and motivation letter in English. We’re eager to learn all about your background and interests, which means applications lacking a motivation letter sadly will not be reviewed. But if we think you could be a good fit, you’ll hear from us sooner than you might expect!More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy. In the event of questions, feel free to contact our Recruitment team at recruitment@optiver.com.Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role. DIVERSITY STATEMENT: As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

title: BI Developer
description: Are you an experienced Google Cloud Developer who can connect the dots between organizing and analyzing first-party data and the communication channels that companies are using? Then we would love to meet you!Your roleActively participate in communications with the client and the teams with the frequency agreed on the projectPerform business analysis for the full cycle of work with requirements based on knowledge areas and project methodologyBreak down key business data by gathering, cleaning, and analyzing business dataGenerate business insights and share insights by visualizing them using different BI toolsIdentify opportunities for data-driven business decisions, improvement and spot trends using gathered business data.Recognise potential issues and offer solutionsYour profileRequired;English speaking & writing, speaking Dutch is a plusA minimum of 3 year of experience in business analysis or a related fieldExcellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skillsStrong documentation skillsWorking knowledge of SCRUM methodologyWorking experience of data base and data warehouse managementUnderstanding of Big DataWorking knowledge of ETL processesSQL knowledgeExperience creating detailed reports and giving presentationsWorking knowledge of Data Visualization tools (Data studio, Looker, Power BI, Tableau)Ability to contibute both independently and as part of a teamBonus;Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud PlatformWorking knowledge of Python, Java or R languagesWorking knowledge of Big DataAbility to read code and support applications, reports and processesWorking knowledge of different project methodologiesWorking expierence of participation in discovery phasesUnderstanding of BI consultingMaster degreeWhat we offerCompetitive salary with an interesting bonus and pension schemeExcellent work/life balance and up to 28 days of annual leave Freedom to work from one of our offices in Rotterdam, Amsterdam or other "Spaces" locations across the Netherlands and join Spaces' events and workshops.Flexibility to work from home or abroadA laptop and first-class travel arrangement by public transportAn opportunity to develop yourself through different (technical) coursesAn international environment with a start-up vibe - no need for a suit at the office!About CrystalloidsCrystalloids was founded in 2006 and as a team of qualified data specialists we help organisations innovate and grow their business by building solutions in Google Cloud. We have been an official Google Cloud partner since 2011. At Crystalloids, the foundation for a successful solution is based on three dimensions: the people, the processes and the technology. We always take these three dimensions into account when we build solutions for our customers.We gained a very respectable client portfolio over the years. Our clients operate in market segments like retail, e-commerce, CPC, media, telecom, finance and insurance and are based in the Netherlands and in other European countries: Rituals, PVH, Swiss Sense, KNVB, Body & Fit, CoolBlue, FD Mediagroep, de Bijenkorf, HEMA, ACSI and others.What's next?Are you interested in the above vacancy for BI Developer? Crystalloids is looking forward to receive your application! By clicking on the 'apply' button in this job listing, you'll be directed to the original posting where you can take a few effortless steps to submit your application for BI Developer.

title: BI Consultant
description: Tijd om je expertise ergens anders in te zetten, BI Consultant. Bij Furore Conclusion krijg je de kans om écht impact te maken in de zorg. Als BI Consultant ontwerp en bouw je informatieproducten voor ziekenhuizen. Externe data-uitwisseling, kwaliteitsverbetering van de zorg en wetenschappelijk onderzoek staan daarbij centraal. Je werkt thuis, op kantoor en op locatie bij de klant in een klein team (en soms solo) aan innovatieve en uitdagende projecten. Misschien ben je straks wel…een near-realtime datawarehouse voor een ziekenhuis aan het ontwerpen of implementeren waar zowel onderzoekers, medisch specialisten als bestuurders informatie uit halen;dashboards en rapportages aan het ontwikkelen voor heldere inzichten in bijvoorbeeld actuele ic-bedbezetting of het gebruik van epd-gegevens;data-uitwisselingen aan het opzetten, zodat gegevens die patiënten in een app invoeren in het datawarehouse terechtkomen;in dit artikel vertellen onze collega’s je meer over een BI-project in het LUMC. Klinkt goed? Lees dan gauw verder. Jij bent te herkennen aan je uitstekende kennis van BI en moderne datatoepassingen en je kritische kijk op zaken. Vinden mensen je leergierig en prettig eigenwijs? Of juist doordacht in je aanpak? Bij ons mag het allebei, want verschil moet er zijn. Voor deze functie ben je kwaliteit- en servicegericht, zelfstandig, kritisch, onderzoekend, gestructureerd en een teamspeler. En verder ben je vooral lekker jezelf. Dat vinden we belangrijk. Onze ideale BI Consultant heeft:een hbo- en/of wo-diploma;2 jaar werkervaring als BI Consultant;ervaring met datavisualisatie en het maken van gebruiksvriendelijke informatieproducten in een tool als Power BI;ervaring met het inventariseren, analyseren en toepassen van klantwensen;een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal. En als je dit ook nog hebt, is dat voor ons een mooie bonus:kennis van SQL/databasetools en modelleertechnieken;inhoudelijke kennis van de zorg- en/of wetenschapssector.

title: Bi consultant
description: BI ConsultantBen jij een echte data freak en wil jij onze klanten helpen met hun data aan de slag te gaan? Bekijk dan onze vacature. Als BI Consultant help je bij het maken van slimme inzichten die beschikbare data omzet naar bruikbare en waardevolle informatie. Daardoor draag je elke dag je steentje bij aan het optimaliseren van de bedrijfsprocessen van onze KidsKonnect klanten! Full-time · Breda/RemoteOver de organisatieKidsKonnect is een succesvol, innovatief en snelgroeiend softwarebedrijf voor de kinderopvangbranche. KidsKonnect is ontstaan door het samenvoegen van de beste kinderopvangsoftware. In Nederland, België en de UK bedienen we inmiddels samen ruim 1 miljoen kinderen en hun ouders in de leeftijdsgroep tussen 0 en 12 jaar met kinderopvangsoftware via de gecombineerde KidsKonnect platformen.Onze innovatieve softwareoplossing KidsKonnect bestaat uit diverse applicaties, waaronder portalen en mobiele apps, voor de verschillende gebruikersgroepen. Wij breiden de functionaliteit in deze portalen en apps continu uit. Daarnaast bouwen we het aantal integraties met andere systemen steeds verder uit.De afdeling Consultancy biedt advies en expertise aan onze KidsKonnect klanten op het gebied van softwareontwikkeling, -implementatie en -beheer. Onze Consultants helpen bij het identificeren van technische behoeften en uitdagingen van onze klant en bieden smart oplossingen in ons SaaS platform en de diverse softwareproducten van KidsKonnect.Over de rolKidsKonnect CPMLive is één van onze platformen en biedt geautomatiseerde ondersteuning aan voor de volledige plan-do-check-act cyclus, dus forecasten, dashboards, management informatie, budgetten, toelichtingen etc.Samen met je collega’s zorg je ervoor dat onze klanten met de hulp van data naar de toekomst kunnen kijken, om zo de beste business beslissingen te kunnen nemen. Resultaten en forecasts worden inzichtelijk met onze oplossing waarbij we bijvoorbeeld de inzet van dashboards afstemmen op de behoefte van de klant. Wat ga je doenAls BI Consultant werk je voor verschillende klanten en ontwikkel je datawarehouse omgevingen. Daarmee maak je het mogelijk dat klanten van KidsKonnect data in het verleden kunnen analyseren, data van vandaag kunnen interpreteren en middels forecast ook in de toekomst kunnen kijken. Het doel hierbij is data-gedreven keuzes mogelijk te maken. Dit doe je met behulp van onze krachtige en gebruiksvriendelijke SaaS oplossing: CPMLive.Daarnaast ben en blijf je altijd op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen in jouw vakgebied, omdat jij nieuwsgierig bent en omdat jij jezelf wil blijven ontwikkelen. Niet alleen in ons teams van consultants, maar in het hele bedrijf hangt een informele sfeer.Samen met jouw collega’s binnen het Consultancy team ben je verantwoordelijk voor het begeleiden van klanttrajecten van A tot Z, zodat de klant altijd juist, compleet en tijdig inzicht heeft in waar hij of zij staat en waar kansen liggen. Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van business processen van de klant en de vertaalslag naar betrouwbare informatievoorzieningen. Je bent een sparringpartner op ieder niveau van de organisatie, van directie- tot operatie;Je zorgt ervoor dat de data altijd compleet, tijdig en juist ontsloten wordt in het datawarehouseJe bouwt zelfstandig én samen met anderen dashboards en solutions in CPMLive;Je denkt niet alleen in wat er gebeurd is en waarom dit gebeurd is, maar vooral wat er gaat gebeuren. Met CPMLive bieden we klanten de mogelijkheden om te forecasten o.b.v. de allernieuwste technieken:Je werkt aan verschillende interne en externe projecten en vindt het leuk om in samenwerking met jouw collega’s bijzondere resultaten te realiseren;Je zult met je collega’s of alleen naar de klant gaan om requirements op te halen waarbij je de informatiebehoefte definieert;Je hebt eigen verantwoordelijkheden binnen jouw team. Samen met je collega’s bepaal je waar je mee aan de slag gaat.Belangrijk om te weten: als jouw ambitie verder gaat dan deze functie, stimuleren en helpen we jou om door te ontwikkelen. Jouw groei en ontwikkeling is onze groei.En, heb je zelf ideeën wat je nog meer met data kunt doen? Laat ze horen! Er bestaan geen heilige huisjes, wij staan open voor jouw inzichten en expertise.Zo zien wij jouMet jouw analytische vaardigheden, je creativiteit met data, visualisaties en jouw kennis weet je data van onze klanten om te zetten in waardevolle informatie. Door middel van doorvragen en kritisch naar materie te kunnen kijken, weet jij de échte vraag van de klant naar boven te halen. Je gaat zelfstandig te werk, maar weet ook wanneer het nodig is om hulp van je collega’s in te schakelen.Je bent daarnaast het gezicht van onze organisatie bij de klant. Jij bevindt je in een sleutelpositie om mee te denken en te adviseren wat er nodig is om de BI dienstverlening mee te kunnen laten groeien.Zo zien wij jouMet jouw analytische vaardigheden, je creativiteit met data, visualisaties en jouw kennis weet je data van onze klanten om te zetten in waardevolle informatie. Door middel van doorvragen en kritisch naar materie te kunnen kijken, weet jij de échte vraag van de klant naar boven te halen. Je gaat zelfstandig te werk, maar weet ook wanneer het nodig is om hulp van je collega’s in te schakelen.Je bent daarnaast het gezicht van onze organisatie bij de klant. Jij bevindt je in een sleutelpositie om mee te denken en te adviseren wat er nodig is om de BI dienstverlening mee te kunnen laten groeien.

title: People Analytics Lead
description: Who we are?JDE Peet’s is the world's leading pure-play coffee and tea company, with local roots dating back to 1753, and is headquartered in the Netherlands. We unleash the possibilities of coffee and tea in more than 100 countries with a portfolio of over 50 brands, including L’OR, Peet’s, Jacobs, Senseo, Tassimo, Douwe Egberts, OldTown, Super, Pickwick and Moccona.What’s it like to work at JDE Peet’s?We are people united by the power and possibility of tea and coffee. At JDE Peet’s, we thrive on the freedom to pursue opportunities, provoking new ideas to make an impact at scale. Our ambition is simple – JDE Peet's: unleashing the possibilities of coffee and tea.We bring action to our intentions, following through on what was agreed, always pushing things forward. We offer our people a range of learning and development programmes to support their personal growth. We’ve worked hard to build an open, collaborative environment where you can approach anyone and be heard.At JDE Peet's, we believe it’s amazing what can happen over a cup of coffee or tea. We also believe that a diverse and inclusive culture enables us to serve every coffee and tea lover in the best possible way. No matter who you are, where you come from, how you live your life, or how you enjoy your coffee or tea, you can fulfil your ambitions and contribute to our success.When you grow, we grow, and coffee & tea grows.UNLEASH YOUR POSSIBILITY! Find out more at https://careers.jacobsdouweegberts.com/Job DescriptionYour role will be instrumental in leveraging the power of People Analytics to drive data informed insights, build a community of people analytics experts, and collaborate with senior business leaders to enhance business performance through HR metrics.As part of the increasing investments in people analytics at JDE we’ve just launched Visier as our HR analytics platform, to a very enthusiastic reception by the community. As we continue to invest in people analytics, you will be key in developing the next steps in that journey.One of the next steps is the development & deployment of a robust data literacy program. You’ll be the driving force behind the program to upskill the entire HR function at JDE and once complete, a further deployment to managers & associates.The second element to your role is a strong contribution to the listening strategy; we’ve implemented Qualtrics and started collecting employee lifecycle feedback from our associates. There’s a wealth of information that our associates will be sharing with us, it’s key we listen to the voice of our associates.The third element to your role is to lead by example, getting hands-on with HR metrics and working with business stakeholders at the highest level of the organization to improve business performance. The best practices you develop here will become the standard on how we deploy analytics in the organization.Team & environmentShould you have done all of the above before, that’s great, but it’s not a must; we’re much more interested in your growth mindset and ability to engage a wide range of stakeholders. There’s a strong foundation set with the recent & future investments and a great team that can help you get up to speed in no-time.You’ll be part of the Global HR Technology & Analytics team, as part of the HR function at the headquarters. The role reports into the Global HR Technology & Analytics Director.With this said, we like you to take responsibility over the following tasks:Summary of responsibilities:Data Literacy Program:Design and implement comprehensive training modules to enhance data literacy skills within the HR team, ensuring a deep understanding of data concepts, analytics tools, and data-driven decision-making processesStrategic Partnership:Collaborate closely with senior business leaders to understand their strategic goals and align HR metrics with overall business objectives.Provide data-driven recommendations that support the decision-making process on talent management, workforce planning, and employee engagement.Listening strategy:Contribute to the further development & deployment of the listening strategy, developing best practices and leveraging the insights for interventions, policy changes and enhanced business performanceCommunity Building:Cultivate a community of people analytics experts within the organization, fostering knowledge sharing and best practices in people analytics.Organize regular workshops, training sessions, encourage sharing of best practices in the community and drive collaborative projects to elevate the analytics acumen across HR and related departmentsData-driven Insights:Harness the power of Visier to analyze and interpret HR-related data, identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities that influence business performance.Translate complex data findings into clear and compelling insights that guide HR strategies and initiatives.HR Metrics and Reporting:Develop and maintain a comprehensive suite of dashboards with HR metrics and KPIs using Visier, to which the HR function and stakeholders will have direct access (self-service). This includes management dashboards, monthly management reviews & quarterly business reviewsContinuously review and improve the metrics to ensure they align with evolving business needsOur technology landscape consists of SuccessFactors, SmartRecruiters, Qualtrics, Visier and local time/attendance & payroll systems.QualificationsWe are looking for an individual that has a growth mindset with a drive for excellence & great analytics capabilities. Someone that holds themselves accountable and doesn’t shy away from responsibility. Given the nature of the role we feel it's important for you to have a certain level of seniority as well as a solid understanding of your own added value. Key qualifications:6+ years of experience in an international environmentExamples of great potential backgrounds for the role:HR Business Partnering background with excellent data & analysis capabilitiesPeople Analytics background with an interest to step up your responsibilitiesConsulting background in HR Technology and/or AnalysisCorporate HR Tech background with a strong data & analysis componentProgram development & HR Project implementation background with strong data & analysis capabilitiesFinancial planning & analysis background with a strong interest in HRAnd many other backgrounds are possible as wellKey is that you’ve developed and rolled out projects/programs and have strong data & analysis capabilitiesYou have strong influencing skills and you’re able to operate at both a strategic and operational level within a complex matrix organization while managing diverse stakeholder relationshipsStrong passion to solve business problems with data & insights, ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions based on data insights.Additional InformationYour application at JDE Peet's: If you are interested in this career opportunity at JDE Peet's, apply and join us. After receiving your application we will do our utmost to give you quick feedback. Part of the recruitment procedure at JDE Peet's would be an online assessment, followed by interviews. A pre-employment check can be part of the recruitment process.The future of work is hybrid, with both office and home playing an important role. At JDE Peet's, we value meeting colleagues in the office to unleash the possibilities of coffee and tea together and we enjoy our focus time when working from home. Join us and you will experience both. Because it’s amazing what happens over a cup of coffee.Whether or not you are with us, two, four or thirty years, it doesn’t matter. We help you build your skillsets and potential career. We offer a solid and competitive base salary and ad additional benefits to the mix. To name a few: Learning and development budget, career development, Insurances, pension plans and a minimum of 25 + 12 ADV days of paid holidays (because we care and want to offer you a healthy work – life balance)#unleashyourpossibility #acupofamazing

title: Data Analyst
description: Taken en verantwoordelijkhedenJOUW ROLHet team van Data & Analytics blijft groeien binnen CEVA Logistics in Tilburg. Jij hebt de kans om samen met het team impact te maken bij onze klant de Bijenkorf. Data speelt een belangrijke rol in de huidige strategie. We verleggen de focus steeds meer op voorspellen in plaats van verklaren, zo creëren we nieuwe inzichten.Als Data Analyst ben je constant op zoek naar oplossingen en verbeteringen voor onze processen. Jouw oplossingen toets je vervolgens om tot de gewenste inzichten en principes te komen. Jouw werk begint meestal met een vraag om informatie vanuit onze klant, een directe collega, MT-lid of is al beschreven door onze Business Analyst.
